--- Document Chunk 9366 ---
𝑉𝑟𝑒𝑙𝑒𝑎𝑠𝑒 =𝑉𝑡𝑎𝑟𝑔𝑒𝑡 

--- Document Chunk 9367 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 9368 ---
3.13.9.4.8.2.1 Note: The above formulas are intended to prevent the calculated release speed from 

--- Document Chunk 9369 ---
fluctuating, according to the distance, speed and acceleration measurements. It allows 

--- Document Chunk 9370 ---
calculating the release speed only once, for a given on-board reference location, unless 

--- Document Chunk 9371 ---
• the train position confidence interval exceeds a predicted one, which is based 

--- Document Chunk 9372 ---
on the assumption that the whole distance between the current on -board 

--- Document Chunk 9373 ---
reference location and the EOA would be travelled with SUBSET-041 odometer 

--- Document Chunk 9374 ---
performance values and without any update of the on-board reference location, 

--- Document Chunk 9375 ---
or 

--- Document Chunk 9376 ---
• the speed under reading amount (V_ura) exceeds the SUBSET -041 

--- Document Chunk 9377 ---
performance value 

--- Document Chunk 9378 ---
Whenever the on-board reference location is updated (e.g. new LRBG), t he release 

--- Document Chunk 9379 ---
speed will however be recalculated and will increase with a step. This behaviour is 

--- Document Chunk 9380 ---
acceptable from an operational point of view. 

--- Document Chunk 9381 ---
3.13.9.4.8.2.2 Note: The method chosen (e.g. iterative algorithm) to compute the release speed is 

--- Document Chunk 9382 ---
an implementation issue. 

--- Document Chunk 9383 ---
3.13.9.4.9 If the release speed (Figure 52 box 1 gives an example when it is calculated on -board) 

--- Document Chunk 9384 ---
exceeds any MRSP element anywhere in the area ( Figure 52 box 2) delimited on one 

--- Document Chunk 9385 ---
side by the location situated at a distance equal to the train position confidence interval 

--- Document Chunk 9386 ---
vs. the SOLR in rear of the presumed start location of the Release speed monitoring and 

--- Document Chunk 9387 ---
on the other side by the trip location related to the EOA (see d_tripEOA in 3.13.9.4.8.2), 

--- Document Chunk 9388 ---
the on-board shall use as a fixed release speed ( Figure 52 box 4) the most restrictive 

--- Document Chunk 9389 ---
MRSP element (Figure 52 box 3) within this  (these) area(s), and shall re -evaluate the 

--- Document Chunk 9390 ---
start location of the Release speed monitoring accordingly. 

--- Document Chunk 9391 ---

3.13.9.5 Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 9435 ---
3.13.10 Speed and distance monitoring commands 

--- Document Chunk 9436 ---
3.13.10.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 9437 ---
3.13.10.1.1 By comparing the train speed and position to the various supervision limits defined in the 

--- Document Chunk 9438 ---
previous section, the on-board equipment generates braking commands, traction cut-off 

--- Document Chunk 9439 ---
commands and relevant information to the driver. The information displayed to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 9440 ---
is selected according to the fo llowing supervision statuses of the speed and distance 

--- Document Chunk 9441 ---
monitoring function: Normal status, Indication status, Overspeed status, Warning status 

--- Document Chunk 9442 ---
and Intervention status. 

--- Document Chunk 9443 ---
3.13.10.1.2 The following types of speed and distance monitoring are defined: 

--- Document Chunk 9444 ---
• Ceiling speed monitoring (CSM) 

--- Document Chunk 9445 ---
• Target speed monitoring (TSM) 

--- Document Chunk 9446 ---
• Release speed monitoring (RSM) 

--- Document Chunk 9447 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 9448 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 9449 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 9450 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 9451 ---

--- Document Chunk 9452 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 9453 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 9454 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 9455 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 9456 ---
Page 160/252 

--- Document Chunk 9457 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 9458 ---
ceiling speed monitoring

--- Document Chunk 9459 ---
release speed

--- Document Chunk 9460 ---
monitoring

--- Document Chunk 9461 ---
I

--- Document Chunk 9462 ---
SBI

--- Document Chunk 9463 ---
MRSP

--- Document Chunk 9464 ---
Speed

--- Document Chunk 9465 ---

--- Document Chunk 9466 ---
EOA SvLStart

--- Document Chunk 9467 ---
RSM

--- Document Chunk 9468 ---
release speed

--- Document Chunk 9469 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 9470 ---
Figure 53: Different types of speed and distance monitoring 

--- Document Chunk 9471 ---
3.13.10.1.3 Ceiling speed monitoring is the speed supervision in the area where the train can run 

--- Document Chunk 9472 ---
without the need to brake to a target. 

--- Document Chunk 9473 ---
3.13.10.1.4 Target speed monitoring is the speed and distance supervision in the area where the 

--- Document Chunk 9474 ---
specific information related to a target is displayed to the driver and within which the train 

--- Document Chunk 9475 ---
brakes to a target. 

--- Document Chunk 9476 ---
3.13.10.1.5 Release speed monitoring is the speed and distance supervision in the area close to the 

--- Document Chunk 9477 ---
EOA where the train is allowed to run with release speed to approach the EOA. 

--- Document Chunk 9478 ---
3.13.10.2 General requirements 

--- Document Chunk 9479 ---
3.13.10.2.1 The train speed indicated to the driver shall be identical to the speed used for the speed 

--- Document Chunk 9480 ---
monitoring. This shall be the estimated speed. 

--- Document Chunk 9481 ---
3.13.10.2.2 Once a Train Interface command (traction cut-off, service brake or emergency brake) is 

--- Document Chunk 9482 ---
triggered, the on-board shall apply it until its corresponding revocation condition is met. 

--- Document Chunk 9483 ---
3.13.10.2.3 If there is no on-board interface with the service brake or if the use of the service brake 

--- Document Chunk 9484 ---
command is not allowed by a National Value (only in Target speed monitoring), whenever 

--- Document Chunk 9485 ---
a service brake command is specified, the emergency brake command shall be triggered 

--- Document Chunk 9486 ---
instead. 

--- Document Chunk 9487 ---
3.13.10.2.4 The emergency brake command, which is triggered instead of the service brake 

--- Document Chunk 9488 ---
command when an SBI supervision limit is exceeded, shall be revoked according to the 

--- Document Chunk 9489 ---
requirements specified for the revocation of service brake command, unless the 

--- Document Chunk 9490 ---
emergency brake command has been also triggered due to an EBI supervision limit. In 

--- Document Chunk 9491 ---
such case, the condition for revoking the emergency brake command due to EBI 

--- Document Chunk 9492 ---
supervision limit shall prevail. 

--- Document Chunk 9493 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 9494 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 9495 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 9496 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 9497 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 9498 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 9499 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 9500 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 9501 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 9502 ---
Page 161/252 

--- Document Chunk 9503 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 9504 ---
3.13.10.2.5 The on -board shall revoke the Intervention status only when no brake com mand is 

--- Document Chunk 9505 ---
applied by the speed and distance monitoring function. 

--- Document Chunk 9506 ---
3.13.10.2.6 In level 2: Train trip shall be initiated if: 

--- Document Chunk 9507 ---
a) the on -board equipment detects that the minimum safe front end has passed the 

--- Document Chunk 9508 ---
EOA/LOA location, OR 

--- Document Chunk 9509 ---
b) while being in release speed monitoring, the on -board equipment receives a balise 

--- Document Chunk 9510 ---
group whose first possible location (see 3.4.4.4.3.1) is known by linking information 

--- Document Chunk 9511 ---
to be: 

--- Document Chunk 9512 ---
• in rear of the EOA by a distance shorter than the distance between the active 

--- Document Chunk 9513 ---
Eurobalise antenna and the front end of the train, OR 

--- Document Chunk 9514 ---
• at the EOA, OR 

--- Document Chunk 9515 ---
• in advance of the EOA. 

--- Document Chunk 9516 ---
3.13.10.2.7 In Level 1: Train Trip shall be initiated if the on -board equipment detects that the 

--- Document Chunk 9517 ---
minimum safe antenna position has passed the EOA/LOA location. 

--- Document Chunk 9518 ---
3.13.10.2.8 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 9519 ---
3.13.10.3 Requirements for Ceiling speed monitoring 

--- Document Chunk 9520 ---
3.13.10.3.1 The on-board equipment shall display the Permitted speed ceiling supervision limit. 

--- Document Chunk 9521 ---
3.13.10.3.2 When the supervision status is Overspeed, Warning or Intervention, the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 9522 ---
equipment shall display the SBI speed ceiling supervision limit. 

--- Document Chunk 9523 ---
3.13.10.3.3 The on -board shall compare the estimated speed with the ceiling supervision limits 

--- Document Chunk 9524 ---
defined in section 3.13.9.2 and shall  trigger/revoke commands to the train interface 

--- Document Chunk 9525 ---
(service brake if implemented or emergency brake) and supervision statuses  as 

--- Document Chunk 9526 ---
described in Table 5 and Table 6.

--- Document Chunk 9638 ---
3.13.10.3.6 The Indication status is not used in ceiling speed monitoring. However, in case the ceiling 

--- Document Chunk 9639 ---
speed monitoring is entered and the supervision status was previously set to Indication, 

--- Document Chunk 9640 ---
the on -board equipment shall immediately execute one of the transitions fro m the 

--- Document Chunk 9641 ---
Indication status, as described in Table 7. 

--- Document Chunk 9642 ---
3.13.10.3.7 In ceiling speed monitoring, only the ceiling supervision limits (described in section 

--- Document Chunk 9643 ---
3.13.9.2) are used to determine the commands to the Train Interface and the supervision 

--- Document Chunk 9644 ---
statuses displayed to the driver. However the braking to target supervision limits and the 

--- Document Chunk 9645 ---
release speed supervision limits (described in sections 3.13.9.3 and 3.13.9.3.6.5) are 

--- Document Chunk 9646 ---
also used to determine the locations where the transition to target speed monitoring and 

--- Document Chunk 9647 ---
to release speed monitoring occur respectively. 

--- Document Chunk 9648 ---

--- Document Chunk 9649 ---
reached either by the max safe or by the estimated train front end. To that effect, the on-

--- Document Chunk 9650 ---
board shall compute the remaining distance to the first Indication location as follows:

3.13.10.3.10 If A_MAXREDADH (see 3.13.6.2.1.6) requests a time to Indication as supplementary 

--- Document Chunk 9696 ---
DMI information, the on-board equipment shall compute the Time to Indication (TTI) as 

--- Document Chunk 9697 ---
the time to travel at the estimated speed the remaining distance to the first Indication 

--- Document Chunk 9698 ---
location (as spe cified in 3.13.10.3.8 and 3.13.10.3.8.1). The on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 9699 ---
inform the driver as long as this time is shorter than a fixed value (refer to A.3.1). 

--- Document Chunk 9700 ---
3.13.10.3.10.1 Exception: In case the list of supervised targets is empty or in case of LOA with no 

--- Document Chunk 9701 ---
EBD based target whose speed value is below V_MRSP and with no EBD based target 

--- Document Chunk 9702 ---
whose speed value is below the estimated speed, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 9703 ---
equipment shall not compute any time to Indication. 

--- Document Chunk 9704 ---
3.13.10.4 Requirements for Target speed monitoring 

--- Document Chunk 9705 ---
3.13.10.4.1 In target speed monitori ng, both the ceiling supervision limits and the braking to target 

--- Document Chunk 9706 ---
supervision limits, described in sections 3.13.9.2 and 3.13.9.3, are used to determine the 

--- Document Chunk 9707 ---
commands to the Train Interface and the supervision statuses displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 9708 ---
3.13.10.4.2 The on-board equipment shall display to the driver the target information (target speed 

--- Document Chunk 9709 ---
and distance to target) related to one target at a time: the Most Re levant Displayed 

--- Document Chunk 9710 ---
Target (MRDT). The MRDT shall be selected amongst the supervised targets whose 

--- Document Chunk 9711 ---
Indication supervision limit i s exceeded (i.e. a condition to trigger a supervision status 

--- Document Chunk 9712 ---
with respect to these targets is met, see table 8 and table 9) and shall be determined 

--- Document Chunk 9713 ---
according to the following steps: 

--- Document Chunk 9714 ---
• Step 0: MRDT0 = the target of which the braking to target Permitted speed supervision 

--- Document Chunk 9715 ---
limit (refer to section 3.13.9.3.5), calculated for the current position of the train, is the 

--- Document Chunk 9716 ---
lowest one amongst the concerned targets:

If at least one target is masked by MRDT0, then the MRDT obtained from this step 

--- Document Chunk 9801 ---
(MRDT1) shall be the masked target with its Indication supervision limit the furthest in 

--- Document Chunk 9802 ---
rear of the location of the MRDT0 Permitted speed supervision limit and the on-board 

--- Document Chunk 9803 ---
equipment shall go to the next step. 

--- Document Chunk 9804 ---

--- Document Chunk 9805 ---
or if there is no other remaining target to check in the list of concerned targets, then 

--- Document Chunk 9806 ---
the MRDT shall be the target obtained from the previous step (i.e. MRDT0). 

--- Document Chunk 9807 ---
... 

--- Document Chunk 9808 ---
• Step n: the on -board shall apply step n -1, substituting MRDT n-2 with MRDTn-1 and 

--- Document Chunk 9809 ---
checking the list of concerned targets excluding the targets which have been 

--- Document Chunk 9810 ---
preselected as MRDT in all the previous steps (i.e. from MRDT0 to MRDTn-1 inclusive). 

--- Document Chunk 9811 ---
3.13.10.4.2.1 Note 1: the a bove process for the determination of the MRDT ensures that when 

--- Document Chunk 9812 ---
several targets are close to each other it is avoided that a target is displayed after its 

--- Document Chunk 9813 ---
Indication supervision limit has been reached. 

--- Document Chunk 9814 ---
3.13.10.4.2.2 Note 2: when entering target speed monitoring, there is by definition at least one target 

--- Document Chunk 9815 ---
that satisfies the conditions to be selected as MRDT. Afterwards (e.g. due to train 

--- Document Chunk 9816 ---
braking) it is possible that no target satisfies any more the conditions to be selected as 

--- Document Chunk 9817 ---
MRDT, which however only means that the target previously selected remains the MRDT 

--- Document Chunk 9818 ---
(see clause 3.13.10.4.5). 

--- Document Chunk 9819 ---
3.13.10.4.2.3 Note 3: if MRDTn-1 is a target at zero speed (e.g. EOA or SvL) , then it is always 

--- Document Chunk 9820 ---
selected as MRDT, i.e. no other target can be selected as MRDT as per step n. 

--- Document Chunk 9821 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 9846 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 9847 ---
With Target_1, ..., Target_n being all the targets from the list of supervised targets 

--- Document Chunk 9848 ---
3.13.10.4.4 When the supervision status is Overspeed, Warning or Intervention , the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 9849 ---
equipment shall display the SBI speed, according to the following formula: 

--- Document Chunk 9850 ---
[𝑉𝑆𝐵𝐼]𝐷𝑀𝐼 =min{

--- Document Chunk 9851 ---
𝑚𝑎𝑥{[𝑉𝑆𝐵𝐼1(𝑑𝑒𝑠𝑡𝑓𝑟𝑜𝑛𝑡)]𝐸𝑂𝐴,𝑉𝑟𝑒𝑙𝑒𝑎𝑠𝑒},𝑚𝑎𝑥{[𝑉𝑆𝐵𝐼2(𝑑𝑚𝑎𝑥𝑠𝑎𝑓𝑒𝑓𝑟𝑜𝑛𝑡)]𝑆𝑣𝐿,𝑉𝑟𝑒𝑙𝑒𝑎𝑠𝑒},

--- Document Chunk 9852 ---
[𝑉𝑆𝐵𝐼2(𝑑𝑚𝑎𝑥𝑠𝑎𝑓𝑒𝑓𝑟𝑜𝑛𝑡)]

--- Document Chunk 9853 ---
𝑇𝑎𝑟𝑔𝑒𝑡−1

--- Document Chunk 9854 ---
,…,[𝑉𝑆𝐵𝐼2(𝑑𝑚𝑎𝑥𝑠𝑎𝑓𝑒𝑓𝑟𝑜𝑛𝑡)]

--- Document Chunk 9855 ---
𝑇𝑎𝑟𝑔𝑒𝑡−𝑛

--- Document Chunk 9856 ---
,𝑉𝑀𝑅𝑆𝑃 +𝑑𝑉𝑠𝑏𝑖(𝑉𝑀𝑅𝑆𝑃)} 

--- Document Chunk 9857 ---
3.13.10.4.5 Once a target is the MRDT, it shall remain the MRDT until it is removed from the list of 

--- Document Chunk 9858 ---
supervised targets or until it is replaced as MRDT with another target that has a target 

--- Document Chunk 9859 ---
speed lower than or equal to the current MRDT and which is selected according to clause 

--- Document Chunk 9860 ---
3.13.10.4.2. The driver shall be informed upon any change of MRDT. 

--- Document Chunk 9861 ---
3.13.10.4.6 If the MRDT is either the EOA or the SvL, the on -board equipment shall display the 

--- Document Chunk 9862 ---
release speed, if given by the trackside or calculated on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 9863 ---
3.13.10.4.7 If the MRDT is neither the EOA nor the SvL, the indicated distance to the target shall be 

--- Document Chunk 9864 ---
the distance between the maximum safe front end and the location of the Permitted 

--- Document Chunk 9865 ---
speed supervision limit calculated for the target speed (see section 3.13.9.3.5 for the 

--- Document Chunk 9866 ---
calculation of this location), but limited to zero after this location is passed. 

--- Document Chunk 9867 ---
[target distance]𝐷𝑀𝐼 =𝑚𝑎𝑥{(𝑑𝑃(𝑉𝑡𝑎𝑟𝑔𝑒𝑡)−𝑑𝑚𝑎𝑥𝑠𝑎𝑓𝑒𝑓𝑟𝑜𝑛𝑡),0} 

--- Document Chunk 9868 ---
3.13.10.4.7.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 9869 ---
3.13.10.4.8 If the MRDT is either the EOA or the SvL, the indicated distance to the target shall be 

--- Document Chunk 9870 ---
calculated as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 9871 ---
[target distance]𝐷𝑀𝐼 =𝑚𝑎𝑥{𝑚𝑖𝑛{(𝑑𝐸𝑂𝐴 −𝑑𝑒𝑠𝑡𝑓𝑟𝑜𝑛𝑡),(𝑑𝑆𝑣𝐿 −𝑑𝑚𝑎𝑥𝑠𝑎𝑓𝑒𝑓𝑟𝑜𝑛𝑡)},0} 

--- Document Chunk 9872 ---
3.13.10.4.8.1 As long as the displayed values are locked due to SB feedback (see Appendix A.3.10 

--- Document Chunk 9873 ---
for details) or are not allowed to increase (see Appendix A.3.13 for details), the on-board 

--- Document Chunk 9874 ---
equipment shall ensure that the displayed Permitted speed, the displayed SBI speed (if 

--- Document Chunk 9875 ---
any) and the distance to target (in case of service brake feedback) never increase (e.g. 

--- Document Chunk 9876 ---
due to the reduction of T_bs1 and T_bs2 or e.g. due to relocation). In other terms if a 

--- Document Chunk 9877 ---
concerned displayed value (VP_DMI, VSBI_DMI or target distance) calculated as above 

--- Document Chunk 9878 ---
has a higher value than the previously displayed value, then the previous value shall 

--- Document Chunk 9879 ---
remain displayed until a further calculated value is lower than the displayed one. 

--- Document Chunk 9880 ---
3.13.10.4.9 The on-board shall consider the service brake command as available for use unless: 

--- Document Chunk 9881 ---
a) The service brake command is not implemented, OR 

--- Document Chunk 9882 ---
b) The national value inhibits its use. 

--- Document Chunk 9883 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 9895 ---

--- Document Chunk 9896 ---
the train interface (traction cut -off if implemented, service brake if available for use or

--- Document Chunk 9898 ---
conditions as specified in clause 3.13.10.4.10.1.

3.13.10.4.12 Note: Figure 55 shows the parts of the ceiling speed and braking to target supervision 

--- Document Chunk 10247 ---
limits, which are used in target speed monitoring to trigger the brake commands and the 

--- Document Chunk 10248 ---
transitions between supervision statuses. It does not show what is displayed to the driver: 

--- Document Chunk 10249 ---
in particular, the braking to target Permitted supervision limit is displayed (even if not 

--- Document Chunk 10250 ---
supervised) for values lower than the release speed. 

--- Document Chunk 10251 ---
3.13.10.4.13 In case of target EOA/SvL with a release speed higher than or equal to V_MRSP or 

--- Document Chunk 10252 ---
without any supervised release spee d, the Table 9 and Table 11 shall be applied,  by 

--- Document Chunk 10253 ---
substituting V_release with the value 0. 

--- Document Chunk 10254 ---
3.13.10.4.13.1 In case the target is the location at the end of the maximum permitted distance to run 

--- Document Chunk 10255 ---
in Staff Responsible, the Table 9 and Table 11 shall be applied, by substituting V_release 

--- Document Chunk 10256 ---
with the value 0, SvL with staff responsible end location and by ignoring any formula 

--- Document Chunk 10257 ---
related to EOA. 

--- Document Chunk 10258 ---
3.13.10.4.14 A TI command shall be triggered if a corresponding triggering condition is met for at 

--- Document Chunk 10259 ---
least one target. On the other hand it shall be revoked only if a corresponding revocation 

--- Document Chunk 10260 ---
condition is met for each supervised target. 

--- Document Chunk 10261 ---
3.13.10.4.15 The on -board equipment shall execute the transitions between the different 

--- Document Chunk 10262 ---
supervision statuses as described in Table 12 (see section 4.6.1 for detail s about the 

--- Document Chunk 10263 ---
symbols). A triggering condition shall be taken into account as soon as it is satisfied for 

--- Document Chunk 10264 ---
any target. On the other hand a transition from Overspeed, Warning or Intervention 

--- Document Chunk 10265 ---
status to the Indication status shall be made only if a revocation co ndition specified for 

--- Document Chunk 10266 ---
the concerned transition is met for each supervised target.

3.13.10.4.16 When the speed and distance monitoring function becomes active and the target 

--- Document Chunk 10322 ---
speed monitoring is the first one entered, the triggering condition t3 defined in Table 8 or 

--- Document Chunk 10323 ---
Table 9 shall be checked for each target in order to determine whether the Indication 

--- Document Chunk 10324 ---
status applies. If it is not the case, the on -board shall immediately set the supervision 

--- Document Chunk 10325 ---
status to the relevant value, applying a transition from the Indication status according to 

--- Document Chunk 10326 ---
clause 3.13.10.4.15. 

--- Document Chunk 10327 ---
3.13.10.4.17 The Normal status is not used in target speed monitoring. However, in case the target 

--- Document Chunk 10328 ---
speed monitoring is entered and the supervision status was previously set to Normal, the 

--- Document Chunk 10329 ---
on-board equipment shall immediately execute one of the transitions from the Normal 

--- Document Chunk 10330 ---
status, as specified in clause 3.13.10.4.15. 

--- Document Chunk 10331 ---
3.13.10.4.18 Note: Depending upon train speed/position it is possible that for some target(s) none 

--- Document Chunk 10332 ---
of the triggering conditions specified in table 8 and 9 is met. However the conditions to 

--- Document Chunk 10333 ---
enter the target speed monitoring are such (see condition [1] in table 16) that the clauses 

--- Document Chunk 10334 ---
3.13.10.4.16 and 3.13.10.4.17 always allow determining a supervision status. 

--- Document Chunk 10335 ---

checked in order to determine whether the Indication status applies. If it is not the case, 

--- Document Chunk 10440 ---
the on -board shall immediately set the supervision status to the Intervention status, 

--- Document Chunk 10441 ---
applying a transition from the Indication status according to Table 15. 

--- Document Chunk 10442 ---
3.13.10.5.7 The Normal, Warning and Overspeed statuses are not used in release speed monitoring. 

--- Document Chunk 10443 ---
However, in case the release speed monitoring is entered and the supervision status 

--- Document Chunk 10444 ---
was previously set to Normal, Warning or Overspeed, the on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 10445 ---
immediately execute one of the transitions from respectively the Normal, Warning or 

--- Document Chunk 10446 ---
Overspeed status, as described in Table 15. 

--- Document Chunk 10447 ---

3.13.10.6.2 If a transition of speed and distance monitoring occurs while a brake command is already 

--- Document Chunk 10507 ---
applied, the concerned command shall be maintained until the revocation condition, if 

--- Document Chunk 10508 ---
specified for the newly entered speed and distance monitoring, is fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 10509 ---
3.13.10.6.2.1 Note: This means that when the service bra ke is commanded in ceiling speed 

--- Document Chunk 10510 ---
monitoring while it is not available in target speed monitoring, the service brake remains 

--- Document Chunk 10511 ---
commanded when the on-board switches to target speed monitoring and is only revoked 

--- Document Chunk 10512 ---
when the Permitted speed supervision limit is no longer exceeded. 

--- Document Chunk 10513 ---
3.13.10.6.3 If a transition from target speed monitoring to ceiling speed or release speed monitoring 

--- Document Chunk 10514 ---
occurs while a traction cut-off command is already applied, the traction cut-off command 

--- Document Chunk 10515 ---
shall be immediately revoked. 

--- Document Chunk 10516 ---
3.13.10.6.4 If a transition from target s peed monitoring to release speed monitoring occurs while a 

--- Document Chunk 10517 ---
service brake command is already applied, the service brake command shall be 

--- Document Chunk 10518 ---
immediately revoked. 

--- Document Chunk 10519 ---
3.13.10.6.5 On executing a transition between types of speed and distance monitoring, the 

--- Document Chunk 10520 ---
supervision status shall be determined according to the requirements specified for the 

--- Document Chunk 10521 ---
newly entered speed and distance monitoring. 

--- Document Chunk 10522 ---
3.13.11 Perturbation location 

--- Document Chunk 10523 ---
3.13.11.1 The purpose of the perturbation location is to trigger the MA request to the RBC in order 

--- Document Chunk 10524 ---
to renew the Movement Authority in due time before the train would have to brake to an 

--- Document Chunk 10525 ---
EOA/SvL or LOA target. 

--- Document Chunk 10526 ---
3.13.11.2 For the SvL, the on-board shall calculate the perturbation location applying the clauses 

--- Document Chunk 10527 ---
3.13.11.3, 3.13.11.4, 3.13.11.5 and 3.13.11.6. 

--- Document Chunk 10528 ---
3.13.11.3 Starting from the first element of the MRSP  (i.e. from the start location of the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 10529 ---
stored track description), the on -board shall calculate the location of the Indication 

--- Document Chunk 10530 ---
supervision limit, valid for the speed of the MRSP element, taking into account the 

--- Document Chunk 10531 ---
following assumptions: 

--- Document Chunk 10532 ---
a) the estimated acceleration shall be set to “zero” 

--- Document Chunk 10533 ---
b) if not inhibited by National Value, the compensation of the inaccuracy of the speed 

--- Document Chunk 10534 ---
measurement shall be set to a value, calculated from the speed of the MRSP element, 

--- Document Chunk 10535 ---
as defined in SUBSET-041 § 5.3.1.2: V_delta0ind = f41(V_MRSP-n) 

--- Document Chunk 10536 ---
c) If available for use, the service brake feedback shall not have any effect: T_bs1ind 

--- Document Chunk 10537 ---
and T_bs2ind shall be set to T_bs if the service brake command is available for use, 

--- Document Chunk 10538 ---
otherwise they shall be set to “zero”. T_tractionind and T_berem ind shall be defined 

--- Document Chunk 10539 ---
as in 3.13.9.3.2 for T_traction and T_berem by substituting T_bs2 with T_bs2ind and 

--- Document Chunk 10540 ---
T_be_reduced with T_be as defined in 3.13.6.2.2.3 

--- Document Chunk 10541 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 10542 ---

--- Document Chunk 10554 ---
n, T_traction with T_tractionind, T_berem with T_beremind and V_delta0 with 

--- Document Chunk 10555 ---
V_delta0ind.

3.13.11.7.1 For the LOA, the on-board shall calculate its perturbation location in the same way as for 

--- Document Chunk 10613 ---
the SvL, except that: 

--- Document Chunk 10614 ---
a) the elements of the MRSP whose speed is lower than the LOA speed shall be 

--- Document Chunk 10615 ---
skipped, 

--- Document Chunk 10616 ---
b) the clause 3.13.11.6 shall apply only if none of the two referred consecutive MRSP 

--- Document Chunk 10617 ---
elements is skipped according to a) 

--- Document Chunk 10618 ---
3.13.11.7.1.1 In case no perturbation location can be found applying 3.13.11.7.1 (e.g. the LOA 

--- Document Chunk 10619 ---
speed is higher than the speed of all elements of the MRSP), the perturbation location 

--- Document Chunk 10620 ---
shall be set at the LOA location. 

--- Document Chunk 10621 ---
3.13.11.7.1.2 In case the perturbation location found applying 3.13.11.7.1 is in advance of the LOA, 

--- Document Chunk 10622 ---
the perturbation location shall be set at the LOA location. 

--- Document Chunk 10623 ---
3.13.11.8 The on-board shall trigger the MA request to the RBC when the train has passed, either 

--- Document Chunk 10624 ---
with its estimated front end for the perturbation location calculated from the EOA or with 

--- Document Chunk 10625 ---
its max safe front end for the perturbation location calculated from the SvL or the L OA, 

--- Document Chunk 10626 ---
the following location: 

--- Document Chunk 10627 ---
𝑑𝑀𝐴𝑅 =𝑑𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑡𝑢𝑟𝑏𝑎𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛 −(𝑉𝑀𝑅𝑆𝑃 +𝑑𝑉𝑤𝑎𝑟𝑛𝑖𝑛𝑔(𝑉𝑀𝑅𝑆𝑃))⋅𝑇𝑀𝐴𝑅 

--- Document Chunk 10628 ---

--- Document Chunk 10629 ---
the start location of the MRSP is lower than the speed of the first element of the MRSP, 

--- Document Chunk 10630 ---
the location to trigger the MA request to the RBC shall be considered as already passed. 

--- Document Chunk 10631 ---

--- Document Chunk 10632 ---
supervision limit are necessary to obtain a fully predictable perturbation location, i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 10633 ---
independent from the measured acceleration and speed confidence interval.

--- Document Chunk 10645 ---
3.14 Brake Command Handling and Protection against Undesirable 

--- Document Chunk 10646 ---
Train Movement 

--- Document Chunk 10647 ---
3.14.1 Brake Command Handling 

--- Document Chunk 10648 ---
3.14.1.1 Note: Whenever the type of brake used is not specified explicitly in the text, it shall be 

--- Document Chunk 10649 ---
interpreted as not being important for technical interoperability and being a property of  

--- Document Chunk 10650 ---
the specific implementation.  

--- Document Chunk 10651 ---
3.14.1.2 In case only the application of (the non -vital) service brake has been commanded a nd 

--- Document Chunk 10652 ---
the service brake fails to be applied, the emergency brake command shall be given. 

--- Document Chunk 10653 ---
3.14.1.3 If the emergency brake command was triggered due to a trip condition (see chapter 4) 

--- Document Chunk 10654 ---
the emergency brake command shall be released at standstill and after driver 

--- Document Chunk 10655 ---
acknowledgement of the trip condition. 

--- Document Chunk 10656 ---
3.14.1.4 For handling of brake commands resulting from the speed and distance monitoring, refer 

--- Document Chunk 10657 ---
to section 3.13.10. 

--- Document Chunk 10658 ---
3.14.1.5 If the brake command was triggered due to roll away protection, unauthorised direction 

--- Document Chunk 10659 ---
movement protection , standstill supervision, or detection of a train movement while 

--- Document Chunk 10660 ---
modifying/revalidating train data or while entering SR speed/distance limits,  the brake 

--- Document Chunk 10661 ---
command shall be released at standstill and after driver acknowledgement.  

--- Document Chunk 10662 ---
3.14.1.6 If the brake command was triggered due t o linking error, balise group message 

--- Document Chunk 10663 ---
inconsistency or RAMS related supervision error, the brake command shall be released 

--- Document Chunk 10664 ---
at standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 10665 ---
3.14.1.7 If the brake command was triggered due to supervision of the safe radio connection 

--- Document Chunk 10666 ---
(T_NVCONTACT) the brake command shall be released at standstill or if a new message 

--- Document Chunk 10667 ---
has been received from the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 10668 ---
3.14.1.7.1 If the brake command was triggered due to an overpassed reversing distance related to 

--- Document Chunk 10669 ---
a reversing area  or due to any further movement in the direction opposite to the train 

--- Document Chunk 10670 ---
orientation while the reversing distance is still overpassed, the brake command shall be 

--- Document Chunk 10671 ---
released if the reversing distance becomes extended so that the reversing distance is no 

--- Document Chunk 10672 ---
longer overpassed, or at standstill after driver acknowledgement. 

--- Document Chunk 10673 ---
3.14.1.7.2 If the brake c ommand was triggered due to change of Train Data while running (see 

--- Document Chunk 10674 ---
section 5.17 procedure "Changing Train Data from sources different from the driver”), 

--- Document Chunk 10675 ---
the brake command shall be released at standstill and after driver acknowledgement. 

--- Document Chunk 10676 ---
3.14.1.7.3 If the brake command was triggered due to the driver not having acknowledged a mode 

--- Document Chunk 10677 ---
or level change ordered from trackside (see sections 5.7, 5.9, 5.10 and 5.19), the brake 

--- Document Chunk 10678 ---
command shall be released after the driver has acknowledged the mode or level 

--- Document Chunk 10679 ---
transition. 

--- Document Chunk 10680 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 10681 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 10682 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 10683 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 10684 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 10685 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 10686 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 10687 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 10688 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 10689 ---
Page 180/252 

--- Document Chunk 10690 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 10691 ---
3.14.1.7.4 If the brake command was triggered due to an overpassed distance allowed for reverse 

--- Document Chunk 10692 ---
movement in Post Trip mode or due to any further movement in the direction opposite to 

--- Document Chunk 10693 ---
the train orientation while the distance allowed for reverse movement in Post Trip mode 

--- Document Chunk 10694 ---
is still overpassed , the brake command shall be released at standstill and after driver 

--- Document Chunk 10695 ---
acknowledgement. 

--- Document Chunk 10696 ---
3.14.1.7.5 If the brake command was triggered due to the driver not having acknowledged a text 

--- Document Chunk 10697 ---
message, the brake command shall be released after the driver has acknowledged the 

--- Document Chunk 10698 ---
text message. 

--- Document Chunk 10699 ---
3.14.1.7.6 If the brake command was triggered due to the safe consist length information having 

--- Document Chunk 10700 ---
become unavailable, the brake command shall be released at standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 10701 ---
3.14.1.7.7 For handling of brake commands resulting from the STM control function, refer to 

--- Document Chunk 10702 ---
SUBSET-035. 

--- Document Chunk 10703 ---
3.14.1.8 A brake command reason that pertains to one of the above clauses 3.14.1.3 to 3.14.1.7.7 

--- Document Chunk 10704 ---
shall be considered as applicable from the time the brake command is triggered to the 

--- Document Chunk 10705 ---
time the release condition specified in the concerned above clause is fulfilled or to the 

--- Document Chunk 10706 ---
time it is revoked due to a mode change. 

--- Document Chunk 10707 ---
3.14.1.9 Whenever an acknowledgem ent is requested together with standstill for the release 

--- Document Chunk 10708 ---
condition of a brake command, it shall be requested to the driver only when the train 

--- Document Chunk 10709 ---
reaches standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 10710 ---
3.14.1.10 In case more than one reason to command the brake is applicable at the same time, the 

--- Document Chunk 10711 ---
brake command shall be released only when the release conditions specified for each of 

--- Document Chunk 10712 ---
the above clauses 3.14.1.3 to 3.14.1.7. 7 including the concerned reasons have been 

--- Document Chunk 10713 ---
fulfilled. In particular, if several brake command reasons applicable at the same time are 

--- Document Chunk 10714 ---
included in several clauses where a driver acknowledgement is required, there shall be 

--- Document Chunk 10715 ---
as many individual driver acknowledgements required as concerned clauses. 

--- Document Chunk 10716 ---
3.14.1.10.1 In some of the above clauses 3.14.1.3 to 3.14.1.7.7, brake reasons are grouped: in case 

--- Document Chunk 10717 ---
several brake command reasons are applicable at the same time and they are all 

--- Document Chunk 10718 ---
pertaining to the same clause, only one driver acknowledgement shall be required in 

--- Document Chunk 10719 ---
relation to these brake reasons. 

--- Document Chunk 10720 ---
3.14.1.11 In case a change of mode occurs while a brake command due to one or more reasons 

--- Document Chunk 10721 ---
is still ongoing, see section 4.12 specifying for every individual brake command reason 

--- Document Chunk 10722 ---
whether it shall be revoked or it shall remain applicable. 

--- Document Chunk 10723 ---
3.14.1.11.1 Upon a mode change, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall maintain the brake 

--- Document Chunk 10724 ---
command if at least one individual brake command reason remains applicable, until the 

--- Document Chunk 10725 ---
corresponding release conditions have been all fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 10726 ---
3.14.1.11.2 If an individual brake command reason is revoked on a mode change, the release 

--- Document Chunk 10727 ---
conditions specified in the clause including this brake reason shall not apply anymore, 

--- Document Chunk 10728 ---
unless another brake reason included in the same clause remains applicable further to 

--- Document Chunk 10729 ---
this mode change. 

--- Document Chunk 10730 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 10731 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 10732 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 10733 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 10734 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 10735 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 10736 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 10737 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 10738 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 10739 ---
Page 181/252 

--- Document Chunk 10740 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 10741 ---
3.14.2 Roll Away Protection 

--- Document Chunk 10742 ---
3.14.2.1 Note: This protection is only applicable if the required information can be obtained from 

--- Document Chunk 10743 ---
the direction controller. 

--- Document Chunk 10744 ---
3.14.2.2 The Roll Away Protection (RAP) shall prevent the train from moving in a direction, which 

--- Document Chunk 10745 ---
conflicts with the current position of the direction controller in the active desk. 

--- Document Chunk 10746 ---
3.14.2.3 If the controller is in neutral position, the RAP shall prev ent forward and reverse 

--- Document Chunk 10747 ---
movements of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 10748 ---
3.14.2.4 As soon as a movement conflicting with the position of the direction controller is detected, 

--- Document Chunk 10749 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall start supervising (see section 3.6.7) whether the train 

--- Document Chunk 10750 ---
travels away, from the locati on when the conflicting movement was detected, over a 

--- Document Chunk 10751 ---
distance longer than the national value for the allowed roll away distance . In case this 

--- Document Chunk 10752 ---
roll away distance is exceeded, the brake command shall be triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 10753 ---
3.14.2.5 Refer to section 3.14.1. 

--- Document Chunk 10754 ---
3.14.2.6 An indication shall be given to the driver showing when the RAP is commanding the 

--- Document Chunk 10755 ---
brakes. 

--- Document Chunk 10756 ---
3.14.2.7 After revocation of the brake command , the RAP shall be re-initialised, i.e. the clause 

--- Document Chunk 10757 ---
3.14.2.4 shall be applied again. 

--- Document Chunk 10758 ---
3.14.3 Unauthorised Direction Movement Protection 

--- Document Chunk 10759 ---
3.14.3.1 The Unauthorised Direction Movement Protection (UDMP) shall prevent the train from 

--- Document Chunk 10760 ---
moving in the opposite direction to the permitted one. The permitted movement direction 

--- Document Chunk 10761 ---
of a train shall be the one of the currently valid MA, if available on-board. See chapter 4 

--- Document Chunk 10762 ---
concerning permitted direction for special cases. 

--- Document Chunk 10763 ---
3.14.3.2 As soon as  a movement opposite to the authorised direction is detected, the 

--- Document Chunk 10764 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall start supervising (see section 3.6.7) whether the train 

--- Document Chunk 10765 ---
travels away, from the location when the opposite movement was detected, over a 

--- Document Chunk 10766 ---
distance longer than a distance specified by the national value. In case this distance is 

--- Document Chunk 10767 ---
exceeded, the brake command shall be triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 10768 ---
3.14.3.3 Refer to section 3.14.1. 

--- Document Chunk 10769 ---
3.14.3.4 An indication shall be given to the driver showing when the UDMP is commanding the 

--- Document Chunk 10770 ---
brakes. 

--- Document Chunk 10771 ---
3.14.3.5 After revocation of the brake command, the UDMP shall be reinitialised, i.e. the clause 

--- Document Chunk 10772 ---
3.14.3.2 shall be applied again. 

--- Document Chunk 10773 ---
3.14.3.6 Information received from balises during movement opposite to the authorised direction 

--- Document Chunk 10774 ---
shall be ignored. 

--- Document Chunk 10775 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 10776 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 10777 ---

3.14.4 Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 10787 ---
3.15 Special functions 

--- Document Chunk 10788 ---
3.15.1 RBC/RBC Handover 

--- Document Chunk 10789 ---
3.15.1.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 10790 ---
3.15.1.1.1 The RBC/RBC Handover principles are such that trains are able to pass from one RBC 

--- Document Chunk 10791 ---
area to another automatically (without driver action). 

--- Document Chunk 10792 ---
3.15.1.1.2 This is also granted when, due to a failure in the GSM-R on-board radio communication 

--- Document Chunk 10793 ---
system, the on -board is no longer able to manage two communication sessions 

--- Document Chunk 10794 ---
established through GSM-R at once, while the communication session with the Handing 

--- Document Chunk 10795 ---
Over RBC has been established through GSM -R and the communication session with 

--- Document Chunk 10796 ---
the Accepting RBC can only be established through GSM-R. Thereby, the behaviour of 

--- Document Chunk 10797 ---
the RBCs is independent from such on-board degraded situation. 

--- Document Chunk 10798 ---
3.15.1.1.3 However, such an RBC/RBC handover performed by a train with only one 

--- Document Chunk 10799 ---
communication session established through GSM-R at once may result in performance 

--- Document Chunk 10800 ---
penalties since it will not be able to “prepare” (session establishment, version 

--- Document Chunk 10801 ---
determination, …) the expected supervision by the Accepting RBC until the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 10802 ---
disconnects from the Handing Over RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 10803 ---
3.15.1.1.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 10804 ---
3.15.1.1.5 For successive RBC/RBC handovers, it shall be possible for an RBC to act as the 

--- Document Chunk 10805 ---
Accepting and as the Handing Over RBC for the same engine at different RBC/RBC 

--- Document Chunk 10806 ---
border locations simultaneously. 

--- Document Chunk 10807 ---
3.15.1.1.5.1 Note: Successive RBC/RBC handover means that the track side initiates another 

--- Document Chunk 10808 ---
handover procedure while an ongoing handover has not finished. However, from the 

--- Document Chunk 10809 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board point of view, there is only one handover at a time. 

--- Document Chunk 10810 ---
3.15.1.1.5.2 Note: An RBC acting as both Accepting and Handing Over RBC for the same engine 

--- Document Chunk 10811 ---
may as Accepting RBC forward all or parts of route related information it receives as 

--- Document Chunk 10812 ---
Handing Over RBC, but if and how this is done is intentionally not specified. 

--- Document Chunk 10813 ---
3.15.1.1.6 In an RBC/RBC handover, the Accepting RBC is defined by the RBC transition order, 

--- Document Chunk 10814 ---
while the Handing Over RBC is the RBC which the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 10815 ---
considers as the supervising RBC when receiving an RBC transition order. 

--- Document Chunk 10816 ---
3.15.1.1.6.1 Exception: clause 3.15.1.3.2 describes a situation when the current Accepting RBC 

--- Document Chunk 10817 ---
becomes the new Handing Over RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 10818 ---
3.15.1.2 Handing Over RBC 

--- Document Chunk 10819 ---
3.15.1.2.1 When the Handing Over RBC detects that a route is set for a train to enter another RBC 

--- Document Chunk 10820 ---
area, it shall send: 

--- Document Chunk 10821 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 10822 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 10823 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 10824 ---

Page 183/252 

--- Document Chunk 10831 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 10832 ---
a) Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 10833 ---
b) To the Accepting RBC the following information: 

--- Document Chunk 10834 ---
• The ETCS identity of the on-board equipment; 

--- Document Chunk 10835 ---
• The border location that will be passed by the train when entering the Accepting RBC 

--- Document Chunk 10836 ---
area; 

--- Document Chunk 10837 ---
• Current mode of the on-board equipment; 

--- Document Chunk 10838 ---
• For a leading engine  performing a mission in a mode different from Supervised 

--- Document Chunk 10839 ---
Manoeuvre, Train Data and Train Running Number; 

--- Document Chunk 10840 ---
• For an engine in Supervised Manoeuvre mode, safe consist length information  and 

--- Document Chunk 10841 ---
default Train Data; 

--- Document Chunk 10842 ---
• The system versions supported by the on-board equipment; 

--- Document Chunk 10843 ---
• Optionally, for a non-leading engine, the ETCS identity of the leading engine. 

--- Document Chunk 10844 ---
3.15.1.2.1.1 Exception: for successive handove rs, an RBC already acting as Accepting RBC for 

--- Document Chunk 10845 ---
the engine shall only send this information to the next Accepting RBC after the 

--- Document Chunk 10846 ---
information about the train has been received from the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 10847 ---
equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 10848 ---
3.15.1.2.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 10849 ---
3.15.1.2.3 It shall be possible for the Handing Over RBC to request route related information from 

--- Document Chunk 10850 ---
the Accepting RBC, limited to a maximum amount of data. 

--- Document Chunk 10851 ---
3.15.1.2.3.1 Route related information is : 

--- Document Chunk 10852 ---

--- Document Chunk 10853 ---

--- Document Chunk 10854 ---

--- Document Chunk 10856 ---

--- Document Chunk 10857 ---

--- Document Chunk 10858 ---

--- Document Chunk 10859 ---

--- Document Chunk 10860 ---
i) Track Conditions 

--- Document Chunk 10861 ---
j) Level Transition orders 

--- Document Chunk 10862 ---
k) Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 10863 ---
l) Route Suitability Data 

--- Document Chunk 10864 ---
m)  National Values 

--- Document Chunk 10865 ---
n) Adhesion Factor 

--- Document Chunk 10866 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 10878 ---

--- Document Chunk 10879 ---
3.15.1.2.3.2 Note: The amount of information to be sent between the RBCs is depending on the 

--- Document Chunk 10880 ---
implementation trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 10881 ---
3.15.1.2.4 The Handing Over RBC shall send information to an on-board equipment concerning the 

--- Document Chunk 10882 ---
route in advance of the border only if this information ha s been received from the 

--- Document Chunk 10883 ---
Accepting RBC in the Route related information. 

--- Document Chunk 10884 ---
3.15.1.2.4.1 Note: Route related information received from the Accepting RBC will be processed 

--- Document Chunk 10885 ---
by the Handing Over RBC if possible. 

--- Document Chunk 10886 ---
3.15.1.2.5 Deleted.  

--- Document Chunk 10887 ---
3.15.1.2.6 When the Handing Over RBC receives a position report a nd detects that the maximum 

--- Document Chunk 10888 ---
safe front end of the train has passed the border location, it shall inform the Accepting 

--- Document Chunk 10889 ---
RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 10890 ---
3.15.1.2.6.1 Note: This information might be needed to inform the signalman of the Accepting RBC 

--- Document Chunk 10891 ---
that the train has entered the Accepting RBC area. 

--- Document Chunk 10892 ---
3.15.1.2.7 It is a trackside implementation issue to decide when it is appropriate to send the session 

--- Document Chunk 10893 ---
termination order to the on-board equipment, e.g. when the Handing Over RBC receives 

--- Document Chunk 10894 ---
a position report and detects that the minimum safe rear end of the train has passed the 

--- Document Chunk 10895 ---
border, or after the RBC has received a train integrity confirmation indicating that the 

--- Document Chunk 10896 ---
confirmed rear end of the train has passed the border. 

--- Document Chunk 10897 ---
3.15.1.2.8 When the Accepting RBC informs the Handing Over RBC that it has taken over the 

--- Document Chunk 10898 ---
responsibility, the l atter shall stop sending route related information to the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 10899 ---
equipment.  

--- Document Chunk 10900 ---
3.15.1.2.9 When the Handing Over RBC detects that the transition to the Accepting RBC has to be 

--- Document Chunk 10901 ---
cancelled, it shall send this cancellation information to the Accepting RBC (including the 

--- Document Chunk 10902 ---
train identification). 

--- Document Chunk 10903 ---
3.15.1.2.9.1 Note: For instance, the cancellation procedure can be triggered by:  

--- Document Chunk 10904 ---
• Change to a route which does no more include the border; 

--- Document Chunk 10905 ---
• The need to initiate a Supervised Manoeuvre procedure, after the RBC -RBC 

--- Document Chunk 10906 ---
handover has been e ngaged with an on -board equipment in a mode different from 

--- Document Chunk 10907 ---
Supervised Manoeuvre; 

--- Document Chunk 10908 ---
• The sending of an “end of mission” information from the on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 10909 ---

--- Document Chunk 10910 ---

--- Document Chunk 10911 ---
board equipment shall: 

--- Document Chunk 10912 ---
a) Immediately establish the communication session with the Accepting RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 10913 ---

--- Document Chunk 10924 ---
b) Send a position report to the Handing Over RBC when the maximum safe front end 

--- Document Chunk 10925 ---
of the train passes the given location; 

--- Document Chunk 10926 ---
c) Send a position report to the Handing Over RBC when the minimum safe rear end of 

--- Document Chunk 10927 ---
the train passes the given location; 

--- Document Chunk 10928 ---
3.15.1.3.2 Exception to 3.15.1.3.1 a) (degraded situation) , only  if the following conditions are 

--- Document Chunk 10929 ---
fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 10930 ---
a) the GSM-R radio system is installed on-board, AND 

--- Document Chunk 10931 ---
b) the on-board equipmen t is able to handle only one communication session 

--- Document Chunk 10932 ---
established through GSM-R at a given time, AND 

--- Document Chunk 10933 ---
c) the communication session with the Handing Over RBC has been established through 

--- Document Chunk 10934 ---
GSM-R, AND 

--- Document Chunk 10935 ---
d) the Radio Network type is GSM -R or is FRMCS+GSM -R while the RBC tr ansition 

--- Document Chunk 10936 ---
order does not relate to an RBC interfaced with FRMCS only, 

--- Document Chunk 10937 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall wait until the session with the Handing over 

--- Document Chunk 10938 ---
RBC is terminated due to crossing the border, apply the clause 3.5.6.6 (if relevant), and 

--- Document Chunk 10939 ---
then establish the session with the Accepting RBC  after successful registration of the 

--- Document Chunk 10940 ---
GSM-R Mobile Terminal to the new GSM-R Radio Network (if relevant). 

--- Document Chunk 10941 ---
3.15.1.3.2.1 Justification: in case of loss of safe radio connection with the Handing over RBC, the 

--- Document Chunk 10942 ---
only GSM-R Mobile Terminal still available cannot be pre-empted to set-up a safe radio 

--- Document Chunk 10943 ---
connection with the Accepting RBC as long as the Handing over RBC is the supervising 

--- Document Chunk 10944 ---
one. 

--- Document Chunk 10945 ---
3.15.1.3.2.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall manage only one RBC/RBC handover 

--- Document Chunk 10946 ---
at a time, therefore a new RBC transition order shall replace a previously received order. 

--- Document Chunk 10947 ---
3.15.1.3.2.3 If, whilst in session with both the Handing Over RBC and the Accepting RBC, the 

--- Document Chunk 10948 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment receives a new RBC transition order with an 

--- Document Chunk 10949 ---
Accepting RBC different than the current on e from the RBC/RBC handover already 

--- Document Chunk 10950 ---
engaged, the communication session with the RBC which is not the currently supervising 

--- Document Chunk 10951 ---
RBC shall be terminated, while the currently supervising RBC remains or becomes the 

--- Document Chunk 10952 ---
Handing Over RBC. Then after the clause s 3.15.1.3.1 and 3.15.1.3.2 (if relevant) shall 

--- Document Chunk 10953 ---
be applied again for the new pair of Handing Over RBC/Accepting RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 10954 ---
3.15.1.3.2.4 Exception to 3.15.1.3.2: If, while waiting until the communication session with the 

--- Document Chunk 10955 ---
Handing over RBC is terminated due to crossing the border, the on -board receives a 

--- Document Chunk 10956 ---
new RBC transition order with an Accepting RBC different than the current one as per 

--- Document Chunk 10957 ---
the RBC/RBC handover already engaged and if the maximum safe front end of the train 

--- Document Chunk 10958 ---
has left the area of the current Handing Over RBC when this new RBC t ransition order 

--- Document Chunk 10959 ---
is received, the communication session with the current Handing Over RBC shall be 

--- Document Chunk 10960 ---
terminated, the registration of its GSM -R Mobile Terminal in working condition to the 

--- Document Chunk 10961 ---
ordered GSM -R Radio Network (if any) shall be performed (see 3.5.6.6) , a nd the 

--- Document Chunk 10962 ---
communication session shall be established with the Accepting RBC from the previous 

--- Document Chunk 10963 ---
RBC transition order, which becomes the new Handing Over RBC. Then after, the 

--- Document Chunk 10964 ---

--- Document Chunk 10977 ---
3.15.1.3.3 As soon as the on-board equipment has established the session with the Accepting RBC, 

--- Document Chunk 10978 ---
it shall send its valid Train Data if available. If in Supervised Manoeuvre mode, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 10979 ---
send its safe consist length information instead. 

--- Document Chunk 10980 ---
3.15.1.3.4 When the on -board equipment is connected to both RBCs, it shall send its position 

--- Document Chunk 10981 ---
reports to both of them with the use of the position report parameters valid for the 

--- Document Chunk 10982 ---
Handing Over RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 10983 ---
3.15.1.3.4.1 If the on -board equipment is connected to both RBCs, and it executes an End of 

--- Document Chunk 10984 ---
Mission, it shall execute the End of Mission procedure with both RBCs. 

--- Document Chunk 10985 ---
3.15.1.3.5 As soon as the on-board sends a position report directly to the Accepting RBC with its 

--- Document Chunk 10986 ---
maximum safe front end having passed the border, it shall use information received from 

--- Document Chunk 10987 ---
the Accepting RBC , which is now considered to be the supervising RBC,  and only a 

--- Document Chunk 10988 ---
disconnection order shall be accepted from the Handing Over RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 10989 ---
3.15.1.3.5.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 10990 ---

--- Document Chunk 10991 ---
Accepting RBC before a position report is sent to the Accepting RBC with the maximum 

--- Document Chunk 10992 ---
safe front end having passed the border, this information shall be stored on -board.  

--- Document Chunk 10993 ---
Exception: The acknowledgement of Train Data shall be immediately accepted by t he 

--- Document Chunk 10994 ---
on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 10995 ---
3.15.1.3.6.1 Note: for the exhaustive list of accepted/rejected information, please refer to Chapter 

--- Document Chunk 10996 ---

--- Document Chunk 10997 ---

--- Document Chunk 10998 ---
RBC transition immediately i s received, the on -board shall substitute the current valid 

--- Document Chunk 10999 ---
RBC contact information with those of the Accepting RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 11000 ---

--- Document Chunk 11001 ---
the Handing Over RBC until at least one of the following conditions is fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 11002 ---
a) The communication session with this Handing Over RBC has been terminated, 

--- Document Chunk 11003 ---
b) The RBC transition order is deleted according to 4.10. 

--- Document Chunk 11004 ---
3.15.1.3.8.1 Note: Even after the train front end has passed the border, the on-board may have to 

--- Document Chunk 11005 ---
maintain the communication session with the Handing Over RBC (see 3.5.4) or re -

--- Document Chunk 11006 ---
establish it (see 3.5.3.4 f)) and needs therefore to remember the RBC contact information 

--- Document Chunk 11007 ---
of this RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 11008 ---

--- Document Chunk 11009 ---

--- Document Chunk 11010 ---
is received from the Handing Over RBC within a fixed waiting time (see Appendix A.3.1) 

--- Document Chunk 11011 ---
from the time the position report was sent, it shall repeatedly send a position report with 

--- Document Chunk 11012 ---
the fixed waiting time after each repetition, until the order to terminate the session is

--- Document Chunk 11028 ---
3.15.1.4 Accepting RBC 

--- Document Chunk 11029 ---
3.15.1.4.1 The Accepting RBC shall keep route related information sent to the Handing Over RBC 

--- Document Chunk 11030 ---
updated. In particular, this possibly includes temporary speed restrictions. 

--- Document Chunk 11031 ---
3.15.1.4.2 As soon as the Accepting RBC receives from the on -board equipment a position report 

--- Document Chunk 11032 ---
and detects that the maximum safe front end of the train has passed the border, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 11033 ---
inform the Handing Over RBC that it has taken over the responsibility. 

--- Document Chunk 11034 ---
3.15.1.4.3 When the Accepting RBC receives Train Data from both the on -board equipment and 

--- Document Chunk 11035 ---
the Handing over RBC Train Data provided by the on -board equipment shall take 

--- Document Chunk 11036 ---
precedence. 

--- Document Chunk 11037 ---
3.15.1.4.4 If the Accepting RBC receives a cancellation information from the Handing Over RBC, it 

--- Document Chunk 11038 ---
shall send an order to terminate the communication session to the corresponding on -

--- Document Chunk 11039 ---
board equipment (if already established). 

--- Document Chunk 11040 ---
3.15.1.4.5 The Accepting RBC shall comply with the maximum amount of data contained in the last 

--- Document Chunk 11041 ---
received route related information request from the Handing Over RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 11042 ---
3.15.1.4.6 An Accepting RBC shall only give a transition order for a successive RBC/RBC handover 

--- Document Chunk 11043 ---
after the on-board has reported as LRBG the balise group at the RBC/RBC border for 

--- Document Chunk 11044 ---
the already ongoing RBC/RBC handover or a balise group in advance of that border. 

--- Document Chunk 11045 ---
3.15.1.5 RBC/RBC message acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 11046 ---
3.15.1.5.1 As soon as a consistent RBC/RBC message including the request for acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 11047 ---
is received, the receiving RBC shall send an acknowledgement to the emitting RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 11048 ---
3.15.1.5.2 The RBC/RBC message is  consistent when all checks have been completed 

--- Document Chunk 11049 ---
successfully: 

--- Document Chunk 11050 ---
a) It has passed the checks performed by the RBC/RBC Safe Communication Interface 

--- Document Chunk 11051 ---
protocol (see SUBSET-098); 

--- Document Chunk 11052 ---
b) Variables in the message do not have invalid values. 

--- Document Chunk 11053 ---
3.15.1.5.3 The acknowledgement message shall r efer to the identity of the concerned message 

--- Document Chunk 11054 ---
sent by the emitting RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 11055 ---
3.15.2 Handling of Trains with Non Leading Engines 

--- Document Chunk 11056 ---
3.15.2.1 It is possible to operate a train using more than one engine, each engine being under 

--- Document Chunk 11057 ---
the control of a driver. 

--- Document Chunk 11058 ---
3.15.2.2 Only the leading engine is responsible for the train movement supervision functions. 

--- Document Chunk 11059 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 11060 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11061 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11062 ---

--- Document Chunk 11070 ---
3.15.3 Splitting/joining 

--- Document Chunk 11071 ---
3.15.3.1 ERTMS/ETCS allow s Splitting and Joining using the normal supervision functions 

--- Document Chunk 11072 ---
available (e.g. On-sight, Shunting). 

--- Document Chunk 11073 ---
3.15.3.2 Splitting only refers to the case that the two resulting trains contain at least one 

--- Document Chunk 11074 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment each. 

--- Document Chunk 11075 ---
3.15.3.2.1 Note: This must be ensured by operational procedures. 

--- Document Chunk 11076 ---
3.15.3.3 ERTMS/ETCS is not responsible for providing information that a Splitting/Joining 

--- Document Chunk 11077 ---
operation has been correctly completed (technical aspect and/or operational aspect). 

--- Document Chunk 11078 ---
3.15.3.4 Justification: ERTMS/ETCS is not able to provide this information. Split ting and Joining 

--- Document Chunk 11079 ---
requires the fulfilment of operating rules ensuring that a Splitting/Joining operation has 

--- Document Chunk 11080 ---
been correctly completed (e.g. physical disconnection). 

--- Document Chunk 11081 ---
3.15.4 Reversing of movement direction 

--- Document Chunk 11082 ---
3.15.4.1 It shall be possible to send in advance to an on -board equipment information about 

--- Document Chunk 11083 ---
areas, where initiation of reversing of movement direction is possible, i.e. change the 

--- Document Chunk 11084 ---
direction of train movement without changing the train orientation. 

--- Document Chunk 11085 ---
3.15.4.1.1 A new reversing area given from the trackside shall replace the one already a vailable 

--- Document Chunk 11086 ---
on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 11087 ---
3.15.4.2 Together with start and end of reversing area, the following supervision information shall 

--- Document Chunk 11088 ---
be sent: 

--- Document Chunk 11089 ---
a) Maximum distance to run in the direction opposite to the orientation of the reversing 

--- Document Chunk 11090 ---
area, the fixed reference location being the end location of the area where reversing 

--- Document Chunk 11091 ---
of movement is permitted with which the maximum distance information is sent. 

--- Document Chunk 11092 ---
b) Reversing mode speed limit allowed during reverse movement. 

--- Document Chunk 11093 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11094 ---

--- Document Chunk 11095 ---
reversing

--- Document Chunk 11163 ---

3.15.5 Track ahead free 

--- Document Chunk 11176 ---
3.15.5.1 In a level 2 area, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is able to handle a track ahead 

--- Document Chunk 11177 ---
free request given by the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 11178 ---
3.15.5.2 The track ahead free request from the RBC shall indicate to the on-board 

--- Document Chunk 11179 ---
a) at which location the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall begin to display the 

--- Document Chunk 11180 ---
request to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 11181 ---
b) at which location the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall stop to  display the 

--- Document Chunk 11182 ---
request to the driver (in case the driver did not acknowledge). 

--- Document Chunk 11183 ---
3.15.5.3 As long as it is displayed, t he driver has the possibility to acknowledge the track ahead 

--- Document Chunk 11184 ---
free request (meaning the driver confirms that the track between the head of the train 

--- Document Chunk 11185 ---
and the next signal or board marking signal position is free). 

--- Document Chunk 11186 ---
3.15.5.4 When the driver acknowledges, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall stop 

--- Document Chunk 11187 ---
displaying the request, and shall inform the RBC that the track ahead is free. 

--- Document Chunk 11188 ---
3.15.5.5 There is no restrictive consequence by th e on -board system if the driver does not 

--- Document Chunk 11189 ---
acknowledge. 

--- Document Chunk 11190 ---
3.15.5.6 A new track ahead free request shall replace the one previously received and stored. 

--- Document Chunk 11191 ---
3.15.6 Handling of National Systems 

--- Document Chunk 11192 ---
3.15.6.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board support s driving on national infrastructure u nder the 

--- Document Chunk 11193 ---
supervision of National Systems. 

--- Document Chunk 11194 ---
3.15.6.2 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is interfaced to a National System 

--- Document Chunk 11195 ---
through an STM, refer to Subset 035 for detailed requirements. 

--- Document Chunk 11196 ---
3.15.6.2.1 Intentionally deleted.  

--- Document Chunk 11197 ---
3.15.6.3 Intentionally deleted.  

--- Document Chunk 11198 ---
3.15.6.4 Intentionally deleted.  

--- Document Chunk 11199 ---
3.15.6.5 Amongst the  data to be used by applications outside ERTMS/ETCS that can be 

--- Document Chunk 11200 ---
transmitted by trackside over the ERTMS/ETCS transmission channels,  it shall be 

--- Document Chunk 11201 ---
possible, only from balise as non-infill information or from RBC, to identify a National 

--- Document Chunk 11202 ---
System to which the data will be forwarded by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment in 

--- Document Chunk 11203 ---
case it is interfaced to this National System through an STM. 

--- Document Chunk 11204 ---
3.15.6.5.1 Note: In case the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is not interfaced to the concerned 

--- Document Chunk 11205 ---
National System through an STM, the way the data is forwarded to the National System 

--- Document Chunk 11206 ---
is outside the scope of the ERTMS/ETCS specifications. However, the trackside has to 

--- Document Chunk 11207 ---
take into account that any ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment interfaced to the 

--- Document Chunk 11208 ---
concerned National System through an STM will apply all the applicable ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 11209 ---
rules to the balise group/RBC message that includes this data. 

--- Document Chunk 11210 ---
