--- Document Chunk 11221 ---
3.15.7 Tolerance of Big Metal Mass 

--- Document Chunk 11222 ---
3.15.7.1 Big metal object in the track, exceeding the limits for big metal masses as defined in 

--- Document Chunk 11223 ---
Subset-036, section 6.5.2 “Metal Masses in the Track” may trigger an alarm (called 

--- Document Chunk 11224 ---
“Integrity check alarm of balise transmission”, and referred in the following as “BTM 

--- Document Chunk 11225 ---
alarm” in short) reporting a malfunction for the onboard balise transmission function. 

--- Document Chunk 11226 ---
3.15.7.2 In Levels 0/NTC, the alarms which may be triggered by meta l masses shall be ignored 

--- Document Chunk 11227 ---
for a defined distance (see A .3.1). If the alarm persists for a longer distance the 

--- Document Chunk 11228 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall trigger a safety reaction. 

--- Document Chunk 11229 ---
3.15.7.3 Justification: Ignoring the alarm for a defined distance eliminates the need to equip all 

--- Document Chunk 11230 ---
excessive big metal masses with track condition “Big Metal Mass” outside ETCS fitted 

--- Document Chunk 11231 ---
areas. 

--- Document Chunk 11232 ---
3.15.7.4 In Levels 1/2, the BTM alarms which may be triggered by metal masses shall be ignored 

--- Document Chunk 11233 ---
in any of the following cases: 

--- Document Chunk 11234 ---
a) if the “BTM alarm reaction inhibition” is active (see procedure in 5.22), or 

--- Document Chunk 11235 ---
b) if mode is Stand-By. 

--- Document Chunk 11236 ---
3.15.7.5 In all Levels, the BTM alarms which may be triggered by metal masses shall be ignored 

--- Document Chunk 11237 ---
if the track condition “Big Metal Mass” is applicable for the given location (see 3.12.1.3, 

--- Document Chunk 11238 ---
9th bullet). 

--- Document Chunk 11239 ---
3.15.7.6 If the BTM alarm is triggered and not ignored according to 3.15.7.4 or 3.15.7.5, the 

--- Document Chunk 11240 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall trigger a safety reaction. 

--- Document Chunk 11241 ---
3.15.7.6.1 Note: the on -board reaction is left to specific implementation because it contributes to 

--- Document Chunk 11242 ---
the attainment of the global on -board THR, whose apportionment is on -board-

--- Document Chunk 11243 ---
implementation specific. 

--- Document Chunk 11244 ---
3.15.8 Cold Movement Detection 

--- Document Chunk 11245 ---
3.15.8.1 After being switched off (i.e. once in No Power mode), the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 11246 ---
equipment shall be capable, if fitted with, to detect and record whether th e engine has 

--- Document Chunk 11247 ---
been moved or not, during a period of at least 72 hours. 

--- Document Chunk 11248 ---
3.15.8.1.1 To allow small movements e.g. for coupling in No Power mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 11249 ---
board equipment shall consider that no cold movement has occurred as long as the train 

--- Document Chunk 11250 ---
does not move for mo re than 2m away from the train position stored when No Power 

--- Document Chunk 11251 ---
mode was entered. 

--- Document Chunk 11252 ---
3.15.8.2 When powered on again, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall use, if available, 

--- Document Chunk 11253 ---
the memorised information about cold movement in order to update the status of 

--- Document Chunk 11254 ---
information stored by on-board equipment (see chapter 4 section 4.11 for details). 

--- Document Chunk 11255 ---
3.15.8.3 Note: information memorised by Cold Movement Detection function is considered as not 

--- Document Chunk 11256 ---
available if: 

--- Document Chunk 11257 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 11258 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11259 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11260 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 11261 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 11262 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 11263 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 11264 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 11265 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 11266 ---
Page 192/252 

--- Document Chunk 11267 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11268 ---
a) no Cold Movement Detection function is implemented in the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 11269 ---
equipment, OR 

--- Document Chunk 11270 ---
b) the Cold Movement Detection function has encountered a condition, during the No 

--- Document Chunk 11271 ---
Power period, which prevents the use of the Cold Movement information (e.g. the 

--- Document Chunk 11272 ---
battery ensuring the Cold Movement Detection function has run down during the No 

--- Document Chunk 11273 ---
Power period). 

--- Document Chunk 11274 ---
3.15.9 Virtual Balise Cover 

--- Document Chunk 11275 ---
3.15.9.1 It shall be possible to set and remove from balise a Virtual Balise Cover (VBC). A VBC 

--- Document Chunk 11276 ---
is defined by: 

--- Document Chunk 11277 ---
a) A marker corresponding to balises to be ignored by the on -board together with the 

--- Document Chunk 11278 ---
area (country or region) in which the VBC is appl icable. The VBC marker and the 

--- Document Chunk 11279 ---
country/region identity form the unique VBC identity. 

--- Document Chunk 11280 ---
b) Its validity period. 

--- Document Chunk 11281 ---
3.15.9.2 During a start of mission, the driver shall have the opportunity to set a new VBC, or to 

--- Document Chunk 11282 ---
remove an existing one. 

--- Document Chunk 11283 ---
3.15.9.3 As long as a VBC is stored on-board: 

--- Document Chunk 11284 ---
a) While applying any other clause (with the exception of the ones of section 3.20 

--- Document Chunk 11285 ---
"Juridical data") than this one, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall consider 

--- Document Chunk 11286 ---
any balise telegram that includes a VBC marker and a country/region identity that both 

--- Document Chunk 11287 ---
match the VBC identity as not received (i.e. as if the balise was physically covered). 

--- Document Chunk 11288 ---
b) As a consequence, n o reaction will be applied if errors in the reading of the rest of 

--- Document Chunk 11289 ---
such balise telegram occur. 

--- Document Chunk 11290 ---
3.15.9.3.1 Since it relies on the system version number of the telegram itself (see chapter 6 for 

--- Document Chunk 11291 ---
details), the check stipulated in 3.15.9.3 a) shall prevail on any system version number 

--- Document Chunk 11292 ---
related check specified in the section 3.17, with the exception of 3.17.3.5 a). 

--- Document Chunk 11293 ---
3.15.9.4 If the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment receives from balise or from driver a new VBC 

--- Document Chunk 11294 ---
with the same VBC identity as an already stored VBC, the new VBC shall replace the 

--- Document Chunk 11295 ---
previous one, including its validity period. 

--- Document Chunk 11296 ---
3.15.9.5 A VBC shall be retained on -board when the on -board equipment is switched off (i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 11297 ---
enters No Power mode) and shall remain applicable when powered on again. It shall be 

--- Document Chunk 11298 ---
deleted when: 

--- Document Chunk 11299 ---
a) it is ordered by trackside, or 

--- Document Chunk 11300 ---
b) its validity period has elapsed, or 

--- Document Chunk 11301 ---
c) it is removed by the driver (during Start of Mission), or 

--- Document Chunk 11302 ---
d) a mismatch is detected between the country/region identity read from a balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11303 ---
and the country/region identity of the VBC. Not e: this means that the reception of a 

--- Document Chunk 11304 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 11305 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11306 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11307 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 11308 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 11309 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 11310 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 11311 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 11312 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 11313 ---
Page 193/252 

--- Document Chunk 11314 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11315 ---
consistent balise group message is a necessary condition for deleting a VBC due to 

--- Document Chunk 11316 ---
mismatching country/region identities. 

--- Document Chunk 11317 ---
3.15.9.6 The validity period shall start at the time the balise group message is received or shall 

--- Document Chunk 11318 ---
start at the time the VBC is entered by the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 11319 ---
3.15.10 Advance display of route related information 

--- Document Chunk 11320 ---
3.15.10.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display an overview of the gradient profile 

--- Document Chunk 11321 ---
(as received from trackside), of the MRSP, of the track conditions  (except the tunnel 

--- Document Chunk 11322 ---
stopping areas, big metal masses, changes of allowed current consumption and station 

--- Document Chunk 11323 ---
platforms), of the first Indication location, if any (only in Ceiling Speed monitoring ), and 

--- Document Chunk 11324 ---
of the EOA/LOA, with the remaining distances referred to the train front end position. 

--- Document Chunk 11325 ---
3.15.10.2 With regards to the MRSP, the track conditions and the EOA/LOA, the remaining 

--- Document Chunk 11326 ---
distances shall be computed taking into account the min safe, the estimated or the max 

--- Document Chunk 11327 ---
safe train front end position depending on their respective supervision. 

--- Document Chunk 11328 ---
3.15.10.3 With regards to the gradient profile, the remaining distances shall be computed taking 

--- Document Chunk 11329 ---
into account the estimated train front end position. 

--- Document Chunk 11330 ---
3.15.10.3.1 With regards to the first Indication location, the remaining distance shall be computed as 

--- Document Chunk 11331 ---
specified in clauses 3.13.10.3.8 and 3.13.10.3.8.1. 

--- Document Chunk 11332 ---
3.15.10.4 The overview of route related information shall be restricted to the elements contained 

--- Document Chunk 11333 ---
within the movement authority and up to the first target at zero speed, if any. 

--- Document Chunk 11334 ---
3.15.10.5 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment applies at least one of the clauses 

--- Document Chunk 11335 ---
3.12.2.4, 3.12.4.7 and 3.12.5.8, the term EOA in this section 3.15.10 shall refer to the 

--- Document Chunk 11336 ---
closest location amongst the temporary EOA(s) and the EOA. 

--- Document Chunk 11337 ---
3.15.11 Driving with Automatic Train Operation 

--- Document Chunk 11338 ---
3.15.11.1 In case it is interfaced to an ERTMS/ATO on -board, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 11339 ---
equipment supports automatic driving on lines fitted with an ERTMS/ATO trackside 

--- Document Chunk 11340 ---
subsystem. 

--- Document Chunk 11341 ---
3.15.11.2 The driver shall have the possibility, through an ATO selector, to enable/disable the 

--- Document Chunk 11342 ---
automatic driving and the display of the information related to the ERTMS/ATO 

--- Document Chunk 11343 ---
subsystem, with the exception of the ATO data entry/view. The ATO selector position 

--- Document Chunk 11344 ---
("On" or "Stand-by") applicable when the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is switched 

--- Document Chunk 11345 ---
off (i.e. enters No Power mode) shall be retained and shall remain applicable when 

--- Document Chunk 11346 ---
powered on. 

--- Document Chunk 11347 ---
3.15.11.3 For detailed requirements in case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is interfaced 

--- Document Chunk 11348 ---
to an ERTMS/ATO on-board, refer to chapter 4 and SUBSET-125. 

--- Document Chunk 11349 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 11350 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11351 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11352 ---

--- Document Chunk 11360 ---
3.16 Data Consistency 

--- Document Chunk 11361 ---
3.16.1 General 

--- Document Chunk 11362 ---
3.16.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall consider a message received from the 

--- Document Chunk 11363 ---
trackside as inconsistent if it is not compliant with the ETCS specifications. 

--- Document Chunk 11364 ---
3.16.1.1.1 As a minimum, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall consider the use of a spare 

--- Document Chunk 11365 ---
value of a variable as not compliant with the ETCS specifications . Having in mind that 

--- Document Chunk 11366 ---
the trackside messages are presumed to be compliant with the ETCS specifications, it 

--- Document Chunk 11367 ---
is however not in th e scope of this specification to list the other checks that the 

--- Document Chunk 11368 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment might consider to determine that a message is not 

--- Document Chunk 11369 ---
compliant with them. 

--- Document Chunk 11370 ---
3.16.1.2 For the other inconsistency criteria, reactions and other functionality related to the 

--- Document Chunk 11371 ---
consistency of the information from balises, see 3.16.2. 

--- Document Chunk 11372 ---
3.16.1.3 For the other inconsistency criteria, reactions and other functionality related to the 

--- Document Chunk 11373 ---
consistency of the information from radio, see 3.16.3. 

--- Document Chunk 11374 ---
3.16.1.4 Unless stated otherwise, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall reject a message 

--- Document Chunk 11375 ---
that fulfils any inconsistency criteria. 

--- Document Chunk 11376 ---
3.16.2 Balises 

--- Document Chunk 11377 ---
3.16.2.1 Definitions 

--- Document Chunk 11378 ---
3.16.2.1.1 The information that is sent from a balise is called a balise telegram. 

--- Document Chunk 11379 ---
3.16.2.1.2 The whole set of information (balise telegram or telegrams) coming from a balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11380 ---
is called a balise group message.  

--- Document Chunk 11381 ---
3.16.2.1.2.1 Note: In case of a balise group containing a single balise, telegram and message 

--- Document Chunk 11382 ---
coincide. 

--- Document Chunk 11383 ---
3.16.2.1.3 Intentionally deleted.  

--- Document Chunk 11384 ---
3.16.2.2 General 

--- Document Chunk 11385 ---
3.16.2.2.1 If the on-board is not able to recognise whether a balise group is linked or unlinked (if 

--- Document Chunk 11386 ---
none of the balises  in the balise group can be read correctly), it shall consider it as 

--- Document Chunk 11387 ---
unlinked. 

--- Document Chunk 11388 ---
3.16.2.2.2 A balise within a balise group shall be regarded as missed if 

--- Document Chunk 11389 ---
a) No balise is detected (see SUBSET -036 sections 4.2.4.1 and 4.2.4.2)  within the 

--- Document Chunk 11390 ---
maximum distance between balises from the previous balise in the group, or 

--- Document Chunk 11391 ---
b) A following balise within the group is received, or 

--- Document Chunk 11392 ---
c) A balise from another group is received 

--- Document Chunk 11393 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 11394 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11395 ---

--- Document Chunk 11403 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11404 ---
3.16.2.3 Linking Consistency 

--- Document Chunk 11405 ---
3.16.2.3.1 If linking consistency is checked the on-board shall react according to the linking reaction 

--- Document Chunk 11406 ---
information in the following cases: 

--- Document Chunk 11407 ---
a) If the location reference of the expected balise group is detected (see SUBSET-036 

--- Document Chunk 11408 ---
sections 4.2.4.1 and 4.2.4.2) in rear of the expectation window 

--- Document Chunk 11409 ---
b) If the location reference of the expected balise group is not detected (see SUBSET-

--- Document Chunk 11410 ---
036 sections 4.2.4.1 and 4.2.4.2) inside the expectation window 

--- Document Chunk 11411 ---
c) If inside the expectation window of the expected balise group a balise from another 

--- Document Chunk 11412 ---
announced balise group, expected later, is received. 

--- Document Chunk 11413 ---
3.16.2.3.1.1 For a balise group location reference not detected at all, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 11414 ---
equipment shall consider the criterion 3.16.2.3.1 b) as fulfilled  only once the min safe 

--- Document Chunk 11415 ---
antenna position has passed the last possible location of the balise group plus 1.3m, for 

--- Document Chunk 11416 ---
a time equal to: 

--- Document Chunk 11417 ---
a) 100 ms for balise groups to be passed in nominal direction 

--- Document Chunk 11418 ---
b) Tn (see SUBSET -036 clause 4.2.9) for balise groups to be passed in reverse 

--- Document Chunk 11419 ---
direction. 

--- Document Chunk 11420 ---
3.16.2.3.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11421 ---
3.16.2.3.2.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11422 ---
3.16.2.3.3 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11423 ---
3.16.2.3.4 If the balise duplicating the location reference balise is used as location reference for the 

--- Document Chunk 11424 ---
group, and is detected (see SUBSET -036 sections 4.2.4.1 and 4.2.4.2)  within the 

--- Document Chunk 11425 ---
expectation window, no linking reaction shall be applied. 

--- Document Chunk 11426 ---
3.16.2.4 Balise Group Message Consistency 

--- Document Chunk 11427 ---
3.16.2.4.1 The on-board shall react according to the linking reaction when  the message from a 

--- Document Chunk 11428 ---
balise group announced by linking, whose location reference was detected (see 

--- Document Chunk 11429 ---
SUBSET-036 sections 4.2.4.1 and 4.2.4.2)  inside its expectation window or whose 

--- Document Chunk 11430 ---
expectation window is currently supervised , fulfils the general inconsistency criterion 

--- Document Chunk 11431 ---
3.16.1.1 or any of the following inconsistency criteria: 

--- Document Chunk 11432 ---
a) A balise is missed inside the group. 

--- Document Chunk 11433 ---
b) A balise is detected but no telegram is decoded (e.g. wrong CRC,...). 

--- Document Chunk 11434 ---
c) Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11435 ---
d) Message counters do not match (see 3.16.2.4.7) 

--- Document Chunk 11436 ---
3.16.2.4.2 Exception: Even if it considers the message as inconsistent due to either a) or b) above 

--- Document Chunk 11437 ---
but the balise missed, or not decoded, is duplicated within the balise group and the 

--- Document Chunk 11438 ---
duplicating one is correctly read, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall not reject 

--- Document Chunk 11439 ---
the message and shall not apply the linking reaction. 

--- Document Chunk 11440 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 11441 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11442 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11443 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 11444 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 11445 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 11446 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 11447 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 11448 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 11449 ---
Page 196/252 

--- Document Chunk 11450 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11451 ---
3.16.2.4.3 If linking consistency is checked, the expected balise group is referred in the linking 

--- Document Chunk 11452 ---
information with a balise group with ID not set to  “unknown”, and the on-board rejects 

--- Document Chunk 11453 ---
the message from a balise group marked as linked as per 3.4.4.4.2, no reaction shall be 

--- Document Chunk 11454 ---
applied, even if errors in the reading of the balise group occur. 

--- Document Chunk 11455 ---
3.16.2.4.3.1 If linking consistency is checked, the expected balise group is referred in the linking 

--- Document Chunk 11456 ---
information with a balise group with ID “unknown”, and the on-board rejects the message 

--- Document Chunk 11457 ---
from a balise group marked as linked because one of the conditions of 3.4.4.4.2.1 is not 

--- Document Chunk 11458 ---
fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 11459 ---
a) in case the condition 3.4.4.4.2.1 a) is fulf illed but the condition 3.4.4.4.2.1 c) is not 

--- Document Chunk 11460 ---
fulfilled, no reaction shall be applied, even if errors in the reading of the balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11461 ---
occur. Rationale: the balise group can for sure not be the expected one (i.e. the one 

--- Document Chunk 11462 ---
which contains repositioning information valid for the train orientation); 

--- Document Chunk 11463 ---
b) in all other cases and if an error in the reading of the balise group occurs, the linking 

--- Document Chunk 11464 ---
reaction shall be applied. Rationale: it cannot be excluded that the balise group is the 

--- Document Chunk 11465 ---
expected one (i.e. the one which contains repositioning information valid for the train 

--- Document Chunk 11466 ---
orientation) because e.g. one of the missed or not decoded balise(s) does contain the 

--- Document Chunk 11467 ---
repositioning information valid for the train orientation or e.g. although a balise 

--- Document Chunk 11468 ---
containing repositioning informat ion has been correctly received the balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11469 ---
orientation cannot be determined from the balise group itself. 

--- Document Chunk 11470 ---
3.16.2.4.4 If linking consistency is not checked, the on -board shall command application of the 

--- Document Chunk 11471 ---
service brake when the message from a balise group marked as linked fulfils the general 

--- Document Chunk 11472 ---
inconsistency criterion 3.16.1.1 or any of the following inconsistency criteria: 

--- Document Chunk 11473 ---
a) A balise is missed inside the group. 

--- Document Chunk 11474 ---
b) A balise is detected, but no telegram is decoded (e.g. wrong CRC). 

--- Document Chunk 11475 ---
c) Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11476 ---
d) Message counters do not match (see 3.16.2.4.7) 

--- Document Chunk 11477 ---
3.16.2.4.4.1 Exceptions: Even if it considers the message as inconsistent due to either a) or b) of 

--- Document Chunk 11478 ---
clause 3.16.2.4.4, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment:  

--- Document Chunk 11479 ---
a) shall not reject the message and shall not command application of the service brake 

--- Document Chunk 11480 ---
if the balise missed, or not decoded, is duplicated within the balise group, the 

--- Document Chunk 11481 ---
duplicating one is correctly read and contains: 

--- Document Chunk 11482 ---
• directional information while the orientation of the balise group can still be 

--- Document Chunk 11483 ---
evaluated, or 

--- Document Chunk 11484 ---
• only information valid for both directions, or 

--- Document Chunk 11485 ---
• neither directional information nor information valid for both directions, or 

--- Document Chunk 11486 ---
• only data to be used by applications outside ERTMS/ETCS, or 

--- Document Chunk 11487 ---
• only data to be used by applications outside ERTMS/ETCS together with other 

--- Document Chunk 11488 ---
information valid for both directions. 

--- Document Chunk 11489 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 11490 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11491 ---

--- Document Chunk 11499 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11500 ---
b) shall not command application of the service brake if the telegram correctly read from 

--- Document Chunk 11501 ---
another balise of the group contains the information “Inhibition of balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11502 ---
message consistency reaction”. 

--- Document Chunk 11503 ---
3.16.2.4.4.2 Concerning clause 3.16.2.4.4, if the service brake is applied, the location based 

--- Document Chunk 11504 ---
information stored on-board shall be shortened to the current position when the train has 

--- Document Chunk 11505 ---
reached standstill. Refer to appendix A.3.4 for the exhaustive list of information,  which 

--- Document Chunk 11506 ---
shall be shortened. 

--- Document Chunk 11507 ---
3.16.2.4.4.3 Concerning clause 3.16.2.4.4, if the service brake is applied, the driver shall be 

--- Document Chunk 11508 ---
informed that this is due to a balise group message consistency problem. 

--- Document Chunk 11509 ---
3.16.2.4.4.4 Exception: Concerning clause 3.16.2.4.4, if the balise group was the last announced 

--- Document Chunk 11510 ---
one by linking and the linking consistency is no longer checked as per 3.4.4.4.6 a), the 

--- Document Chunk 11511 ---
on-board shall apply the clause 3.16.2.4.1 instead. 

--- Document Chunk 11512 ---
3.16.2.4.5 A message counter shall be attached to each balise telegram indicating which balise 

--- Document Chunk 11513 ---
group message the telegram fits to. 

--- Document Chunk 11514 ---
3.16.2.4.6 Instead of a message counter corresponding to a given balise group message, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 11515 ---
be possible to identify a telegram as always fitting all possible messages of the group. 

--- Document Chunk 11516 ---
3.16.2.4.6.1 It shall also be possible to identify a telegram as never fitting any message of the 

--- Document Chunk 11517 ---
group. 

--- Document Chunk 11518 ---
3.16.2.4.7 Comparing message counters of the received telegrams of a balise group message, 

--- Document Chunk 11519 ---
excluding the ones complying with 3.16.2.4.6 and the ones that are not used by the on-

--- Document Chunk 11520 ---
board to compose the message (see 3.16.2.4.8.2), if their values are not all identical, or 

--- Document Chunk 11521 ---
at least one of  them complies with 3.16.2.4.6.1, th e message shall be considered as 

--- Document Chunk 11522 ---
inconsistent. 

--- Document Chunk 11523 ---
3.16.2.4.7.1 In case of single balise group, if the message counter of the received telegram 

--- Document Chunk 11524 ---
complies with 3.16.2.4.6.1, the message shall also be considered as inconsistent. 

--- Document Chunk 11525 ---
3.16.2.4.8 It shall be possible to indicate failures in the system underlying the balise/loop/RIU (e.g. 

--- Document Chunk 11526 ---
the Lineside Electronic Unit, LEU) by sending a balise telegram, a loop message or a 

--- Document Chunk 11527 ---
RIU message including the information "default balise/loop/RIU information". 

--- Document Chunk 11528 ---
3.16.2.4.8.1 If one (and only one) out of a pair of duplicated balise telegrams received by the on -

--- Document Chunk 11529 ---
board includes the information “default balise information”, the on-board shall ignore any 

--- Document Chunk 11530 ---
other information included i n this telegram and shall consider information from the 

--- Document Chunk 11531 ---
telegram not containing “default balise information". 

--- Document Chunk 11532 ---
3.16.2.4.8.2 When duplicated balises are both received and decoded correctly, and both, or none 

--- Document Chunk 11533 ---
of them, contain "default balise information", the ERTMS/ETCS o n-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 11534 ---
shall compose the message using only the information from the last received balise 

--- Document Chunk 11535 ---
telegram out of the pair. 

--- Document Chunk 11536 ---

3.16.2.5 Unlinked Balise Group Message Consistency 

--- Document Chunk 11553 ---
3.16.2.5.1 The on-board equipment shall command application of the service brake when  the 

--- Document Chunk 11554 ---
message received from a balise group marked as unlinked fulfils the general 

--- Document Chunk 11555 ---
inconsistency criterion 3.16.1.1 or any of the following inconsistency criteria: 

--- Document Chunk 11556 ---
a) A balise is missed inside the unlinked balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 11557 ---
b) A balise is detected, but no telegram is decoded (e.g. wrong CRC). 

--- Document Chunk 11558 ---
c) Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11559 ---
d) Message counters do not match (see 3.16.2.4.7) 

--- Document Chunk 11560 ---
3.16.2.5.1.1 Exceptions: Even if it considers the message as inconsistent due to either a) or b) of 

--- Document Chunk 11561 ---
clause 3.16.2.5.1, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment: 

--- Document Chunk 11562 ---
a)  shall not reject the message and shall not command application of the service brake 

--- Document Chunk 11563 ---
if the balise missed, or not decoded, is duplicated within the balise group, t he 

--- Document Chunk 11564 ---
duplicating one is correctly read and contains: 

--- Document Chunk 11565 ---
• directional information while the orientation of the balise group can still be 

--- Document Chunk 11566 ---
evaluated, or 

--- Document Chunk 11567 ---
• only information valid for both directions, or 

--- Document Chunk 11568 ---
• neither directional information nor information valid for both directions, or 

--- Document Chunk 11569 ---
• only data to be used by applications outside ERTMS/ETCS, or 

--- Document Chunk 11570 ---
• only data to be used by applications outside ERTMS/ETCS  together with other 

--- Document Chunk 11571 ---
information valid for both directions. 

--- Document Chunk 11572 ---
b) shall not command application of the service brake if the telegram correctly read from 

--- Document Chunk 11573 ---
another balise of the group contains the information “Inhibition of balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11574 ---
message consistency reaction”. 

--- Document Chunk 11575 ---
3.16.2.5.2 Concerning clause 3.16.2.5.1, if the service brake is applied, the location based 

--- Document Chunk 11576 ---
information stored on-board shall be shortened to the current position when the train has 

--- Document Chunk 11577 ---
reached standstill. Refer to appendix A.3.4 for the exhaustive list of information, which 

--- Document Chunk 11578 ---
shall be shortened.  

--- Document Chunk 11579 ---
3.16.2.5.3 Concerning clause 3.16.2.5.1, if the service brake is applied, the driver shall be informed 

--- Document Chunk 11580 ---
that this is due to a balise group message consistency problem.

3.16.2.6 Linking Reactions 

--- Document Chunk 11593 ---
3.16.2.6.1 When the linking reaction leads to train trip or a service brake application, the driver shall 

--- Document Chunk 11594 ---
be informed that the intervention is due to data consistency problem with the expecte d 

--- Document Chunk 11595 ---
balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 11596 ---
3.16.2.6.2 If the service brake is initiated due to the linking reaction, the location based information 

--- Document Chunk 11597 ---
stored on-board shall be shortened to the current position when the train has reached 

--- Document Chunk 11598 ---
standstill. Refer to appendix A.3.4 for the exhaustive list of information, which shall be 

--- Document Chunk 11599 ---
shortened. 

--- Document Chunk 11600 ---
3.16.2.7 RAMS related supervision functions 

--- Document Chunk 11601 ---
3.16.2.7.1 Mitigation of balise detection degradation 

--- Document Chunk 11602 ---
3.16.2.7.1.1 If no balise is detected between the start of the expectation window of a balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11603 ---
announced by linking and the end of the expectation window of the next balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11604 ---
announced by linking, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall command the service brake and 

--- Document Chunk 11605 ---
the driver shall be informed. At standstill, the location based information stored on-board 

--- Document Chunk 11606 ---
shall be shortened to the current position. Refer to appendix A.3.4 for the exhaustive list 

--- Document Chunk 11607 ---
of information, which shall be shortened. 

--- Document Chunk 11608 ---
3.16.2.7.2 Mitigation of balise cross-talk while expecting repositioning information 

--- Document Chunk 11609 ---
3.16.2.7.2.1 If repositioning is announced and the expected  repositioning balise group has been 

--- Document Chunk 11610 ---
received, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall keep looking for a balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11611 ---
that satisfies the same criteria as this previously expected and already received 

--- Document Chunk 11612 ---
repositioning balise group, until one of the following events occurs: 

--- Document Chunk 11613 ---
a) the min safe antenna position leaves the expectation window of the repositioning 

--- Document Chunk 11614 ---
balise group that was announced and already received 

--- Document Chunk 11615 ---
b) a linked balise group that has been announced with known identity is received. 

--- Document Chunk 11616 ---
3.16.2.7.2.2 If a second balise group is received that satisfies the same criteria as the previously 

--- Document Chunk 11617 ---
expected and already received repositioning balise group, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 11618 ---
equipment shall command the service brake  and the driver shall be informed . At 

--- Document Chunk 11619 ---
standstill, the location based information stored on -board shall be shortened to the 

--- Document Chunk 11620 ---
current position. Refer to appendix A.3.4 for the exhaustive list of information, which shall 

--- Document Chunk 11621 ---
be shortened. 

--- Document Chunk 11622 ---
3.16.2.7.2.3 Note: this function is independent from linking consistency check function, i.e. the 

--- Document Chunk 11623 ---
rules related to linking always apply. This means that once a repositioning balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11624 ---
has been received and if this latter contains new linking information, the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 11625 ---
on-board equipment will start expecting the first balise group ann ounced in this new 

--- Document Chunk 11626 ---
linking information in parallel with the monitoring specified in 3.16.2.7.2.1. 

--- Document Chunk 11627 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 11628 ---

--- Document Chunk 11638 ---
3.16.3 Radio 

--- Document Chunk 11639 ---
3.16.3.1 General issues 

--- Document Chunk 11640 ---
3.16.3.1.1 In addition to the check of the general inconsistency criteria 3.16.1.1, a  radio message 

--- Document Chunk 11641 ---
is inconsistent when any of the applicable checks among the following is not completed 

--- Document Chunk 11642 ---
successfully: 

--- Document Chunk 11643 ---
a) Checks performed by Euroradio protocol (see Subset-037) 

--- Document Chunk 11644 ---
b) Time stamps check (see 3.16.3.3.3) 

--- Document Chunk 11645 ---
c) Message length check (see 8.4.4.2.1). 

--- Document Chunk 11646 ---
3.16.3.1.1.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11647 ---
3.16.3.1.1.2 The on-board shall inform the trackside if an inconsistent message is received. 

--- Document Chunk 11648 ---
3.16.3.1.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11649 ---
3.16.3.1.3 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11650 ---
3.16.3.1.3.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11651 ---
3.16.3.1.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11652 ---
3.16.3.2 Time stamping 

--- Document Chunk 11653 ---
3.16.3.2.1 The trackside shall always transmit its information with reference to the train time. 

--- Document Chunk 11654 ---
3.16.3.2.2 To time-stamp its messages, the trackside shall make a safe estimation of the on-board 

--- Document Chunk 11655 ---
time, based on the time -stamp of the received messages and the internal processing 

--- Document Chunk 11656 ---
times. The estimation shall be made in such a way that the on-board time estimated by 

--- Document Chunk 11657 ---
the trackside shall not be in advance of the real on-board time. 

--- Document Chunk 11658 ---
3.16.3.2.3 Wrap around of the onboard timer can occur during a communication session and shall 

--- Document Chunk 11659 ---
have no impact on system behaviour. 

--- Document Chunk 11660 ---
3.16.3.3 Supervision of Sequence 

--- Document Chunk 11661 ---
3.16.3.3.1 The trackside shall time -stamp a message with a value corresponding to the ti me of 

--- Document Chunk 11662 ---
sending. 

--- Document Chunk 11663 ---
3.16.3.3.2 There shall always be a time stamp increment between consecutive messages. 

--- Document Chunk 11664 ---
3.16.3.3.3 The on-board shall consider a message as inconsistent if its time stamp is lower than or 

--- Document Chunk 11665 ---
equal to the time stamp of the preceding message. 

--- Document Chunk 11666 ---
3.16.3.3.3.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11667 ---
3.16.3.3.3.2 Note: The supervision does not detect a lost message. This has to be assured by 

--- Document Chunk 11668 ---
means of the “acknowledge” function. 

--- Document Chunk 11669 ---
3.16.3.3.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11670 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 11671 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11672 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11673 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 11674 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 11675 ---
05/07/2023

System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 11677 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 11678 ---
Principles

--- Document Chunk 11680 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11681 ---
T_TRAIN1

--- Document Chunk 11682 ---
T_TRAIN1 + 1

--- Document Chunk 11683 ---
T_TRAIN2 + 2

--- Document Chunk 11684 ---

--- Document Chunk 11685 ---

--- Document Chunk 11686 ---

--- Document Chunk 11687 ---

--- Document Chunk 11688 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11689 ---
Figure 60: Supervision of sequence 

--- Document Chunk 11690 ---
3.16.3.4 Supervision of safe radio connection 

--- Document Chunk 11691 ---
3.16.3.4.1 When the difference between the time stamp of the latest received message and the 

--- Document Chunk 11692 ---
current on-board time is greater than the T_NVCONTACT parameter (national value), 

--- Document Chunk 11693 ---
the on-board shall apply the reaction required by trackside (see 3.16.3.4.2). 

--- Document Chunk 11694 ---
3.16.3.4.1.1 After the on-board equipment has switched to Level 2  with no communication session 

--- Document Chunk 11695 ---
established, the current onboard time shall be compared with the on -board time at the 

--- Document Chunk 11696 ---
moment of the level transition (instead of the time stamp of the latest received message) 

--- Document Chunk 11697 ---
until a new message has been received. 

--- Document Chunk 11698 ---
3.16.3.4.1.2 When an RBC/RBC handover has been announced, the current onboard time shall 

--- Document Chunk 11699 ---
be compared with the time stamp of the latest message from the Handing over RBC until 

--- Document Chunk 11700 ---
the train considers the Accepting RBC as the supervising one (refer to 3.15.1.3.5). From 

--- Document Chunk 11701 ---
then on the current onboard time shall be compared with the time stamp of the latest 

--- Document Chunk 11702 ---
received message from the Accepting RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 11703 ---
3.16.3.4.1.2.1 Exception: in case an RBC/RBC handover is announced when another RBC/RBC 

--- Document Chunk 11704 ---
handover is already on going and this announcement changes the Handing Over RBC 

--- Document Chunk 11705 ---
(refer to 3.15.1.3.2), then the current on -board time shall be compared with the time 

--- Document Chunk 11706 ---
stamp of the latest received message. 

--- Document Chunk 11707 ---
3.16.3.4.1.3 As long as the engine, taking into account its front and rear  ends, overlaps an 

--- Document Chunk 11708 ---
announced radio hole, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall stop the supervision 

--- Document Chunk 11709 ---
of the safe radio connection. Afterwards, until a new message has been received, the 

--- Document Chunk 11710 ---
current onboard time shall be compared with the on -board time when the engine 

--- Document Chunk 11711 ---
rear/front end left the radio hole, depending on whether the train orientation is the same 

--- Document Chunk 11712 ---
as/opposite to the active cab (instead of the time stamp of the latest received message). 

--- Document Chunk 11713 ---

3.16.3.4.2 It shall be possible to select one of the following reactions (National value) : 

--- Document Chunk 11747 ---
a) Train trip 

--- Document Chunk 11748 ---
b) Apply service brake 

--- Document Chunk 11749 ---
c) No reaction 

--- Document Chunk 11750 ---
3.16.3.4.3 For all reactions, if no new message has been received after an additional delay time (as 

--- Document Chunk 11751 ---
defined in A.3.1), the on-board shall release the safe radio connection and then set-up it 

--- Document Chunk 11752 ---
again (maintaining the communication session). 

--- Document Chunk 11753 ---
3.16.3.4.4 When the reaction leads to train trip or a service brake application, the driver shall be 

--- Document Chunk 11754 ---
informed that no radio message has been received in due time. 

--- Document Chunk 11755 ---
3.16.3.4.5 If the service brake is initiated, the following reaction shall be taken; 

--- Document Chunk 11756 ---
a) For brake command release conditions refer to section 3.14.1.7. 

--- Document Chunk 11757 ---

--- Document Chunk 11767 ---

--- Document Chunk 11769 ---

3.16.3.5 Message Acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 11775 ---
3.16.3.5.1 When a message including the request for acknowledgement is received and unless this 

--- Document Chunk 11776 ---
message is considered as inconsistent, the on-board shall send an acknowledgement to 

--- Document Chunk 11777 ---
the trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 11778 ---
3.16.3.5.1.1 Note: In order to ensure trackside that the on-board has correctly received transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 11779 ---
information, the trackside may ask the on-board to acknowledge. 

--- Document Chunk 11780 ---
3.16.3.5.2 Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 11781 ---
3.16.3.5.3 The acknowledgement message shall refer to the time stamp of the concerned message 

--- Document Chunk 11782 ---
sent by the trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 11783 ---

--- Document Chunk 11784 ---
3.16.4 Error reporting to RBC 

--- Document Chunk 11785 ---
3.16.4.1 In level 2, if a radio communication session is established, errors shall be reported as 

--- Document Chunk 11786 ---
soon as the availability of a safe radio connection permits. 

--- Document Chunk 11787 ---
3.16.4.2 This refers to balise group errors, odometer accuracy related errors and radio message 

--- Document Chunk 11788 ---
errors regardless if there is an error reaction. 

--- Document Chunk 11789 ---
3.16.4.3 If linking consistency is checked on-board, no error reporting shall be done for balise 

--- Document Chunk 11790 ---
groups marked as linked but not included in the linking information. 

--- Document Chunk 11791 ---
3.17 System Version Management  

--- Document Chunk 11792 ---
3.17.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 11793 ---
3.17.1.1 Definitions, high level principles and rules regarding the offline management of 

--- Document Chunk 11794 ---
ERTMS/ETCS system version during the ERTMS/ETCS system life time are given in 

--- Document Chunk 11795 ---
SUBSET-104. 

--- Document Chunk 11796 ---
3.17.1.2 The objective of th is section is to define requirements applicable to ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 11797 ---
board e quipment and to trackside constituents, when different versions  of the 

--- Document Chunk 11798 ---
ERTMS/ETCS system have been defined. 

--- Document Chunk 11799 ---
3.17.1.3 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11800 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 11810 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11811 ---
3.17.2 Determination of the operated system version 

--- Document Chunk 11812 ---
3.17.2.1 The on -board equipment shall be able to operate with (i.e. shall support) any of  the 

--- Document Chunk 11813 ---
ERTMS/ETCS system version numbers X included in its envelope of supported system 

--- Document Chunk 11814 ---
versions, as defined in chapter 6. 

--- Document Chunk 11815 ---
3.17.2.1.1 Within one of its supported system version numbers X, the on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 11816 ---
always operate the highest system version number Y defined in its envelope of supported 

--- Document Chunk 11817 ---
system versions , regardless of the system version number Y transmitted by the 

--- Document Chunk 11818 ---
trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 11819 ---
3.17.2.2 The on-board equipment shall operate with only one system version at a time, i.e. it shall 

--- Document Chunk 11820 ---
behave according to the whole set of requirements applicable to a system version (refer 

--- Document Chunk 11821 ---
to chapter 6 in case the operated system version is older than the last one introduced in 

--- Document Chunk 11822 ---
this release of the SRS). 

--- Document Chunk 11823 ---
3.17.2.3 The on -board equipment shall determine the operated system version  number X , in 

--- Document Chunk 11824 ---
relation to non-RBC trackside constituents, as the highest system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 11825 ---
transmitted in the telegrams forming a balise group message (i.e. the telegrams which 

--- Document Chunk 11826 ---
are not ignored as per a clause referred to in the column "Telegram" of the Table 17), or 

--- Document Chunk 11827 ---
as the system version number X transmitted by a loop whose message is not ignored as 

--- Document Chunk 11828 ---
per a clause referred to in the column "Message" of the Table 17 , or as the system 

--- Document Chunk 11829 ---
version number X transmitted by an RIU, if this system version number X is higher than 

--- Document Chunk 11830 ---
the currently operated one. 

--- Document Chunk 11831 ---
3.17.2.4 It shall be possible from balise group to order the on -board equipment to operate a 

--- Document Chunk 11832 ---
system version. 

--- Document Chunk 11833 ---
3.17.2.5 Once a balise group message has been received, if one of the telegrams forming the 

--- Document Chunk 11834 ---
message (i.e. a telegram which is not ignored as per a clause referred to in the column 

--- Document Chunk 11835 ---
"Telegram" of the Table 17) includes an  order to operate system version which would 

--- Document Chunk 11836 ---
not be ignored as per a clause referred to in the column "Individual information" of the 

--- Document Chunk 11837 ---
Table 17, the on-board equipment shall immediately operate the system version number 

--- Document Chunk 11838 ---
X given in the order, regardless of the clauses 3.17.2.3 and 3.17.2.6 . After the order is 

--- Document Chunk 11839 ---
executed, the clauses 3.17.2.3 and 3.17.2.6 shall again apply for any further received 

--- Document Chunk 11840 ---
balise group/loop message or any further contacted RIU. 

--- Document Chunk 11841 ---
3.17.2.5.1 Note: the system version order is to be used wherever it is necessary to enforce an 

--- Document Chunk 11842 ---
operated system version number X lower than the currently operated one. 

--- Document Chunk 11843 ---
3.17.2.6 If a mismatch has been detected between the country or region identifier read  from a 

--- Document Chunk 11844 ---
balise group/loop and the corresponding identifier(s) of the applicable set of national 

--- Document Chunk 11845 ---
values, the on -board equipment shall consider the highest system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 11846 ---
transmitted in the telegrams forming the balise group message (i.e. telegrams which are 

--- Document Chunk 11847 ---
not ignored as per a clause referred to in the column "Telegram" of the Table 17) or the 

--- Document Chunk 11848 ---
system version number X transmitted by the loop whose message is not ignored as per 

--- Document Chunk 11849 ---
a clause referred to in the column "Message" of the Table 17 , as the operated one and 

--- Document Chunk 11850 ---
shall comply again with requirement 3.17.2.3. For balise groups, the on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 11851 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 11852 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11853 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11854 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 11855 ---
4.0.0

05/07/2023

System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 11858 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 11859 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 11860 ---
Page 205/252 

--- Document Chunk 11861 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 11862 ---
shall take into account, if any, the country or region identifier(s) of a set of national values 

--- Document Chunk 11863 ---
applicable immediately, which is included in a telegram forming the balise group 

--- Document Chunk 11864 ---
message and which would not be ignored as per a clause referred to in the column 

--- Document Chunk 11865 ---
"Individual information" of the Table 17. 

--- Document Chunk 11866 ---
3.17.2.7 If the on-board equipment does not support the system version number X transmitted by 

--- Document Chunk 11867 ---
a non-RBC trackside constituent or the one specified in the balise group order, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 11868 ---
consider the operated system version as unchanged. 

--- Document Chunk 11869 ---
3.17.2.8 In case of communication session established with an RBC, the system version number 

--- Document Chunk 11870 ---
X of the RBC shall take precedence on the operated system version in relation to non -

--- Document Chunk 11871 ---
RBC constituents and on system version ordered from balise group; the operated system 

--- Document Chunk 11872 ---
version number X shall be determined according to the following principles: 

--- Document Chunk 11873 ---
a) if the on-board equipment is in level 0, NTC or 1 (e.g. entrance in level 2 area), the 

--- Document Chunk 11874 ---
RBC system version number X shall be operated when the transition to level 2 is 

--- Document Chunk 11875 ---
executed; 

--- Document Chunk 11876 ---
b) if the on -board equipment is in level 2 (SoM procedure or order received from 

--- Document Chunk 11877 ---
trackside), the RBC system version number X shall be operated immediately; 

--- Document Chunk 11878 ---
c) in case of session established with an accepting RBC (RBC/RBC Handover), the 

--- Document Chunk 11879 ---
accepting RBC system version number X shall be operated as soon as the train has 

--- Document Chunk 11880 ---
passed the RBC/RBC border location with its maximum safe front end; 

--- Document Chunk 11881 ---
d) in case the on-board equipment switches from level 2 to another level (e.g. exit from 

--- Document Chunk 11882 ---
a level 2 area), the system version control in relation to non -RBC constituents shall 

--- Document Chunk 11883 ---
be again applied and the balise group orders shall be again considered; 

--- Document Chunk 11884 ---
e) in case the engine passes the RBC/RBC border location with its maximum safe front 

--- Document Chunk 11885 ---
end and no session is established with the accepting RBC, the system version control 

--- Document Chunk 11886 ---
in relation to non-RBC constituents shall be again applied and the balise group orders 

--- Document Chunk 11887 ---
shall be again considered. 

--- Document Chunk 11888 ---
3.17.2.8.1 For item a): if the switch from level 0, NTC or 1 to level 2 results from an immediate level 

--- Document Chunk 11889 ---
transition order or a conditional level transition order received from balise group and if 

--- Document Chunk 11890 ---
the RBC system version number X is different from the system versi on number X 

--- Document Chunk 11891 ---
operated before the level transition, the checks of the raw balise group message and the 

--- Document Chunk 11892 ---
evaluation of its whole content shall be performed taking into account the RBC system 

--- Document Chunk 11893 ---
version and shall substitute the checks and evaluation performed befo rehand with 

--- Document Chunk 11894 ---
regards to the previously operated system version. 

--- Document Chunk 11895 ---
3.17.2.8.2 For item d): if the switch from level 2 to another level results from an immediate level 

--- Document Chunk 11896 ---
transition order or a conditional level transition order received from balise group, the 

--- Document Chunk 11897 ---
clauses 3.17.2. 3, 3.17.2.5 and 3.17.2.6 shall be immediately checked to determine 

--- Document Chunk 11898 ---
whether a change of operated system version occurs. If so, the checks of the raw balise 

--- Document Chunk 11899 ---
group message and the evaluation of its whole content shall be performed taking into 

--- Document Chunk 11900 ---
account the new operated system version and shall substitute the checks and evaluation 

--- Document Chunk 11901 ---
performed beforehand with regards to the previously operated system version. 

--- Document Chunk 11902 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

3.17.2.9 The system version currently operated when the on-board equipment is switched off (i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 11914 ---
enters No Power mode) shall be retained and re-used when powered on. 

--- Document Chunk 11915 ---
3.17.2.9.1 If the on-board equipment loses the information (failure situation), the highest supported 

--- Document Chunk 11916 ---
system version shall be used. 

--- Document Chunk 11917 ---
3.17.3 Handling of trackside data in relation to system version 

--- Document Chunk 11918 ---
3.17.3.1 Every telegram transmitted by a balise, and every message transmitted by Euroloop and 

--- Document Chunk 11919 ---
Radio Infill Unit shall contain only the data related to one system version. It is not allowed 

--- Document Chunk 11920 ---
for the balise, Euroloop and Radio Infill Unit to transmit data correspondent to several 

--- Document Chunk 11921 ---
system versions. 

--- Document Chunk 11922 ---
3.17.3.2 All messages transmitted by an RBC shall contain data only related to one major system 

--- Document Chunk 11923 ---
version X and, within one communication session, they shall contain only data for one 

--- Document Chunk 11924 ---
minor system version Y. 

--- Document Chunk 11925 ---
3.17.3.3 Except for the balises whose telegram is ignored as per clause 3.14.3.6 or 3.15.9.3 a), 

--- Document Chunk 11926 ---
the on-board equipment shall check the system version transmitted by the balises/loops 

--- Document Chunk 11927 ---
and then shall determine the operated system version prior to any further checks (data 

--- Document Chunk 11928 ---
consistency, ...) and evaluation of the oth er data included in a balise group/loop 

--- Document Chunk 11929 ---
message, as they may depend on the system version. 

--- Document Chunk 11930 ---
3.17.3.4 If any of the further checks that are referred to in the column "Message" of the Table 17 

--- Document Chunk 11931 ---
leads to the rejection of the whole balise group/loop message, any change o f operated 

--- Document Chunk 11932 ---
system version due to the application of clause 3.17.2.3, 3.17.2.5 or 3.17.2.6 shall be 

--- Document Chunk 11933 ---
revoked by the on -board equipment, i.e. the operated system version prior to the 

--- Document Chunk 11934 ---
reception of the balise group/loop message remains unchanged. 

--- Document Chunk 11935 ---
3.17.3.4.1 Note: the clau ses 3.17.3.3 and 3.17.3.4 imply that on reception of a balise group/loop 

--- Document Chunk 11936 ---
message the on -board equipment checks first the information which may impact the 

--- Document Chunk 11937 ---
determination of the operated system version as per clauses 3.17.2.3, 3.17.2.5 or 

--- Document Chunk 11938 ---
3.17.2.6 (i.e. the s ystem version transmitted by the balises/loop/RIU, the country or 

--- Document Chunk 11939 ---
region identifiers of a set of National Values applicable immediately and a system version 

--- Document Chunk 11940 ---
order). Then, upon a change of operated system version, the other information included 

--- Document Chunk 11941 ---
in the messa ge received from the balise group or loop will be checked and evaluated 

--- Document Chunk 11942 ---
considering the newly operated system version. However, should the whole balise 

--- Document Chunk 11943 ---
group/loop message be rejected due to e.g. linking, no change of operated system 

--- Document Chunk 11944 ---
version will take place. 

--- Document Chunk 11945 ---
3.17.3.4.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 11946 ---
3.17.3.5 The on-board equipment shall check the ERTMS/ETCS system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 11947 ---
transmitted by any balise: 

--- Document Chunk 11948 ---
a) In all levels, if this system version number X equals to 0, the balise information shall 

--- Document Chunk 11949 ---
be ignored.

b) In all levels, if this system  version number X is different from 0 and lower than the 

--- Document Chunk 11962 ---

--- Document Chunk 11963 ---

--- Document Chunk 11964 ---

--- Document Chunk 11965 ---

--- Document Chunk 11966 ---

--- Document Chunk 11971 ---

--- Document Chunk 11972 ---

--- Document Chunk 11973 ---

--- Document Chunk 11974 ---
version number X supported by the on -board equipment, the info rmation from this 

--- Document Chunk 11975 ---

--- Document Chunk 11977 ---

--- Document Chunk 11978 ---

--- Document Chunk 11979 ---

--- Document Chunk 11980 ---

--- Document Chunk 11981 ---

--- Document Chunk 11982 ---

--- Document Chunk 11983 ---

--- Document Chunk 11984 ---
equipment shall be able to interpret the loop information. See chapter 6 for detailed 

--- Document Chunk 11985 ---
requirements. 

--- Document Chunk 11986 ---
c) If this system version number X is greater than the highest version number X 

--- Document Chunk 11987 ---
supported by the on -board equipment , no reaction shall be applied and the 

--- Document Chunk 11988 ---
information from this loop shall be ignored.

3.18 System Data 

--- Document Chunk 12022 ---
3.18.1 Fixed Values 

--- Document Chunk 12023 ---
3.18.1.1 Note: Appendix to chapter 3 contains a list of Fixed values used as system parameters 

--- Document Chunk 12024 ---
in the supervision. These parameters are system related and can easily be changed in 

--- Document Chunk 12025 ---
later versions of  the ERTMS/ETCS if required. These parameters are not defined as 

--- Document Chunk 12026 ---
National data.  

--- Document Chunk 12027 ---
3.18.2 National / Default Values 

--- Document Chunk 12028 ---
3.18.2.1 Note: Appendix to chapter 3 contains list of National and Default Values. 

--- Document Chunk 12029 ---
3.18.2.2 Trains shall be supervised according to the National Values of the current infrastructure 

--- Document Chunk 12030 ---
if they are available on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 12031 ---
3.18.2.3 National Values are transmitted with the area(s) (country or region) in which they are 

--- Document Chunk 12032 ---
applicable. They shall become applicable at a defined location, or shall be applicable 

--- Document Chunk 12033 ---
immediately. 

--- Document Chunk 12034 ---
3.18.2.4 Evaluating a balise group message, the balise identity information referring to the country 

--- Document Chunk 12035 ---
or region shall be used to ensure that correct National Values are used. 

--- Document Chunk 12036 ---
3.18.2.5 For each National Value, the corresponding Default Value shall be used as fall back 

--- Document Chunk 12037 ---
value if: 

--- Document Chunk 12038 ---
• the National Value is not available, or  

--- Document Chunk 12039 ---
• a mismatch has been detected between the country or region identifier read from a 

--- Document Chunk 12040 ---
balise group and the corresponding identifier(s) of the applicable set with which the 

--- Document Chunk 12041 ---
National Value was received and stored. 

--- Document Chunk 12042 ---
3.18.2.6 Note: even though the National Values are always transmitted as a single set for a given 

--- Document Chunk 12043 ---
system version, the content of a set depends on the system version, so that when a set 

--- Document Chunk 12044 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12045 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12046 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12047 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 12048 ---
4.0.0

--- Document Chunk 12055 ---
of National Values is received or becomes applicable, or when passing a balise group, 

--- Document Chunk 12056 ---
the on-board equipment may apply clause 3.18.2.5 for a subset of National Values 

--- Document Chunk 12057 ---
3.18.2.7 The National Values currently applicable when the on-board equipment is switched off 

--- Document Chunk 12058 ---
(i.e. enters No Power mode) shall be retained and shall remain applicable when powered 

--- Document Chunk 12059 ---
on. 

--- Document Chunk 12060 ---
3.18.2.7.1 Justification:  The aim of this requirement is to limit the number of balise groups 

--- Document Chunk 12061 ---
containing National Value information. Once a set of National Values has been received 

--- Document Chunk 12062 ---
on-board, there is no need to re-load the information unless National Values change, the 

--- Document Chunk 12063 ---
on-board equipment loses the information (failure situation), or the train enters an area 

--- Document Chunk 12064 ---
requiring different National Values. 

--- Document Chunk 12065 ---
3.18.2.8 The applicable set of National Values data shall be transmitted from the trackside on 

--- Document Chunk 12066 ---
transition between areas requiring a different set of National Values. 

--- Document Chunk 12067 ---
3.18.2.8.1 When a new set of National Values becomes applicable its content shall always overwrite 

--- Document Chunk 12068 ---
the corresponding National Values  currently applicable regardless of the country or 

--- Document Chunk 12069 ---
region identifier(s). 

--- Document Chunk 12070 ---
3.18.2.9 A previously received set of National Values which is not yet applicable shall be deleted 

--- Document Chunk 12071 ---
if: 

--- Document Chunk 12072 ---
• a new set of National Values is received, or 

--- Document Chunk 12073 ---
• the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is switched off (i.e., enters No Power mode). 

--- Document Chunk 12074 ---
3.18.2.10 If a National Value becomes invali d, i.e., a mismatch has been detected between the 

--- Document Chunk 12075 ---
country or region identifier read from a balise group and the corresponding identifier(s) 

--- Document Chunk 12076 ---
of the applicable set with which the National Value was received and stored, then it shall 

--- Document Chunk 12077 ---
be deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12078 ---
3.18.2.11 When a new se t of National Values becomes applicable, any ongoing supervision 

--- Document Chunk 12079 ---
involving an overwritten National Value of type time or distance shall continue, but using 

--- Document Chunk 12080 ---
the corresponding value from the new set. However, the starting location or starting time 

--- Document Chunk 12081 ---
shall remain unchanged. 

--- Document Chunk 12082 ---
3.18.3 Train Data  

--- Document Chunk 12083 ---
3.18.3.1 Train Data can neither be provided nor modified by ERTMS/ETCS trackside equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 12084 ---
3.18.3.2 Before starting a mission in a mode different from Supervised Manoeuvre, the Train Data 

--- Document Chunk 12085 ---
shall be acquired by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of a leading engine 

--- Document Chunk 12086 ---
a) Train category(ies) 

--- Document Chunk 12087 ---
b) Train length: 

--- Document Chunk 12088 ---
• Either the safe consist length 

--- Document Chunk 12089 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12090 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12091 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12092 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 12093 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 12094 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 12095 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12096 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 12097 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 12098 ---
Page 210/252 

--- Document Chunk 12099 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12100 ---
• Or any value that is obtained by means of a process which involves the driver 

--- Document Chunk 12101 ---
or by means of a process or an external source with a safety level that could be 

--- Document Chunk 12102 ---
lower than the one for the safe consist length 

--- Document Chunk 12103 ---
c) Traction / brake parameters: 

--- Document Chunk 12104 ---
• Traction model 

--- Document Chunk 12105 ---
• Braking models (brake reaction time, brake build up time and speed dependent 

--- Document Chunk 12106 ---
deceleration) or brake percentage 

--- Document Chunk 12107 ---
• Brake position 

--- Document Chunk 12108 ---
• On-board correction factors 

--- Document Chunk 12109 ---
• Nominal rotating mass 

--- Document Chunk 12110 ---
d) Maximum train speed 

--- Document Chunk 12111 ---
e) Loading gauge  

--- Document Chunk 12112 ---
f) Axle load category 

--- Document Chunk 12113 ---
g) Traction system(s) accepted by the engine 

--- Document Chunk 12114 ---
h) Train fitted with airtight system  

--- Document Chunk 12115 ---
i) List of National Systems available on-board 

--- Document Chunk 12116 ---
j) Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 12117 ---
k) Axle number  

--- Document Chunk 12118 ---
3.18.3.2.1 The Train Data may come from ERTMS/ETCS external sources (e.g. the Train Interface), 

--- Document Chunk 12119 ---
from pre-configured values or from the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 12120 ---
3.18.3.2.2 Exception: The driver shall never be involved in the entry/ modification/validation of the 

--- Document Chunk 12121 ---
Train Data “safe consist length”, “Traction system(s) accepted by  the engine”, “List of 

--- Document Chunk 12122 ---
National Systems available on-board” and “Axle number”. 

--- Document Chunk 12123 ---
3.18.3.2.3 The unit, range and resolution of the Train Data that can be directly entered by the driver 

--- Document Chunk 12124 ---
shall be as specified in A.3.11. 

--- Document Chunk 12125 ---
3.18.3.2.4 In the clauses where the term “safe consist length” is not explicitly used, the term “train 

--- Document Chunk 12126 ---
length” shall be interpreted as referring to the overall length of the train from one 

--- Document Chunk 12127 ---
extremity to the other one. When no valid Train Data is available but  the safe consist 

--- Document Chunk 12128 ---
length is available, the term “train length” shall refer to the sum of the max safe consist 

--- Document Chunk 12129 ---
lengths in front of and in rear of the engine respectively. When the safe consist length is 

--- Document Chunk 12130 ---
captured as part of valid Train Data, the term “train length” shall refer to the max safe 

--- Document Chunk 12131 ---
consist length in rear of the engine. 

--- Document Chunk 12132 ---
3.18.3.2.5 If the safe consist length information is acquired from an external source and it becomes 

--- Document Chunk 12133 ---
unavailable while performing a mission, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 12134 ---
nevertheless consider the Train Data “safe consist length” as unchanged. 

--- Document Chunk 12135 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 12145 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12146 ---
3.18.3.2.5.1 From the time the first Supervised Manoeuvre authorisation is received to the time 

--- Document Chunk 12147 ---
the mission is either ended or continued in Non Leading mode , the train front end 

--- Document Chunk 12148 ---
information shall still be derived from the safe consist length values in front or in rear of 

--- Document Chunk 12149 ---
the engine, which are stored on-board as Train Data 

--- Document Chunk 12150 ---
3.18.3.2.5.2 Note: when no valid Train Data is stored on -board, the continuous availability of the 

--- Document Chunk 12151 ---
safe consist length information is however necessary to send position reports with train 

--- Document Chunk 12152 ---
integrity confirmed by ext ernal source or to start or continue a mission in Supervised 

--- Document Chunk 12153 ---
Manoeuvre mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12154 ---
3.18.3.3 At standstill, it shall be possible for the driver to enter, modify and revalidate the Train 

--- Document Chunk 12155 ---
Data that requires driver validation according to the specific train implementation. 

--- Document Chunk 12156 ---
3.18.3.3.1 In normal operation after the start of mission, if a train movement is detected while the 

--- Document Chunk 12157 ---
driver is modifying or revalidating the Train Data, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 12158 ---
shall trigger the brake command. 

--- Document Chunk 12159 ---
3.18.3.4 Following any validation of Tra in data /modification of valid Train Data when a 

--- Document Chunk 12160 ---
communication session is already established or following the successful establishment 

--- Document Chunk 12161 ---
of a communication session when valid Train Data are already available (e.g. when 

--- Document Chunk 12162 ---
approaching a level 2 area or an accept ing RBC area), the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12163 ---
equipment of the leading engine shall send the following set of Train Data to the RBC: 

--- Document Chunk 12164 ---
a) Train category(ies). 

--- Document Chunk 12165 ---
b) Train length.  

--- Document Chunk 12166 ---
c) Maximum train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 12167 ---
d) Loading gauge. 

--- Document Chunk 12168 ---
e) Axle load category. 

--- Document Chunk 12169 ---
f) Traction system(s) accepted by the engine. 

--- Document Chunk 12170 ---
g) Train fitted with airtight system. 

--- Document Chunk 12171 ---
h) List of National Systems available on-board 

--- Document Chunk 12172 ---
i) Axle number 

--- Document Chunk 12173 ---
3.18.3.4.1 The RBC shall acknowledge the reception of this set of Train Data. 

--- Document Chunk 12174 ---
3.18.3.4.2 In case the safe radio connection is lost before the acknowledgement is received, the 

--- Document Chunk 12175 ---
Train Data shall be sent again once the safe radio connection has been re-established 

--- Document Chunk 12176 ---
within the ongoing communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 12177 ---
3.18.3.5 If the safe consist length information is available and as long a s the safe consist length 

--- Document Chunk 12178 ---
in front of the engine, taking into account the side of the active cab which defines the 

--- Document Chunk 12179 ---
front of the engine, is different from zero: 

--- Document Chunk 12180 ---
a) The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall consider that no valid Train Data is 

--- Document Chunk 12181 ---
stored on-board 

--- Document Chunk 12182 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 12192 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12193 ---
b) By exception to 3.18.3.3, the entry, modification and revalidation of Train Data that 

--- Document Chunk 12194 ---
requires driver validation shall not be possible 

--- Document Chunk 12195 ---
3.18.3.6 For modification of Train Data , which is/are affected by a change of input information 

--- Document Chunk 12196 ---
from the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipmen t external interface , refer to procedure 

--- Document Chunk 12197 ---
"Changing Train Data from sources different from the driver" described in section 5.17. 

--- Document Chunk 12198 ---
3.18.3.7 In case the Train Data regarding train category, axle load  category, loading gauge or 

--- Document Chunk 12199 ---
traction system has been changed and the train is at standstill: 

--- Document Chunk 12200 ---
a) the location based information stored on -board shall be shortened to the current 

--- Document Chunk 12201 ---
position of the train . Refer to appendix A.3.4 for the exhaustive list of information, 

--- Document Chunk 12202 ---
which shall be shortened. 

--- Document Chunk 12203 ---
b) the stored MA, linking and track description, which have been received from the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 12204 ---
after a level 2 transition or an RBC transition for a further location has been ordered, 

--- Document Chunk 12205 ---
shall be deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12206 ---
3.18.3.8 In case valid Train Data is available and the Train Data regarding train length has been 

--- Document Chunk 12207 ---
increased or in case no valid Train Data is available  but the Train Data “safe consist 

--- Document Chunk 12208 ---
length” is available and has been increased in the direction opposite to the train 

--- Document Chunk 12209 ---
orientation, the currently used track description, if any, shall be considered as unknown 

--- Document Chunk 12210 ---
in rear of the former min safe rear end of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 12211 ---
3.18.3.9 In order to perform a mission in Supervised Manoeuvre mode with only the Train Data 

--- Document Chunk 12212 ---
“safe consist length” available, the on-board shall be configured with default Train Data 

--- Document Chunk 12213 ---
for all items of 3.18.3.2 except item b). From the time the first Supervised Manoeuvre 

--- Document Chunk 12214 ---
authorisation is received to the time the mission is either ended or continued in Non 

--- Document Chunk 12215 ---
Leading mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall use these default Train Data 

--- Document Chunk 12216 ---
and shall consider that no valid Train Data is stored on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 12217 ---
3.18.3.10 In Stand-By mode (only in level 2 when a communication session is already established) 

--- Document Chunk 12218 ---
and from the time the first Supervised Manoeuvre request is sent to the time the mission 

--- Document Chunk 12219 ---
is either ended or continued in Non Leading mode  or to the time this Supervised 

--- Document Chunk 12220 ---
Manoeuvre request is refused , the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall send the 

--- Document Chunk 12221 ---
safe consist length information for Supervised Manoeuvre to the RBC following any 

--- Document Chunk 12222 ---
modification of the Train Data “safe consist length” or when the  safe consist length 

--- Document Chunk 12223 ---
information acquired from an external source becomes available or becomes 

--- Document Chunk 12224 ---
unavailable. 

--- Document Chunk 12225 ---
3.18.3.10.1 The RBC shall acknowledge the reception of the safe consist length information for 

--- Document Chunk 12226 ---
Supervised Manoeuvre. 

--- Document Chunk 12227 ---
3.18.3.10.2 In case the safe radio connection is lost b efore the acknowledgement is received, the 

--- Document Chunk 12228 ---
safe consist length information for Supervised Manoeuvre shall be sent again once the 

--- Document Chunk 12229 ---
safe radio connection has been re -established within the ongoing communication 

--- Document Chunk 12230 ---
session. 

--- Document Chunk 12231 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 12242 ---
3.18.4 Additional Data 

--- Document Chunk 12243 ---
3.18.4.1 Driver ID 

--- Document Chunk 12244 ---
3.18.4.1.1 The driver ID  shall be used to identify the responsible person for operating an active 

--- Document Chunk 12245 ---
desk. 

--- Document Chunk 12246 ---
3.18.4.1.1.1 Note: This data is used for recording purposes only. 

--- Document Chunk 12247 ---
3.18.4.1.2 If allowed by a National value, it shall be possible for the driver to change driver ID while 

--- Document Chunk 12248 ---
the train is running. 

--- Document Chunk 12249 ---
3.18.4.1.3 It shall be possible to enter driver ID also in a non-leading engine. 

--- Document Chunk 12250 ---
3.18.4.1.4 The unit, range and resolution of the driver ID shall be as specified in A.3.11. 

--- Document Chunk 12251 ---
3.18.4.2 ERTMS/ETCS Level 

--- Document Chunk 12252 ---
3.18.4.2.1 The driver shall have the possibility to enter the ERTMS/ETCS level during a start of a 

--- Document Chunk 12253 ---
mission. 

--- Document Chunk 12254 ---
3.18.4.2.2 The ERTMS/ETCS level information is required for train operation except sleeping mode. 

--- Document Chunk 12255 ---
3.18.4.2.3 In normal operation after the start of mission the driver shall not have to select the 

--- Document Chunk 12256 ---
ERTMS/ETCS level (all other level transitions are executed automatically). 

--- Document Chunk 12257 ---
3.18.4.2.4 For operational fallback situations: at standstill, the onboard equipment shall allow the 

--- Document Chunk 12258 ---
driver to change the ERTMS/ETCS level. 

--- Document Chunk 12259 ---
3.18.4.2.4.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12260 ---
3.18.4.2.5 If a table of supported levels given by trackside is stored on-board and is applicable, the 

--- Document Chunk 12261 ---
selection of level by the driver shall be limited to those contained in this table. If no table 

--- Document Chunk 12262 ---
of trackside supported levels is applicable, the driver can select any level within a default 

--- Document Chunk 12263 ---
list configured on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 12264 ---
3.18.4.3 Radio data: Radio Network type and GSM -R Radio Network identification / RBC 

--- Document Chunk 12265 ---
contact information 

--- Document Chunk 12266 ---
3.18.4.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall store one valid RBC contact information 

--- Document Chunk 12267 ---
(RBC identity and, if relevant, its  telephone number) at a time, obtained from the last 

--- Document Chunk 12268 ---
driver data entry, from the last  received order to establish a session with an RBC 

--- Document Chunk 12269 ---
(excluding RBC transition orders) or from the crossing of a n RBC/RBC border (see 

--- Document Chunk 12270 ---
clause 3.15.1.3.7). 

--- Document Chunk 12271 ---
3.18.4.3.1.1 Note: If a valid RBC contact information is available on-board, no driver data entry is 

--- Document Chunk 12272 ---
needed to establish a connection to the RBC when performing a start of mission or after 

--- Document Chunk 12273 ---
a manual level change to level 2. 

--- Document Chunk 12274 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12275 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12276 ---
