--- Document Chunk 12281 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 12282 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 12283 ---
Page 214/252 

--- Document Chunk 12284 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12285 ---
3.18.4.3.2 In level 2 only, at standstill, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the driver 

--- Document Chunk 12286 ---
different means to select the RBC contact information, for de tails see step S3, section 

--- Document Chunk 12287 ---
5.4, Start of Mission procedure. 

--- Document Chunk 12288 ---
3.18.4.3.3 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12289 ---
3.18.4.3.4 If the driver selects “Use of EIRENE short number” to contact the RBC and the 

--- Document Chunk 12290 ---
communication session is successfully established, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 12291 ---
equipment shall stor e as valid RBC identity and telephone number, the RBC identity 

--- Document Chunk 12292 ---
reported by EURORADIO and the EIRENE short number, respectively. 

--- Document Chunk 12293 ---
3.18.4.3.4.1 Note: If the short number is re -used by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment (e.g. 

--- Document Chunk 12294 ---
following a loss of safe radio connection) and does not direct to an RBC with the stored 

--- Document Chunk 12295 ---
RBC ID, the connection will be terminated (EURORADIO functionality). 

--- Document Chunk 12296 ---
3.18.4.3.5 The unit, range and resolution of the RBC identity and telephone number shall be as 

--- Document Chunk 12297 ---
specified in A.3.11. 

--- Document Chunk 12298 ---
3.18.4.3.6 At standstill, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the possibility to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 12299 ---
to modify the Radio Network type and/or, if t he stored Radio Network type is 

--- Document Chunk 12300 ---
FRMCS+GSM-R or GSM-R, the GSM-R Radio Network ID. 

--- Document Chunk 12301 ---
3.18.4.3.6.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall terminate the ongoing communication 

--- Document Chunk 12302 ---
session(s), if any, and shall abort any ongoing attempts to establish a communication 

--- Document Chunk 12303 ---
session, in case: 

--- Document Chunk 12304 ---
a) The driver has selected a new Radio Network type different from the previously stored 

--- Document Chunk 12305 ---
one 

--- Document Chunk 12306 ---
b) The driver elects to modify the GSM-R Radio Network ID 

--- Document Chunk 12307 ---
3.18.4.3.6.2 If the driver has elected to modify the GSM -R Radio Network ID: As soon as the 

--- Document Chunk 12308 ---
related safe connection is released, if any, the on -board equipment shall acquire an 

--- Document Chunk 12309 ---
alphanumeric list of available and allowed GSM-R networks, based on a request to the 

--- Document Chunk 12310 ---
GSM-R Mobile Terminal(s).If the driver selects a new GSM-R Radio Network ID from the 

--- Document Chunk 12311 ---
proposed list, the registration of the GSM-R Mobile Terminal(s) to this new GSM-R Radio 

--- Document Chunk 12312 ---
Network shall be ordered. 

--- Document Chunk 12313 ---
3.18.4.3.6.3 If not “unknown” the status of the RBC contact information shall be immediately set to 

--- Document Chunk 12314 ---
“invalid”, as soon as: 

--- Document Chunk 12315 ---
a) The driver has selected a new Radio Network type different from the previously stored 

--- Document Chunk 12316 ---
one 

--- Document Chunk 12317 ---
b) The driver has selected a new GSM-R Radio Network ID 

--- Document Chunk 12318 ---
3.18.4.4 ETCS Identity 

--- Document Chunk 12319 ---
3.18.4.4.1 The ETCS identity of an on -board equipment is made of a single identity number. The 

--- Document Chunk 12320 ---
ETCS identity of an RBC, balise group, loop or RIU is composed of a country/region 

--- Document Chunk 12321 ---
identity number and of an identity number within the country/region. 

--- Document Chunk 12322 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12323 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12324 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12325 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 12326 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 12327 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 12328 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 12329 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 12330 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 12331 ---
Page 215/252 

--- Document Chunk 12332 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12333 ---
3.18.4.4.2 All on-board equipments in service, balise groups marked as linked, RBC’s, RIU’s, and 

--- Document Chunk 12334 ---
loops shall be assigned a unique ETCS identity within their respective group. 

--- Document Chunk 12335 ---
3.18.4.4.3 The assignment of (unique or not) ETCS identities to balise groups marked as unlinked 

--- Document Chunk 12336 ---
is the sole responsibility of the entity in charge of the assignment of values (see SUBSET-

--- Document Chunk 12337 ---
054), depending on the specific trackside implementation. 

--- Document Chunk 12338 ---
3.18.4.5 Train Running Number 

--- Document Chunk 12339 ---
3.18.4.5.1 During the Start of Mission, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of a leading engine 

--- Document Chunk 12340 ---
shall acquire the train running number  from driver input, from the RBC or from other 

--- Document Chunk 12341 ---
ERTMS/ETCS external sources. 

--- Document Chunk 12342 ---
3.18.4.5.2 It shall be possible to enter train running number also in a non-leading engine. 

--- Document Chunk 12343 ---
3.18.4.5.3 It shall be possible to change the train running number while running, from driver input, 

--- Document Chunk 12344 ---
from the RBC or from other ERTMS/ETCS external sources. 

--- Document Chunk 12345 ---
3.18.4.5.4 Following any entry/modification of the train running number when a communication 

--- Document Chunk 12346 ---
session is already established or following the successful establishment of a 

--- Document Chunk 12347 ---
communication session when valid train running nu mber is already available, the 

--- Document Chunk 12348 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall send the train running number to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 12349 ---
3.18.4.5.4.1 Exception: if the train running number has been received from the RBC, it shall not 

--- Document Chunk 12350 ---
be sent back to the RBC by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 12351 ---
3.18.4.5.5 The unit, range and resolution of the train running number shall be as specified in A.3.11. 

--- Document Chunk 12352 ---
3.18.4.6 Adhesion Factor 

--- Document Chunk 12353 ---
3.18.4.6.1 The adhesion factor is used to adjust the emergency brake model of the train (see 3.13).  

--- Document Chunk 12354 ---
3.18.4.6.2 The adhesion factor may be changed while the train is running. 

--- Document Chunk 12355 ---
3.18.4.6.2.1 It shall be possible to update the adhesion factor from trackside and - if permitted by 

--- Document Chunk 12356 ---
a National value - by the driver. If, following a change of National Values, the update of 

--- Document Chunk 12357 ---
the adhesion factor is no more permitted to the driver, the adhesion fact or previously 

--- Document Chunk 12358 ---
modified by the driver to slippery rail shall immediately be reset to non slippery rail. Any 

--- Document Chunk 12359 ---
trackside adhesion profile is not affected. 

--- Document Chunk 12360 ---
3.18.4.6.2.2 The adhesion factor shall be sent as profile data from trackside when needed. 

--- Document Chunk 12361 ---
3.18.4.6.2.3 The driver shall be informed whether the value of the adhesion factor is “slippery rail”. 

--- Document Chunk 12362 ---
3.18.4.6.3 The selection of the adhesion value from trackside or by driver entry shall be limited to 

--- Document Chunk 12363 ---
the options slippery rail/ non slippery rail. 

--- Document Chunk 12364 ---
3.18.4.6.3.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12365 ---
3.18.4.6.4 The default value for the adhesion factor shall be the highest value (i.e. not slippery rail). 

--- Document Chunk 12366 ---
3.18.4.6.5 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12367 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 12368 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12369 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 12370 ---

3.18.5 Date and Time 

--- Document Chunk 12379 ---
3.18.5.1 Each ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall be able to provide the date (day, month, 

--- Document Chunk 12380 ---
year) and time (hour, minute, second) in Universal Time Co -ordinated (UTC) and Local 

--- Document Chunk 12381 ---
Time. 

--- Document Chunk 12382 ---
3.18.5.2 The local time shall be presented to the driver, while the UTC shall be used for the 

--- Document Chunk 12383 ---
juridical data. 

--- Document Chunk 12384 ---
3.18.5.3 Deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 12385 ---
3.18.6 Data view 

--- Document Chunk 12386 ---
3.18.6.1 Outside the context of data entry, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the 

--- Document Chunk 12387 ---
possibility to the driver to view the driver ID, the train running number, the RBC contact 

--- Document Chunk 12388 ---
information, the Radio Network type, the GSM -R Radio Network ID, the Virtual Balise 

--- Document Chunk 12389 ---
Cover(s) and the Train Data either modifiable by the driver  or modifiable by other 

--- Document Chunk 12390 ---
ERTMS/ETCS external sources. 

--- Document Chunk 12391 ---
3.18.6.2 Only valid data shall be presented to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 12392 ---

--- Document Chunk 12640 ---

A.3.3 Handling of information received from trackside 

--- Document Chunk 12645 ---
A.3.3.1  Before it can be accepted and used by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment, raw 

--- Document Chunk 12646 ---
information received from trackside is subject to various checks, which can lead to the 

--- Document Chunk 12647 ---
individual rejection/ignoring of information (e.g. Movement Authority not valid for the train 

--- Document Chunk 12648 ---
orientation), the ignoring of a whole balise telegram or the rejection of a whole message. 

--- Document Chunk 12649 ---
The SRS clauses/sections corresponding to these checks are gathered in Table 17.

A.3.3.2 With the exception of the clauses/sections referred to in Table 17 and of the clause s 

--- Document Chunk 12730 ---
3.16.3.5.1, 3.17.2.3 , 3.17.2.5, 3.17.2.6 and 3.17.3.3, all the clauses in this specification 

--- Document Chunk 12731 ---
and in the SUBSET-035, in which trackside information is referred to (through the terms 

--- Document Chunk 12732 ---
“balise”, “telegram”, “balise group [message]”, “message”, “[name of] information”...), 

--- Document Chunk 12733 ---
shall be applied assuming that the information has not been ignored/rejected by the 

--- Document Chunk 12734 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment due to all the checks listed in Table 17. 

--- Document Chunk 12735 ---
A.3.3.3 Example 1: clause 3.16.2.4.9 has to be understood as follows: “If a <consistent> 

--- Document Chunk 12736 ---
message <composed with telegrams that have passed the system ve rsion check, that 

--- Document Chunk 12737 ---
have not been ignored because of a VBC, that have not been ignored because of 

--- Document Chunk 12738 ---
duplication, and that have been received while no movement opposite to the authorised 

--- Document Chunk 12739 ---
direction was performed> has been received <with one of its telegrams comp osing it> 

--- Document Chunk 12740 ---
containing the information “default balise information” <which is valid for the train 

--- Document Chunk 12741 ---
orientation (or the balise group crossing direction for NL or SL engines) and which has 

--- Document Chunk 12742 ---
passed the level and mode filters>, the driver shall be informed.” 

--- Document Chunk 12743 ---
A.3.3.4 Example 2: as a result of the clause A.3.3.2, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment will 

--- Document Chunk 12744 ---
not apply requirements in relation to the content of the telegram or the message such 

--- Document Chunk 12745 ---
as: 

--- Document Chunk 12746 ---
• clause 3.6.2.2.2 a), in case the balise group message is rejected because  

--- Document Chunk 12747 ---
inconsistent (e.g. according to 3.16.2.4.1), it does not become LRBG 

--- Document Chunk 12748 ---
• clause 3.17.2.3, in case the balise telegram is ignored because of its system version 

--- Document Chunk 12749 ---
number (e.g. according to 3.17.3.5 d)), this latter will not affect the system version 

--- Document Chunk 12750 ---
operated by the on-board 

--- Document Chunk 12751 ---
• clause 3.18.2.5 2nd bullet, in case a message from a balise group marked as linked 

--- Document Chunk 12752 ---
is rejected because the balise group was not announced by linking (see 3.16.2.4.3), 

--- Document Chunk 12753 ---
the balise group country or region identifier will not be compared with the o ne(s) of 

--- Document Chunk 12754 ---
the currently applicable set of National Values 

--- Document Chunk 12755 ---
A.3.3.5 Example 3: as a result of the clause A.3.3.2, the clause 3.4.1.1 (definition of a balise 

--- Document Chunk 12756 ---
group) has to be understood as follows: “A balise group consists of between one and 

--- Document Chunk 12757 ---
eight balises shar ing the same balise group identity <and which are not covered by a 

--- Document Chunk 12758 ---
VBC (i.e. whose telegrams will not be ignored by the on -board) at a certain moment in 

--- Document Chunk 12759 ---
time>”. Therefore when, for migration purposes, more than one instance of balises with 

--- Document Chunk 12760 ---
the same internal number but with different VBC markers are used in a cluster of balises, 

--- Document Chunk 12761 ---
the number of balises inside the group that is indicated in each balise telegram shou ld 

--- Document Chunk 12762 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

not take into account the balises which are covered by a VBC at a certain moment in

time. 

--- Document Chunk 12775 ---
A.3.4 Handling of Accepted and Stored Information in specific 

--- Document Chunk 12776 ---
Situations 

--- Document Chunk 12777 ---
A.3.4.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 12778 ---
A.3.4.1.1 All data that can be stored onboard after being accepted may be influenced in special 

--- Document Chunk 12779 ---
situations. 

--- Document Chunk 12780 ---
A.3.4.1.2 The situations acting on the “status” of stored information are: 

--- Document Chunk 12781 ---
a) the acceptance of a conditional emergency stop (3.10.2.2 b)); 

--- Document Chunk 12782 ---
b) the reception of a shortened MA (3.8.5.1.3, 3.8.5.1.4); 

--- Document Chunk 12783 ---
c) the stored MA is shortened due to a section time-out (3.8.4.2.2); 

--- Document Chunk 12784 ---
d) the SvL is shifted (to the DP if any or to the EOA) due to an overlap time -out 

--- Document Chunk 12785 ---
(3.8.4.4.2) ; 

--- Document Chunk 12786 ---
e) the stored MA is shortened due to an end section time-out (3.8.4.1.2); 

--- Document Chunk 12787 ---
f) a request to shorten MA is granted by the onboard (3.8.6.2); 

--- Document Chunk 12788 ---
g) inconsistency in a balise group marked as unlinked and the train is at standstill 

--- Document Chunk 12789 ---
(3.16.2.5.2); 

--- Document Chunk 12790 ---
h) a linking reaction led to a service brake and the train is at standstill (3.16.2.6.2) ; 

--- Document Chunk 12791 ---
i) the reaction due to the supervision of the safe radio connection led to a service brake 

--- Document Chunk 12792 ---
and the train is at standstill (3.16.3.4.5 b) ; 

--- Document Chunk 12793 ---
j) the train category, axle load  category, loading gauge or traction system is changed 

--- Document Chunk 12794 ---
and the train is at standstill (3.18.3.7) ; 

--- Document Chunk 12795 ---
k) driver closes the desk during SoM ; 

--- Document Chunk 12796 ---
l) RAMS related supervision functions led to a service brake and the train is at standstill 

--- Document Chunk 12797 ---
(3.16.2.7) 

--- Document Chunk 12798 ---
m) inconsistency in a balise group marked as linked and linking consistency is not 

--- Document Chunk 12799 ---
checked onboard and the train is at standstill (3.16.2.4.4.2) 

--- Document Chunk 12800 ---
n) the Limit of Authority becomes an End of Authority and the on -board considers an 

--- Document Chunk 12801 ---
SvL (3.8.4.3.2) 

--- Document Chunk 12802 ---
o) the safe consist length information acquired from external source becomes 

--- Document Chunk 12803 ---
unavailable (4.4.21.1.12) 

--- Document Chunk 12804 ---

--- Document Chunk 12958 ---
be defined. 

--- Document Chunk 12959 ---

--- Document Chunk 12960 ---

--- Document Chunk 12961 ---
reference, i.e. the balise group at the next main signal 

--- Document Chunk 12962 ---

--- Document Chunk 12967 ---

--- Document Chunk 12971 ---

--- Document Chunk 12972 ---

--- Document Chunk 12973 ---
end positions of the train, as the EOA and SvL respectively, with no release speed

A.3.5 Handling of Actions in Specific Situations 

--- Document Chunk 13041 ---
A.3.5.1 Regards the following actions executed in reference to location based information 

--- Document Chunk 13042 ---
received from trackside, the on -board equipment shall , by exception to the other 

--- Document Chunk 13043 ---
requirements in this document,  ensure that the action related to passing a location is 

--- Document Chunk 13044 ---
neither reverted, nor executed twice in case of reverse movement (initiated by driver or 

--- Document Chunk 13045 ---
due to roll-away) and sub-sequent forward movement, or in case of adjustment of train 

--- Document Chunk 13046 ---
position and relocation on passing a  balise group that becomes SOLR, which result in 

--- Document Chunk 13047 ---
a new train position situated in rear of the location which triggered the action: 

--- Document Chunk 13048 ---
• Applying new National Values (see 3.18.2.3) 

--- Document Chunk 13049 ---
• Request to acknowledge new l evel on entering the acknowledgement area (see 

--- Document Chunk 13050 ---
5.10.4.1 a)), actions related to passing the level transition border (see 3.5.3.8 d), 

--- Document Chunk 13051 ---
3.6.5.1.4 f), 5.10.1.5, 5.10.3.3.3, 5.10.3.6.2, 5.10.3.7.5, 5.10.3.10.3) 

--- Document Chunk 13052 ---
• Start and stop displaying plain or fixed text messages (see 3.12.3.4.3.1) 

--- Document Chunk 13053 ---
• Mode transition due to passing the beginning (see 3.12.4.5 together with 4.6.3 [34], 

--- Document Chunk 13054 ---
[40], [71], [72], [73], [74]) or the end (see 3.12.4.6 together with 4.6.3 [ 75], [76]) of a 

--- Document Chunk 13055 ---
LS/OS mode profile 

--- Document Chunk 13056 ---
• Actions related to  radio infill areas (see 3.5.4.3 3rd bullet, 3.9.3.5, 3.9.3.10 a)&b), 

--- Document Chunk 13057 ---
3.9.3.15, 3.9.3.16) 

--- Document Chunk 13058 ---
• Actions related to RBC/RBC handover (see 3.5.3.8 f), 3.6.5.1.4 e)&k), 3.11.5.14 2nd 

--- Document Chunk 13059 ---
bullet, 3.15.1.3.1 b)&c), 3.15.1.3.2, 3.15.1.3.7, 3.15.1.3.8 a), 3.17.2.8 c)&e), 5.15.1.4) 

--- Document Chunk 13060 ---
• Actions related to track condition information with the exception of big metal masses 

--- Document Chunk 13061 ---
and non stopping areas  (see 3.5.3.4 e), 3.5.3.8 g), 3.5.4.4, 3.16.3.4.1.3, 

--- Document Chunk 13062 ---
5.18.2.2,3,5&6, 5.18.3.2,3,4&5, 5.18.5.2&3, 5.18.6.2,3,4&5, 5.18.7.3,4&5, 

--- Document Chunk 13063 ---
5.18.8.3,4&5, 5.18.9.2&3, 5.18.10.2,5&6, 5.20.2.2,4&5, 5.20.3.2,4&5, 5.20.4.2,4&5, 

--- Document Chunk 13064 ---
5.20.5.3,5&6, 5.20.6.2&4, 5.20.7.2&5, 5.20.8.2,5&6) 

--- Document Chunk 13065 ---
• Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 13066 ---
• Start and stop Track Ahead free request to driver (see 3.15.5.2) 

--- Document Chunk 13067 ---
• Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 13068 ---
• Substitute the supervisi on of the LX start location as temporary EOA/SvL by the 

--- Document Chunk 13069 ---
inclusion of the LX speed restriction in the MRSP (see 5.16.2.1, 5.16.3.2) 

--- Document Chunk 13070 ---
• Start the MA end section timer/overlap timer (see 3.8.4.1.1, 3.8.4.4.1) 

--- Document Chunk 13071 ---
A.3.5.1.1 Note: the fact that an action is not referr ed to in the above list does not mean that the 

--- Document Chunk 13072 ---
action is automatically reverted, but that the other requirements in this document strictly 

--- Document Chunk 13073 ---
apply. For instance: 

--- Document Chunk 13074 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 13075 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13076 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13077 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 13078 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 13079 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 13080 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 13081 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 13082 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 13083 ---
Page 229/252 

--- Document Chunk 13084 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13085 ---
• In case the reverse movement or the relocation brings back the max safe antenna 

--- Document Chunk 13086 ---
position in rear of the start location of the big metal mass area, the on-board will stop 

--- Document Chunk 13087 ---
ignoring the alarms which may be triggered by big metal masses (i.e. the clauses 

--- Document Chunk 13088 ---
3.12.1.2.1.2 and 3.12.1.3 apply) 

--- Document Chunk 13089 ---
• In case the reverse movement or the relocation brings back the min safe front end in 

--- Document Chunk 13090 ---
rear of an unprotected LX end location, the on-board will take again into account the 

--- Document Chunk 13091 ---
LX speed restriction (i.e. 3.13.10.2.8 applies) and display again the unprotected LX 

--- Document Chunk 13092 ---
status (i.e. 5.16.1.5 applies) 

--- Document Chunk 13093 ---
• The transition to TR mode on pass ing the EOA/LOA will never be reverted, even if 

--- Document Chunk 13094 ---
the train moves backwards in rear of the EOA/LOA location. Reason: on purpose, no 

--- Document Chunk 13095 ---
such transition back to FS/OS/LS is specified in sections 4.6.2 and 4.6.3. 

--- Document Chunk 13096 ---
• The transition from CSM to TSM on passing the Indic ation supervision limit will not 

--- Document Chunk 13097 ---
be reverted in case of relocation that brings back the train front end in rear of the 

--- Document Chunk 13098 ---
Indication supervision limit. Reason: it has been specified in that way for obvious 

--- Document Chunk 13099 ---
ergonomic reasons (see 3.13.10.6.1). 

--- Document Chunk 13100 ---
A.3.5.2 A maximum time Tn (see Subset-036 clause 4.2.9) after it has received a balise group 

--- Document Chunk 13101 ---
message (i.e. a maximum time Tn after  it has received the last balise telegram of the 

--- Document Chunk 13102 ---
balise group), the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment  shall not consider any action 

--- Document Chunk 13103 ---
related to passing an EOA (only in level 1), an LOA, or a former EOA/LOA located in 

--- Document Chunk 13104 ---
advance of the train position measured at the time of reception of this last telegram, until 

--- Document Chunk 13105 ---
the content of the message has been taken into account. 

--- Document Chunk 13106 ---
A.3.5.2.1 Example 1: in level 1, the crossing of the EOA/LOA location with the min safe antenna, 

--- Document Chunk 13107 ---
before a new extended MA (received when the min safe antenna was in rear of the 

--- Document Chunk 13108 ---
EOA/LOA) has been processed, will not lead to train trip. In other terms the replacement 

--- Document Chunk 13109 ---
of the EOA/LOA is considered by the on -board as happening before the min safe 

--- Document Chunk 13110 ---
antenna crosses the EOA/LOA location (i.e. preventing that clause 3.13.10.2.7 applies). 

--- Document Chunk 13111 ---
A.3.5.2.2 Example 2: when the override function is active, the crossing of the former EOA /LOA 

--- Document Chunk 13112 ---
location by the min safe antenna, before a “Stop if in SR” information (received when the 

--- Document Chunk 13113 ---
min safe antenna was in rear of the former EOA/LOA) has been processed, will not lead 

--- Document Chunk 13114 ---
to the end of the override procedure followed by a train trip due to “Stop if in SR”. In other 

--- Document Chunk 13115 ---
terms, both the deletion of the former EOA/LOA and the end of override procedure (see 

--- Document Chunk 13116 ---
5.8.3.1.3 and 5.8.4.1 c)) are considered by the on -board as simultaneously happening 

--- Document Chunk 13117 ---
before the min safe antenna crosses the former EOA/LOA location. 

--- Document Chunk 13118 ---
A.3.5.2.3 Example 3: in level 2, the crossing of the LOA location with the min safe front end before 

--- Document Chunk 13119 ---
an immediate level transition order to level NTC or level 0 (received when the min safe 

--- Document Chunk 13120 ---
front end was in rear of the LOA) has been processed, will not lead to train trip. In other 

--- Document Chunk 13121 ---
terms the deletion of the MA (and therefore the deletion of the LOA) due to the level 

--- Document Chunk 13122 ---
change is considered by the on -board as happening before the min safe front end 

--- Document Chunk 13123 ---
crosses the LOA location (i.e. preventing that clause 3.13.10.2.6 a) applies). 

--- Document Chunk 13124 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 13125 ---

A.3.6 Deletion of accepted and stored information when used 

--- Document Chunk 13136 ---
A.3.6.1 Standard case 

--- Document Chunk 13137 ---
A.3.6.1.1 When the train moves in the direction of its train orientation, storage capacity occupied 

--- Document Chunk 13138 ---
by trackside information no longer used, i.e., the related on-board functionality has been 

--- Document Chunk 13139 ---
completed, shall be made available immediately. 

--- Document Chunk 13140 ---
A.3.6.1.1.1 Note: The requirement is needed to allow trackside to predict the storage capacity 

--- Document Chunk 13141 ---
available on-board in order to comply with dimensioning rules regards information stored 

--- Document Chunk 13142 ---
on-board given in Subset 040. 

--- Document Chunk 13143 ---
A.3.6.2 Exception 

--- Document Chunk 13144 ---
A.3.6.2.1 Following information shall remain stored on-board for a distance defined by a fixed value 

--- Document Chunk 13145 ---
in rear of the min safe rear end position of the train: 

--- Document Chunk 13146 ---
• location dependent static speed restrictions , i.e., SSP, ASP, TSR, LX SR, PBD SR 

--- Document Chunk 13147 ---
(see 3.11.2.2), 

--- Document Chunk 13148 ---
• gradient information, 

--- Document Chunk 13149 ---
• reduced adhesion information received from trackside, 

--- Document Chunk 13150 ---
• Track condition “Big metal masses”, 

--- Document Chunk 13151 ---
• MA Section entry points and their associated Section timer stop locations. 

--- Document Chunk 13152 ---
A.3.6.2.1.1 Note: The above information remains stored for the case of a reverse movement: 

--- Document Chunk 13153 ---
• With the exception of the track condition “Big metal masses”,  the stored information 

--- Document Chunk 13154 ---
allows the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment to calculate speed supervision limits 

--- Document Chunk 13155 ---
after a reverse movement (roll-away, or initiated by the driver), 

--- Document Chunk 13156 ---
• Track condition “Big metal masses” is needed also for a reverse movement itself to 

--- Document Chunk 13157 ---
avoid any false alarms due to Big metal masses in the track, 

--- Document Chunk 13158 ---
• The MA Section information is needed to apply the clause 3.8.4.2.4 in case of reverse 

--- Document Chunk 13159 ---
movement in rear of an MA Section timer stop location. 

--- Document Chunk 13160 ---
A.3.6.2.1.2 Note: The distance to intervention of the Roll Away Protection or the Unauthorised 

--- Document Chunk 13161 ---
Direction Movement Protection is determined by a National/Default val ue.  This is also 

--- Document Chunk 13162 ---
true for a reverse movement in Post trip mode. However, following an intervention, the 

--- Document Chunk 13163 ---
train will not stop immediately. In order to keep the on-board functionality simple, a fixed 

--- Document Chunk 13164 ---
distance value was chosen to define an unambiguous location in rear of the train where 

--- Document Chunk 13165 ---
the above information is no longer required and the related on-board storage capacity is 

--- Document Chunk 13166 ---
made available again. 

--- Document Chunk 13167 ---
A.3.7  Calculation of the basic deceleration 

--- Document Chunk 13168 ---
A.3.7.1 The brake percentage (λ) shall be converted into two different input parameters: 

--- Document Chunk 13169 ---
λo = λ for calculation of emergency brake deceleration (A_brake_emergency(V)) 

--- Document Chunk 13170 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 13171 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13172 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13173 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 13174 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 13175 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 13176 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 13177 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 13178 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 13179 ---
Page 231/252 

--- Document Chunk 13180 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13181 ---
λo = MIN (λ, 135) for calculation of service brake deceleration (A_brake_service(V)) 

--- Document Chunk 13182 ---
where λ is the brake percentage defined as part of Train Data. 

--- Document Chunk 13183 ---
A.3.7.2 The calculation of the basic deceleration (A_basic(V)) shall use a common algorithm that 

--- Document Chunk 13184 ---
will be used twice, once for the service brake and once for the emergency brake. 

--- Document Chunk 13185 ---
A.3.7.3 The speed limit for the first step shall be calculated as V_lim = x * λoy. 

--- Document Chunk 13186 ---
V_lim is the speed limit for the first step in km/h 

--- Document Chunk 13187 ---
x = 16.85 

--- Document Chunk 13188 ---
y = 0.428 

--- Document Chunk 13189 ---
A.3.7.4 The first step of the basic deceleration shall be calculated as AD_0 = A * λo + B 

--- Document Chunk 13190 ---
AD_0 is the basic deceleration in m/s2 for 0 ≤ speed ≤ V_lim. 

--- Document Chunk 13191 ---
A = 0.0075 

--- Document Chunk 13192 ---
B = 0.076 

--- Document Chunk 13193 ---
A.3.7.5 The following steps of the basic deceleration shall be calculated by means of a set of 

--- Document Chunk 13194 ---
polynomials of the third order with the following format: 

--- Document Chunk 13195 ---
AD_n = a3_n * λo3 + a2_n * λo2 + a1_n * λo + a0_n 

--- Document Chunk 13196 ---
and with the following values for n (all speed limits in km/h): 

--- Document Chunk 13197 ---
n = 1   valid for V_lim < speed ≤ 100  if V_lim < 100 

--- Document Chunk 13198 ---
to be ignored      if V_lim ≥ 100 

--- Document Chunk 13199 ---
n = 2   valid for V_lim < speed ≤ 120  if 100 < V_lim < 120 

--- Document Chunk 13200 ---
valid for 100 < speed ≤ 120   if V_lim ≤ 100 

--- Document Chunk 13201 ---
to be ignored      if V_lim ≥ 120 

--- Document Chunk 13202 ---
n = 3   valid for V_lim < speed ≤ 150  if 120 < V_lim < 150 

--- Document Chunk 13203 ---
valid for 120 < speed ≤ 150   if V_lim ≤ 120 

--- Document Chunk 13204 ---
to be ignored      if V_lim ≥ 150 

--- Document Chunk 13205 ---
n = 4   valid for V_lim < speed ≤ 180  if 150 < V_lim < 180 

--- Document Chunk 13206 ---
valid for 150 < speed ≤ 180   if V_lim ≤ 150 

--- Document Chunk 13207 ---
to be ignored      if V_lim ≥ 180 

--- Document Chunk 13208 ---
n = 5   valid for V_lim < speed    if V_lim > 180 

--- Document Chunk 13209 ---
valid for 180 < speed    if V_lim ≤ 180 

--- Document Chunk 13210 ---
A.3.7.6 The coefficients for the polynomials shall be defined as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 13211 ---
am_n   m =   

--- Document Chunk 13212 ---
  3 2 1 0 

--- Document Chunk 13213 ---
 1 -6.30E-07 6.10E-05 4.72E-03 0.0663 

--- Document Chunk 13214 ---
 2 2.73E-07 -4.54E-06 5.14E-03 0.1300 

--- Document Chunk 13215 ---
n = 3 5.58E-08 -6.76E-06 5.81E-03 0.0479 

--- Document Chunk 13216 ---
 4 3.00E-08 -3.85E-06 5.52E-03 0.0480 

--- Document Chunk 13217 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 13218 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13219 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13220 ---

--- Document Chunk 13227 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13228 ---
 5 3.23E-09 1.66E-06 5.06E-03 0.0559 

--- Document Chunk 13229 ---
A.3.8 Calculation of the emergency brake reaction time and 

--- Document Chunk 13230 ---
emergency brake equivalent time 

--- Document Chunk 13231 ---
A.3.8.1 The basic brake build up time for the emergency brake with the brake position in 

--- Document Chunk 13232 ---
passenger trains in P shall be calculated as: 

--- Document Chunk 13233 ---
T_brake_basic_eb = a + b * (L/100) + c * (L/100)2 

--- Document Chunk 13234 ---
where 

--- Document Chunk 13235 ---
L = MAX (400m; train length in m) 

--- Document Chunk 13236 ---
a = 2.30 

--- Document Chunk 13237 ---
b = 0.00 

--- Document Chunk 13238 ---
c = 0.17 

--- Document Chunk 13239 ---
A.3.8.2 The basic brake build up time for the emergency brake with the brake position in freight 

--- Document Chunk 13240 ---
trains in P shall be calculated as: 

--- Document Chunk 13241 ---
T_brake_basic_eb = a + b * (L/100) + c * (L/100)2 

--- Document Chunk 13242 ---
where 

--- Document Chunk 13243 ---
L = MAX (400m; train length in m) 

--- Document Chunk 13244 ---
If train length ≤ 900m: 

--- Document Chunk 13245 ---
a = 2.30 

--- Document Chunk 13246 ---
b = 0.00 

--- Document Chunk 13247 ---
c = 0.17 

--- Document Chunk 13248 ---
If 900m < train length ≤ 1500m: 

--- Document Chunk 13249 ---
a = -0.40 

--- Document Chunk 13250 ---
b = 1.60 

--- Document Chunk 13251 ---
c = 0.03 

--- Document Chunk 13252 ---
A.3.8.3 The basic brake build up time for the emergency brake with the brake position in freight 

--- Document Chunk 13253 ---
trains in G shall be calculated as: 

--- Document Chunk 13254 ---
T_brake_basic_eb = a + b * (L/100) + c * (L/100)2 

--- Document Chunk 13255 ---
where 

--- Document Chunk 13256 ---
L = train length in m 

--- Document Chunk 13257 ---
If train length ≤ 900m: 

--- Document Chunk 13258 ---
a = 12.00 

--- Document Chunk 13259 ---
b = 0.00 

--- Document Chunk 13260 ---
c = 0.05 

--- Document Chunk 13261 ---
If 900m < train length ≤ 1500m: 

--- Document Chunk 13262 ---
a = -0.40 

--- Document Chunk 13263 ---
b = 1.60 

--- Document Chunk 13264 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 13265 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13266 ---

--- Document Chunk 13274 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13275 ---
c = 0.03 

--- Document Chunk 13276 ---
A.3.8.4 The equivalent brake build up time for the emergency brake shall be computed as 

--- Document Chunk 13277 ---
follows: 

--- Document Chunk 13278 ---
T_brake_emergency_cm0 = T_brake_basic_eb when V_target = 0 

--- Document Chunk 13279 ---
T_brake_emergency_cmt = kto * T_brake_basic_eb when V_target > 0 

--- Document Chunk 13280 ---
where 

--- Document Chunk 13281 ---
V_target is the target speed 

--- Document Chunk 13282 ---
A.3.8.5 The correction factor kto shall depend on the brake position as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 13283 ---
kto = 1 + Ct 

--- Document Chunk 13284 ---
where 

--- Document Chunk 13285 ---
Ct = 0.16  for freight trains in G 

--- Document Chunk 13286 ---
Ct = 0.20  for freight trains in P 

--- Document Chunk 13287 ---
Ct = 0.20  for passenger trains 

--- Document Chunk 13288 ---
A.3.8.6 The brake reaction times for the emergency brake shall be defined as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 13289 ---
category T_brake_emergency_react 

--- Document Chunk 13290 ---
brake position in passenger trains 1.42 s 

--- Document Chunk 13291 ---
brake position in freight trains in P 2.99 s 

--- Document Chunk 13292 ---
brake position in freight trains in G 9.30 s 

--- Document Chunk 13293 ---

--- Document Chunk 13294 ---

--- Document Chunk 13303 ---

where 

--- Document Chunk 13307 ---

--- Document Chunk 13308 ---
If train length ≤ 900m: 

--- Document Chunk 13309 ---
a = 3.00

--- Document Chunk 13341 ---

--- Document Chunk 13342 ---

--- Document Chunk 13343 ---
A.3.9.5 The correction factor kto shall be defined as in A.3.8.5 

--- Document Chunk 13344 ---
A.3.9.6 The values of a, b, c , kto and T_brake_service_react used in A.3.9.1, A.3.9.2, A.3.9.3 , 

--- Document Chunk 13345 ---
A.3.9.4 and A.3.9.8 define reference values for the equivalent brake build up time for the 

--- Document Chunk 13346 ---
service brake, which shall be considered as maximum ones. If justified by the specific 

--- Document Chunk 13347 ---
brake system of the train other values of these coefficients, which lead to shorter values 

--- Document Chunk 13348 ---
of the equivalent brake build up time for the service brake, may be used. 

--- Document Chunk 13349 ---
A.3.9.7 Note: Although certain trains may perform better, the reference values for the equivalent 

--- Document Chunk 13350 ---
brake build up time for the service brake, as defined here, are the appropriate basis for 

--- Document Chunk 13351 ---
infrastructure planning. 

--- Document Chunk 13352 ---
A.3.9.8 The brake reaction times for the service brake shall be defined as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 13353 ---
category T_brake_service_react 

--- Document Chunk 13354 ---
brake position in passenger trains 1.06 s 

--- Document Chunk 13355 ---
brake position in freight trains in P 2.07 s 

--- Document Chunk 13356 ---
brake position in freight trains in G 5.70 s

A.3.10 Service brake feedback 

--- Document Chunk 13369 ---
A.3.10.1 The purpose of service brake feedback is to reduce the distance between the SBI and 

--- Document Chunk 13370 ---
EBI supervision limits and between the SBI and SBD curves. 

--- Document Chunk 13371 ---
A.3.10.2 The on-board shall consider the service brake feedback as available for use if: 

--- Document Chunk 13372 ---
a) The service brake feedback is implemented, AND 

--- Document Chunk 13373 ---
b) The national value does not inhibit its use. 

--- Document Chunk 13374 ---
A.3.10.3 Two different types of feedback fr om the service brake are specified, main brake pipe 

--- Document Chunk 13375 ---
pressure and brake cylinder pressure. The algorithms below are made for main brake 

--- Document Chunk 13376 ---
pipe pressure. When brake cylinder pressure is used instead this shall be converted into 

--- Document Chunk 13377 ---
a fictive main brake pressure value in the following way: 

--- Document Chunk 13378 ---
p = fictive main brake pipe pressure (kPa) 

--- Document Chunk 13379 ---
p_cylinder = brake cylinder pressure (kPa) 

--- Document Chunk 13380 ---
k1 = vehicle dependent constant (set by engineering of ETCS on-board; k1 is normally 

--- Document Chunk 13381 ---
between 2.0 and 2.7) 

--- Document Chunk 13382 ---
p =  500  - p_cylinder / k1 

--- Document Chunk 13383 ---
A.3.10.4 The value of T_bs1 and T_bs2 shall be calculated according to the following algorithm 

--- Document Chunk 13384 ---
to take the service brake feedback into account: 

--- Document Chunk 13385 ---
p = current main brake pipe pressure (or fictive main brake pipe pressure calculated in 

--- Document Chunk 13386 ---
A.3.10.3) 

--- Document Chunk 13387 ---
p0 = reference pressure when not braking  

--- Document Chunk 13388 ---
p1 = pressure at which the train starts to brake = p0 - 30  

--- Document Chunk 13389 ---
p2 = pressure limit, under which T_bs1 and T_bs2 are locked = p0 - 60  

--- Document Chunk 13390 ---
p3 = pressure at full service brake = p0 - 150  

--- Document Chunk 13391 ---
Q_feedback_active = a Boolean stating whether the feedback function is active, i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 13392 ---
once it has started to reduce T_bs1 and T_bs2 until the ceiling speed monitoring is 

--- Document Chunk 13393 ---
entered. 

--- Document Chunk 13394 ---
Q_Tbslocked = a boolean stating whether T_bs1 and T_bs2 have been locked to the 

--- Document Chunk 13395 ---
following values due to enough main brake pipe pressure reduction: 

--- Document Chunk 13396 ---
T_bs1_locked =  0 s. 

--- Document Chunk 13397 ---
T_bs2_locked =  2 s. 

--- Document Chunk 13398 ---
Q_displaylocked_P = a boolean stating whether the displayed permitted speed is 

--- Document Chunk 13399 ---
locked due to SB feedback. 

--- Document Chunk 13400 ---
Q_displaylocked_SBI = a boolean stating whether the displayed SBI speed (if any) is 

--- Document Chunk 13401 ---
locked due to SB feedback. 

--- Document Chunk 13402 ---
Q_displaylocked_TD = a boolean stating whether the displayed target distance is 

--- Document Chunk 13403 ---
locked due to SB feedback. 

--- Document Chunk 13404 ---
A displayed value is locked from the moment the SB feedback has started to reduce 

--- Document Chunk 13405 ---
T_bs1 and T_bs2 until the calculated value becomes less than the displayed and 

--- Document Chunk 13406 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 13407 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13408 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13409 ---
SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 13410 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 13411 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 13412 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 13413 ---
Chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 13414 ---
Principles 

--- Document Chunk 13415 ---
Page 236/252 

--- Document Chunk 13416 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13417 ---
locked value. Note: It is only SB feedback that can start the locking of the displayed 

--- Document Chunk 13418 ---
values. Once started and still locked it remains locked also in case the calculated 

--- Document Chunk 13419 ---
values are increased due to other reasons (e.g. due to relocation), which will prolong 

--- Document Chunk 13420 ---
the locking period. 

--- Document Chunk 13421 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13422 ---
Initial values when the target speed monitoring is entered or when the release speed 

--- Document Chunk 13423 ---
monitoring is entered not from target speed monitoring: 

--- Document Chunk 13424 ---
Tbs1_prev= Tbs 

--- Document Chunk 13425 ---
Q_feedback_active = false 

--- Document Chunk 13426 ---
Q_displaylocked_P = false 

--- Document Chunk 13427 ---
Q_displaylocked_SBI = false 

--- Document Chunk 13428 ---
Q_displaylocked_TD = false 

--- Document Chunk 13429 ---
Q_Tbslocked =false 

--- Document Chunk 13430 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13431 ---
If on-board is in target speed monitoring or release speed monitoring then 

--- Document Chunk 13432 ---
 If Q_Tbslocked then 

--- Document Chunk 13433 ---
  T_bs1 = T_bs1_locked 

--- Document Chunk 13434 ---
  T_bs2 = T_bs2_locked 

--- Document Chunk 13435 ---
 Else 

--- Document Chunk 13436 ---
  If p > p2 then 

--- Document Chunk 13437 ---
   If Q_feedback_active or p ≤ p1 then  

--- Document Chunk 13438 ---
    Q_feedback_active = true 

--- Document Chunk 13439 ---
    T_bs_feedback = T_bs * (p - p3) / (p0 - p3) 

--- Document Chunk 13440 ---
    T_bs1 = T_bs2 = T_bs_feedback 

--- Document Chunk 13441 ---
    If T_bs_feedback > T_bs then 

--- Document Chunk 13442 ---
     T_bs1 = T_bs2 = T_bs 

--- Document Chunk 13443 ---
    Else if T_bs_feedback < T_bs2_locked then 

--- Document Chunk 13444 ---
     T_bs2 = T_bs2_locked 

--- Document Chunk 13445 ---
    End If 

--- Document Chunk 13446 ---
   Else 

--- Document Chunk 13447 ---
    T_bs1 = T_bs 

--- Document Chunk 13448 ---
    T_bs2 = T_bs 

--- Document Chunk 13449 ---
   End If 

--- Document Chunk 13450 ---
  Else 

--- Document Chunk 13451 ---
   T_bs1 = T_bs1_locked 

--- Document Chunk 13452 ---
   T_bs2 = T_bs2_locked 

--- Document Chunk 13453 ---
   Q_feedback_active = true 

--- Document Chunk 13454 ---
   Q_Tbslocked = true 

--- Document Chunk 13455 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 13456 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13457 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13458 ---

--- Document Chunk 13463 ---

--- Document Chunk 13465 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13466 ---
  End If 

--- Document Chunk 13467 ---
 End If 

--- Document Chunk 13468 ---
Else 

--- Document Chunk 13469 ---
 T_bs1 = T_bs 

--- Document Chunk 13470 ---
 T_bs2 = T_bs 

--- Document Chunk 13471 ---
End if  

--- Document Chunk 13472 ---
If Q_feedback_active and T_bs1 < T_bs1_prev then 

--- Document Chunk 13473 ---
 Q_displaylocked_P = true 

--- Document Chunk 13474 ---
 Q_displaylocked_SBI = true 

--- Document Chunk 13475 ---
 Q_displaylocked_TD = true 

--- Document Chunk 13476 ---
End If 

--- Document Chunk 13477 ---
T_bs1_prev = T_bs1 

--- Document Chunk 13478 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13479 ---
If Q_displaylocked_P and the permitted speed computed for display purposes (VP-DMI) 

--- Document Chunk 13480 ---
as per clause 3.13.10.4.3 is less than the locked and displayed permitted speed, then 

--- Document Chunk 13481 ---
 Q_displaylocked_P = false 

--- Document Chunk 13482 ---
End If 

--- Document Chunk 13483 ---
If Q_displaylocked_SBI and the SBI speed computed for display purposes (VSBI-DMI) as 

--- Document Chunk 13484 ---
per clause 3.13.10.4.4 is less than the locked and displayed SBI speed, then 

--- Document Chunk 13485 ---
 Q_displaylocked_SBI = false 

--- Document Chunk 13486 ---
End If 

--- Document Chunk 13487 ---
If Q_displaylocked_TD and the target distance computed for display purposes as per 

--- Document Chunk 13488 ---
clause 3.13.10.4.7 is less than the locked and displayed target distance, then 

--- Document Chunk 13489 ---
 Q_displaylocked_TD = false 

--- Document Chunk 13490 ---
End If 

--- Document Chunk 13491 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13492 ---
If the MRDT changes then  

--- Document Chunk 13493 ---
 Q_displaylocked_P = false 

--- Document Chunk 13494 ---
 Q_displaylocked_SBI = false  

--- Document Chunk 13495 ---
 Q_displaylocked_TD = false 

--- Document Chunk 13496 ---
End If 

--- Document Chunk 13497 ---

SUBSET-026-3 

--- Document Chunk 13502 ---

System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 13505 ---

--- Document Chunk 13508 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13509 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13510 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13511 ---
The reference pressure p0 (nominal value 500 kPa) shall be set on starting the ETCS:  

--- Document Chunk 13512 ---
 a) To the first stable p value between 400-550 kPa achieved.  

--- Document Chunk 13513 ---
 b) Stable in this instance means that the pressure has not varied more than ± 20 

--- Document Chunk 13514 ---
kPa over 3 seconds. 

--- Document Chunk 13515 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13516 ---
 The reference pressure p0 shall thereafter be adapted to the current pressure 

--- Document Chunk 13517 ---
according to the following table (which applies if the calculation is performed once per 

--- Document Chunk 13518 ---
second): 

--- Document Chunk 13519 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13520 ---
 CONDITIONS: ACTION: REMARKS 

--- Document Chunk 13521 ---
a) p = p0 No change Constant pressure 

--- Document Chunk 13522 ---
b) p > p0 p0 = p0 + 1,5 Increasing pressure 

--- Document Chunk 13523 ---
c) p < p0 - 30 No change Braking 

--- Document Chunk 13524 ---
d) p0 > p > p0 - 30 p0 = p0 − 0,5 Decreasing pressure 

--- Document Chunk 13525 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13526 ---
Where: 

--- Document Chunk 13527 ---
- p is limited to max 550 kPa. 

--- Document Chunk 13528 ---
- Values given in kPa. 

--- Document Chunk 13529 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13530 ---

--- Document Chunk 13531 ---
target, the locking will remain even if the train speed comes below the target speed. This 

--- Document Chunk 13532 ---
avoids “jumping” indications related to the values of T_bs1 and T_bs2 . It also makes it

--- Document Chunk 13574 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 13575 ---
possible to release the brakes before a speed reduction, without having the curves 

--- Document Chunk 13576 ---
moving back again. It might though result in emergency b rake intervention if the driver 

--- Document Chunk 13577 ---
releases the brakes too early. But since EBI is not moved, this is not a safety issue. To 

--- Document Chunk 13578 ---
keep 2 s between the SBI and EBI enables the service brake to be activated first and 

--- Document Chunk 13579 ---
thus may avoid emergency brake. 

--- Document Chunk 13580 ---

--- Document Chunk 13581 ---
will remain active until the ceiling speed monitoring is entered . This avoids “jumping” 

--- Document Chunk 13582 ---
indications in some rare situations.

--- Document Chunk 13623 ---
A.3.12 Calculation of reduced values of safe brake build up time and 

--- Document Chunk 13624 ---
expected brake build up time 

--- Document Chunk 13625 ---
A.3.12.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 13626 ---
A.3.12.1.1 Modelling the brake build up effort using a ramp function rather than a step function 

--- Document Chunk 13627 ---
allows to predict that a certain deceleration development may be enough to safely reach 

--- Document Chunk 13628 ---
a target with only a portion of the equivalent brake build up time elapsed. 

--- Document Chunk 13629 ---
A.3.12.1.2 This section defines how the safe brake build up time and expected brake build up times 

--- Document Chunk 13630 ---
can be reduced to take profit of such effect. 

--- Document Chunk 13631 ---
A.3.12.1.3 This computation is done for each target according to the following seven steps:  

--- Document Chunk 13632 ---
a) Determination of the inputs for the computation; 

--- Document Chunk 13633 ---
b) Extrapolation of the train speed development over the brake reaction time, to check 

--- Document Chunk 13634 ---
whether this extrapolated speed is above the target speed at this time; 

--- Document Chunk 13635 ---
c) Extrapolation of the train speed development over the full brake build up time along 

--- Document Chunk 13636 ---
the ramp model; 

--- Document Chunk 13637 ---
d) Computation of the time at which the target speed is reached along the ramp model, 

--- Document Chunk 13638 ---
for the targets whose speed is higher than this train speed extrapolated as per bullet 

--- Document Chunk 13639 ---
c); 

--- Document Chunk 13640 ---
e) Computation of the corresponding travelled distances; 

--- Document Chunk 13641 ---
f) Conversion of these travelled distances into reduced values of safe and expected 

--- Document Chunk 13642 ---
(equivalent) brake build up times that are to be used in the formulas to derive the 

--- Document Chunk 13643 ---
EBI/SBI supervision limits; 

--- Document Chunk 13644 ---
g) Selection of the highest reduced values of safe and expected (equivalent) brake build 

--- Document Chunk 13645 ---
up times amongst the ones ensuring equivalent speed reduction and the ones 

--- Document Chunk 13646 ---
ensuring equivalent travelled distance. 

--- Document Chunk 13647 ---
A.3.12.1.4 Exception: in case the conversion model is used and 𝐾𝑡_𝑖𝑛𝑡 =0, the rest of section A.3.12 

--- Document Chunk 13648 ---
does not apply for 𝑇𝑏𝑒_𝑟𝑒𝑑𝑢𝑐𝑒𝑑 determination and 𝑇𝑏𝑒_𝑟𝑒𝑑𝑢𝑐𝑒𝑑 shall be set to 𝑇𝑏𝑒. 

--- Document Chunk 13649 ---
A.3.12.1.5 Exception: if 𝑇𝑡𝑟𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛 ≥𝑇𝑏𝑒, the rest of section A.3.12 does not app ly for 𝑇𝑏𝑒_𝑟𝑒𝑑𝑢𝑐𝑒𝑑 

--- Document Chunk 13650 ---
determination and 𝑇𝑏𝑒_𝑟𝑒𝑑𝑢𝑐𝑒𝑑 shall be set to 𝑇𝑏𝑒. 

--- Document Chunk 13651 ---

--- Document Chunk 13897 ---

--- Document Chunk 13898 ---
A.3.12.9 Informative annex: derivation of the formulas 

--- Document Chunk 13899 ---
A.3.12.9.1 The purpose of this part is to explain how the formulas given in the rest of section A.3.12 

--- Document Chunk 13900 ---
have been obtained. The explanation is based on the emergency brake related formulas, 

--- Document Chunk 13901 ---
A.3.12.7.17 explains how these can be modified to obtain service brake related formulas. 

--- Document Chunk 13902 ---
A.3.12.9.2 About A.3.12.3&4:  For these calcul ations, it is assumed (refer to figure 45 and 

--- Document Chunk 13903 ---
3.13.9.3.2) that once the emergency brake command is triggered, the train speed 

--- Document Chunk 13904 ---
(compensated for the speed measurement inaccuracy 𝑉𝑑𝑒𝑙𝑡𝑎0) increases with 𝐴𝑒𝑠𝑡1 

--- Document Chunk 13905 ---
acceleration up to 𝑇𝑡𝑟𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛_𝑚𝑎𝑥 time and then with 𝐴𝑒𝑠𝑡2 acceleration. This speed 

--- Document Chunk 13906 ---
increase is compensated by the 𝐴𝐸𝐵 deceleration coming from the brake force as per the 

--- Document Chunk 13907 ---
ramp model from 𝑇𝑏𝑒_𝑟𝑒𝑎𝑐𝑡 to 𝑡2𝑏𝑒 (refer to Figure 31). The average deceleration coming 

--- Document Chunk 13908 ---
from the brake force is half of its final (full) value. 

--- Document Chunk 13909 ---

--- Document Chunk 14065 ---
A.3.12.9.7 The value of 𝐷𝑡2𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ is the value of 𝑑_𝑟𝑎𝑚𝑝(𝑡2𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ). It must be noticed that after 

--- Document Chunk 14066 ---
having travelled this distance, the wanted final speed is reached, i.e. no distance is to be 

--- Document Chunk 14067 ---
travelled over the EBD curve. 

--- Document Chunk 14068 ---
A.3.12.9.8 About A.3.12.7: Because the model that is  used in section 3.13 is a step model, we 

--- Document Chunk 14069 ---
need to find which (artificial) value of 𝑇𝑏𝑒 (𝑡𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ_𝑠𝑡𝑒𝑝_𝑑𝑖𝑠𝑡, here called 𝑡𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛) would 

--- Document Chunk 14070 ---
lead to obtaining the same travelled distance 𝐷𝑡2𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ. In contrast to the use of t he 

--- Document Chunk 14071 ---
ramp model, a section of the EBD curve is needed here, between this sought time 𝑡𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛 

--- Document Chunk 14072 ---
and the time the wanted final speed 𝑉𝑡𝑎𝑟𝑔𝑒𝑡, here called 𝑉𝑇) is reached. 

--- Document Chunk 14073 ---

--- Document Chunk 14253 ---
A.3.12.9.16 Since 𝑡𝑏𝑒_𝑋 =

--- Document Chunk 14254 ---
𝑉𝑒𝑠𝑡+𝑉𝑑𝑒𝑙𝑡𝑎0+(𝐴𝑒𝑠𝑡1−𝐴𝑒𝑠𝑡2)∙𝑇𝑡𝑟𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛_𝑚𝑖𝑛

--- Document Chunk 14255 ---
−𝐴𝑒𝑠𝑡2

--- Document Chunk 14256 ---
 is always < 0, t he valid solution of the 

--- Document Chunk 14257 ---
quadratic equation is derived from the positive sign in front of the square root. 

--- Document Chunk 14258 ---
A.3.12.9.17 About A.3.12.8:  This value 𝑡𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛, i.e. 𝑡𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ_𝑠𝑡𝑒𝑝_𝑑𝑖𝑠𝑡, ensures that the distance 

--- Document Chunk 14259 ---
travelled along the step model (supporting section 3.13 formulas) is equivalent to the one 

--- Document Chunk 14260 ---
computed along the ramp model. However, it does not ensure that the speed reduction 

--- Document Chunk 14261 ---
is equivalent along both models. 

--- Document Chunk 14262 ---
A.3.12.9.18 Therefore, an equivalent brake build up time 𝑡𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ_𝑠𝑡𝑒𝑝_𝑑𝑒𝑙𝑡𝑎𝑉 computed from 

--- Document Chunk 14263 ---
𝑡2𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ is used as a lower limit to the final 𝑇𝑏𝑒_𝑟𝑒𝑑𝑢𝑐𝑒𝑑 value. Its computation is similar 

--- Document Chunk 14264 ---
to the one defined by clause 3.13.2.2.3.2.4: 

--- Document Chunk 14265 ---
𝑡𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ_𝑠𝑡𝑒𝑝_𝑑𝑒𝑙𝑡𝑎𝑉 =𝑇𝑏𝑒_𝑟𝑒𝑎𝑐𝑡 +

--- Document Chunk 14266 ---
𝑡2𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ−𝑇𝑏𝑒_𝑟𝑒𝑎𝑐𝑡

--- Document Chunk 14267 ---
2 =

--- Document Chunk 14268 ---
𝑇𝑏𝑒_𝑟𝑒𝑎𝑐𝑡+𝑡2𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ

--- Document Chunk 14269 ---
2    

--- Document Chunk 14270 ---
A.3.12.9.19 About service brake related formulas:  They can be obtained from the emergency 

--- Document Chunk 14271 ---
brake ones by setting 𝑉𝑑𝑒𝑙𝑡𝑎0,  𝑇𝑡𝑟𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛_𝑚𝑖𝑛,  𝑇𝑡𝑟𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛_𝑚𝑎𝑥, 𝐴𝑒𝑠𝑡1 and 𝐴𝑒𝑠𝑡2  to zero and 

--- Document Chunk 14272 ---
making the following substitutions: 𝑉𝑡2𝑏𝑒 =𝑉𝑡2𝑏𝑠 ; 𝑇𝑏𝑒_𝑟𝑒𝑎𝑐𝑡 =𝑇𝑏𝑠_𝑟𝑒𝑎𝑐𝑡 ; 𝑡2𝑏𝑒 =𝑡2𝑏𝑠 ; 𝐴𝐸𝐵 =

--- Document Chunk 14273 ---
𝐴𝑆𝐵 ; 𝐴𝑠𝑎𝑓𝑒_𝑚𝑎𝑥 =𝐴𝑒𝑥𝑝𝑒𝑐𝑡𝑒𝑑_𝑚𝑎𝑥 ; 𝐷𝑡2𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ =𝐷𝑡2𝑏𝑠_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ ; 𝑡2𝑏𝑒_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ =𝑡2𝑏𝑠_𝑒𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑔ℎ. 

--- Document Chunk 14274 ---
A.3.13 Inhibition of increase of displayed permitted speed and SBI 

--- Document Chunk 14275 ---
speed 

--- Document Chunk 14276 ---
A.3.13.1 This appendix specifies under which conditions the displayed permitted speed and SBI 

--- Document Chunk 14277 ---
speed are locked in order to avoid their increase which could be caused by active 

--- Document Chunk 14278 ---
reduction of brake build up times (see Appendix A.3.12). 

--- Document Chunk 14279 ---
A.3.13.2 The boolean stating whether the displayed permitted speed and SBI speed are not 

--- Document Chunk 14280 ---
allowed to increase (Q_display_pawl) shall be calculated according to the following 

--- Document Chunk 14281 ---
algorithm: 

--- Document Chunk 14282 ---
If on-board is in target speed monitoring or release speed monitoring then 

--- Document Chunk 14283 ---
If the MRDT changes then  

--- Document Chunk 14284 ---
Q_display_pawl = false 

--- Document Chunk 14285 ---
Else if T_be_reduced computed for any target is lower than T_be then 

--- Document Chunk 14286 ---
Q_display_pawl = true 

--- Document Chunk 14287 ---
Else if the service brake command is available for use, the service brake 

--- Document Chunk 14288 ---
feedback is not available for use, and T_bs_reduced computed for any 

--- Document Chunk 14289 ---
target is lower than T_bs then 

--- Document Chunk 14290 ---
Q_display_pawl = true 

--- Document Chunk 14291 ---
Else 

--- Document Chunk 14292 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

Q_display_pawl = false 

--- Document Chunk 14304 ---
End if 

--- Document Chunk 14305 ---
Else 

--- Document Chunk 14306 ---
Q_display_pawl = false 

--- Document Chunk 14307 ---
End if

--- Document Chunk 14699 ---
4.3 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 14700 ---
4.3.1 Presentation of the document 

--- Document Chunk 14701 ---
4.3.1.1 This document defines the modes of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment (see  

--- Document Chunk 14702 ---
chapter 4.4 “Definition of the modes” and chapter 4.5 “Modes and on-board functions”). 

--- Document Chunk 14703 ---
4.3.1.2 This document gives all transitions between modes (see chapter 4.6 “Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 14704 ---
between modes”). 

--- Document Chunk 14705 ---
4.3.1.3 This document describes the possible exchanged information between the driver and the 

--- Document Chunk 14706 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, respect to the mode (see chapter  4.7 “ DMI 

--- Document Chunk 14707 ---
depending on modes”). 

--- Document Chunk 14708 ---
4.3.1.4 This document describes how the received information is filtered, respect to several 

--- Document Chunk 14709 ---
criteria such as the level, the mode, etc. (see chapter 4.8 “Acceptance of received 

--- Document Chunk 14710 ---
information”). 

--- Document Chunk 14711 ---
4.3.1.5 This document describes how the stored information is handled, respect t o several 

--- Document Chunk 14712 ---
criteria such as the level, the mode, etc. (see chapter 4.9 “What happens to accepted 

--- Document Chunk 14713 ---
and stored information when entering a given level”, and chapter 4.10 “What happens to 

--- Document Chunk 14714 ---
accepted and stored information when entering a given mode”). 

--- Document Chunk 14715 ---
4.3.1.6 All the tab les that are included in this document shall be considered as mandatory 

--- Document Chunk 14716 ---
requirements. 

--- Document Chunk 14717 ---
4.3.1.7 Some notes appear in this document. These notes are here to help the reader to 

--- Document Chunk 14718 ---
understand the specifications, or to explain the reason(s) of a requirement. 

--- Document Chunk 14719 ---
4.3.2 Identification of the possible modes 

--- Document Chunk 14720 ---
4.3.2.1 List of the modes: 

--- Document Chunk 14721 ---
Full Supervision   (FS) 

--- Document Chunk 14722 ---
Automatic Driving  (AD) 

--- Document Chunk 14723 ---
Limited Supervision  (LS) 

--- Document Chunk 14724 ---
On Sight    (OS) 

--- Document Chunk 14725 ---
Staff Responsible  (SR) 

--- Document Chunk 14726 ---
Supervised Manoeuvre  (SM) 

--- Document Chunk 14727 ---
Shunting    (SH) 

--- Document Chunk 14728 ---
Unfitted    (UN) 

--- Document Chunk 14729 ---
Passive Shunting   (PS) 

--- Document Chunk 14730 ---
Sleeping    (SL) 

--- Document Chunk 14731 ---
Stand By    (SB) 

--- Document Chunk 14732 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 14733 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14734 ---

--- Document Chunk 14742 ---

--- Document Chunk 14743 ---

--- Document Chunk 14744 ---

--- Document Chunk 14745 ---

--- Document Chunk 14746 ---

--- Document Chunk 14747 ---

--- Document Chunk 14758 ---
4.4 Definition of the modes 

--- Document Chunk 14759 ---
4.4.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 14760 ---
4.4.1.1 For each mode the following information is given: 

--- Document Chunk 14761 ---
a) The context of utilisation of the mode and the functions that characterise the mode 

--- Document Chunk 14762 ---
(chapter “Description”).  

--- Document Chunk 14763 ---
b) The ERTMS/ETCS levels in which the mode can be used (chapter “Used in levels”). 

--- Document Chunk 14764 ---
c) The related responsibility of the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment and of the driver, 

--- Document Chunk 14765 ---
once the equipment is in this mode (chapter “Responsibilities”). 

--- Document Chunk 14766 ---
4.4.1.2 A complete list of transitions to and from each mode is given in the section 4.6.2 

--- Document Chunk 14767 ---
“Transitions Table”). 

--- Document Chunk 14768 ---
4.4.2 General Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 14769 ---
4.4.2.1 When the desk is open, a clear indication of the ERTMS/ETCS mode shall be shown to 

--- Document Chunk 14770 ---
the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 14771 ---
4.4.2.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 14772 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 14773 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14774 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 14775 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 14776 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 14777 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 14778 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 14779 ---
Page 11/93 

--- Document Chunk 14780 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14781 ---
4.4.3 ISOLATION 

--- Document Chunk 14782 ---
4.4.3.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 14783 ---
4.4.3.1.1 In Isolation mode, t he ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall be physically isolated 

--- Document Chunk 14784 ---
from the brakes and can be isolated from other on-board equipments/systems depending 

--- Document Chunk 14785 ---
on the specific on-board implementation. 

--- Document Chunk 14786 ---
4.4.3.1.2 There shall be a clear indication to the driver that the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 14787 ---
is isolated. 

--- Document Chunk 14788 ---
4.4.3.1.3 To leave Isolation mode, a special operating procedure is needed (no transition from 

--- Document Chunk 14789 ---
Isolation is specified). This procedure shall ensure that the on -board equipment is only 

--- Document Chunk 14790 ---
put back into service when it has been proven that this is safe for operation. 

--- Document Chunk 14791 ---
4.4.3.1.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 14792 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14793 ---
4.4.3.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 14794 ---
4.4.3.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 14795 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14796 ---
4.4.3.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 14797 ---
4.4.3.3.1 Isolation of the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is performed by the driver under his 

--- Document Chunk 14798 ---
complete responsibility. 

--- Document Chunk 14799 ---
4.4.3.3.2 Once the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is isolated, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 14800 ---
equipment has no more responsibility. 

--- Document Chunk 14801 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 14802 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14803 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 14804 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 14805 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 14806 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 14807 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 14808 ---
Page 12/93 

--- Document Chunk 14809 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14810 ---
4.4.4 NO POWER 

--- Document Chunk 14811 ---
4.4.4.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 14812 ---
4.4.4.1.1 When the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is not powered, the equipment is in the No 

--- Document Chunk 14813 ---
Power mode. 

--- Document Chunk 14814 ---
4.4.4.1.1.1 Note: in order to ensure cold mo vement detection function, some parts of the 

--- Document Chunk 14815 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment may be fed by an auxiliary power supply. 

--- Document Chunk 14816 ---
4.4.4.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall permanently command the emergency 

--- Document Chunk 14817 ---
brake. 

--- Document Chunk 14818 ---
4.4.4.1.3 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 14819 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14820 ---
4.4.4.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 14821 ---
4.4.4.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 14822 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14823 ---
4.4.4.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 14824 ---
4.4.4.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has no responsibility in this mode, except 

--- Document Chunk 14825 ---
commanding the emergency brake and (optionally) monitoring cold movements. 

--- Document Chunk 14826 ---
4.4.4.3.2 The notion of responsibility of the driver is not relevant for the No Power mode. 

--- Document Chunk 14827 ---
4.4.4.3.3 If it is required to move a loco in NP mode as a wagon, ETCS brake command must be 

--- Document Chunk 14828 ---
overridden by external means. 

--- Document Chunk 14829 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 14830 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14831 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 14832 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 14833 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 14834 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 14835 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 14836 ---
Page 13/93 

--- Document Chunk 14837 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14838 ---
4.4.5 SYSTEM FAILURE 

--- Document Chunk 14839 ---
4.4.5.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 14840 ---
4.4.5.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall switch to the System Failure mode in case 

--- Document Chunk 14841 ---
of a fault, which affects safety. 

--- Document Chunk 14842 ---
4.4.5.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall permanently command the Emergency 

--- Document Chunk 14843 ---
Brakes. 

--- Document Chunk 14844 ---
4.4.5.1.3 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 14845 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14846 ---
4.4.5.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 14847 ---
4.4.5.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 14848 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14849 ---
4.4.5.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 14850 ---
4.4.5.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is responsible for commanding the Emergency 

--- Document Chunk 14851 ---
Brakes. 

--- Document Chunk 14852 ---
4.4.5.3.2 No responsibility of the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 14853 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 14854 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14855 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 14856 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 14857 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 14858 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 14859 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 14860 ---
Page 14/93 

--- Document Chunk 14861 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14862 ---
4.4.6 SLEEPING 

--- Document Chunk 14863 ---
4.4.6.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 14864 ---
4.4.6.1.1 The Sleeping mode is defined to manage the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment of a 

--- Document Chunk 14865 ---
slave engine that is remote controlled. 

--- Document Chunk 14866 ---
4.4.6.1.2 The desk(s) of a sleeping engine must be closed (since there is no driver, no information 

--- Document Chunk 14867 ---
shall be shown). 

--- Document Chunk 14868 ---
4.4.6.1.3 As the engine is remote controlled by the leading engine, its ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 14869 ---
equipment shall not perform any train movement supervision. 

--- Document Chunk 14870 ---
4.4.6.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform the Train Position function; in 

--- Document Chunk 14871 ---
particular, the front/rear end of the engine (i.e., not the train) shall be used to refer to 

--- Document Chunk 14872 ---
train front/rear end. 

--- Document Chunk 14873 ---
4.4.6.1.5 Sleeping mode shall be automatically detected on-board via the train interface. 

--- Document Chunk 14874 ---
4.4.6.1.6 If possible, the train must not be stopped due to a safety critical fault in a sleeping engine. 

--- Document Chunk 14875 ---
The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment should therefore try to memorise the occurrence 

--- Document Chunk 14876 ---
of such fault(s), which sh ould be handled when the engine leaves the Sleeping mode. 

--- Document Chunk 14877 ---
The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment should also try to send an error information to 

--- Document Chunk 14878 ---
the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 14879 ---
4.4.6.1.7 If a desk of the sleeping engine is opened while the train is running (this is an abnormal 

--- Document Chunk 14880 ---
operation), the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall switch to Stand-By mode. 

--- Document Chunk 14881 ---
4.4.6.1.8 If the sleeping input information is set to "sleeping not requested" (no more detection of 

--- Document Chunk 14882 ---
the remote control), the switch to S tand-By mode shall be made only if the train is at 

--- Document Chunk 14883 ---
standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 14884 ---
4.4.6.1.9 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 14885 ---
4.4.6.1.10 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall open a communication session with the 

--- Document Chunk 14886 ---
RBC when at least one of the following events occurs: 

--- Document Chunk 14887 ---
a) in all levels, on receipt of the order  to establish a communication session with  the 

--- Document Chunk 14888 ---
RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 14889 ---
b) In level 2, when entering or exiting Sleeping mode (to report the change of mode to 

--- Document Chunk 14890 ---
the RBC). 

--- Document Chunk 14891 ---
c) In level 2, when a safety critical fault of the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment occurs 

--- Document Chunk 14892 ---
(to report the fault to the RBC). 

--- Document Chunk 14893 ---
4.4.6.1.11 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 14894 ---
4.4.6.1.12 In case of balise group message consistency error (refer to 3.16.2.4.4 and 3.16.2.5.1), 

--- Document Chunk 14895 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall not command the service brake. 

--- Document Chunk 14896 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 14897 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14898 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 14899 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 14900 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 14901 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 14902 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 14903 ---
Page 15/93 

--- Document Chunk 14904 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14905 ---
4.4.6.1.13 When in level 2, if no compatible version has been established bet ween the on-board 

--- Document Chunk 14906 ---
equipment in Sleeping mode and the RBC, the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 14907 ---
react as specified in 3.5.3.7 d) 2nd bullet but no driver’s indication shall be given. 

--- Document Chunk 14908 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14909 ---
4.4.6.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 14910 ---
4.4.6.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 14911 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14912 ---
4.4.6.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 14913 ---
4.4.6.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment of an engine in Sleeping mode has no 

--- Document Chunk 14914 ---
responsibility for the train protection. 

--- Document Chunk 14915 ---
4.4.6.3.2 The notion of responsibility of the driver is not relevant for the Sleeping mode. 

--- Document Chunk 14916 ---
4.4.6.3.2.1 Note: The leading engine is responsible  for the movement of the train. It is then the 

--- Document Chunk 14917 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment of the leading engine that is fully/partially/not 

--- Document Chunk 14918 ---
responsible for the train protection, with respect to its mode. 

--- Document Chunk 14919 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 14920 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14921 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 14922 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 14923 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 14924 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 14925 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 14926 ---
Page 16/93 

--- Document Chunk 14927 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14928 ---
4.4.7 STAND BY 

--- Document Chunk 14929 ---
4.4.7.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 14930 ---
4.4.7.1.1 The Stand-By mode is a default mode and cannot be selected by the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 14931 ---
4.4.7.1.2 It is in the Stand-By mode that the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment awakes. 

--- Document Chunk 14932 ---
4.4.7.1.3 Data for mission are collected in Stand -By (see SRS -chapter 5: “Start of Mission” 

--- Document Chunk 14933 ---
procedure). 

--- Document Chunk 14934 ---
4.4.7.1.4 In Stand-By mode, the desk of the engine can be open or closed. No interaction with the 

--- Document Chunk 14935 ---
driver shall be possible as long as the desk is closed, except isolation of the 

--- Document Chunk 14936 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 14937 ---
4.4.7.1.5 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall perform the Standstill Supervision, in order 

--- Document Chunk 14938 ---
to prevent the train from moving. 

--- Document Chunk 14939 ---
4.4.7.1.5.1 As soon as a movement is detected, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall start supervising 

--- Document Chunk 14940 ---
(see section 3.6.7) whether the train travels away, from the location when the movement 

--- Document Chunk 14941 ---
was detected, over a distance longer than a distance specified by the National Value. In 

--- Document Chunk 14942 ---
case this distance is exceeded, the brake command shall be triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 14943 ---
4.4.7.1.5.2 Refer to section 3.14.1 for the revocation of the brake command. 

--- Document Chunk 14944 ---
4.4.7.1.5.3 After revocation of the brake command, the Standstill Supervision shall be re-initialised, 

--- Document Chunk 14945 ---
i.e. the clause 4.4.7.1.5.1 shall be applied again. 

--- Document Chunk 14946 ---
4.4.7.1.5.4 If a desk is open, an indication shall be given to the driver showing when the Standstill 

--- Document Chunk 14947 ---
Supervision is commanding the brakes. 

--- Document Chunk 14948 ---
4.4.7.1.6 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform the Train Position function; in 

--- Document Chunk 14949 ---
particular, the front/rear end of the engine shall be used to refer to train front/rear end 

--- Document Chunk 14950 ---
and no train integrity information shall be reported to the RBC, with the following 

--- Document Chunk 14951 ---
exceptions: 

--- Document Chunk 14952 ---
a) If valid Train Data is available, the Train Data “train length” can be used to report train 

--- Document Chunk 14953 ---
integrity information in case other preconditions are fulfilled (see chapter 3 Table 2 c 

--- Document Chunk 14954 ---
for details), OR 

--- Document Chunk 14955 ---
b) If no valid Train Data is available but the safe consist length information is available, 

--- Document Chunk 14956 ---
the train front/rear is determined as per cl auses 3.6.1.3.4 and 3.18.3.2.4 and train 

--- Document Chunk 14957 ---
integrity information can be reported to the RBC in case other preconditions are 

--- Document Chunk 14958 ---
fulfilled (see chapter 3 Table 2c for details). 

--- Document Chunk 14959 ---
4.4.7.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 14960 ---
4.4.7.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2 and level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 14961 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14962 ---
4.4.7.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 14963 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 14964 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14965 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 14966 ---

--- Document Chunk 14971 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 14972 ---
4.4.7.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is responsible for maintaining the train at 

--- Document Chunk 14973 ---
standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 14974 ---
4.4.7.3.2 The driver has no responsibility for train movements. 

--- Document Chunk 14975 ---
