--- Document Chunk 14984 ---
4.4.8 SHUNTING 

--- Document Chunk 14985 ---
4.4.8.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 14986 ---
4.4.8.1.1 The purpose of the Shunting mode is to enable shunting movements. In Shunting mode, 

--- Document Chunk 14987 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall supervise the train movements against: 

--- Document Chunk 14988 ---
a) a ceiling speed: the shunting mode speed limit  

--- Document Chunk 14989 ---
b) a list of expected balise groups (if such list was sent by the trackside equipment). The 

--- Document Chunk 14990 ---
train shall be tripped if a balise gro up, not contained in the list, is passed (When an 

--- Document Chunk 14991 ---
empty list is sent, no balise group can be passed. When no list is sent, all balise 

--- Document Chunk 14992 ---
groups can be passed) 

--- Document Chunk 14993 ---
c) “stop if in shunting mode” information. The train is tripped if such information is 

--- Document Chunk 14994 ---
received from balise groups 

--- Document Chunk 14995 ---
d) Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 14996 ---
4.4.8.1.2 The Shunting mode shall not require Train Data. 

--- Document Chunk 14997 ---
4.4.8.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform the Train Position function ; in 

--- Document Chunk 14998 ---
particular, the front/rear end of the engine shall be used to refer to train front/rear end. 

--- Document Chunk 14999 ---
4.4.8.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall generate the information  to the train 

--- Document Chunk 15000 ---
interface that it is ready for remote shunting. 

--- Document Chunk 15001 ---
4.4.8.1.5 While the ERTMS/ETCS on-board is in Shunting mode, the reception of level transition 

--- Document Chunk 15002 ---
orders has no immediate effec t. The level transition announcements shall be rejected 

--- Document Chunk 15003 ---
and, upon reception of the order while already in Shunting mode , an immediate level 

--- Document Chunk 15004 ---
transition order or a conditional level transition order shall be stored but evaluated only 

--- Document Chunk 15005 ---
when another mode than Shunting or Passive Shunting has been entered (i.e. when the 

--- Document Chunk 15006 ---
Shunting movement is terminated). 

--- Document Chunk 15007 ---
4.4.8.1.5.1 Note: in case the Shunting movement is terminated through a direct transition to No 

--- Document Chunk 15008 ---
Power mode, see clause 4.11.1.4. 

--- Document Chunk 15009 ---
4.4.8.1.5.2 When receiving a communication session establishment order, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 15010 ---
board in Shunting mode shall not establish the communication session, but shall store 

--- Document Chunk 15011 ---
the RBC contact information. 

--- Document Chunk 15012 ---
4.4.8.1.5.3 When in Shunting mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall not manage RBC-RBC hand-

--- Document Chunk 15013 ---
over, except for storing the RBC contact information given at the RBC/RBC border. 

--- Document Chunk 15014 ---
4.4.8.1.6 Shunting mode can be selected by the driver, only accepted when the train is at standstill, 

--- Document Chunk 15015 ---
or ordered by the trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 15016 ---
4.4.8.1.7 In case of selection of Shunting mode by the driver: 

--- Document Chunk 15017 ---
• in level 1 operations, the switch to shunting is always accepted by the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 15018 ---
equipment 

--- Document Chunk 15019 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15020 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15021 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 15022 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 15023 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 15024 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 15025 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 15026 ---
Page 19/93 

--- Document Chunk 15027 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15028 ---
• in level 2 areas, the on -board asks the trackside for an authorisation. The switch to 

--- Document Chunk 15029 ---
shunting is possible only after receiving such authorisation. The trackside can send a 

--- Document Chunk 15030 ---
list of balise  groups, that the train is allowed to pass while in SH, together with the 

--- Document Chunk 15031 ---
authorisation 

--- Document Chunk 15032 ---
4.4.8.1.8 In case of order to switch to Shunting mode from trackside, the order: 

--- Document Chunk 15033 ---
• in level 1 is given by a balise group. A list of balise groups, that the train is allowed to 

--- Document Chunk 15034 ---
pass after the entry in Shunting, can be sent together with the order 

--- Document Chunk 15035 ---
• in level 2 is sent via radio. A list of balise groups, that the train is allowed to pass after 

--- Document Chunk 15036 ---
the entry in Shunting, can be sent together with the order 

--- Document Chunk 15037 ---
4.4.8.1.9 When the switch to shunting is ordered by trackside, a driver acknowledgement is 

--- Document Chunk 15038 ---
requested. 

--- Document Chunk 15039 ---
4.4.8.1.9.1 Note: in Shunting mode the train is only partially supervised, therefore it is necessary 

--- Document Chunk 15040 ---
that the driver takes the responsibility. 

--- Document Chunk 15041 ---
4.4.8.1.10 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the train speed and, only on driver 

--- Document Chunk 15042 ---
request, the permitted speed. The display of the permitted speed shall also be stopped 

--- Document Chunk 15043 ---
on driver request. 

--- Document Chunk 15044 ---
4.4.8.1.11 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15045 ---
4.4.8.1.12 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15046 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15047 ---
4.4.8.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15048 ---
4.4.8.2.1 Used in level 0, NTC, 1 and 2. 

--- Document Chunk 15049 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15050 ---
4.4.8.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15051 ---
4.4.8.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is responsible for the supervision of the shunting 

--- Document Chunk 15052 ---
mode speed limit, and that the engine with the active antenna is tripped when passing 

--- Document Chunk 15053 ---
the defined border of the shunting area (only if there is a defined border: balise group 

--- Document Chunk 15054 ---
not in the list given by trackside, or balise  group giving the information “stop if in 

--- Document Chunk 15055 ---
shunting”). 

--- Document Chunk 15056 ---
4.4.8.3.2 The driver is responsible for: 

--- Document Chunk 15057 ---
a) Remaining inside the shunting area defined by a procedure or an external system 

--- Document Chunk 15058 ---
outside ERTMS/ETCS (also when the shunting area is protected by balises) 

--- Document Chunk 15059 ---
b) Train/engine movements and shunting operations 

--- Document Chunk 15060 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 15069 ---
4.4.9 FULL SUPERVISION 

--- Document Chunk 15070 ---
4.4.9.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15071 ---
4.4.9.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall be in the Full Supervision mode when all 

--- Document Chunk 15072 ---
train and track data, which is required for a complete supervision of the train, is available 

--- Document Chunk 15073 ---
on board. 

--- Document Chunk 15074 ---
4.4.9.1.2 Full supervision cannot be selected by the driver, but is entered automatically when all 

--- Document Chunk 15075 ---
necessary conditions are fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 15076 ---
4.4.9.1.3 To be in Full Supervision mode, SSP and gradient are not required for the whole length 

--- Document Chunk 15077 ---
of the train, but must be available at least from the FRONT END of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 15078 ---
4.4.9.1.4 Once in Full Supervision mode, if SSP and gradient are not known for the whole length 

--- Document Chunk 15079 ---
of the train, an indication “ENT ERINGFS” shall be clearly displayed to the driver until 

--- Document Chunk 15080 ---
SSP and gradient are known for the whole length of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 15081 ---
4.4.9.1.4.1 Note: this indication may also be displayed in case the train length has been increased, 

--- Document Chunk 15082 ---
see 3.18.3.8. 

--- Document Chunk 15083 ---
4.4.9.1.5 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise train movements against a 

--- Document Chunk 15084 ---
dynamic speed profile. 

--- Document Chunk 15085 ---
4.4.9.1.6 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall display the train speed, the permitted 

--- Document Chunk 15086 ---
speed, the target distance and the target speed to the driver (this list is not exhaustive – 

--- Document Chunk 15087 ---
refer to chapter 4.7 “DMI depending on modes”). 

--- Document Chunk 15088 ---
4.4.9.1.7 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15089 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15090 ---
4.4.9.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15091 ---
4.4.9.2.1 Used in level 1 and 2. 

--- Document Chunk 15092 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15093 ---
4.4.9.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15094 ---
4.4.9.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is fully responsible for the train protection 

--- Document Chunk 15095 ---
(except for the 2 situations described below). 

--- Document Chunk 15096 ---
4.4.9.3.2 The driver is responsible for respecting the EOA when approaching an EO A with a 

--- Document Chunk 15097 ---
release speed. 

--- Document Chunk 15098 ---
4.4.9.3.3 When “ENTERING FS” is displayed to the driver, the driver is responsible for respecting 

--- Document Chunk 15099 ---
speed restrictions that apply for the part of the train that is not covered by SSP and 

--- Document Chunk 15100 ---
gradient data. 

--- Document Chunk 15101 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15102 ---

--- Document Chunk 15110 ---
4.4.10 UNFITTED 

--- Document Chunk 15111 ---
4.4.10.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15112 ---
4.4.10.1.1 The Unfitted mode is used to allow train movements in either: 

--- Document Chunk 15113 ---
a) Areas that are equipped neither with ERTMS/ETCS track -side equipment nor with 

--- Document Chunk 15114 ---
national train control system 

--- Document Chunk 15115 ---
b) Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 15116 ---
c) Areas that are equipped with ERTMS/ETCS trackside equipment and/or national train 

--- Document Chunk 15117 ---
control system(s), but operation under their supervision is currently not possible 

--- Document Chunk 15118 ---
4.4.10.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise train movements against a 

--- Document Chunk 15119 ---
ceiling speed: the lowest of the maximum train speed and the Unfitted mode speed limit 

--- Document Chunk 15120 ---
for unfitted area (national value). 

--- Document Chunk 15121 ---
4.4.10.1.2.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15122 ---
4.4.10.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall also supervise temporary speed 

--- Document Chunk 15123 ---
restrictions. 

--- Document Chunk 15124 ---
4.4.10.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the train speed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 15125 ---
4.4.10.1.5 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15126 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15127 ---
4.4.10.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15128 ---
4.4.10.2.1 Used in level 0. 

--- Document Chunk 15129 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15130 ---
4.4.10.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15131 ---
4.4.10.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment supervises a ceiling speed and (if available) 

--- Document Chunk 15132 ---
temporary speed restrictions. 

--- Document Chunk 15133 ---
4.4.10.3.2 The driver must respect the existing line -side signals and is fully responsible for train 

--- Document Chunk 15134 ---
movements. 

--- Document Chunk 15135 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15136 ---

--- Document Chunk 15144 ---
4.4.11 STAFF RESPONSIBLE 

--- Document Chunk 15145 ---
4.4.11.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15146 ---
4.4.11.1.1 The Staff Responsible mode allows the driver to move the train under his own 

--- Document Chunk 15147 ---
responsibility in an ERTMS/ETCS equipped area. 

--- Document Chunk 15148 ---
4.4.11.1.2 This mode is used when the system does not know the route. For example: 

--- Document Chunk 15149 ---
a) After the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment starts-up (awakening of the train). 

--- Document Chunk 15150 ---
b) To pass a signal at danger / override an EOA. 

--- Document Chunk 15151 ---
c) After a trackside failure (for example: loss of radio contact). 

--- Document Chunk 15152 ---
4.4.11.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall supervise train movements against: 

--- Document Chunk 15153 ---
a) a ceiling speed: the staff responsible mode speed limit  

--- Document Chunk 15154 ---
b) a given distance (regarding its supervision starting time/start  location see 

--- Document Chunk 15155 ---
4.4.11.1.3.1). The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall supervise braking curves 

--- Document Chunk 15156 ---
with a target speed of zero to the end of this distance. If the train overpasses this 

--- Document Chunk 15157 ---
distance (see next note) the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall trip the train 

--- Document Chunk 15158 ---
c) a list of expected balise groups, if this list has been sent by the RBC. The train shall 

--- Document Chunk 15159 ---
be tripped if overpassing a balise group that is not in the list. (When an empty list is 

--- Document Chunk 15160 ---
sent, no balise group can be passed. When no list is sent, all balise groups can be 

--- Document Chunk 15161 ---
passed) 

--- Document Chunk 15162 ---
d) balise groups giving the order ‘stop if in SR’. This order shall immediately trip the train, 

--- Document Chunk 15163 ---
unless the overpassed balise group is included in a list of expected balises as defined 

--- Document Chunk 15164 ---
in item c) 

--- Document Chunk 15165 ---
e) running in the direction opposite to the train orientation ( Unauthorised Direction 

--- Document Chunk 15166 ---
Movement Protection) 

--- Document Chunk 15167 ---
4.4.11.1.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall supervise the SR distance as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 15168 ---
a) If the National/Default Value determines the max permitted distance to run in SR 

--- Document Chunk 15169 ---
mode, the calculation of the remaining  distance from the virtual train position to the 

--- Document Chunk 15170 ---
end of the SR distance (see section 3.6.7) shall be based on a supervisio n starting 

--- Document Chunk 15171 ---
when SR mode is entered, or, already in Staff Responsible mode, when Override is 

--- Document Chunk 15172 ---
activated. 

--- Document Chunk 15173 ---
b) If the max permitted distance to run in SR mode is determined by the value transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 15174 ---
by the RBC, or entered by the driver, the calculation of the remaining distance from 

--- Document Chunk 15175 ---
the virtual train position to the end of the SR distance (see section 3.6.7) shall be 

--- Document Chunk 15176 ---
based on a supervision starting when the distance information is received or entered. 

--- Document Chunk 15177 ---
c) If the max permitted distance to run in SR mode is determined by the value transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 15178 ---
by Euroloop, the distance information transmitted by Euroloop shall be referred to one 

--- Document Chunk 15179 ---
or more reference balise groups. On -board shall evaluate the distance to run in SR 

--- Document Chunk 15180 ---
mode by matching the reference balise groups given with the LRBG. 

--- Document Chunk 15181 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15182 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15183 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 15184 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 15185 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 15186 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 15187 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 15188 ---
Page 23/93 

--- Document Chunk 15189 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15190 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15191 ---
4.4.11.1.3.1.1 Note: the end of the SR distance determined from Euroloop, which is originally 

--- Document Chunk 15192 ---
referred to the LRBG at the time of the reception of the Euroloop information, can be 

--- Document Chunk 15193 ---
afterwards relocated to the SOLR that is different from any of the original reference balise 

--- Document Chunk 15194 ---
groups transmitted by Euroloop. 

--- Document Chunk 15195 ---
4.4.11.1.4 Note: Since the gradient profile may not be available , the supervision of the braking 

--- Document Chunk 15196 ---
curves in Staff Responsible mode does not ensure that the train will not pass the given 

--- Document Chunk 15197 ---
distance. 

--- Document Chunk 15198 ---
4.4.11.1.5 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall give the possibility to the driver to modify 

--- Document Chunk 15199 ---
the value of the SR mode speed limit and of the given distance. This shall be possible 

--- Document Chunk 15200 ---
only at standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 15201 ---
4.4.11.1.5.1 If a train movement is detected while the driver is entering the SR speed/distance 

--- Document Chunk 15202 ---
limits, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall trigger the brake command. 

--- Document Chunk 15203 ---
4.4.11.1.5.2 The unit, range and resolution of the SR mode speed limit and distance entered by 

--- Document Chunk 15204 ---
the driver shall be as specified in A.3.11. 

--- Document Chunk 15205 ---
4.4.11.1.6 If the level is 2 and a communication session is open, the driver shall have the possibility 

--- Document Chunk 15206 ---
to request a new distance to run in Staff Responsible, by selecting "Start". This triggers 

--- Document Chunk 15207 ---
an MA request. 

--- Document Chunk 15208 ---
4.4.11.1.6.1 Note: Once the SR distance is covered, the driver may have to go further. 

--- Document Chunk 15209 ---
4.4.11.1.6.2 When entering SR mode, the value applicable for SR mode speed limit and the value 

--- Document Chunk 15210 ---
applicable for SR distance shall be the corresponding National/Default values. Exception 

--- Document Chunk 15211 ---
for SR distance: SR mode is authorised by RBC giving an SR distance. 

--- Document Chunk 15212 ---
4.4.11.1.6.3 While in SR mode , the value applicable for the SR mode speed limit shall be, if 

--- Document Chunk 15213 ---
available, the last value entered by the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 15214 ---
4.4.11.1.6.4 While in SR mode, the value applicable for the SR distance shall be, if available, the 

--- Document Chunk 15215 ---
last value received by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment amongst: 

--- Document Chunk 15216 ---
a) the distance to run in SR entered by the driver; 

--- Document Chunk 15217 ---
b) the distance to run in SR given by trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 15218 ---
4.4.11.1.6.5 When "Override" is selected , the SR mode speed limit value and the SR distance 

--- Document Chunk 15219 ---
value previously entered by driver or given by trackside, if any, shall be deleted. The 

--- Document Chunk 15220 ---
corresponding National/Default values shall enter in force. 

--- Document Chunk 15221 ---
4.4.11.1.6.6 If the train is in SR and receives a new distance to run in SR mode from the RBC, the 

--- Document Chunk 15222 ---
stored list of expected balise groups, if any, shall be deleted or shall be replaced by the 

--- Document Chunk 15223 ---
list of expected balise groups sent together with the distance to run in SR. 

--- Document Chunk 15224 ---
4.4.11.1.6.7 If an ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment in SR mode, after having received from 

--- Document Chunk 15225 ---
Euroloop max permitted distance to run in SR mode information, detects the main signal 

--- Document Chunk 15226 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15227 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15228 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 15229 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 15230 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 15231 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 15232 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 15233 ---
Page 24/93 

--- Document Chunk 15234 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15235 ---
balise group bein g part of this information then it shall ignore any new max permitted 

--- Document Chunk 15236 ---
distance to run in SR mode information from that loop. 

--- Document Chunk 15237 ---
4.4.11.1.7 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall display the train speed and the (when 

--- Document Chunk 15238 ---
active) override (permission to pass a signal at dang er, trip inhibited). The permitted 

--- Document Chunk 15239 ---
speed, target distance and the target speed shall be displayed only on driver request , 

--- Document Chunk 15240 ---
until the driver requests to stop their display. 

--- Document Chunk 15241 ---
4.4.11.1.8 If a virtual train position is supervised as per clause 3.6.7.1 f) or g), the clauses  

--- Document Chunk 15242 ---
mentioning the train position shall apply by analogy. 

--- Document Chunk 15243 ---
4.4.11.1.9 If receiving a "track ahead free" request from the RBC, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 15244 ---
equipment requests the driver to enter the "track ahead free" information. 

--- Document Chunk 15245 ---
4.4.11.1.10 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15246 ---
4.4.11.1.11 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15247 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15248 ---
4.4.11.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15249 ---
4.4.11.2.1 Level 1 and 2. 

--- Document Chunk 15250 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15251 ---
4.4.11.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15252 ---
4.4.11.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment supervises a ceiling speed , a SR distance if 

--- Document Chunk 15253 ---
finite and, if available, a list of balise groups. 

--- Document Chunk 15254 ---
4.4.11.3.2 The driver must check if the track is free, if points are correctly positioned, and must 

--- Document Chunk 15255 ---
respect the existing line-side information (signals, speed boards etc.). 

--- Document Chunk 15256 ---
4.4.11.3.3 When using the possibility to modify the value of the SR mode speed limit and of the 

--- Document Chunk 15257 ---
given distance, the driver is responsible for entering reasonable values. 

--- Document Chunk 15258 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15259 ---

--- Document Chunk 15261 ---

--- Document Chunk 15264 ---

--- Document Chunk 15266 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15267 ---
4.4.12 ON SIGHT 

--- Document Chunk 15268 ---
4.4.12.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15269 ---
4.4.12.1.1 The On Sight mode enables the train to enter into a track section that could be already 

--- Document Chunk 15270 ---
occupied by another train, or obstructed by any kind of obstacle. 

--- Document Chunk 15271 ---
4.4.12.1.2 On Sight mode cannot be selected by the driver, but shall be entered automatically when 

--- Document Chunk 15272 ---
commanded by trackside and all necessary conditions are fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 15273 ---
4.4.12.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise train movements against a 

--- Document Chunk 15274 ---
dynamic speed profile. 

--- Document Chunk 15275 ---
4.4.12.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the train speed to the driver. The 

--- Document Chunk 15276 ---
permitted speed, target distance , target speed and release speed (if any) shall be 

--- Document Chunk 15277 ---
displayed only on driver request, until the driver requests to stop their display (this list is 

--- Document Chunk 15278 ---
not exhaustive – refer to chapter 4.7 “DMI depending on modes”). 

--- Document Chunk 15279 ---
4.4.12.1.5 If receiving a "track ahead free" request from the RBC, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 15280 ---
equipment requests the driver to enter the "track ahead free" information. 

--- Document Chunk 15281 ---
4.4.12.1.6 To be in On Sight mode, SSP and gradient are not required for the whole length of the 

--- Document Chunk 15282 ---
train, but must be available at least from the FRONT END of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 15283 ---
4.4.12.1.7 Once in On Sight mode, if SSP and gradient are not known for the whole length of the 

--- Document Chunk 15284 ---
train, an indication “ENTERING OS” shall be clearly displayed to the driver until SSP and 

--- Document Chunk 15285 ---
gradient are known for the whole length of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 15286 ---
4.4.12.1.7.1 Note: this indication may also be displayed in case the train length has been 

--- Document Chunk 15287 ---
increased, see 3.18.3.8. 

--- Document Chunk 15288 ---
4.4.12.1.8 Deleted 

--- Document Chunk 15289 ---
4.4.12.1.9 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15290 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15291 ---
4.4.12.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15292 ---
4.4.12.2.1 Used in level 1 and 2. 

--- Document Chunk 15293 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15294 ---
4.4.12.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15295 ---
4.4.12.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is responsible for the supervision of the train 

--- Document Chunk 15296 ---
movements. 

--- Document Chunk 15297 ---
4.4.12.3.2 The driver is responsible for checking the track occupancy when moving the train, 

--- Document Chunk 15298 ---
because the track may be occupied. 

--- Document Chunk 15299 ---

4.4.13 TRIP 

--- Document Chunk 15309 ---
4.4.13.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15310 ---
4.4.13.1.1 Deleted 

--- Document Chunk 15311 ---
4.4.13.1.1.1 Note: Application of emergency brakes and tr ain trip are two different things. For 

--- Document Chunk 15312 ---
example, exceeding the permitted speed leads to application of the emergency brakes, 

--- Document Chunk 15313 ---
but as long as the train does not pass the EOA/LOA, it is not a train trip. 

--- Document Chunk 15314 ---
4.4.13.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall command the emergency brakes (no brake 

--- Document Chunk 15315 ---
release is possible in Trip mode). 

--- Document Chunk 15316 ---
4.4.13.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall indicate to the driver the reason of the train 

--- Document Chunk 15317 ---
trip. 

--- Document Chunk 15318 ---
4.4.13.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall request an acknowledgement from the 

--- Document Chunk 15319 ---
driver once train is at standstill (to allow the driver to acknowledge the train trip). 

--- Document Chunk 15320 ---
4.4.13.1.4.1 Note: This acknowledgement is mandatory to exit from Trip mode. 

--- Document Chunk 15321 ---
4.4.13.1.5 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15322 ---
4.4.13.1.6 Closing the desk while being in Trip mode will not cause a mode change but no 

--- Document Chunk 15323 ---
interaction with the driver shall be possible as long as the desk is closed, except isolation 

--- Document Chunk 15324 ---
of the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 15325 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15326 ---
4.4.13.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15327 ---
4.4.13.2.1 Used in level 0, NTC, 1 and 2. 

--- Document Chunk 15328 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15329 ---
4.4.13.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15330 ---
4.4.13.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is responsible for stopping the train and for 

--- Document Chunk 15331 ---
maintaining the train at standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 15332 ---
4.4.13.3.2 The driver has no responsibility for train movements. 

--- Document Chunk 15333 ---

4.4.14 POST TRIP 

--- Document Chunk 15343 ---
4.4.14.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15344 ---
4.4.14.1.1 The Post Trip mode shall be entered immediately after the driver acknowledges the trip. 

--- Document Chunk 15345 ---
4.4.14.1.2 Once in post trip mode, the onboard equipment shall release the Command of the 

--- Document Chunk 15346 ---
emergency brake. 

--- Document Chunk 15347 ---
4.4.14.1.2.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall keep on indicating to the driver the 

--- Document Chunk 15348 ---
reason of the train trip. 

--- Document Chunk 15349 ---
4.4.14.1.3 The train shall only be authorised to perform a reverse movement over a given distance 

--- Document Chunk 15350 ---
(national value), which is counted opposite to the train orientation from the estimated 

--- Document Chunk 15351 ---
train front end when the Post Trip mode is entered . The ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 15352 ---
equipment shall command the service brake if th is distance is overpassed. The driver 

--- Document Chunk 15353 ---
shall be informed about the reason for the brake application. 

--- Document Chunk 15354 ---
4.4.14.1.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall perform the Unauthorised Direction  

--- Document Chunk 15355 ---
Movement Protection. As in PT mode, the allowed movement is a reverse movement, 

--- Document Chunk 15356 ---
then the Unauthorised Direction Movement Protection avoids the train running in forward 

--- Document Chunk 15357 ---
direction. 

--- Document Chunk 15358 ---
4.4.14.1.3.2 After the release of a brake command initiated due to an overpassed distance allowed 

--- Document Chunk 15359 ---
for reverse movement in Post Trip mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 15360 ---
command the service brake for any further movement in t he direction opposite to the 

--- Document Chunk 15361 ---
train orientation. 

--- Document Chunk 15362 ---
4.4.14.1.4 When performing a reverse movement in Post Trip mode, the train trip shall be inhibited. 

--- Document Chunk 15363 ---
4.4.14.1.5 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15364 ---
4.4.14.1.6 When ERTMS/ETCS level is 1, if the driver selects “Start” the onboard equipment 

--- Document Chunk 15365 ---
proposes Staff Responsible. When ERTMS/ETCS level is 2, the selection of Start leads 

--- Document Chunk 15366 ---
to an MA Request to the RBC. It is the RBC responsibility to give an SR authorisation, 

--- Document Chunk 15367 ---
or a Full Supervision MA or an On Sight /Shunting MA to an ERTMS/ETCS equipment 

--- Document Chunk 15368 ---
that is in Post Trip mode. 

--- Document Chunk 15369 ---
4.4.14.1.7 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15370 ---
4.4.14.1.8 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15371 ---
4.4.14.1.9 In case of balise group message consistency error (refer to 3.16.2.4.4 and 3.16.2.5.1), 

--- Document Chunk 15372 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall not command the service brake. 

--- Document Chunk 15373 ---
4.4.14.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15374 ---
4.4.14.2.1 Used in level 1 and 2. 

--- Document Chunk 15375 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15376 ---
4.4.14.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15377 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15378 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15379 ---

--- Document Chunk 15384 ---

--- Document Chunk 15385 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15386 ---
4.4.14.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is responsible for supervising that the train only 

--- Document Chunk 15387 ---
performs a reverse movement  and that this movement does not exceed the maximum 

--- Document Chunk 15388 ---
permitted distance (national value). 

--- Document Chunk 15389 ---
4.4.14.3.2 The driver is responsible not to overpass the  maximum permitted  distance when  

--- Document Chunk 15390 ---
performing the reverse movement.

--- Document Chunk 15400 ---
4.4.15 NON LEADING 

--- Document Chunk 15401 ---
4.4.15.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15402 ---
4.4.15.1.1 The Non-Leading mode is defined to manage the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of 

--- Document Chunk 15403 ---
a slave engine that is NOT electrically coupled to the leading engine (and so, not remote 

--- Document Chunk 15404 ---
controlled) but has its own driver. 

--- Document Chunk 15405 ---
4.4.15.1.1.1 Note: This operating situation is called Tandem. 

--- Document Chunk 15406 ---
4.4.15.1.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall use, as a necessary condition to enter 

--- Document Chunk 15407 ---
in Non-Leading mode, a non-leading input information from the train interface. 

--- Document Chunk 15408 ---
4.4.15.1.1.3 Upon the detection that the non-leading input information is set to "Non-leading not 

--- Document Chunk 15409 ---
permitted", the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall inform the driver that the non -

--- Document Chunk 15410 ---
leading operation is no longer permitted and shall request an acknowledgement from the 

--- Document Chunk 15411 ---
driver. However, the switch to Stand -By mode shall be made only if the train is at 

--- Document Chunk 15412 ---
standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 15413 ---
4.4.15.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall not perform any train movement 

--- Document Chunk 15414 ---
supervision in Non-Leading mode. 

--- Document Chunk 15415 ---
4.4.15.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform the Train Position function; in 

--- Document Chunk 15416 ---
particular, the front/rear end of the engine (i.e., not the train) shall be used to refer to 

--- Document Chunk 15417 ---
train front/rear end  and no train integrity information shall be reported to the RBC, 

--- Document Chunk 15418 ---
regardless of whether the train integrity and/or the safe con sist length information is 

--- Document Chunk 15419 ---
available on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 15420 ---
4.4.15.1.4 When level is 2, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall report its position to the 

--- Document Chunk 15421 ---
RBC, according to the previously received parameters. 

--- Document Chunk 15422 ---
4.4.15.1.5 If possible, the train must not be stopped due to a safety critical fau lt in a non -leading 

--- Document Chunk 15423 ---
engine. The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment sh ould therefore try to memorise the 

--- Document Chunk 15424 ---
occurrence of such fault(s), which sh ould be handled when the engine leaves Non 

--- Document Chunk 15425 ---
Leading mode. The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment should also try to send an error 

--- Document Chunk 15426 ---
information to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 15427 ---
4.4.15.1.6 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the train speed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 15428 ---
4.4.15.1.7 Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 15429 ---
4.4.15.1.8 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15430 ---
4.4.15.1.9 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15431 ---
4.4.15.1.10 In case of balise group message consistency error (refer to 3.16.2.4.4 and 3.16.2.5.1), 

--- Document Chunk 15432 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall not command the service brake. 

--- Document Chunk 15433 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15434 ---
4.4.15.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15435 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15436 ---

--- Document Chunk 15444 ---
4.4.15.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2 and level NTC.

--- Document Chunk 15447 ---

--- Document Chunk 15448 ---

--- Document Chunk 15450 ---
are displayed by the DMI.

--- Document Chunk 15460 ---
4.4.16 AUTOMATIC DRIVING 

--- Document Chunk 15461 ---
4.4.16.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15462 ---
4.4.16.1.1  If it is interfaced to an ERTMS/ATO on-board and if the ATO selector is in position "On", 

--- Document Chunk 15463 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is in Automatic Driving mode when the 

--- Document Chunk 15464 ---
ERTMS/ATO on-board drives the train according to a journey profile provided by the 

--- Document Chunk 15465 ---
ERTMS/ATO trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 15466 ---
4.4.16.1.2  The Automatic Driving mode can only be entered upon a driver action, i.e. selecting "ATO 

--- Document Chunk 15467 ---
engage" when all necessary conditions are fulfilled (see SUBSET-125 for details). 

--- Document Chunk 15468 ---
4.4.16.1.3  Once in Automatic Driving mode, the driver can at any time take back the control of the 

--- Document Chunk 15469 ---
train driving by acting on the brakes or by selecting "ATO disengage". 

--- Document Chunk 15470 ---
4.4.16.1.4  The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise train movements in the same 

--- Document Chunk 15471 ---
way as in Full Supervision mode, except that for the speed and distance target speed 

--- Document Chunk 15472 ---
monitoring when an SBI supervision limit is exceeded neither a brake command nor the 

--- Document Chunk 15473 ---
intervention status shall be triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 15474 ---
4.4.16.1.5  The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall display the train speed, the permitted 

--- Document Chunk 15475 ---
speed and the SBI speed (whenever the ERTMS/ATO on -board drives over the 

--- Document Chunk 15476 ---
permitted speed) to the driver (this list is not exhaustive – refer to chapter  4.7 “DMI 

--- Document Chunk 15477 ---
depending on modes”). 

--- Document Chunk 15478 ---
4.4.16.1.6 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall generate the information to the train 

--- Document Chunk 15479 ---
interface that it is in Automatic Driving mode. 

--- Document Chunk 15480 ---
4.4.16.2  Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15481 ---
4.4.16.2.1  Used in level 1 and 2. 

--- Document Chunk 15482 ---
4.4.16.3  Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15483 ---
4.4.16.3.1  The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is fully responsible for the train protection , 

--- Document Chunk 15484 ---
except for the following situation: the ERTMS/ATO on-board is responsible for respecting 

--- Document Chunk 15485 ---
the EOA when approaching an EOA with a release speed. 

--- Document Chunk 15486 ---
4.4.16.3.2  Substituting the driver for acting on the traction/brakes of the train, the ERTMS/ATO on-

--- Document Chunk 15487 ---
board is responsible to drive the train according to the ATO journey profile. However 

--- Document Chunk 15488 ---
each time  the "ATO ready"  information is displayed to the driver  (e.g. af ter the 

--- Document Chunk 15489 ---
ERTMS/ATO on-board has stopped the train at an operational stopping point), the driver 

--- Document Chunk 15490 ---
is responsible for resuming the automatic driving by selecting "ATO Engage". 

--- Document Chunk 15491 ---
4.4.16.3.2.1 Note: While in Automatic Driving mode, the ERTMS/ATO on-board disengages itself 

--- Document Chunk 15492 ---
(i.e. it stops acting on the traction/brakes of the train) after it has stopped the train at an 

--- Document Chunk 15493 ---
operational stopping point included in the ATO journey profile. 

--- Document Chunk 15494 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15495 ---

4.4.17 NATIONAL SYSTEM (SN) 

--- Document Chunk 15504 ---
4.4.17.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15505 ---
4.4.17.1.1 In SN mode, according to the specific on -board implementation, the National System 

--- Document Chunk 15506 ---
may access the following resources via the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment: DMI, 

--- Document Chunk 15507 ---
Juridical Recording interface, odometer, train interface and brakes. This can be achieved 

--- Document Chunk 15508 ---
through the STM interface. 

--- Document Chunk 15509 ---
4.4.17.1.2 A limited set of data coming fro m balises shall be used by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 15510 ---
equipment, refer to SRS chapter 4.8 “Use of received information”. 

--- Document Chunk 15511 ---
4.4.17.1.3 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15512 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15513 ---
4.4.17.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15514 ---
4.4.17.2.1 Level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 15515 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15516 ---
4.4.17.3 Responsibilities of ERTMS/ETCS Onboard 

--- Document Chunk 15517 ---
4.4.17.3.1 No train supervision functionality is provided by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 15518 ---
In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is interfaced to the National System 

--- Document Chunk 15519 ---
through an STM, refer to the FFFIS STM (Subset 035)  for the functionality provided by 

--- Document Chunk 15520 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 15521 ---
4.4.17.3.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15522 ---
4.4.17.4 Responsibilities of the National System 

--- Document Chunk 15523 ---
4.4.17.4.1 The National System is responsible for all train supervision and protection functions. 

--- Document Chunk 15524 ---
4.4.17.4.2 The National System is responsible for issuing and revoking brake command. 

--- Document Chunk 15525 ---
4.4.17.4.3 The National System  is responsible for maintaining national system behaviour and 

--- Document Chunk 15526 ---
interact with national trackside equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 15527 ---
4.4.17.4.4 The National System is responsible for interaction with the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 15528 ---
4.4.17.5 Responsibilities of the driver 

--- Document Chunk 15529 ---
4.4.17.5.1 The responsibility of the driver depends on the National System in use. 

--- Document Chunk 15530 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 15539 ---
4.4.18 REVERSING 

--- Document Chunk 15540 ---
4.4.18.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15541 ---
4.4.18.1.1 The Reversing mode allows the driver to change the direction of movement of the train 

--- Document Chunk 15542 ---
and drive from the same cab, i.e. the train orientation remains unchanged. This is 

--- Document Chunk 15543 ---
possible only in areas so marked by trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 15544 ---
4.4.18.1.2 Note: This mode is used to allow the train to escape from a dangerous situation and to 

--- Document Chunk 15545 ---
reach as fast as possible a “safer” location. 

--- Document Chunk 15546 ---
4.4.18.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall supervise train movements against: 

--- Document Chunk 15547 ---
a) a ceiling speed: the Reversing mode speed limit given from trackside 

--- Document Chunk 15548 ---
b) a distance to run in the direction opposite to the train orientation, given from trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 15549 ---
The emergency brake shall be commanded if overpassing this distance 

--- Document Chunk 15550 ---
4.4.18.1.4 After the release of a brake command initiated due to an overpassed reversing distance, 

--- Document Chunk 15551 ---
and while the reversing distance is still overpassed, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 15552 ---
equipment shall command the emergency brake for any further movement in the 

--- Document Chunk 15553 ---
direction opposite to the train orientation. 

--- Document Chunk 15554 ---
4.4.18.1.5 The ERTMS/ETC S on -board equipment shall display the train speed, the permitted 

--- Document Chunk 15555 ---
speed and the remaining distance to run. 

--- Document Chunk 15556 ---
4.4.18.1.6 In case the SBI supervision limit is exceeded (refer to chapter 3  table 5, triggering 

--- Document Chunk 15557 ---
condition t4), the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall command the emergency 

--- Document Chunk 15558 ---
brake instead of the service brake . For the revocation of the brake command, refer to 

--- Document Chunk 15559 ---
3.13.10.2.4. 

--- Document Chunk 15560 ---
4.4.18.1.7 The position reports sent when in reversing mode shall refer to the location of the driving 

--- Document Chunk 15561 ---
cab (as before reversing). 

--- Document Chunk 15562 ---
4.4.18.1.8 The ERTMS/ETCS onboard e quipment shall perform the Unauthorised Direction  

--- Document Chunk 15563 ---
Movement Protection. As in RV mode, the allowed movement is a reverse movement, 

--- Document Chunk 15564 ---
then the Unauthorised Direction Movement Protection avoids the train running in forward 

--- Document Chunk 15565 ---
direction. 

--- Document Chunk 15566 ---
4.4.18.1.9 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15567 ---
4.4.18.1.10 In case of balise group message consistency error (refer to 3.16.2.4.4 and 3.16.2.5.1), 

--- Document Chunk 15568 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall not command the service brake. 

--- Document Chunk 15569 ---
4.4.18.1.11 In case there is an alarm reporting a malfunction for the onboard balise transmission 

--- Document Chunk 15570 ---
function, the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall ignore this alarm. 

--- Document Chunk 15571 ---
4.4.18.1.12 In case the ERTMS/ETCS system version number X transmitted by any balise is greater 

--- Document Chunk 15572 ---
than the highest version X supported by the onboard equipment (refer to 3.17.3.5), the 

--- Document Chunk 15573 ---
information from this balise shall be ignored, the train shall not be tripped and the driver 

--- Document Chunk 15574 ---
shall not be informed. 

--- Document Chunk 15575 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15576 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15577 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 15578 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 15579 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 15580 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 15581 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 15582 ---
Page 34/93 

--- Document Chunk 15583 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15584 ---
4.4.18.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15585 ---
4.4.18.2.1 Level 1 and 2. 

--- Document Chunk 15586 ---
4.4.18.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15587 ---
4.4.18.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment supervises a ceiling speed and a distance to 

--- Document Chunk 15588 ---
run in the direction opposite to the train orientation. 

--- Document Chunk 15589 ---
4.4.18.3.2 The driver must keep the train movement inside the received distance to run. 

--- Document Chunk 15590 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 15598 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15599 ---
4.4.19 LIMITED SUPERVISION 

--- Document Chunk 15600 ---
4.4.19.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15601 ---
4.4.19.1.1 The Limited Supervision mode enables the train to be operated in areas where trackside 

--- Document Chunk 15602 ---
information can be supplied to realise background supervision of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 15603 ---
4.4.19.1.2 Limited supervision can not be selected by the driver, but shall be entered automatically 

--- Document Chunk 15604 ---
when commanded by trackside and all necessary conditions are fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 15605 ---
4.4.19.1.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall supervise train movements against a 

--- Document Chunk 15606 ---
dynamic speed profile. 

--- Document Chunk 15607 ---
4.4.19.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall display the train speed  and the release 

--- Document Chunk 15608 ---
speed, if any (this list is not exhaustive – refer to chapter 4.7 “DMI depending on modes”). 

--- Document Chunk 15609 ---
Upon request by trackside (refer to clauses 4.4.19.1.4.2 to 4.4.19.1.4.6) if the generic LS 

--- Document Chunk 15610 ---
function marker is stored on-board or if the conditions in clause 4.4.19.1.4.7 are fulfilled, 

--- Document Chunk 15611 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall also display the lowest speed amongst: 

--- Document Chunk 15612 ---
a) the lowest MRSP element between the minimum safe front end of the train and the 

--- Document Chunk 15613 ---
EOA/LOA, AND 

--- Document Chunk 15614 ---
b) the target speed at the EOA/LOA 

--- Document Chunk 15615 ---
4.4.19.1.4.1 The speed resulting from 4.4.19.1.4 a) and b) is called the Lowest Supervised Speed 

--- Document Chunk 15616 ---
within the Movement Authority (LSSMA) 

--- Document Chunk 15617 ---
4.4.19.1.4.2 Upon an order to toggle on the LSSMA display, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 15618 ---
equipment shall start a delay timer: 

--- Document Chunk 15619 ---
a) For order received from RBC/RIU: at the value of the time stamp of the me ssage 

--- Document Chunk 15620 ---
including the order. 

--- Document Chunk 15621 ---
b) For order received from balise group: at the time of passage over the first encountered 

--- Document Chunk 15622 ---
balise of the balise group giving the order. 

--- Document Chunk 15623 ---
c) Exception to a) and b): for order that has been stored in the level transition buffer (see 

--- Document Chunk 15624 ---
section 4.8.3): at the time the level transition is performed. 

--- Document Chunk 15625 ---
4.4.19.1.4.3 When the delay timer value becomes greater than the time -out value given by 

--- Document Chunk 15626 ---
trackside, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the LSSMA. 

--- Document Chunk 15627 ---
4.4.19.1.4.4 On reception of an order to toggle (on or off) the L SSMA display, a toggle on order 

--- Document Chunk 15628 ---
which has not been executed yet (because the on-board delay timer has not reached the 

--- Document Chunk 15629 ---
delay time-out value) shall be deleted by the on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 15630 ---
4.4.19.1.4.5 If the LSSMA display is already toggled on, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 15631 ---
shall toggle off the LSSMA display in case: 

--- Document Chunk 15632 ---
a) the clause 4.4.19.1.4.3 is not immediately fulfilled upon reception of a new order to 

--- Document Chunk 15633 ---
toggle on the LSSMA display 

--- Document Chunk 15634 ---
b) an order to toggle off the LSSMA display is received. 

--- Document Chunk 15635 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15636 ---

System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 15641 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 15642 ---
Page 36/93 

--- Document Chunk 15643 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15644 ---
4.4.19.1.4.6 When entering the Limited Supervision mode, the LSSMA display shall be toggled off 

--- Document Chunk 15645 ---
by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, unless a toggle on order is received and 

--- Document Chunk 15646 ---
leads immediately to the display of the LSSMA as per clauses 4.4.19.1.4.2 and 

--- Document Chunk 15647 ---
4.4.19.1.4.3. 

--- Document Chunk 15648 ---
4.4.19.1.4.7 If the generic LS function marker is not  stored on-board, the clauses 4.4.19.1.4.2 to 

--- Document Chunk 15649 ---
4.4.19.1.4.6 shall not apply and the LSSMA shall be displayed if: 

--- Document Chunk 15650 ---
a) the target speed at the EOA/LOA is lower than the Limited Supervision mode speed 

--- Document Chunk 15651 ---
limit, AND 

--- Document Chunk 15652 ---
b) the LSSMA is lower than the maximum train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 15653 ---
4.4.19.1.4.8 The generic LS function marker shall be deleted by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 15654 ---
equipment as soon as a Limited Supervision mode profile is received without it in the 

--- Document Chunk 15655 ---
same balise group message. 

--- Document Chunk 15656 ---
4.4.19.1.5 If receiving a "track ahead free" request from the RBC, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 15657 ---
equipment requests the driver to enter the "track ahead free" information. 

--- Document Chunk 15658 ---
4.4.19.1.6 To be in Limited Supervision mode, SSP and gradient are not required for the whole 

--- Document Chunk 15659 ---
length of the train, but shall be at least available from the FRONT END of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 15660 ---
4.4.19.1.7 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15661 ---
4.4.19.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15662 ---
4.4.19.2.1 Used in levels 1 and 2. 

--- Document Chunk 15663 ---
4.4.19.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15664 ---
4.4.19.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is responsible for the background supervision 

--- Document Chunk 15665 ---
of the train movement to the extent permitted by the information provided by trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 15666 ---
4.4.19.3.1.1 Note: The Li mited Supervision mode enables the train to be operated in areas 

--- Document Chunk 15667 ---
equipped with lineside signals where ETCS does not have information regarding the 

--- Document Chunk 15668 ---
status of some signals, i.e. not all signals are fitted with LEUs or connected to an RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 15669 ---
4.4.19.3.2 The driver must always observe the existing line-side information (signals, speed boards 

--- Document Chunk 15670 ---
etc.) and National operating rules. 

--- Document Chunk 15671 ---
4.4.19.3.2.1 Note: the indications given to the driver by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment do 

--- Document Chunk 15672 ---
not substitute the observance of the line-side information. In particular the display of the 

--- Document Chunk 15673 ---
LSSMA, if deemed necessary by the trackside, only complements the line -side 

--- Document Chunk 15674 ---
information, e.g. in case there could be a discrepancy between this latter and the 

--- Document Chunk 15675 ---
background supervision. 

--- Document Chunk 15676 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15677 ---

--- Document Chunk 15685 ---
4.4.20 PASSIVE SHUNTING 

--- Document Chunk 15686 ---
4.4.20.1 Description 

--- Document Chunk 15687 ---
4.4.20.1.1 The Passive Shunting mode is defined to manage the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 15688 ---
equipment of a slave engine (NOT remote controlled, but mechanically coupled to the 

--- Document Chunk 15689 ---
leading engine), being part of a shunting consist. This mode can also be used to carry 

--- Document Chunk 15690 ---
on a shunting movement wit h a s ingle engine fitted with one on -board equipment and 

--- Document Chunk 15691 ---
two cabs, when the driver has to change the driving cab. 

--- Document Chunk 15692 ---
4.4.20.1.2 The desk of a Passive Shunting engine must be closed (since there is no driver, no 

--- Document Chunk 15693 ---
information shall be shown). 

--- Document Chunk 15694 ---
4.4.20.1.3 As the engine is coupled to a leading engine, its ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 15695 ---
not perform any train movement supervision. 

--- Document Chunk 15696 ---
4.4.20.1.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform Train Position function; in 

--- Document Chunk 15697 ---
particular, the front/rear end of the engine (i.e., not the train) shall be used  to refer to 

--- Document Chunk 15698 ---
train front/rear end. 

--- Document Chunk 15699 ---
4.4.20.1.5 It shall only be possible to enter in Passive Shunting mode from the Shunting mode; 

--- Document Chunk 15700 ---
while in Shunting mode, the driver shall have the possibility to enable the function 

--- Document Chunk 15701 ---
“Continue Shunting on desk closure”. 

--- Document Chunk 15702 ---
4.4.20.1.6 When the active desk is closed, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall switch to 

--- Document Chunk 15703 ---
Passive Shunting mode if the function “Continue Shunting on desk closure” is active and 

--- Document Chunk 15704 ---
the passive shunting input information is set to "Passive shunting permitted" on the train 

--- Document Chunk 15705 ---
interface. If the function “Continue Shunting on desk closure” is not active or the passive 

--- Document Chunk 15706 ---
shunting input information is set to "Passive shunting not permitted", the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 15707 ---
on-board equipment shall switch to Stand-By mode instead. 

--- Document Chunk 15708 ---
4.4.20.1.7 The special function “Continue Shunting on desk closure” shall allow one and only one 

--- Document Chunk 15709 ---
transition from Shunting mode to Passive Shunting mode. The special function shall be 

--- Document Chunk 15710 ---
inactive once the Shunting mode is left. 

--- Document Chunk 15711 ---
4.4.20.1.8 If a desk of the Passive Shunting engine is opened  and no “Stop Shunting on desk 

--- Document Chunk 15712 ---
opening” information previously received from balise group is stored onboard , the 

--- Document Chunk 15713 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall switch to Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 15714 ---
4.4.20.1.9 If a desk of the Passive Shunting engine is opened and “Stop Shunting on desk opening” 

--- Document Chunk 15715 ---
information previously received from balise group is stored onboard, the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 15716 ---
on-board equipment shall switch to Stand By mode. 

--- Document Chunk 15717 ---
4.4.20.1.10 If possible, the train must not be stopped due to a safety critical fault in a Passive 

--- Document Chunk 15718 ---
Shunting engine. The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment sh ould therefore try to 

--- Document Chunk 15719 ---
memorise the occurrence of such fault(s), which sh ould be handled when the engine 

--- Document Chunk 15720 ---
leaves the Passive Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 15721 ---
4.4.20.1.11 While the ERTMS/ETCS on-board is in Passive Shunting mode, the reception of level 

--- Document Chunk 15722 ---
transition orders has no immediate effect. The level transition announcements shall be 

--- Document Chunk 15723 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15724 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15725 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 15726 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 15727 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 15728 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 15729 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 15730 ---
Page 38/93 

--- Document Chunk 15731 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15732 ---
rejected and an immediate level transition order or a conditional level transition order 

--- Document Chunk 15733 ---
shall be stored but evaluated only when another mode than Shunting or Passive 

--- Document Chunk 15734 ---
Shunting has been entered (i.e. when the Shunting movement is terminated). 

--- Document Chunk 15735 ---
4.4.20.1.11.1 Note: in case the Shunting movement is terminated through a direct transition to No 

--- Document Chunk 15736 ---
Power mode, see clause 4.11.1.4. 

--- Document Chunk 15737 ---
4.4.20.1.12 When receiving a communication session establishment order, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 15738 ---
board in Passive Shunting mode shall not establish the communication session, but shall 

--- Document Chunk 15739 ---
store the RBC contact information. 

--- Document Chunk 15740 ---
4.4.20.1.13 When in Passive Shunting mode, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall not manage RBC -

--- Document Chunk 15741 ---
RBC hand-over, except for storing the RBC contact information given at the RBC/RBC 

--- Document Chunk 15742 ---
border. 

--- Document Chunk 15743 ---
4.4.20.1.14 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 15744 ---
4.4.20.1.15 In case of balise group message consistency error (refer to 3.16.2.4.4 and 3.16.2.5.1), 

--- Document Chunk 15745 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall not command the service brake. 

--- Document Chunk 15746 ---
4.4.20.2 Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15747 ---
4.4.20.2.1 Used in all levels: Level 0, level 1, level 2 and level NTC 

--- Document Chunk 15748 ---
4.4.20.3 Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15749 ---
4.4.20.3.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of an engine in Passive Shunting mode has no 

--- Document Chunk 15750 ---
responsibility for the train protection. 

--- Document Chunk 15751 ---
4.4.20.3.2 The notion of responsibility of the driver is not relevant for the Passive Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 15752 ---
4.4.20.3.3 Note: The leading engine is responsible for the movement of the train. It is then the 

--- Document Chunk 15753 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment of the leading engine that is fully/partially/not 

--- Document Chunk 15754 ---
responsible for the train protection, with respect to its mode. 

--- Document Chunk 15755 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15756 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15757 ---

--- Document Chunk 15764 ---
4.4.21 SUPERVISED MANOEUVRE 

--- Document Chunk 15765 ---
4.4.21.1  Description 

--- Document Chunk 15766 ---
4.4.21.1.1 The purpose of the Supervised Manoeuvre mode is to enable an enhanced supervision 

--- Document Chunk 15767 ---
of shunting movements similar to the Full Supervision mode, while the cab is not 

--- Document Chunk 15768 ---
necessarily at the front of the shunting consist. 

--- Document Chunk 15769 ---
4.4.21.1.2 The Supervised Manoeuvre mode can only be entered upon the reception of an 

--- Document Chunk 15770 ---
authorisation from the RBC, which is preceded by a driver action (i.e. at standstill 

--- Document Chunk 15771 ---
selecting "Supervised Manoeuvre"). 

--- Document Chunk 15772 ---
4.4.21.1.3 The selection of "Supervised Manoeuvre" by the driver shall only be possible if the “safe 

--- Document Chunk 15773 ---
consist length” information is available on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 15774 ---
4.4.21.1.4 However, the Supervised Manoeuvre mode does not require that the Train Data set as 

--- Document Chunk 15775 ---
listed in 3.18.3.2, which would fully correspond to the composition of the shunting consist, 

--- Document Chunk 15776 ---
is captured by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. With the exception of 3.18.3.2 b), 

--- Document Chunk 15777 ---
preconfigured default Train Data shall be used by the on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 15778 ---
4.4.21.1.5 To be in Supervised Manoeuvre mode, SSP and gradient are not required for the whole 

--- Document Chunk 15779 ---
length of the consist, but shall be at least available from the front end of the consist. 

--- Document Chunk 15780 ---
4.4.21.1.6 Once in Supervised Manoeuvre mode, if SSP and gradient are not known for the whole 

--- Document Chunk 15781 ---
length of the consist, an indication “EN TERING SM” shall be clearly displayed to the 

--- Document Chunk 15782 ---
driver until SSP and gradient are known for the whole length of the consist. 

--- Document Chunk 15783 ---
4.4.21.1.6.1 Note: this indication may also be displayed in case the safe consist length information 

--- Document Chunk 15784 ---
has been changed. 

--- Document Chunk 15785 ---
4.4.21.1.7  The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall perform the Train Position function, taking 

--- Document Chunk 15786 ---
into account the clauses 3.6.1.3.4, 3.6.1.5.1, 3.6.4.1.5, 3.18.3.2.4 and the Train Data 

--- Document Chunk 15787 ---
“safe consist length”. In case, upon reception of a Supervised Manoeuvre authorisation, 

--- Document Chunk 15788 ---
the direction of its Movement Authority is opposite to the current train orientation, the 

--- Document Chunk 15789 ---
following shall apply: 

--- Document Chunk 15790 ---
a) The new estimated train front end shall be obtained by shifting the current one in  

--- Document Chunk 15791 ---
direction of the new authorisation, with a distance equal to the sum of the nominal 

--- Document Chunk 15792 ---
consist lengths in front of and in rear of the engine respectively. 

--- Document Chunk 15793 ---
b) The new min safe front end shall be obtained by shifting the current max safe front 

--- Document Chunk 15794 ---
end in direction of the new authorisation, with a distance equal to the sum of: 

--- Document Chunk 15795 ---
• the max safe consist length in front of the engine and the min safe consist length 

--- Document Chunk 15796 ---
in rear of the engine, if the train orientation was the same as the active cab, or 

--- Document Chunk 15797 ---
• the max safe consist length in rear of the engine and the min safe consist length 

--- Document Chunk 15798 ---
in front of the engine, if the train orientation was opposite to the active cab. 

--- Document Chunk 15799 ---
c) The new max safe fro nt end shall be obtained by shifting the current min safe front 

--- Document Chunk 15800 ---
end in direction of the new authorisation, with a distance equal to the sum of: 

--- Document Chunk 15801 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15802 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15803 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 15804 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 15805 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 15806 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 15807 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 15808 ---
Page 40/93 

--- Document Chunk 15809 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15810 ---
• the min safe consist length in front of the engine and the max safe consist length 

--- Document Chunk 15811 ---
in rear of the engine, if the train orientation was the same as the active cab, or 

--- Document Chunk 15812 ---
• the min safe consist length in rear of the engine and the max safe consist length 

--- Document Chunk 15813 ---
in front of the engine, if the train orientation was opposite to the active cab 

--- Document Chunk 15814 ---
4.4.21.1.8  The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall  supervise train movements against a 

--- Document Chunk 15815 ---
dynamic speed profile. 

--- Document Chunk 15816 ---
4.4.21.1.9  The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall display the train speed, the permitted 

--- Document Chunk 15817 ---
speed, the target distance, and the target speed to the driver (this list is not exhaustive 

--- Document Chunk 15818 ---
– refer to chapter 4.7 “ DMI depending on modes”). The ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 15819 ---
equipment shall also indicate whether a movement of the train corresponding to the 

--- Document Chunk 15820 ---
direction of the Supervised Manoeuvre Movement Authority is obtained through traction 

--- Document Chunk 15821 ---
applied with the direction controller in position forward or backward. 

--- Document Chunk 15822 ---
4.4.21.1.10  At standstill, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall give the possibility to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 15823 ---
to request a new Supervised Manoeuvre authorisation (e.g. in case of zig -zag 

--- Document Chunk 15824 ---
movements when the end of a Movement Authority is reached). 

--- Document Chunk 15825 ---
4.4.21.1.11  While the ERTMS/ETCS on-board is in Supervised Manoeuvre mode, the reception of 

--- Document Chunk 15826 ---
level transitions orders has no immediate effect. The level transition announcements 

--- Document Chunk 15827 ---
shall be rejected and, upon reception of the order while already in Supervised Manoeuvre 

--- Document Chunk 15828 ---
mode, an immediate level transition order or a conditional level transition order shall be 

--- Document Chunk 15829 ---
stored but evaluated only when another mode than Supervised Manoeuvre or Shunting 

--- Document Chunk 15830 ---
has been entered (i.e. when the Supervised Manoeuvre movement, possibly followed by 

--- Document Chunk 15831 ---
a Shunting one, is terminated). 

--- Document Chunk 15832 ---
4.4.21.1.11.1 Note: in case the Supervised Manoeuvre movement is terminated through a direct 

--- Document Chunk 15833 ---
transition to No Power mode, see clause 4.11.1.4. 

--- Document Chunk 15834 ---
4.4.21.1.12  If the safe consist length information is acquired from an external source and it becomes 

--- Document Chunk 15835 ---
unavailable, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall inform the driver and the 

--- Document Chunk 15836 ---
trackside and, if the train is not at standstill, it shall command the service brake. The 

--- Document Chunk 15837 ---
location based information stored on -board shall be shortened to the current position  

--- Document Chunk 15838 ---
either immediately or, if the train was not at standstill, only when it has reached standstill. 

--- Document Chunk 15839 ---
Refer to appendix A.3.4 for the exhaustive list of information, which shall be shortened. 

--- Document Chunk 15840 ---
4.4.21.1.13  The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall generate the information to the train 

--- Document Chunk 15841 ---
interface that it is ready for remote shunting and that the engine orientation is either the 

--- Document Chunk 15842 ---
same as or opposite to the direction of its Movement Authority. 

--- Document Chunk 15843 ---
4.4.21.2  Used in levels 

--- Document Chunk 15844 ---
4.4.21.2.1  Used in level 2. 

--- Document Chunk 15845 ---
4.4.21.3  Responsibilities 

--- Document Chunk 15846 ---
4.4.21.3.1  The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is responsible for the train protection. However, 

--- Document Chunk 15847 ---
the speed and distance monitoring function will rely on default Train Data. 

--- Document Chunk 15848 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 15849 ---

--- Document Chunk 15855 ---

--- Document Chunk 15856 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15857 ---
4.4.21.3.2  When approaching an EOA with a release speed, the driver is responsible for respecting 

--- Document Chunk 15858 ---
the EOA,  possibly in collaboration with other staff on site or on -board the shunting 

--- Document Chunk 15859 ---
consist. 

--- Document Chunk 15860 ---
4.4.21.3.3  When performing e.g. a joining operation, the driver is responsible for checking the track 

--- Document Chunk 15861 ---
occupancy, possibly in collaboration with other staff on site or on -board the shunting 

--- Document Chunk 15862 ---
consist. 

--- Document Chunk 15863 ---

--- Document Chunk 15872 ---
4.5 Modes and on-board functions 

--- Document Chunk 15873 ---
4.5.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 15874 ---
4.5.1.1 The following table specifies for each mode, which on-board functions are active or not, 

--- Document Chunk 15875 ---
when it cannot be derived from the specific provisions of the mode itself (see § 4.4), from 

--- Document Chunk 15876 ---
the mode transitions (see § 4.6), from the display of information according to the mode 

--- Document Chunk 15877 ---
(see §4.7), from the acceptance criteria of trackside information according to the level 

--- Document Chunk 15878 ---
and mode (see §4.8), from the handling of accepted and stored information upon a mode 

--- Document Chunk 15879 ---
transition (see §4.10 and 4.11) and from any other explicit mode specific provision in the 

--- Document Chunk 15880 ---
specifications. The term “function” in this section must be understood a s an individual 

--- Document Chunk 15881 ---
clause classified as on -board requirement or definition, or as a group of clauses 

--- Document Chunk 15882 ---
classified as on-board requirement or definition, which is/are referred to in the “Related 

--- Document Chunk 15883 ---
SRS §” (second column of the table). 

--- Document Chunk 15884 ---
4.5.1.2 Note: This table must be understood as a complement to all other SRS chapters.  

--- Document Chunk 15885 ---
Conversely when a clause is not referred to in this table, it means that there are no 

--- Document Chunk 15886 ---
additional requirements on the applicability of the clause depending on the mode to the 

--- Document Chunk 15887 ---
ones, if any, that can be found in the rest of the SRS. 

--- Document Chunk 15888 ---
4.5.1.3 Note: for DMI depending on modes, refer to §4.7. 

--- Document Chunk 15889 ---
4.5.1.4 Unless stated otherwise, the clauses not referred to in this table shall not be applicable 

--- Document Chunk 15890 ---
in NP mode. 

--- Document Chunk 15891 ---
4.5.1.5 With the exception of the clauses stipulated in the sections 4.4.3 and 4.4.5 respectively, 

--- Document Chunk 15892 ---
the applicability of any other clause of the SRS is irrelevant in modes IS and SF. 

--- Document Chunk 15893 ---
4.5.2 Active Functions Table 

--- Document Chunk 15894 ---
4.5.2.1 X = functions shall be active, i.e. their corresponding on-board requirements and/or 

--- Document Chunk 15895 ---
definitions shall apply 

--- Document Chunk 15896 ---
Empty case = functions shall be inactive, i.e. their corresponding on-board 

--- Document Chunk 15897 ---
requirements and/or definitions shall not apply 

--- Document Chunk 15898 ---
NR = Not Relevant: This concerns the modes SF and IS in which the on-board 

--- Document Chunk 15899 ---
behaviour cannot be harmonised 

--- Document Chunk 15900 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15901 ---
4.5.2.2 Whenever a section number is referred to in the second column of the table, it means 

--- Document Chunk 15902 ---
that all the clauses classified as on -board requirement belonging to thi s section are 

--- Document Chunk 15903 ---
applicable/not applicable for the concerned mode, depending whether the corresponding 

--- Document Chunk 15904 ---
function is marked as active/not active. 

--- Document Chunk 15905 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 15906 ---
ONBOARD-FUNCTIONS RELATED 

--- Document Chunk 15907 ---
SRS § 

--- Document Chunk 15908 ---
N 

--- Document Chunk 15909 ---
P 

--- Document Chunk 15910 ---
S 

--- Document Chunk 15911 ---
B 

--- Document Chunk 15912 ---
P 

--- Document Chunk 15913 ---
S

Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 16326 ---
Page 47/93 

--- Document Chunk 16327 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16328 ---
4.6 Transitions between modes 

--- Document Chunk 16329 ---
4.6.1 Symbols 

--- Document Chunk 16330 ---
4.6.1.1 The indication “4>” means: The condition n°4 must be fulfilled to trigger the transition 

--- Document Chunk 16331 ---
4.6.1.2 From the mode located in the column 

--- Document Chunk 16332 ---
4.6.1.3 To the mode that is indicated by the arrow “>”. 

--- Document Chunk 16333 ---
4.6.1.4 Each transition from a given mode receives a priority order (indicated by “-px-”, x is the 

--- Document Chunk 16334 ---
priority order) to avoid a conflict between the different transitions when they occur at the 

--- Document Chunk 16335 ---
same time (i.e. in the same clock cycle). P1 has a higher priority than P2. 

--- Document Chunk 16336 ---
4.6.1.5 Some transitions have received the same priority order. This has been decided when it 

--- Document Chunk 16337 ---
is obvious that these transitions cannot occur at the same time, and so can never lead 

--- Document Chunk 16338 ---
to a conflicting situation (for example, the RBC cannot give in the same time a MA for FS 

--- Document Chunk 16339 ---
and a MA for OS to a given engine,  this is why the transition “from SR to FS” and the 

--- Document Chunk 16340 ---
transition “from SR to OS” have the same priority order). 

--- Document Chunk 16341 ---
4.6.1.6 "16, 17, 18" means "16 or 17 or 18". 

--- Document Chunk 16342 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 16343 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 16344 ---

--- Document Chunk 16806 ---

--- Document Chunk 16807 ---

--- Document Chunk 16808 ---

--- Document Chunk 16809 ---

--- Document Chunk 16810 ---

--- Document Chunk 16811 ---

--- Document Chunk 16813 ---

--- Document Chunk 16814 ---
clause 5.16.1.4)) 

--- Document Chunk 16815 ---

--- Document Chunk 16816 ---
Manoeuvre authorisation) + SSP +gradient are on-board) AND (the train position 

--- Document Chunk 16817 ---
confidence interval does not overlap any Mode Profile) 

--- Document Chunk 16818 ---
[11] (While being in release speed monitoring, the on-board receives a balise group 

--- Document Chunk 16819 ---
whose first possible location is known by linking information to be in rear of the EOA 

--- Document Chunk 16820 ---
by a distance shorter than the distance between the active Eurobalise antenna and 

--- Document Chunk 16821 ---

--- Document Chunk 16822 ---
level is 2).

--- Document Chunk 16824 ---

--- Document Chunk 16825 ---

--- Document Chunk 16826 ---

--- Document Chunk 16827 ---
standstill) AND (all desks connected to the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment are 

--- Document Chunk 16828 ---
closed)

--- Document Chunk 16867 ---

--- Document Chunk 16869 ---

--- Document Chunk 16870 ---

--- Document Chunk 16871 ---
confidence interval overlaps this On Sight area) AND (Starting from the min safe 

--- Document Chunk 16872 ---
front end of the train this On Sight area is the furthest area that the train position 

--- Document Chunk 16873 ---
confidence interval overlaps within the Mode Profile) AND (The ERTMS/ETCS level 

--- Document Chunk 16874 ---
switches to 1 or 2)

--- Document Chunk 16876 ---

--- Document Chunk 16877 ---
is active, see {8} here under)

--- Document Chunk 16879 ---
related to SR mode) AND (override is not active).

been received) AND (ERTMS/ETCS level switches to 2)  see {3} here under

--- Document Chunk 17013 ---
{1} The request to acknowledge On Sight is displayed to the driver only if certain conditions are 

--- Document Chunk 17014 ---
fulfilled. These conditions are not specified here. See the “On Sight” procedure” in 5.9. 

--- Document Chunk 17015 ---
{2} This transition to the Unfitted mode is also a transition of lev el. For further information, See the 

--- Document Chunk 17016 ---
“Level Transition” procedure in 5.10 and the “Start Of Mission” procedure in 5.4. 

--- Document Chunk 17017 ---
{3} See the “Override” procedure” of SRS-§5. 

--- Document Chunk 17018 ---
{4} The Staff Responsible mode is proposed to the driver only if certain conditions are fulfilled. These 

--- Document Chunk 17019 ---
conditions are not specified here. See the “Start Of Mission” procedure and the "Train Trip" 

--- Document Chunk 17020 ---
procedure of SRS-§5. 

--- Document Chunk 17021 ---
{5} The request to acknowledge Shunting is displayed to the driver only if certain conditions are 

--- Document Chunk 17022 ---
fulfilled. These conditions are  not specified here. See the “Entry in Shunting” procedure and the 

--- Document Chunk 17023 ---
“Start Of Mission” procedure of SRS-§5. 

--- Document Chunk 17024 ---
{6} The request to acknowledge Reversing is displayed to the driver when certain conditions are 

--- Document Chunk 17025 ---
fulfilled. These conditions are not specified here. See the “reversing” procedure of SRS-§5. 

--- Document Chunk 17026 ---
{7} The request to acknowledge Limited Supervision is displayed to the driver only if certain 

--- Document Chunk 17027 ---
conditions are fulfilled. These conditions are not specified here. See the “Limited Supervision” 

--- Document Chunk 17028 ---
procedure” of SRS-§5 (for transitions from FS/AD/OS/UN to LS) and the "Start of mission" procedure 

--- Document Chunk 17029 ---
(for transition from SB to LS). 

--- Document Chunk 17030 ---
{8} Refer to Subset-035 for details. 

--- Document Chunk 17031 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP
