--- Document Chunk 17051 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17052 ---
4.7 DMI depending on modes 

--- Document Chunk 17053 ---
4.7.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 17054 ---
4.7.1.1 The DMI is an interface that allows the direct exchange of information between the driver 

--- Document Chunk 17055 ---
and the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment. The indirect exchange of information done 

--- Document Chunk 17056 ---
via the train interface (e.g. a driver’s action on the service brake used for the service 

--- Document Chunk 17057 ---
brake feedback, opening/closing the desk) is not part of the DMI. 

--- Document Chunk 17058 ---
4.7.1.2 The device(s) used to select “ERTMS/ETC S onboard equipment powered/unpowered” 

--- Document Chunk 17059 ---
is (are) not part of the DMI. 

--- Document Chunk 17060 ---
4.7.1.3 The device(s) used to select /indicate “ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment isolated/not 

--- Document Chunk 17061 ---
isolated” is (are) part of the DMI. 

--- Document Chunk 17062 ---
4.7.1.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 17063 ---
4.7.1.5 Information (input or output) only relevant for National System and not originated by the 

--- Document Chunk 17064 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board is not included in the following section. 

--- Document Chunk 17065 ---
4.7.2 DMI versus Mode Table 

--- Document Chunk 17066 ---
4.7.2.1.1 X = active: For a  DMI output, this means that the output information shall be shown to 

--- Document Chunk 17067 ---
the driver when the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equ ipment is in the mode indicated in the 

--- Document Chunk 17068 ---
column. For a DMI input, this means that it shall be possible for the driver to enter this 

--- Document Chunk 17069 ---
information when the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment is in the mode indicated in the 

--- Document Chunk 17070 ---
column). 

--- Document Chunk 17071 ---
4.7.2.1.2 A = available: This means that the input/output shall become active ONLY if another 

--- Document Chunk 17072 ---
condition(s) is (are) fulfilled. This condition(s) are not described here. 

--- Document Chunk 17073 ---
4.7.2.1.3 Grey cells: availability and meaning defined by national system. 

--- Document Chunk 17074 ---
4.7.2.1.4 NA = Not Applicable: This concer ns the modes SF and IS in which the DMI inputs and 

--- Document Chunk 17075 ---
outputs cannot be determined. 

--- Document Chunk 17076 ---

--- Document Chunk 17540 ---
4.8 Acceptance of received information 

--- Document Chunk 17541 ---
4.8.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 17542 ---
4.8.1.1 The aim of this chapter is to give an overview of which information is accepted or rejected 

--- Document Chunk 17543 ---
depending on the state of the on -board (level, mode) , the origin of the received 

--- Document Chunk 17544 ---
information (from RBC or not), and in case of information not transmitted by an RBC the 

--- Document Chunk 17545 ---
type of information (infill or non-infill). 

--- Document Chunk 17546 ---
4.8.1.2 The following sections have to be interpreted by applying the filters as shown in Figure 

--- Document Chunk 17547 ---
3. The first filter is detailed in section 4.8.3 “Accepted information depending on the level, 

--- Document Chunk 17548 ---
the origin and the type of information ”, the third filter in section 4.8.4 “Accepted 

--- Document Chunk 17549 ---
information depending on the mode and the type of information”. 

--- Document Chunk 17550 ---
4.8.1.3 If a message contains level transition information, any other information in that message 

--- Document Chunk 17551 ---
shall be evaluated considering the level transition information. 

--- Document Chunk 17552 ---
4.8.1.3.1 Information received in the same message as an immediate level transition order or a 

--- Document Chunk 17553 ---
conditional level transition order that causes a level transition shall be evaluated against 

--- Document Chunk 17554 ---
the first filter in two steps: 

--- Document Chunk 17555 ---
1) A first evaluation shall take place considering the on-board currently operated level, 

--- Document Chunk 17556 ---
as if a level transition order for further location had been received (i.e. the condition 

--- Document Chunk 17557 ---
[1] or [2] of Figure 3, if applied, shall be automatically fulfilled). 

--- Document Chunk 17558 ---
2) Then, if relevant, information to which the condition [1] or [2] of Figure 3 applies shall 

--- Document Chunk 17559 ---
be immediately extracted from the buffer and re -evaluated according to the new 

--- Document Chunk 17560 ---
selected level. The information accepted or rejected immediately considering the on-

--- Document Chunk 17561 ---
board currently operated level shall not be re-evaluated according to the new selected 

--- Document Chunk 17562 ---
level. 

--- Document Chunk 17563 ---
4.8.1.4 Note: As shown in Figure 3, information stored following an announcement of a change 

--- Document Chunk 17564 ---
of level, is re -checked for acceptance when the level has changed. This implies that, 

--- Document Chunk 17565 ---
when the level changes, the mode is - for a short moment – still unchanged, until the 

--- Document Chunk 17566 ---
stored information has been processed. The consequence for the Third Filter is that 

--- Document Chunk 17567 ---
information needs to be ac cepted for this short period also in modes in which this 

--- Document Chunk 17568 ---
information is otherwise useless. 

--- Document Chunk 17569 ---
4.8.1.5 If a message contains infill information, this latter shall be evaluated considering all other 

--- Document Chunk 17570 ---
non-infill information in that message. 

--- Document Chunk 17571 ---
4.8.1.6 When evaluating trackside information received by radio or when re-evaluating a set of 

--- Document Chunk 17572 ---
information released from the transition buffer, linking information, if any, shall be 

--- Document Chunk 17573 ---
evaluated prior to any other location related information. 

--- Document Chunk 17574 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17575 ---

--- Document Chunk 17662 ---
4.8.2 Assumptions 

--- Document Chunk 17663 ---
4.8.2.1 The following tables shall be applied assuming that: 

--- Document Chunk 17664 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17665 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17666 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 17667 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 17668 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 17669 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 17670 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 17671 ---
Page 62/93 

--- Document Chunk 17672 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17673 ---
a) the information complies with the system version checks (see section 3.17.3) and with 

--- Document Chunk 17674 ---
the data consistency checks.(see section 3.16) 

--- Document Chunk 17675 ---
b) with the exception of information part of an SM authorisation, the direction for which 

--- Document Chunk 17676 ---
the information is valid matches the current train orientation, or  the balise group 

--- Document Chunk 17677 ---
crossing direction (for SL, PS and SH engines).(see section 3.6.3) 

--- Document Chunk 17678 ---
c) In level 2, it is assumed that the “RBC” information which is marked “A” (Accepted) 

--- Document Chunk 17679 ---
comes from the supervising RBC (see RBC/RBC handover). If this information is 

--- Document Chunk 17680 ---
received from the “Accepting” RBC while the “Handing Over” RBC is still responsible, 

--- Document Chunk 17681 ---
it is stored onboard until the RBC transition is performed 

--- Document Chunk 17682 ---
Exception 1: The information “Acknowledgement of Train Data”, "Session 

--- Document Chunk 17683 ---
Management" and “Acknowledgement of Session Termination" shall be immediately 

--- Document Chunk 17684 ---
accepted. 

--- Document Chunk 17685 ---
Exception 2: The information “RBC transition order”, “Request to shorten  MA”, 

--- Document Chunk 17686 ---
“Revocation of Emergency Stop” and “LSSMA display toggle on/off order” shall be 

--- Document Chunk 17687 ---
rejected. 

--- Document Chunk 17688 ---
d) to check exception [4] in 4.8.3, the track description is referred to the SOLR (i.e. 

--- Document Chunk 17689 ---
relocation has been performed see 3.6.4.3). 

--- Document Chunk 17690 ---
e) the information from balise is received while no movement opposite to the authorised 

--- Document Chunk 17691 ---
direction is performed (see clause 3.14.3.6) 

--- Document Chunk 17692 ---
4.8.2.2 Regarding 4.8.2.1 a): In case a balise is missed or a balise telegram cannot be decoded, 

--- Document Chunk 17693 ---
the information “Inhibition of balise group message consistency reaction” is only used by 

--- Document Chunk 17694 ---
the o n-board equipment to inhibit the service brake reaction, while the balise group 

--- Document Chunk 17695 ---
message is rejected. If all the telegrams from a balise group are correctly read, the 

--- Document Chunk 17696 ---
information “Inhibition of balise group message consistency reaction”, if received, shall 

--- Document Chunk 17697 ---
be ignored by the on-board equipment. Therefore this information need not to be referred 

--- Document Chunk 17698 ---
to in the following tables. 

--- Document Chunk 17699 ---
4.8.2.3 In case a balise telegram contains the information VBC marker and a country/region 

--- Document Chunk 17700 ---
identity that both match a stored VBC, the whole balise telegram is ignored and any 

--- Document Chunk 17701 ---
further check in relation to this balise telegram is irrelevant (refer to 3.15.9. 3 b) ). 

--- Document Chunk 17702 ---
Otherwise the information VBC marker, if included in a consistent balise group message, 

--- Document Chunk 17703 ---
shall always be ignored by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment and need not to be 

--- Document Chunk 17704 ---
referred to in the following tables. 

--- Document Chunk 17705 ---
4.8.2.4 Note: with the exception of the data that is forwarded to a National System through the 

--- Document Chunk 17706 ---
STM interface (see 3.15.6 and SUBSET -035), what will happen to the data to be used 

--- Document Chunk 17707 ---
by applications outs ide ERTMS/ETCS (e.g. whether it is discarded, forwarded to an 

--- Document Chunk 17708 ---
external application, processed by a national function…) is outside the scope of this 

--- Document Chunk 17709 ---
specification and is assumed as not being part of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 17710 ---
functionality. 

--- Document Chunk 17711 ---
4.8.2.5 Note: the system version order received from balise group need not be referred to in the 

--- Document Chunk 17712 ---
following tables because it is taken into account by the on -board equipment prior to the 

--- Document Chunk 17713 ---
checks referred to in this section (see also clause 3.17.3.3). 

--- Document Chunk 17714 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 17715 ---

--- Document Chunk 17723 ---
4.8.3 Accepted information depending on the level, the origin and the type of 

--- Document Chunk 17724 ---
information 

--- Document Chunk 17725 ---
4.8.3.1 From RBC or not 

--- Document Chunk 17726 ---
4.8.3.1.1 “No” in column “From RBC” has to be understood as information received from a balise 

--- Document Chunk 17727 ---
group, loop or RIU. 

--- Document Chunk 17728 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17729 ---
NR = Not Relevant A = Accepted R = Rejected 

--- Document Chunk 17730 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 17731 ---
Information 

--- Document Chunk 17732 ---

--- Document Chunk 17733 ---

--- Document Chunk 17734 ---
       National Values No Non-infill A A A A 

--- Document Chunk 17735 ---

--- Document Chunk 17736 ---

--- Document Chunk 17737 ---
Linking No Non-infill R [1] R [1] A R [1] 

--- Document Chunk 17738 ---
 No Infill R R A R [1] 

--- Document Chunk 17739 ---
 Yes NR R [2] R [2] R [2] A [3] [17]

--- Document Chunk 18044 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18045 ---
[1] exception: stored onboard if an order to switch to level 1 at a further location has been received. 

--- Document Chunk 18046 ---
[2] exception: stored onboard if an order to switch to level 2 at a further location has been received. 

--- Document Chunk 18047 ---
[3] exception: rejected if: 

--- Document Chunk 18048 ---
- Train Data has been sent to the RBC and the RBC has not yet acknowledged any train data in the ongoing 

--- Document Chunk 18049 ---
communication session, or 

--- Document Chunk 18050 ---
- Train Data where the value of Train category, Axle load, Loading gauge or Traction system is different 

--- Document Chunk 18051 ---
from the last value a cknowledged by the RBC has been sent to the RBC and the corresponding 

--- Document Chunk 18052 ---
“Acknowledgement of Train Data” has not been received yet. 

--- Document Chunk 18053 ---
[4] exception: rejected if the SSP and gradient already available on-board or given together with the MA do not 

--- Document Chunk 18054 ---
cover the full length of the MA. 

--- Document Chunk 18055 ---
[5] exception: rejected if emergency stop(s) have been accepted and are not yet revoked or deleted onboard 

--- Document Chunk 18056 ---
(see mode transitions). 

--- Document Chunk 18057 ---
[8] exception: revocable TSRs shall be rejected if information “inhibition of revocable TSRs from bali ses in 

--- Document Chunk 18058 ---
level 2” is stored on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 18059 ---
[9] exception: rejected if no level 2 transition order is stored onboard. 

--- Document Chunk 18060 ---
[10] exception: rejected if the referred LRBG is memorised to have been reported with different “previous 

--- Document Chunk 18061 ---
LRBG” 

--- Document Chunk 18062 ---
[11] exception: rejected if a level transition order is received in the same message, or if a previous level 

--- Document Chunk 18063 ---
transition order has announced a level transition still to be executed 

--- Document Chunk 18064 ---
[12] exception: rejected if the text message is sent with a request for report of driver acknowledgement with 

--- Document Chunk 18065 ---
the same text message identifier as a previously received text message, which the driver has not yet 

--- Document Chunk 18066 ---
acknowledged 

--- Document Chunk 18067 ---
[13] exception: rejected if not received together with an immediate level transition order to level 1 or 2 

--- Document Chunk 18068 ---
[14] exception: rejected if it relates to an order to establish a communication session with an RBC referred to 

--- Document Chunk 18069 ---
in an RBC transition order currently stored or received in the same message  

--- Document Chunk 18070 ---
[15] exception: rejected if it is a session establishment order (which, for sleeping units, is to b e executed) 

--- Document Chunk 18071 ---
received together with a Radio Network transition order including a Radio Network type: 

--- Document Chunk 18072 ---
• FRMCS or FRMCS+GSM-R while FRMCS is the only radio system installed on-board or 

--- Document Chunk 18073 ---
FRMCS+GSM-R while both radio systems are installed on-board but the driver has elected to 

--- Document Chunk 18074 ---
perform the mission with FRMCS only, and if the FRMCS on-board is not registered to the FRMCS 

--- Document Chunk 18075 ---
Radio Network 

--- Document Chunk 18076 ---
• FRMCS+GSM-R while both radio systems are installed on-board, and, unless the driver has elected 

--- Document Chunk 18077 ---
to perform the mission with only one radio system, and if either the FRMCS on-board is not 

--- Document Chunk 18078 ---
registered to the FRMCS Radio Network or none of the GSM-R Mobile Terminal(s) available to 

--- Document Chunk 18079 ---
establish the communication session is registered to this GSM-R Radio Network 

--- Document Chunk 18080 ---
• GSM-R or FRMCS+GSM-R while GSM-R is the only radio system installed on-board or 

--- Document Chunk 18081 ---
FRMCS+GSM-R while both radio systems are installed on-board but the driver has elected to 

--- Document Chunk 18082 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

perform the mission with GSM-R only, and if none of the GSM-R Mobile Terminal(s) available to 

--- Document Chunk 18092 ---
establish the communication session is registered to this GSM-R Radio Network. 

--- Document Chunk 18093 ---
[16] exception: rejected if it is received from a balise group marked as unlinked and the list of trackside 

--- Document Chunk 18094 ---
supported levels contained in that order includes level 1. 

--- Document Chunk 18095 ---
[17] exception: rejected if a “Safe consist length information for SM” message has been sent to the RBC and 

--- Document Chunk 18096 ---
the corresponding acknowledgment has not been received yet in the ongoing mission. 

--- Document Chunk 18097 ---
[18] exception: rejected if the Signalling Related Speed Restriction equals zero

--- Document Chunk 18124 ---
4.8.4 Accepted Information depending on the mode and the type of information 

--- Document Chunk 18125 ---
4.8.4.1 Assumptions 

--- Document Chunk 18126 ---
4.8.4.1.1 For infill information, only the columns FS, AD and LS shall apply. In all other modes, infill information shall be rejected. 

--- Document Chunk 18127 ---
4.8.4.1.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 18128 ---
4.8.4.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 18129 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18130 ---
NR = Not Relevant A = Accepted R = Rejected

[1]: for level 2: only if following the reception of the information “Recognition of Exit from TR mode” with a more recent ti me stamp; for level 1: rejected 

--- Document Chunk 18429 ---
[2]: only if a cab is active 

--- Document Chunk 18430 ---
[3]: for order to establish a communication session: RBC contact information is stored without establishing the communication session 

--- Document Chunk 18431 ---
[4]: only if valid Train Data are stored on-board or if received in an SM authorisation 

--- Document Chunk 18432 ---
[5]: only level transition announcement (i.e., immediate level transition order and conditional level transition order shall be rejected) 

--- Document Chunk 18433 ---
[6]: rejected if override is active 

--- Document Chunk 18434 ---
[7]: only immediate level transition order and conditional level transition order shall be accepted (i.e., level transition announcement shall be rejected) and stored 

--- Document Chunk 18435 ---
for later evaluation (see 4.4.8.1.5, 4.4.20.1.11 & 4.4.21.1.11)

[8]: only RBC transition order with null distance to execution shall be accepted (i.e., RBC transition announcement shall be rejected) for storing the RBC contact 

--- Document Chunk 18446 ---
information (see 4.4.8.1.5.2 & 4.4.20.1.13) 

--- Document Chunk 18447 ---

--- Document Chunk 18448 ---
min safe front end of the train this Limited Supervision area is the furthest area that the train position confidence interva l overlaps within in the mode profile

--- Document Chunk 18460 ---

--- Document Chunk 18461 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 18462 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 18463 ---
Page 78/93 

--- Document Chunk 18464 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18465 ---
4.8.5 Handling of transition buffer in case of level transition announcement or 

--- Document Chunk 18466 ---
RBC/RBC handover 

--- Document Chunk 18467 ---
4.8.5.1 If an order to switch to level NTC, 1 or 2 at a further location has been received, the 

--- Document Chunk 18468 ---
ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall be able to store in a transition buffer (see figure 

--- Document Chunk 18469 ---
3, first filter) three sets of information obtained from three filtered messages. 

--- Document Chunk 18470 ---
4.8.5.2 If a n RBC transition order has been received and the Handing Over RBC is still the 

--- Document Chunk 18471 ---
supervising one, the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall be able to store in a 

--- Document Chunk 18472 ---
transition buffer (see figure 3, second filter) three sets of information obtained from three 

--- Document Chunk 18473 ---
filtered messages from the Accepting RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 18474 ---
4.8.5.2.1 Note: the term “set of information” refers to the part of a message being stored in the 

--- Document Chunk 18475 ---
transition buffer (i.e. information which is neither accepted nor rejected immedia tely) 

--- Document Chunk 18476 ---
according to the conditions stated in 4.8.3.1 [1] and [2] (for level transition) or according 

--- Document Chunk 18477 ---
to 4.8.2.1c (for RBC/RBC handover). 

--- Document Chunk 18478 ---
4.8.5.3 In case three sets of information are already stored in the transition buffer, any new set 

--- Document Chunk 18479 ---
to be stored shall replace the oldest one currently stored. 

--- Document Chunk 18480 ---
4.8.5.4 The sets of information stored in the transition buffer shall be deleted: 

--- Document Chunk 18481 ---
a) in case the level transition order is deleted or overwritten by another level transition 

--- Document Chunk 18482 ---
order for a different level, OR 

--- Document Chunk 18483 ---
b) in case the RBC transition order is deleted or overwritten by an order to switch to 

--- Document Chunk 18484 ---
another Accepting RBC, OR 

--- Document Chunk 18485 ---
c) in case the communication session with the RBC that provided the stored information 

--- Document Chunk 18486 ---
is terminated 

--- Document Chunk 18487 ---
4.8.5.5 At the same time the level transition is performed or at the same time the Accepting RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18488 ---
becomes the supervising one, the sets of information stored in the transition buffer shall 

--- Document Chunk 18489 ---
be released and re-evaluated in the sequence they have been received. 

--- Document Chunk 18490 ---
4.8.5.6 This sequential re-evaluation of all the released information shall be a prerequisite to any 

--- Document Chunk 18491 ---
use by the on -board equipment (e.g. it will lead neither to an intermediate change of 

--- Document Chunk 18492 ---
mode nor to a change of information displayed to the driver) and shall obey the following 

--- Document Chunk 18493 ---
principles: 

--- Document Chunk 18494 ---
a) Starting from the information currently used by on-board at the moment the level/RBC 

--- Document Chunk 18495 ---
transition is effective, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall determine the new 

--- Document Chunk 18496 ---
information for train supervision, by performing sequential updates from the 

--- Document Chunk 18497 ---
information released from the transition buffer, if accepted. 

--- Document Chunk 18498 ---
b) For each information update related to a re -evaluated set of information, the same 

--- Document Chunk 18499 ---
rules shall apply as to information update related to new information accepted outside 

--- Document Chunk 18500 ---
a level/RBC transition context. 

--- Document Chunk 18501 ---
c) The information resulting from this sequential u pdate shall then be used by the 

--- Document Chunk 18502 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 18503 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18504 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18505 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 18506 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 18507 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 18508 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 18509 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 18510 ---
Page 79/93 

--- Document Chunk 18511 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18512 ---
4.8.5.7 Accepting re-evaluated Conditional Emergency Stop information according to table 4.8.3 

--- Document Chunk 18513 ---
implies that the accepted Conditional Emergency Stop information may be accepted or 

--- Document Chunk 18514 ---
rejected in a further step (see clause 3.10.2.2) depending on the given stop location. This 

--- Document Chunk 18515 ---
decision, based on the comparison between the min safe front end position of the train 

--- Document Chunk 18516 ---
at the time the message was received and the given stop location, shall be  considered 

--- Document Chunk 18517 ---
part of the evaluation process as it affects the further re-evaluation of information stored 

--- Document Chunk 18518 ---
in the transition buffer (see clause 3.10.2.4). 

--- Document Chunk 18519 ---
4.8.5.7.1 Note: For the case of the Unconditional Emergency Stop information accepting the 

--- Document Chunk 18520 ---
information according to table 4.8.3 will always lead to the train being tripped (see clause 

--- Document Chunk 18521 ---
3.10.2.3) when re-evaluation of the transition buffer is completed. Information accepted 

--- Document Chunk 18522 ---
during re-evaluation of information stored in the transition buffer can then be affected on 

--- Document Chunk 18523 ---
transition to TR mode according to conditions in Table 4.10. 

--- Document Chunk 18524 ---
4.8.5.8 Note: The requirement to acknowledge an Emergency Stop information according to 

--- Document Chunk 18525 ---
clause 3.10.1.4, i.e., communicating to the RBC if the information has been accepted 

--- Document Chunk 18526 ---
(Conditional or Unconditional Emergency Stop) or rejected because the train has passed 

--- Document Chunk 18527 ---
the stop location (Conditional Emergency Stop only) , applies to the time when the 

--- Document Chunk 18528 ---
information is used, immediately after the sequential update has been completed.  

--- Document Chunk 18529 ---
Regards acknowledging the reception of an emergency stop message, as for any other 

--- Document Chunk 18530 ---
information received from trackside, see clause 3.16.3.5. 

--- Document Chunk 18531 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 18540 ---
4.9 What happens to accepted and stored information when 

--- Document Chunk 18541 ---
entering a given level 

--- Document Chunk 18542 ---
4.9.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 18543 ---
4.9.1.1 Every data that can be stored onboard after being accepted may be influenced by a level 

--- Document Chunk 18544 ---
transition. 

--- Document Chunk 18545 ---
4.9.1.2 A level transition acts on the “status” of stored information. 

--- Document Chunk 18546 ---
4.9.1.3 In case of entering level 1, MA Request Parameters, Position Report Parameters and 

--- Document Chunk 18547 ---
Track Ahead Free Request shall be deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 18548 ---
4.9.1.3.1 In case of entering level 0, NTC or 1, the information “Inhibition of revocable TSRs from 

--- Document Chunk 18549 ---
balises in level 2” shall be deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 18550 ---
4.9.1.4 For all other stored data, a level transition has no effect (void). 

--- Document Chunk 18551 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18552 ---

--- Document Chunk 18560 ---
4.10 What happens to accepted and stored information when entering a given mode 

--- Document Chunk 18561 ---
4.10.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 18562 ---
4.10.1.1 Every data that can be stored onboard after being accepted may be influenced by a mode transition. 

--- Document Chunk 18563 ---
4.10.1.2 A mode transition acts on the “status” of stored information. 

--- Document Chunk 18564 ---
4.10.1.3 Depending on which mode is entered, the action shall be one of the following: 

--- Document Chunk 18565 ---
a) data is deleted, 

--- Document Chunk 18566 ---
b) data is to be revalidated, 

--- Document Chunk 18567 ---
c) data is reset (set to default values) 

--- Document Chunk 18568 ---
d) data status is unchanged, 

--- Document Chunk 18569 ---
e) not relevant (the action on the data cannot be determined. This concerns the entry in SF and IS modes) 

--- Document Chunk 18570 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18571 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18572 ---
D = Deleted TBR = To Be Revalidated U = Unchanged NR = Not relevant R = Reset 

--- Document Chunk 18573 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18574 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18575 ---

board

--- Document Chunk 18823 ---
order to establish a communication session, is stored on-board)

--- Document Chunk 18834 ---

--- Document Chunk 18836 ---

--- Document Chunk 18837 ---

the mode profile (if any) and the list of ba lise groups for SH area (if any) become(s)

stored information)

4.11 What happens to stored information when exiting NP mode 

--- Document Chunk 18873 ---
4.11.1.1 Status of stored information, which is set to "Invalid" when No Power mode is entered, 

--- Document Chunk 18874 ---
shall be affected, when relevant, by information from the Cold Movement Detection 

--- Document Chunk 18875 ---
function, according to the following table: 

--- Document Chunk 18876 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18877 ---
 Status of On-board stored information 

--- Document Chunk 18878 ---

--- Document Chunk 18879 ---
information  

--- Document Chunk 18880 ---
Train Position  ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 18881 ---
Level 

--- Document Chunk 18882 ---
Table of trackside 

--- Document Chunk 18883 ---
supported levels 

--- Document Chunk 18884 ---
RBC contact 

--- Document Chunk 18885 ---
information 

--- Document Chunk 18886 ---
Transition conditions Un-

--- Document Chunk 18887 ---
known 

--- Document Chunk 18888 ---
Invalid Valid Un- 

--- Document Chunk 18889 ---
known 

--- Document Chunk 18890 ---

--- Document Chunk 18891 ---
know

--- Document Chunk 18892 ---
n 

--- Document Chunk 18893 ---

--- Document Chunk 18894 ---
known 

--- Document Chunk 18895 ---
Invalid Valid Un- 

--- Document Chunk 18896 ---
known 

--- Document Chunk 18897 ---
Invalid Valid 

--- Document Chunk 18898 ---
No Cold movement occurred  ⚫   ⚫   ⚫   ⚫   ⚫  

--- Document Chunk 18899 ---
Cold movement detected or 

--- Document Chunk 18900 ---
Cold movement information 

--- Document Chunk 18901 ---
not available 

--- Document Chunk 18902 ---
 ⚫         ⚫     

--- Document Chunk 18903 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18904 ---
4.11.1.2 Note: Status of stored information, which remains valid after NP mode has been entered, 

--- Document Chunk 18905 ---
is not affected by information from the Cold Movement Detection function.  

--- Document Chunk 18906 ---
4.11.1.3 If a cold movement has been detected (see section 3.15.8), or the Cold Movement 

--- Document Chunk 18907 ---
Detection function is not able to confirm that no cold movement has taken place, no 

--- Document Chunk 18908 ---
change of status of information to “valid” shall be made until it has been validated by a 

--- Document Chunk 18909 ---
different means than cold movement detection. 

--- Document Chunk 18910 ---
4.11.1.4 In case Supervised Manoeuvre, Shunting or Passive  Shunting mode was left to No 

--- Document Chunk 18911 ---
Power mode and a stored and not yet evaluated immediate level transition order or 

--- Document Chunk 18912 ---
conditional level transition order has to be evaluated (see 4.4.8.1.5 , 4.4.20.1.11 and 

--- Document Chunk 18913 ---
4.4.21.1.11.1), the following shall apply: 

--- Document Chunk 18914 ---
a) The above table in 4.11.1.1 shall not affect the previously applicable level and the 

--- Document Chunk 18915 ---
table of trackside supported levels, which were set to "Invalid" when No Power mode 

--- Document Chunk 18916 ---
was entered; 

--- Document Chunk 18917 ---
b) The previously applicable level which was set to "Invalid" when No Power mode was 

--- Document Chunk 18918 ---
entered, shall be considered as the current level for the evaluation of the immediate 

--- Document Chunk 18919 ---
level transition order or the conditional level transition order; 

--- Document Chunk 18920 ---
c) By exception to 5.10.4.1 b), any level change, which result from the immediate level 

--- Document Chunk 18921 ---
transition order or t he conditional level transition order, shall not lead to any driver 

--- Document Chunk 18922 ---
acknowledgment; 

--- Document Chunk 18923 ---
d) The table of trackside supported levels, which was applicable and was set to "Invalid" 

--- Document Chunk 18924 ---
when No Power mode was entered, shall be deleted; 

--- Document Chunk 18925 ---
e) The level and the table of trackside supported levels, which result from the immediate 

--- Document Chunk 18926 ---
level transition order or the conditional level transition order, shall be set to “invalid” 

--- Document Chunk 18927 ---
and the above table in 4.11.1.1 shall be applied to them by analogy. 

--- Document Chunk 18928 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18929 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18930 ---
SUBSET-026-4 

--- Document Chunk 18931 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 18932 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 18933 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 18934 ---
Chapter 4 : Modes and Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 18935 ---
Page 90/93 

--- Document Chunk 18936 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18937 ---
4.12 What happens to an ongoing brake command when entering a 

--- Document Chunk 18938 ---
given mode 

--- Document Chunk 18939 ---
4.12.1.1 The reason for which a brake command has been triggered in a given mode may be 

--- Document Chunk 18940 ---
influenced by a mode transition. 

--- Document Chunk 18941 ---
4.12.1.2 Depending on which mode is entered, the action shall be one of the following: 

--- Document Chunk 18942 ---
a) the brake command reason is revoked, i.e.  it does not apply anymore in the context 

--- Document Chunk 18943 ---
of the entered mode 

--- Document Chunk 18944 ---
b) the brake command reason is maintained, i.e. it remains applicable in the context of 

--- Document Chunk 18945 ---
the entered mode 

--- Document Chunk 18946 ---
c) the brake command reason is to be re -evaluated according to the data available in 

--- Document Chunk 18947 ---
the entered mode 

--- Document Chunk 18948 ---
d) not relevant (there is no transition from the mode in which the brake command reason 

--- Document Chunk 18949 ---
could be applicable to the entered mode or the transition condition(s) to the entered 

--- Document Chunk 18950 ---
mode can only be fulfilled when the condition(s) to release the brake command 

--- Document Chunk 18951 ---
associated to this individual reason (see 3.14.1) is(are) fulfilled) 

--- Document Chunk 18952 ---
e) not defined (the action on the brake command reason cannot be determined. This 

--- Document Chunk 18953 ---
concerns the entry in SF and IS modes) 

--- Document Chunk 18954 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 18955 ---
M = Maintained R = Revoked 

--- Document Chunk 18956 ---
TBR = To Be Re-evaluated  Grey cells = Not relevant or not 

--- Document Chunk 18957 ---
defined 

--- Document Chunk 18958 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 18959 ---

--- Document Chunk 19534 ---
5.3 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 19535 ---
 Scope and Purpose 

--- Document Chunk 19536 ---
5.3.1.1 This document defines the procedures that are necessary for interoperability within the 

--- Document Chunk 19537 ---
scope of ERTMS/ETCS. 

--- Document Chunk 19538 ---
5.3.1.2 Each procedure is defined by a set of mandatory requirements and , where convenient, 

--- Document Chunk 19539 ---
is illustrated by a flowchart. 

--- Document Chunk 19540 ---
5.3.1.3 In case the condition(s) in chap ter 4 triggering a mode transition is(are) fulfilled, this 

--- Document Chunk 19541 ---
transition shall be executed even if not shown in the chapter 5 procedures. 

--- Document Chunk 19542 ---
5.3.1.3.1 Note: Such a mode transition could lead to exiting a procedure immediately (e. g. cut off 

--- Document Chunk 19543 ---
power of on-board equipment, isolation of on-board equipment). 

--- Document Chunk 19544 ---
5.3.1.4 National operation rules (outside of ERTMS/ETCS) are also excluded, but may be 

--- Document Chunk 19545 ---
applied by the railways in addition to the procedures as long as interoperability is 

--- Document Chunk 19546 ---
retained. 

--- Document Chunk 19547 ---
 Definitions 

--- Document Chunk 19548 ---
5.3.2.1 Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 19549 ---
A procedure defines the required reaction of the ERTMS/ETCS entities (subsystems and 

--- Document Chunk 19550 ---
components) to either information exchanged between ERTMS/ETCS entities or events 

--- Document Chunk 19551 ---
(triggered by external entities or internal events). The procedures focus on the required 

--- Document Chunk 19552 ---
change in status and mode of the described ERTMS/ETCS entities. 

--- Document Chunk 19553 ---
5.3.2.2 Entities 

--- Document Chunk 19554 ---
The procedures define the required system behaviour on a context level, i. e. the entities 

--- Document Chunk 19555 ---
that are used to define the procedures are for example: the on -board equipment, the 

--- Document Chunk 19556 ---
trackside equipment (RBC/Balise), the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 19557 ---
5.3.2.3 States 

--- Document Chunk 19558 ---
States are situations of an ETCS subsystem with a specific set of available functions and 

--- Document Chunk 19559 ---
a specific set of events that may start or terminate the state. A state remains active as 

--- Document Chunk 19560 ---
long as the conditions to trigger the transition to a suc ceeding state are not completely 

--- Document Chunk 19561 ---
satisfied.  

--- Document Chunk 19562 ---
Note 1: one mode of operation may include several states for the on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 19563 ---
Note 2: A new state is only created, if the behaviour of the system differs from another 

--- Document Chunk 19564 ---
one. Possession of information (e. g.  location information) or not does not force 

--- Document Chunk 19565 ---
branching in states. 

--- Document Chunk 19566 ---
5.3.2.4 Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 19567 ---
Transitions define the rules for passing from one state to another. A transition is triggered 

--- Document Chunk 19568 ---
by a set of conditions which has to be fulfilled in a defined order or at the same time. 

--- Document Chunk 19569 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19570 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19571 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 19572 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 19573 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 19574 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 19575 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 19576 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 19577 ---
Page 11/112 

--- Document Chunk 19578 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19579 ---
When a transition refers to a driver’s selection, it means that the conditions to enable the 

--- Document Chunk 19580 ---
corresponding button on the DMI were fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 19581 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 19590 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19591 ---
5.4 Procedure Start of mission 

--- Document Chunk 19592 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 19593 ---
5.4.1.1 The driver may have to start a mission: 

--- Document Chunk 19594 ---
a) Once the train is awake, OR 

--- Document Chunk 19595 ---
b) Once shunting movements are finished, OR 

--- Document Chunk 19596 ---
c) Once a mission is ended, OR 

--- Document Chunk 19597 ---
d) Once a desk is opened (e.g. when a slave engine becomes a leading engine). 

--- Document Chunk 19598 ---
5.4.1.2 The common point of all these situations is that the ERTMS/ETCS on-board is in Stand-

--- Document Chunk 19599 ---
By mode, but the Start of Mission will be different, since some data may be already stored 

--- Document Chunk 19600 ---
on-board, depending on the previous situation. 

--- Document Chunk 19601 ---
5.4.1.3 Once the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in Stand-By mode, the start of mission 

--- Document Chunk 19602 ---
is not the only possibility, the engine may be come remote controlled (i.e. the on-board 

--- Document Chunk 19603 ---
switches to Sleeping mode). 

--- Document Chunk 19604 ---
5.4.1.4 If, upon desk opening, there is an already established communication session for which 

--- Document Chunk 19605 ---
no termination is ongoing, th e ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall first terminate 

--- Document Chunk 19606 ---
this communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 19607 ---
 Status of data stored in the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 19608 ---
5.4.2.1 At the beginning of the Start of Mission procedure, the data required may be in one of 

--- Document Chunk 19609 ---
three states:  

--- Document Chunk 19610 ---
a) “valid” (the stored value is known to be correct) 

--- Document Chunk 19611 ---
b) “Invalid” (the stored value may be wrong) 

--- Document Chunk 19612 ---
c) “Unknown” (no stored value available) 

--- Document Chunk 19613 ---
5.4.2.2 This refers to the following data: Driver ID, ERTMS/ETCS level, RBC contact information, 

--- Document Chunk 19614 ---
Train Data, Train Running Number, Train Position (see 3.6.1.3). 

--- Document Chunk 19615 ---
5.4.2.3 Note 1: The status of data in relation to the previous and the actual mode is described in 

--- Document Chunk 19616 ---
chapter 4, section "What happens to stored information when entering a mode". 

--- Document Chunk 19617 ---
5.4.2.4 Note 2: The change of status of data in course of the procedure is shown in the table in 

--- Document Chunk 19618 ---
section 5.4.3.3. 

--- Document Chunk 19619 ---
 Table of requirements for “Start of Mission” procedure 

--- Document Chunk 19620 ---
5.4.3.1 The ID numbers in the table are used for the representation of the procedure in form of 

--- Document Chunk 19621 ---
a flow chart in section 5.4.4.  

--- Document Chunk 19622 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19623 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19624 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 19625 ---
4.0.0

System Requirements Specification

Procedures

--- Document Chunk 19631 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19632 ---
5.4.3.2 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 19633 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 19634 ---
S0 The Start of Mission procedure shall be engaged when the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 19635 ---
equipment is in Stand -By mode with a desk open and no communication session is 

--- Document Chunk 19636 ---
established or is being established. 

--- Document Chunk 19637 ---
S1 Depending on the status of the Driver-ID, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 19638 ---
request the driver to enter the Driver-ID (if the Driver-ID is unknown) or shall request the 

--- Document Chunk 19639 ---
driver to revalidate or re-enter the Driver-ID (if the Driver-ID is invalid). 

--- Document Chunk 19640 ---
The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the driver the possibility to enter/re-

--- Document Chunk 19641 ---
validate (depending on the status) the Train running number. 

--- Document Chunk 19642 ---
The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall also offer the driver the possibility to 

--- Document Chunk 19643 ---
set/remove a Virtual Balise Cover. 

--- Document Chunk 19644 ---
Once the Driver-ID is entered or revalidated (E1) (possibly further to the Train running 

--- Document Chunk 19645 ---
number entry/revalidation and/or to Virtual Balise Cover setting/removal ), the process 

--- Document Chunk 19646 ---
shall go to D2 

--- Document Chunk 19647 ---
D2 If both the stored position and the stored level are valid, the process shall go to D3 

--- Document Chunk 19648 ---
If the stored position or the stored level is “invalid” or “unknown”, the process shall go to 

--- Document Chunk 19649 ---
S2 

--- Document Chunk 19650 ---
D3 If the stored level is 2, the process shall go to D7 

--- Document Chunk 19651 ---
If the stored level is 0,1 or NTC, the process shall go to S10 

--- Document Chunk 19652 ---
D7 Depending on the stored Radio Network type, on the radio systems(s) installed on-board 

--- Document Chunk 19653 ---
and if one of the following conditions is fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 19654 ---
• The Radio Network type is FRMCS or is FRMCS+GSM -R while FRMCS is 

--- Document Chunk 19655 ---
the only radio system installed on -board and the FRMCS on -board is 

--- Document Chunk 19656 ---
registered to the FRMCS Radio Network, OR 

--- Document Chunk 19657 ---
• The Radio Network type is FRMCS+GSM -R while both radio systems are 

--- Document Chunk 19658 ---
installed on -board, and both the FRMCS on -board is registered to the 

--- Document Chunk 19659 ---
FRMCS Radio Network  and at least one GSM -R Mobile Terminal is 

--- Document Chunk 19660 ---
registered to a GSM-R Radio Network, OR 

--- Document Chunk 19661 ---
• The Radio Network type is GSM -R or is FRMCS+GSM -R while GSM -R is 

--- Document Chunk 19662 ---
the only radio system installed on-board and at least one Mobile Terminal is 

--- Document Chunk 19663 ---
registered to a GSM-R Radio Network 

--- Document Chunk 19664 ---
The process shall go to A31. 

--- Document Chunk 19665 ---
Otherwise, it shall go to S4 

--- Document Chunk 19666 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19667 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19668 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 19669 ---
4.0.0

System Requirements Specification

Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 19674 ---
Page 14/112 

--- Document Chunk 19675 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19676 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 19677 ---
S2 If the status of the Level data is "unknown", the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 19678 ---
request the driver to enter it. 

--- Document Chunk 19679 ---
If the status of the Level data is "invalid", the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 19680 ---
request the driver to re-validate or re-enter the ERTMS/ETCS level. 

--- Document Chunk 19681 ---
If the entered / re-validated level is 2, the process shall go to S3 

--- Document Chunk 19682 ---
If the entered / re-validated level is 0, 1 or one of proposed NTC level(s) (see 3.18.4.2 

--- Document Chunk 19683 ---
for the levels the driver is allowed to select), the process shall go to S10 

--- Document Chunk 19684 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19685 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 19686 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19687 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 19688 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 19689 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 19690 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 19691 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 19692 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 19693 ---
Page 15/112 

--- Document Chunk 19694 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19695 ---
S3 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the possibility to the driver to re-enter 

--- Document Chunk 19696 ---
the Radio Network type. 

--- Document Chunk 19697 ---
If the driver selects a new Radio Network type (i.e. different from the previously stored 

--- Document Chunk 19698 ---
one), the on -board equipment shall terminate the ongoing communication session (if 

--- Document Chunk 19699 ---
any) and if not “unknown” the status of the RBC contact information shall be immediately 

--- Document Chunk 19700 ---
set to “invalid”. 

--- Document Chunk 19701 ---
If the driver selects FRMCS or FRMCS+GSM-R while FRMCS is installed on-board and 

--- Document Chunk 19702 ---
the FRMCS on-board is not registered to the FRMCS Radio Network (E4), the process 

--- Document Chunk 19703 ---
shall go to A41. 

--- Document Chunk 19704 ---
If the Radio Network type is GSM -R or FRMCS+GSM-R while GSM-R is installed on-

--- Document Chunk 19705 ---
board, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall also offer the possibility to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 19706 ---
to re-enter the GSM-R Radio Network ID. If the driver elects to do so, the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 19707 ---
equipment shall terminate the ongoing communication session, if any. As soon as the 

--- Document Chunk 19708 ---
related safe connection is released, if any, the on-board equipment shall acquire an 

--- Document Chunk 19709 ---
alphanumeric list of available and allowed GSM-R networks, based on a request to the 

--- Document Chunk 19710 ---
GSM-R Mobile Terminal(s): 

--- Document Chunk 19711 ---
• If this list is empty (E3) the process shall go to A29 

--- Document Chunk 19712 ---
• If the driver selects a new GSM-R Radio Network ID from the proposed list, the 

--- Document Chunk 19713 ---
registration of the GSM-R Mobile Terminal(s) to this new GSM-R Radio Network 

--- Document Chunk 19714 ---
shall be ordered and if not “unknown” the status of the RBC contact information 

--- Document Chunk 19715 ---
shall be immediately set to “invalid”. 

--- Document Chunk 19716 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19717 ---
If the Radio Network type is FRMCS+GSM-R while both radio systems are installed on-

--- Document Chunk 19718 ---
board, and either the FRMCS on -board is registered to the FRMCS Radio Network  or 

--- Document Chunk 19719 ---
at least one GSM-R Mobile Terminal is duly registered to a GSM-R Radio Network, the 

--- Document Chunk 19720 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall also offer the possibility to the driver to perform 

--- Document Chunk 19721 ---
the mission with only one radio system. If the driver elects to do so ( E17), the process 

--- Document Chunk 19722 ---
shall go to A43. 

--- Document Chunk 19723 ---
Depending on the Radio Network type and only if any of the following sub-conditions is 

--- Document Chunk 19724 ---
fulfilled, 

--- Document Chunk 19725 ---
• The Radio Network type is FRMCS or is FRMCS+GSM -R while FRMCS is the 

--- Document Chunk 19726 ---
only radio system installed on-board, and the FRMCS on-board is registered to 

--- Document Chunk 19727 ---
the FRMCS Radio Network, OR 

--- Document Chunk 19728 ---
• The Radio Network type is FRMCS+GSM -R while both radio systems are 

--- Document Chunk 19729 ---
installed on-board, and both the FRMCS on -board is registered to the FRMCS 

--- Document Chunk 19730 ---
Radio Network and at least one GSM-R Mobile Terminal is registered to a GSM-

--- Document Chunk 19731 ---
R Radio Network, OR 

--- Document Chunk 19732 ---
• The Radio Network type is FRMCS+GSM -R while both radio systems are 

--- Document Chunk 19733 ---
installed on-board, and the driver  has elected to perform the mission with only 

--- Document Chunk 19734 ---
one radio system 

--- Document Chunk 19735 ---
• The Radio Network type is GSM -R or is FRMCS+GSM -R while GSM-R is the 

--- Document Chunk 19736 ---
only radio system installed on -board, and at least one Mobile Terminal is 

--- Document Chunk 19737 ---
registered to a GSM-R Radio Network 

--- Document Chunk 19738 ---

--- Document Chunk 19749 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the following options to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 19750 ---
for the RBC contact information: 

--- Document Chunk 19751 ---
• Only if the status of the RBC contact information is “invalid” or “valid”: order the 

--- Document Chunk 19752 ---

--- Document Chunk 19753 ---
information 

--- Document Chunk 19754 ---

--- Document Chunk 19755 ---

--- Document Chunk 19756 ---

--- Document Chunk 19757 ---

--- Document Chunk 19758 ---

--- Document Chunk 19759 ---
enter it (if its status is “invalid” or “valid”). If the Radio Network type is FRMCS or 

--- Document Chunk 19760 ---
is FRMCS+GSM-R while FRMCS is the only radio system installed on -board, 

--- Document Chunk 19761 ---
the RBC contact information shall only consist of the RBC ID. Otherwise it shall 

--- Document Chunk 19762 ---

--- Document Chunk 19763 ---

--- Document Chunk 19764 ---
the process shall go to A31 

--- Document Chunk 19765 ---
S4 If the stored Radio Network type is FRMCS or is FRMCS+GSM-R while FRMCS is the 

--- Document Chunk 19766 ---

--- Document Chunk 19767 ---

--- Document Chunk 19768 ---

--- Document Chunk 19769 ---

--- Document Chunk 19770 ---

--- Document Chunk 19771 ---
equipment has been detected to be connected to the ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 19772 ---
(E71); in such case the process shall go to A42 

--- Document Chunk 19773 ---

--- Document Chunk 19774 ---

--- Document Chunk 19775 ---

--- Document Chunk 19776 ---
least one GSM -R Mobile Terminal is registered to a GSM -R Radio 

--- Document Chunk 19777 ---
Network(E62); in such case the process shall go to A31, OR 

--- Document Chunk 19778 ---
• a sufficient time (refer to Appendix A.3.1) is elapsed since it has sent the latest 

--- Document Chunk 19779 ---
GSM-R Radio Network registration order to a GSM-R Mobile Terminal (E72); in 

--- Document Chunk 19780 ---
such case the process shall go to A42 

--- Document Chunk 19781 ---

--- Document Chunk 19843 ---
S5 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall request the driver to choose whether to 

--- Document Chunk 19844 ---
perform the mission with only one radio system: 

--- Document Chunk 19845 ---
• If the driver elects to perform the mission with only one radio system and the 

--- Document Chunk 19846 ---
RBC contact information is valid (E8), the process shall go to A31 

--- Document Chunk 19847 ---
• If the driver elects to perform the mission with only one radio system and the 

--- Document Chunk 19848 ---
RBC contact information is not valid (E9), the process shall go to S3 

--- Document Chunk 19849 ---
If the driver elects to not perform the mission with only one radio system ( E15), the 

--- Document Chunk 19850 ---
process shall go to S10 (the driver has to unlock the situation to continue e.g. selection 

--- Document Chunk 19851 ---
of new level). 

--- Document Chunk 19852 ---
S10 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the possibility to the driver to select 

--- Document Chunk 19853 ---
SM (only in level 2, if the train position is valid and is referred to an LRBG, and if the 

--- Document Chunk 19854 ---
“safe consist length” information is available), SH, NL, or to select Train Data Entry. 

--- Document Chunk 19855 ---
• If the driver selects SM (E34), the process shall continue in the same way as the 

--- Document Chunk 19856 ---
procedure “Supervised Manoeuvre”. 

--- Document Chunk 19857 ---
If the RBC rejects the request for Supervised Manoeuvre (E35), the process shall 

--- Document Chunk 19858 ---
go back to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 19859 ---
• If the driver selects SH (E12), the process shall continue in the same way as the 

--- Document Chunk 19860 ---
procedure “Shunting initiated by the driver”. 

--- Document Chunk 19861 ---
If, in level 2, the RBC rejects the request for Shunting (E13), the process shall go 

--- Document Chunk 19862 ---
back to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 19863 ---
• If the driver selects NL ( E10) then the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 19864 ---
immediately switch to Non Leading mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, transition between 

--- Document Chunk 19865 ---
modes: transition [46]). The mission starts in NL mode (if level is 2, the 

--- Document Chunk 19866 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment also reports the change of mode to the RBC). 

--- Document Chunk 19867 ---
• If the driver selects Train Data Entry (E11), the process shall go to S12 

--- Document Chunk 19868 ---
• Following E10, E12, if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall 

--- Document Chunk 19869 ---
delete the train position data (new status: “unknown”) 

--- Document Chunk 19870 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19871 ---
S12 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall request the driver to enter/revalidate t he 

--- Document Chunk 19872 ---
Train Data that requires driver validation. 

--- Document Chunk 19873 ---
Once Train Data is stored and validated (E16), the process shall go to D12 

--- Document Chunk 19874 ---
D12 If Train running number is valid, the process shall go to D10 

--- Document Chunk 19875 ---
If Train running number is “unknown” or “invalid”, the process shall go to S13 

--- Document Chunk 19876 ---
S13 If the status of the Train running number is "unknown" or “invalid”, the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 19877 ---
on-board equipment shall request the driver to enter/re -validate the Train running 

--- Document Chunk 19878 ---
number now. 

--- Document Chunk 19879 ---
Once Train running number is entered/re-validated (E18), the process shall go to D10. 

--- Document Chunk 19880 ---
D10 When the validated level is 2, the process shall go to D11 

--- Document Chunk 19881 ---
When the validated level is 0,1 or NTC, the process shall go to S20 

--- Document Chunk 19882 ---

D11 When the session is open, the process shall go to D15, otherwise it shall go to S10 

--- Document Chunk 19894 ---

--- Document Chunk 19895 ---

--- Document Chunk 19896 ---

--- Document Chunk 19898 ---

--- Document Chunk 19899 ---
stored on-board when Train Data is validated. 

--- Document Chunk 19900 ---
S11 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall wait for the Train Data acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 19901 ---
from the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 19902 ---
When the RBC acknowledges Train Data ( E14), then the ERTMS/ETCS onboard 

--- Document Chunk 19903 ---
equipment shall go to the step S20. 

--- Document Chunk 19904 ---
S20 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the possibility to the driver to select 

--- Document Chunk 19905 ---
“Start” 

--- Document Chunk 19906 ---
a) When the validated level is NTC and the driver selects "start" (E20), the process 

--- Document Chunk 19907 ---
shall go to S22 

--- Document Chunk 19908 ---
b) When the validated level is 0 and the driver selects "start" (E21), the process shall 

--- Document Chunk 19909 ---
go to S23 

--- Document Chunk 19910 ---
c) When the validated level is 1 and the driver selects "start" (E22), the process shall 

--- Document Chunk 19911 ---
go to S24 

--- Document Chunk 19912 ---
d) When the validated level is 2 and the driver selects "start" (E24), the process shall 

--- Document Chunk 19913 ---
go to S21 

--- Document Chunk 19914 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 19915 ---
S21 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall send an MA request to the RBC and wait. 

--- Document Chunk 19916 ---
If an SR authorisation is received from RBC (E26), the process shall go to S24 

--- Document Chunk 19917 ---
If an MA allowing OS/LS/SH is received from RBC (E27), the process shall go to S25 

--- Document Chunk 19918 ---
If an MA allowing FS is received from RBC (E29), the mission starts in Full Supervision 

--- Document Chunk 19919 ---
mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: transition from SB to FS) 

--- Document Chunk 19920 ---
S22 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall request an acknowledgement from the 

--- Document Chunk 19921 ---
driver for running under supervision of the selected National System. When the driver 

--- Document Chunk 19922 ---
acknowledges (E30) , the mission starts in SN mode  (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions 

--- Document Chunk 19923 ---
between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 19924 ---
Following E30, if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall delete the 

--- Document Chunk 19925 ---
train position data (new status: “unknown”) 

--- Document Chunk 19926 ---
S23 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall require an acknowledgement from the 

--- Document Chunk 19927 ---
driver for running in Unfitted mode. When the driver acknowledges ( E31), the mission 

--- Document Chunk 19928 ---
starts in Unfitted mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: transition 

--- Document Chunk 19929 ---
from SB to UN) 

--- Document Chunk 19930 ---
Following E31, if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall delete the 

--- Document Chunk 19931 ---
train position data (new status: “unknown”)” 

--- Document Chunk 19932 ---

--- Document Chunk 19950 ---

--- Document Chunk 19951 ---
acknowledges (E33), the mission starts in On Sight/Limited Supervision/Shunting mode 

--- Document Chunk 19952 ---
(refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: transition from SB to OS, LS or SH) 

--- Document Chunk 19953 ---
A31 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall open the session with the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 19954 ---
D31 If the opening of the session is successful, the process shall go to D32 

--- Document Chunk 19955 ---
If the opening of the session has failed, the process shall go to A32 

--- Document Chunk 19956 ---
A32 The driver shall be informed when the on-board equipment fails to open a radio session. 

--- Document Chunk 19957 ---
Opening  of a radio session has failed if 

--- Document Chunk 19958 ---
• No connection to the RBC can be established (see section 3.5.3.7) OR 

--- Document Chunk 19959 ---
• The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, based on the system configuration 

--- Document Chunk 19960 ---
reported by the RBC, decides that compatibility is not ensured and terminates the 

--- Document Chunk 19961 ---
communication session 

--- Document Chunk 19962 ---
This condition leads to S10 (The driver has to unlock the situation to continue e.g. 

--- Document Chunk 19963 ---
selection of new level). 

--- Document Chunk 19964 ---
D32 If the stored position is valid and refers to an LRBG, the process shall go to A33 

--- Document Chunk 19965 ---
Otherwise, the process shall go to A34 

--- Document Chunk 19966 ---
A33 The “SoM position report” message, marked as referring to a “valid train position referred 

--- Document Chunk 19967 ---
to an LRBG”, shall be transmitted to the RBC, together with valid Train Data and/or valid 

--- Document Chunk 19968 ---
Train running number, if already stored on -board, and, if available while no valid Train 

--- Document Chunk 19969 ---
Data is stored on-board, with safe consist length information. 

--- Document Chunk 19970 ---
This condition leads to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 19971 ---
A34 If the train position data stored in the on-board equipment is of status “invalid” and refers 

--- Document Chunk 19972 ---
to an LRBG, the “SoM position report” message, marked as referring to an “invalid train 

--- Document Chunk 19973 ---
position referred to an LRBG”, shall be transmitted to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 19974 ---
Otherwise the "SoM position report" message, marked as referring to "no train position 

--- Document Chunk 19975 ---
referred to an LRBG” and with the LRBG identity set to "unknown", shall be transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 19976 ---
to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 19977 ---
In both cases valid Train Data and/or valid Train running number, if already sto red on-

--- Document Chunk 19978 ---
board, and, if available while no valid Train Data is stored on-board, safe consist length 

--- Document Chunk 19979 ---
information, shall be included in the “SoM position report” message. 

--- Document Chunk 19980 ---
The process shall then go to D33 

--- Document Chunk 19981 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 19992 ---
D33 When the position report marked as referring to an "invalid train position referred to an 

--- Document Chunk 19993 ---
LRBG" is received by the RBC, this latter shall check whether it can validate this position 

--- Document Chunk 19994 ---
report. 

--- Document Chunk 19995 ---
If the position report can be validated by the RBC, the process shall go to A35 

--- Document Chunk 19996 ---
Otherwise, if the position report was marked as referring to "no train position referred to 

--- Document Chunk 19997 ---
an LRBG", or if the position report that was marked as referring to an  "invalid train 

--- Document Chunk 19998 ---
position referred to an LRBG" cannot be validated by the RBC, the process shall go to 

--- Document Chunk 19999 ---
D22 

--- Document Chunk 20000 ---
Note: How the RBC is able to validate the position report  is a national issue, out of the 

--- Document Chunk 20001 ---
scope for this specification 

--- Document Chunk 20002 ---
A35 The RBC shall inform the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment that the reported position 

--- Document Chunk 20003 ---
referred to an LRBG is valid. 

--- Document Chunk 20004 ---
When this message is received by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, the status  

--- Document Chunk 20005 ---
of the position shall be set to "valid" 

--- Document Chunk 20006 ---
The process shall go to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 20007 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20008 ---
D22 If the SoM position report is marked as referring to "no train position referred to an 

--- Document Chunk 20009 ---
LRBG", or if the RBC is not able to confirm a SoM position report marked as referring to 

--- Document Chunk 20010 ---
an "invalid train position  referred to an LRBG" , the RBC shall neverth eless decide 

--- Document Chunk 20011 ---
whether it accepts the train or not. 

--- Document Chunk 20012 ---
If yes, the process shall go to A23 

--- Document Chunk 20013 ---
If no, the process shall go to A38 

--- Document Chunk 20014 ---
Note: How the RBC assumes responsibility for the train is a national issue, out of the 

--- Document Chunk 20015 ---
scope for this specification 

--- Document Chunk 20016 ---
A23 The RBC shall inform the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment that it accepts the train 

--- Document Chunk 20017 ---
although the on -board has not  reported a  "valid train position referred to an LRBG"  

--- Document Chunk 20018 ---
information. 

--- Document Chunk 20019 ---
D34 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is informed that the train is accepted 

--- Document Chunk 20020 ---
without "valid train position referred to an LRBG" information: 

--- Document Chunk 20021 ---
• If a valid train position data referred to an unlinked balise group  is stored on -

--- Document Chunk 20022 ---
board, the status of the train position shall remain unchanged  and the process 

--- Document Chunk 20023 ---
shall go to S10 

--- Document Chunk 20024 ---
• Otherwise the process shall go to A24 

--- Document Chunk 20025 ---
A24 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall delete the train position data (new status: 

--- Document Chunk 20026 ---
“unknown”) and the process shall go to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 20027 ---
A38 The RBC shall inform the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment that it rejects the train 

--- Document Chunk 20028 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

D35 When the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is informed that the train is rejected: 

--- Document Chunk 20040 ---
• If a valid train position data referred to an unlinked balise group  is stored on -

--- Document Chunk 20041 ---
board, the status of the train position shall remain unchanged  and the process 

--- Document Chunk 20042 ---
shall go to A40 

--- Document Chunk 20043 ---
• Otherwise the process shall go to A39 

--- Document Chunk 20044 ---

--- Document Chunk 20045 ---
“unknown”) and the process shall go to A40 

--- Document Chunk 20046 ---
A40 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall terminate the session with the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 20047 ---
Once the session is terminated it shall inform the driver that the train is rejected and the 

--- Document Chunk 20048 ---
process shall go to S10 (the driver has to unlock the situation to continue e.g. selection 

--- Document Chunk 20049 ---
of new level). 

--- Document Chunk 20050 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20051 ---
5.4.3.2.1 The SoM procedure shall end as soon as at least one of the following conditions is 

--- Document Chunk 20052 ---
fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 20053 ---
• Transition to any mode other than SB 

--- Document Chunk 20054 ---
• The desk is closed 

--- Document Chunk 20055 ---
5.4.3.2.2 When the driver closes the desk, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall terminate 

--- Document Chunk 20056 ---
the communication session with the RBC, if any. 

--- Document Chunk 20057 ---

--- Document Chunk 20500 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20501 ---
Figure 1: Flowchart for “Start of Mission” 

--- Document Chunk 20502 ---
 Degraded Situations 

--- Document Chunk 20503 ---
5.4.5.1 Nominally, accidental loss of an already open session (that can occur at any step) has 

--- Document Chunk 20504 ---
not been taken into account for the design of the SoM flowchart. However, should such 

--- Document Chunk 20505 ---
a fault occur above D11 the nominal procedure applies (refer to D11 in flowchart). On 

--- Document Chunk 20506 ---
the other hand, if it occurs in any step further than D11, the process shall go to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 20507 ---
5.4.5.2 The SoM flowchart described in section 5.4.3 only includes the main paths and does not 

--- Document Chunk 20508 ---
exhaustively cover the various operational situations, which could occur while performing 

--- Document Chunk 20509 ---
the SoM procedure (e.g. when revised instructions are given to the driver or when the 

--- Document Chunk 20510 ---
driver needs to re-enter already captured data). 

--- Document Chunk 20511 ---
5.4.5.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall also offer the driver the following 

--- Document Chunk 20512 ---
possibilities, in addition to the ones that are described in section 5.4.3: 

--- Document Chunk 20513 ---
a) only at S10 and S20 and if the conditions defined in 5.8.2.1 for Stand By are fulfilled, 

--- Document Chunk 20514 ---
to select “Override”. If the driver chooses to do so, then the process shall go to the 

--- Document Chunk 20515 ---
procedure “Override” and, if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 20516 ---
shall delete the train position data (new status: “unknown”) 

--- Document Chunk 20517 ---
b) only at S10 and S20, to re-enter the Driver-ID 

--- Document Chunk 20518 ---
c) only at S10 and S20,to re-enter the “Train running number” 

--- Document Chunk 20519 ---
d) only at S20, to re-enter the Train data. If the driver chooses to do so, then the process 

--- Document Chunk 20520 ---
shall go to S12. 

--- Document Chunk 20521 ---
e) only at S10 and S20, to re -enter the Level. If the driver chooses to do so, t hen the 

--- Document Chunk 20522 ---
process shall go to S2 

--- Document Chunk 20523 ---
f) only at S20, to select “Non Leading ”. If the driver chooses to do so, then the 

--- Document Chunk 20524 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall immediately switch to Non Leading mode 

--- Document Chunk 20525 ---
and, if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board shall delete the train 

--- Document Chunk 20526 ---
position data (new status: “unknown”). 

--- Document Chunk 20527 ---
g) only at S20, to select “Shunting”. If the driver chooses to do so, then the process shall 

--- Document Chunk 20528 ---
go to the procedure “Shunting initiated by driver” and, if the position is still invalid, the 

--- Document Chunk 20529 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall delete the train position data (new status: “unknown”). 

--- Document Chunk 20530 ---
If, in level 2, the RBC rejects the request for Shunting, the process shall go back to 

--- Document Chunk 20531 ---
S20. 

--- Document Chunk 20532 ---
h) only at S10, if valid Train Data is available, to select “Start”. If the driver chooses to 

--- Document Chunk 20533 ---
do so: 

--- Document Chunk 20534 ---
• if the level is 0, then the process shall go to S23. 

--- Document Chunk 20535 ---
• if the level is NTC, then the process shall go to S22. 

--- Document Chunk 20536 ---
• if the level is 1, then the process shall go to S24. 

--- Document Chunk 20537 ---
• if the level is 2 and a session is open, then the process shall go to S21. 

--- Document Chunk 20538 ---
• if the level is 2 and no session is open, then the process shall go to S24. 

--- Document Chunk 20539 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20540 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20541 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 20542 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 20543 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 20544 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 20545 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 20546 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 20547 ---
Page 27/112 

--- Document Chunk 20548 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20549 ---
i) only at S10 and S20, to set/remove a Virtual Balise Cover. 

--- Document Chunk 20550 ---
j) only at S10 and S20, to re-enter the Radio data. If the driver chooses to do so: 

--- Document Chunk 20551 ---
• If the level is 2, then the process shall go to S3. 

--- Document Chunk 20552 ---
• If the level is 0/1/NTC, then the driver shall only have the possibility to modify 

--- Document Chunk 20553 ---
the Radio Network information. 

--- Document Chunk 20554 ---
k) only at S20, if the level is 2 and the “safe consist length” information is available , to 

--- Document Chunk 20555 ---
select “Supervised Manoeuvre”. If the driver chooses to do so, then the process shall 

--- Document Chunk 20556 ---
go to the procedure “Supervised Manoeuvre” . If the RBC rejects the request for 

--- Document Chunk 20557 ---
“Supervised Manoeuvre”, the process shall go back to S20. 

--- Document Chunk 20558 ---
l) only at S10 and S20, to initiate the procedure for “Inhibition of balise transmission 

--- Document Chunk 20559 ---
alarm reaction” (see 5.22). 

--- Document Chunk 20560 ---
 Entry to Mode Considered as a Mission 

--- Document Chunk 20561 ---
5.4.6.1 A mission is considered as started as soon as the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 20562 ---
enters FS, LS, SR, OS, SM, NL, UN, or SN mode. 

--- Document Chunk 20563 ---
5.4.6.2 Entry in all other modes, from SB mode, is not considered as a mission. 

--- Document Chunk 20564 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20565 ---

--- Document Chunk 20574 ---
5.5 Procedure End of Mission 

--- Document Chunk 20575 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 20576 ---
5.5.1.1 End of mission refers to the situation where the trackside stops to authorise the 

--- Document Chunk 20577 ---
movement of a unit. End of mission is initiated by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 20578 ---
when entering specific modes (see below). 

--- Document Chunk 20579 ---
 Entry to Mode Considered as an End of Mission: 

--- Document Chunk 20580 ---
5.5.2.1 Stand-By mode 

--- Document Chunk 20581 ---
5.5.2.1.1 From FS , AD , LS, OS, SM, UN, NL,  SR, PT, RV or SN mode, the entry of the 

--- Document Chunk 20582 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment into the Stand-by mode is considered as an End of 

--- Document Chunk 20583 ---
Mission 

--- Document Chunk 20584 ---
5.5.2.1.2 Note: While in SN mode (level  NTC), some other conditions to end the mission may 

--- Document Chunk 20585 ---
depend on the National System. 

--- Document Chunk 20586 ---
5.5.2.1.3 The entry of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment into the S tand-by mode, from PT 

--- Document Chunk 20587 ---
mode, is only considered as an End of Mission if there was an ongoing mission. 

--- Document Chunk 20588 ---
5.5.2.2 Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 20589 ---
5.5.2.3 Shunting mode 

--- Document Chunk 20590 ---
5.5.2.3.1 The entry of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment into the Shunting mode, from FS , 

--- Document Chunk 20591 ---
AD, LS, OS, SR, SM, SN or UN mode, is considered as an End of Mission. 

--- Document Chunk 20592 ---
5.5.2.3.2 The entry of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment into the Shunting mode, from PT 

--- Document Chunk 20593 ---
mode, is only considered as an End of Mission if there was an ongoing mission. 

--- Document Chunk 20594 ---
5.5.2.3.3 Note: While in SN mode (level  NTC), some other conditions to end the mission may 

--- Document Chunk 20595 ---
depend on the National System. 

--- Document Chunk 20596 ---
 End of Mission Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 20597 ---
5.5.3.1 The procedure comprises the following steps 

--- Document Chunk 20598 ---
5.5.3.1.1 Step 1 - MA, Track Description Data and Train Data may be deleted (mode 

--- Document Chunk 20599 ---
dependent, see Chapter 4, section "What happens to accepted and stored information 

--- Document Chunk 20600 ---
when Entering a Mode"). 

--- Document Chunk 20601 ---
End of Procedure, if there is no existing communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 20602 ---
5.5.3.1.2 If a communication session with an RIU exists: 

--- Document Chunk 20603 ---
Step 2 - The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall terminate the communication 

--- Document Chunk 20604 ---
session 

--- Document Chunk 20605 ---
End of procedure 

--- Document Chunk 20606 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20607 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20608 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 20609 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 20610 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 20611 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 20612 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 20613 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 20614 ---
Page 29/112 

--- Document Chunk 20615 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20616 ---
5.5.3.1.3 If a communication session with an RBC exists: 

--- Document Chunk 20617 ---
Step 2 - The end of mission shall be reported to the RBC by means of the message 

--- Document Chunk 20618 ---
“End of Mission”. 

--- Document Chunk 20619 ---
End of Procedure, if the mode entered is Stand-By upon desk closure. 

--- Document Chunk 20620 ---
 Note: it is a trackside implementation issue to decide when it is appropriate to send a 

--- Document Chunk 20621 ---
session termination order to an ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment having reported its 

--- Document Chunk 20622 ---
end of mission further to a desk closure. 

--- Document Chunk 20623 ---
5.5.3.1.4 If the mode entered is Shunting or Stand-By while a desk is still open (e.g. after the driver 

--- Document Chunk 20624 ---
has selected “Exit SM”) and a communication session with an RBC exists: 

--- Document Chunk 20625 ---
Step 3 -  The RBC shall request to terminate the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 20626 ---
Step 4 - The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall terminate the communication 

--- Document Chunk 20627 ---
session 

--- Document Chunk 20628 ---
End of procedure 

--- Document Chunk 20629 ---
 Note: For the termination of the communication session refer to chapter 3, Management 

--- Document Chunk 20630 ---
of Radio Communication. 

--- Document Chunk 20631 ---
 Note: The “End of Mission” message contains a position report. 

--- Document Chunk 20632 ---
5.5.3.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 20633 ---
 Degraded Situation 

--- Document Chunk 20634 ---
5.5.4.1.1 Mode entered Shunting or Stand-By with a desk open: In case a communication session 

--- Document Chunk 20635 ---
is established and no request to terminate the communication session is received from 

--- Document Chunk 20636 ---
the RBC within a fixed waiting time (see appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value Data) 

--- Document Chunk 20637 ---
after sending the “End of Mission” message , the message shall be repeated with the 

--- Document Chunk 20638 ---
fixed waiting time after each repetition. 

--- Document Chunk 20639 ---
 After a defined number of repetitions (see appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Val ue 

--- Document Chunk 20640 ---
Data), and if no reply is received within the fixed waiting time from the time of the last 

--- Document Chunk 20641 ---
sending of “End of Mission” , the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 20642 ---
communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 20643 ---
5.5.4.1.2 Level 2: In case no communication session is open, no communication session shall be 

--- Document Chunk 20644 ---
established to report the end of mission. 

--- Document Chunk 20645 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP
