5.6 Shunting Initiated by Driver 

--- Document Chunk 20656 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 20657 ---
5.6.1.1 The procedure describes the selection of shunting by the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 20658 ---
5.6.1.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 20659 ---
 Table of requirements for “Shunting Initiated by Driver” procedure 

--- Document Chunk 20660 ---
5.6.2.1 The ID numbers in the table are used for the representation of the procedure in form of 

--- Document Chunk 20661 ---
a flowchart in section 5.6.3. 

--- Document Chunk 20662 ---
5.6.2.2 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 20663 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 20664 ---
S0 The train is at standstill and the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in FS, 

--- Document Chunk 20665 ---
LS, AD, OS, SM, SR, SN, UN, PT or SB mode. 

--- Document Chunk 20666 ---
When the driver selects Shunting (E015) the process shall go to D020. 

--- Document Chunk 20667 ---
D020 If the current ETCS Level of operation is 0 or 1, the process shall go to A050. 

--- Document Chunk 20668 ---
If the current ETCS Level of operation is 2, the process shall go to A045. 

--- Document Chunk 20669 ---
If the current ETCS Level of operation is NTC, the process shall go to D030 

--- Document Chunk 20670 ---
D030 If there is an ongoing National Trip procedure reported by the STM, the process 

--- Document Chunk 20671 ---
shall go to A030 

--- Document Chunk 20672 ---
Otherwise the process shall go to A050 

--- Document Chunk 20673 ---
A030 The process shall go to the “Train trip" procedure 

--- Document Chunk 20674 ---
A045 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall send the “Request for Shunting” 

--- Document Chunk 20675 ---
message to the RBC together with a position report (with special value “position 

--- Document Chunk 20676 ---
unknown” if the position is not known) 

--- Document Chunk 20677 ---
The process shall go to S050. 

--- Document Chunk 20678 ---
S050 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment awaits the reply to the SH request. 

--- Document Chunk 20679 ---
If SH authorised is received from the RBC (optionally with a list of balise groups 

--- Document Chunk 20680 ---
for SH area, which the train can pass when the ERTMS/ETCS onboard 

--- Document Chunk 20681 ---
equipment is in shunting mode) (E090), the process shall go to A050. 

--- Document Chunk 20682 ---
If “SH refused” is received from the RBC (E215), the process shall go to A220. 

--- Document Chunk 20683 ---
A050 The mode shall change to SH. Any previous list of balise groups for SH area 

--- Document Chunk 20684 ---
shall be deleted or replaced by a new list of balise groups for SH area. 

--- Document Chunk 20685 ---
The process shall go to D040. 

--- Document Chunk 20686 ---
D040 If there is an ongoing mission, the process shall go to A100. 

--- Document Chunk 20687 ---
If there is no ongoing mission, the process shall go to D080. 

--- Document Chunk 20688 ---
A100 The process shall go to the “End of Mission" procedure 

--- Document Chunk 20689 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 20700 ---
D080 If the current ETCS Level of operation is 2, the process shall go to A095. 

--- Document Chunk 20701 ---
If the current ETCS Level of operation is 0, 1 or NTC the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 20702 ---
A095 The mode change shall be reported to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 20703 ---
The process shall go to S100. 

--- Document Chunk 20704 ---
S100 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment awaits the RBC order to terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 20705 ---
communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 20706 ---
When an order to terminate the communication session is received from RBC 

--- Document Chunk 20707 ---
the process shall go to A115. 

--- Document Chunk 20708 ---
A115 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall terminate the communication 

--- Document Chunk 20709 ---
session. 

--- Document Chunk 20710 ---
The process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 20711 ---
A220 An indication shall be given to the driver that SH was refused by the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 20712 ---
The process shall END.

--- Document Chunk 20807 ---
5.7 Entry in Shunting with Order from Trackside 

--- Document Chunk 20808 ---
 General Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 20809 ---
5.7.1.1 This procedure is used to allow the entry of a train into a shunting area.  

--- Document Chunk 20810 ---
5.7.1.2 Note: The shunting area, possibly including a “safety envelope”, can be already occupied 

--- Document Chunk 20811 ---
by shunting units, not controlled by the trackside. It is therefore possible that the train 

--- Document Chunk 20812 ---
shall enter into the shunting area in OS mode. The switch to OS is performed according 

--- Document Chunk 20813 ---
to the relevant procedure.   

--- Document Chunk 20814 ---
5.7.1.3 The order to switch to SH mode shall be given by means o f a mode profile, optionally 

--- Document Chunk 20815 ---
with a list of balise groups, which the train can pass when the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 20816 ---
equipment is in shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 20817 ---
5.7.1.4 The switch to shunting, if the transition to shunting was ordered by trackside, requires a 

--- Document Chunk 20818 ---
driver acknowledgement, according to the specifications below. 

--- Document Chunk 20819 ---
5.7.1.5 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has switched to Shunting mode, End of 

--- Document Chunk 20820 ---
Mission, according to chapter 5.5.2.3, is performed. 

--- Document Chunk 20821 ---
 Shunting is requested for the current location (from modes different from 

--- Document Chunk 20822 ---
Stand By and Post Trip) 

--- Document Chunk 20823 ---
5.7.2.1 In a level 1 area, or at the border from a level 0 to a level 1 area, the begi nning of the 

--- Document Chunk 20824 ---
shunting area can be the location where a balise group is installed. In level 2 it is possible 

--- Document Chunk 20825 ---
to send an ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment the order to switch to shunting at the 

--- Document Chunk 20826 ---
current location. 

--- Document Chunk 20827 ---
5.7.2.2 Shunting is requested for the current location means that, according to the mode profile 

--- Document Chunk 20828 ---
received the max safe front end of the train is at or in advance of the location for which 

--- Document Chunk 20829 ---
switching to SH mode is requested. 

--- Document Chunk 20830 ---
5.7.2.3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall switch immediately to SH mode and a 

--- Document Chunk 20831 ---
request for acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver (refer to SRS chapter 4, 

--- Document Chunk 20832 ---
transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 20833 ---
5.7.2.4 If the driver does not acknowledge within the driver acknowledgement time (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 20834 ---
Appendix A.3.1) after the change to SH mode, the service brake command sh all be 

--- Document Chunk 20835 ---
triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 20836 ---
 Shunting is requested for a further location 

--- Document Chunk 20837 ---
5.7.3.1 An order to switch to SH at a further location can be sent 

--- Document Chunk 20838 ---
a) in a level 1 area by a balise group, 

--- Document Chunk 20839 ---
b) in a level 2 area by the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 20840 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20841 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20842 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 20843 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 20844 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 20845 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 20846 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 20847 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 20848 ---
Page 35/112 

--- Document Chunk 20849 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20850 ---
5.7.3.2 A request for acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver, when the following two 

--- Document Chunk 20851 ---
conditions are fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 20852 ---
a) the distance between the estimated front end of the train and the beginning of 

--- Document Chunk 20853 ---
shunting area is shorter than a value, contained in the mode profile 

--- Document Chunk 20854 ---
b) the speed is equal to or lower than the Shunting mode speed limit (National Value, or 

--- Document Chunk 20855 ---
value given in the mode profile) 

--- Document Chunk 20856 ---
5.7.3.3 Once the request for acknowledgement is displayed, it shall not be taken back, even if 

--- Document Chunk 20857 ---
the above conditions are no more fulfilled (e.g., the train accelerates). 

--- Document Chunk 20858 ---
5.7.3.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 20859 ---
5.7.3.5 When the driver acknowledges, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 20860 ---
immediately switch to SH mode (refer to chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 20861 ---
5.7.3.6 If the max safe front end of the train reaches the beginning of the shunting area according 

--- Document Chunk 20862 ---
the mode profile and the driver has not yet acknowledged, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 20863 ---
equipment shall switch immediately to SH mode and a request for acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 20864 ---
shall be displayed to the driver (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 20865 ---
5.7.3.7 If, in this case, the driver does not acknowledge within the driver acknowledgement time 

--- Document Chunk 20866 ---
(refer to Appendix A.3.1) after the change to SH mode, the service brake command shall 

--- Document Chunk 20867 ---
be triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 20868 ---
 Shunting from Stand By or Post Trip mode 

--- Document Chunk 20869 ---
5.7.4.1 When performing a SoM or a Train Trip procedure and when the current level is 2, the 

--- Document Chunk 20870 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment can receive a mode profile giving an Shunting area 

--- Document Chunk 20871 ---
whose beginning has already been passed by the train with its max safe front end. In 

--- Document Chunk 20872 ---
this case, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall first require an acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 20873 ---
from the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 20874 ---
5.7.4.2 When the driver acknowledges, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perfo rm 

--- Document Chunk 20875 ---
transition to Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 20876 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20877 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20878 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 20879 ---
SUBSET-026-5

--- Document Chunk 20951 ---
5.8 Procedure Override 

--- Document Chunk 20952 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 20953 ---
5.8.1.1 In specific degraded situations (for example in the case of a failed signal, failed track 

--- Document Chunk 20954 ---
circuit, failed point…), railways allow a train to pass its End of Movement Authority. 

--- Document Chunk 20955 ---
5.8.1.2 For ERTMS/ETCS, passing an End of Movement Authority can be required in degraded 

--- Document Chunk 20956 ---
situations, e.g. 

--- Document Chunk 20957 ---
• In level 2, if a train is stopped without MA in a location where radio is unavailable 

--- Document Chunk 20958 ---
(e.g. after having received an emergency message, or after a train trip). 

--- Document Chunk 20959 ---
• In level 2, if a train is stopped at the border between two adjacent RBCs (e.g. the 

--- Document Chunk 20960 ---
interface between RBCs is unavailable). 

--- Document Chunk 20961 ---
• In level 2, if a train is stopped after having passed the border between two adjacent 

--- Document Chunk 20962 ---
RBCs (e.g. the connection to the Accepting RBC cannot be established). 

--- Document Chunk 20963 ---
• In level 2, if the RBC is unable to give a permission to run (e.g. lost connection with 

--- Document Chunk 20964 ---
the interlocking) 

--- Document Chunk 20965 ---
• In level 1, if a signal cannot show a proceed aspect (e.g., signal failure, route cannot 

--- Document Chunk 20966 ---
be set) 

--- Document Chunk 20967 ---
• In level 1, if a train is stopped without MA (e.g. after the MA has been shortened due 

--- Document Chunk 20968 ---
to a time-out). 

--- Document Chunk 20969 ---
5.8.1.3 In level 0 /NTC areas, passing a signal at danger is only a national procedure. The 

--- Document Chunk 20970 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is not involved in this procedure, since it does not 

--- Document Chunk 20971 ---
supervise the train movements. 

--- Document Chunk 20972 ---
5.8.1.4 In ERTMS equipped areas (level 1 or 2), locations where the train shall stop are 

--- Document Chunk 20973 ---
supervised by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment. Receiving an order from the 

--- Document Chunk 20974 ---
signalman to pass the End of Movement Authority, the driver must then be able to inhibit 

--- Document Chunk 20975 ---
this supervision. 

--- Document Chunk 20976 ---
5.8.1.4.1 Note: The driver must not us e the “Override” procedure unless authorised by trackside 

--- Document Chunk 20977 ---
personnel. This authorisation is covered by operational procedures. 

--- Document Chunk 20978 ---
5.8.1.5 If a signal at danger must be passed between announcement and execution of the level 

--- Document Chunk 20979 ---
transition from an unfitted area (level 0) or from an area fitted with a National System 

--- Document Chunk 20980 ---
(level NTC) to an ERTMS equipped area (level 1 or 2 ), the signalman gives the order to 

--- Document Chunk 20981 ---
the driver to select “override”. 

--- Document Chunk 20982 ---
5.8.1.6 Note: By using this procedure the driver is fully responsible for the train driving. Therefore 

--- Document Chunk 20983 ---
Staff Responsible mode is entered when the driver selects “override”. 

--- Document Chunk 20984 ---
5.8.1.7 In addition the procedure allows to avoid a train trip when passing a balise group:  

--- Document Chunk 20985 ---
a) transmitting "stop if in SR mode" 

--- Document Chunk 20986 ---
b) not contained in the list of expected balises in SR mode 

--- Document Chunk 20987 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 20988 ---

--- Document Chunk 20998 ---
d) not contained in the list of expected balises in SH mode" 

--- Document Chunk 20999 ---
e) Intentionally deleted 

--- Document Chunk 21000 ---
5.8.1.8 Further, the Override procedure allows a train in SR mode reaching the end of the SR 

--- Document Chunk 21001 ---
distance to proceed (see also 4.4.11.1.6.5) 

--- Document Chunk 21002 ---
5.8.1.9 In case the Override procedure is selected while the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 21003 ---
considers a temporary EOA (as per clause 3.12.2.4, 3.12.4.7 or 3.12.5.8) which is closer 

--- Document Chunk 21004 ---
than the EOA, all the instances of the term EOA throughout this section 5.8 shall relate 

--- Document Chunk 21005 ---
to this temporary EOA. 

--- Document Chunk 21006 ---
 Selection of “Override” 

--- Document Chunk 21007 ---
5.8.2.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall allow the driver to select “Override” only 

--- Document Chunk 21008 ---
when: 

--- Document Chunk 21009 ---
a) The train speed is under or equal to the speed limit for triggering the “override” function 

--- Document Chunk 21010 ---
(national value) AND 

--- Document Chunk 21011 ---
b) The current mode is F ull Supervision, Automatic Driving , Limited Supervision, On 

--- Document Chunk 21012 ---
Sight, Staff Responsible, Shunting, Unfitted, Post Trip, Stand By (in level 2 only)  or 

--- Document Chunk 21013 ---
SN (National System) AND 

--- Document Chunk 21014 ---
c) Validated Train Data and Train running number are available (except when already in 

--- Document Chunk 21015 ---
Shunting mode). 

--- Document Chunk 21016 ---
5.8.2.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 21017 ---
5.8.2.3 The “Override” procedure shall be triggered when selected by the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 21018 ---
 Once the “Override” procedure has been triggered 

--- Document Chunk 21019 ---
5.8.3.1 The mode shall change as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 21020 ---
a) If the current mode is Ful l Supervision, Automatic Driving , Limited Supervision, On 

--- Document Chunk 21021 ---
Sight, Stand -By or Post Trip, the mode shall immediately switch to the Staff 

--- Document Chunk 21022 ---
Responsible (SR) mode (if the mode is already SR it remains unchanged) 

--- Document Chunk 21023 ---
b) If the current mode is Shunting the mode shall remain unchanged 

--- Document Chunk 21024 ---
c) If the current mode is Unfitted (level 0 area) or S N (level NTC area) the mode shall 

--- Document Chunk 21025 ---
only change to Staff Responsible when the level changes to 1 or 2 (refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 21026 ---
chapter 4, transitions between modes) 

--- Document Chunk 21027 ---
5.8.3.1.1 If the mode, when activating Override, is OS , LS, FS or AD, the former EOA/LOA shall 

--- Document Chunk 21028 ---
be retained. If the mode is SB or PT  and there is a valid train position stored on -board, 

--- Document Chunk 21029 ---
the current position of the train front shall be considered as the former EOA/LOA. If the 

--- Document Chunk 21030 ---
mode is SB or PT and there is no valid train position stored on-board, the on-board shall 

--- Document Chunk 21031 ---

--- Document Chunk 21040 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21041 ---
supervise a zero distance from the virtual train front position (see section 3.6.7) to the 

--- Document Chunk 21042 ---
former EOA/LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 21043 ---
5.8.3.1.2 Note: This former EOA/LOA will be used as a Trip condition if the Override function is no 

--- Document Chunk 21044 ---
longer active. Any further activation of the Override in SR mode has no effect on the 

--- Document Chunk 21045 ---
former EOA/LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 21046 ---
5.8.3.1.3 The former EOA/LOA shall be deleted if: 

--- Document Chunk 21047 ---
a) the train reads the information “stop if in SR mode” from a balise group OR 

--- Document Chunk 21048 ---
b) SR mode is left. 

--- Document Chunk 21049 ---
5.8.3.2 Note 1: In level 2, if radio communication is available, the RBC is only informed that the 

--- Document Chunk 21050 ---
Override has been triggered by means of the reported mode change (if there is any) 

--- Document Chunk 21051 ---
5.8.3.3 Note 2: In level 2, if the ERTMS/ETCS - onboard equipment is able to report the mode 

--- Document Chunk 21052 ---
change to the RBC, the RBC may transmit limits for the distance to run in SR mode 

--- Document Chunk 21053 ---
(overriding the national value), a list of balise groups to be passed in SR mode (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 21054 ---
chapter 4, Staff Responsible mode) 

--- Document Chunk 21055 ---
5.8.3.4 Note 3: In level 2, the transition to SR mode triggered by selecting Override revokes all 

--- Document Chunk 21056 ---
emergency stop orders previously received. 

--- Document Chunk 21057 ---
5.8.3.5 In SR mode the driver may modify the value of the SR mode speed limit and of the 

--- Document Chunk 21058 ---
distance to run in SR mode (refer to chapter 4, Staff Responsible mode) 

--- Document Chunk 21059 ---
5.8.3.6 The train trip shall be inhibited (suppression of the transition to the Trip mode), and only 

--- Document Chunk 21060 ---
in level 0, 1 or 2, the MRSP shall include the Override function related Speed Restriction 

--- Document Chunk 21061 ---
(see 3.11.10) as long as the Override function is active. 

--- Document Chunk 21062 ---
5.8.3.7 The status “override active” shall be indicated to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 21063 ---
5.8.3.7.1 Exception 1: In case the Override function has been activated by an STM (see SUBSET-

--- Document Chunk 21064 ---
035) and as long as the on -board is in level NTC , the status “override active” shall not 

--- Document Chunk 21065 ---
be indicated to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 21066 ---
5.8.3.7.2 Exception 2: In case the Override function has been activated by selection of “Override” 

--- Document Chunk 21067 ---
while being in level 0, 1 or 2, the status “override active” shall stop being indicated to the 

--- Document Chunk 21068 ---
driver on executing a transition to level NTC and shall remain unindicated as long as the 

--- Document Chunk 21069 ---
on-board is in level NTC. 

--- Document Chunk 21070 ---
5.8.3.8 As long as the Override function is active, new SR distance information received from 

--- Document Chunk 21071 ---
Euroloop shall be rejected. 

--- Document Chunk 21072 ---
5.8.3.9 When “Override” is selected and Override is already active, the supervision of the time 

--- Document Chunk 21073 ---
and distance (see 5.8.4.1 a) and b)) for train trip suppression shall be re-started. 

--- Document Chunk 21074 ---
 End of Override procedure 

--- Document Chunk 21075 ---
5.8.4.1 The Override procedure shall end when at least one of the following conditions is fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 21076 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 21077 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21078 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 21079 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 21080 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 21081 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 21082 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 21083 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 21084 ---
Page 40/112 

--- Document Chunk 21085 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21086 ---
a) The "max. time for train trip suppression when Override function is triggered" (national 

--- Document Chunk 21087 ---
value) elapses after Override has been selected 

--- Document Chunk 21088 ---
b) The train has run more than the "distance for train trip suppression when Override 

--- Document Chunk 21089 ---
function is triggered" (national value) after Override has been selected 

--- Document Chunk 21090 ---
c) The former EOA/LOA has been passed with the min safe antenna position  

--- Document Chunk 21091 ---
d) The train passes a balise group giving “stop if in SR mode” or “stop if in SH mode” 

--- Document Chunk 21092 ---
information 

--- Document Chunk 21093 ---
e) The train passes a balise group giving proceed information (i.e., MA with no signalling 

--- Document Chunk 21094 ---
related speed restriction of value zero) 

--- Document Chunk 21095 ---
f) In level 2, an MA is received from the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 21096 ---
g) The train passes a balise group not in the list of expected balises in SR mode or th e 

--- Document Chunk 21097 ---
list of expected balises in SH mode 

--- Document Chunk 21098 ---
h) The train overpasses the SR distance supervised before overriding with its estimated 

--- Document Chunk 21099 ---
front end 

--- Document Chunk 21100 ---
i) The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment switches to TR, LS, OS or SH mode. 

--- Document Chunk 21101 ---
5.8.4.1.1 Note: For modes UN and SN, only end conditions a) and b) are supervised. 

--- Document Chunk 21102 ---
5.8.4.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall apply the conditions d) and g) (i.e. the 

--- Document Chunk 21103 ---
Override function shall be considered as not active anymore) only once all the 

--- Document Chunk 21104 ---
information received from the balise group has been evaluated. 

--- Document Chunk 21105 ---

--- Document Chunk 21117 ---
5.9 Procedure On-Sight 

--- Document Chunk 21118 ---
 General Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 21119 ---
5.9.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall be in On Sight mode before the train 

--- Document Chunk 21120 ---
reaches the beginning of the On Sight area or, at the latest, when the train reaches the 

--- Document Chunk 21121 ---
beginning of the On Sight area. 

--- Document Chunk 21122 ---
5.9.1.2 An acknowledgement for running in On Sight mode is requested from the driver. The 

--- Document Chunk 21123 ---
conditions of the acknowledgement are specified below. 

--- Document Chunk 21124 ---
 On Sight is requested for current location (from modes different from 

--- Document Chunk 21125 ---
Stand By and Post Trip) 

--- Document Chunk 21126 ---
5.9.2.1 In a level 1 area, the beginning of the On Sight area can be the balise (group) that gives 

--- Document Chunk 21127 ---
the Mode Profile. When the train passes the balise group and receives this information, 

--- Document Chunk 21128 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall immediately switch to On Sight mode. 

--- Document Chunk 21129 ---
5.9.2.2 In a level 2 area, the ERTMS/ETC S on-board equipment can receive a mode profile 

--- Document Chunk 21130 ---
giving an On Sight area which the train position confidence interval already overlaps. If 

--- Document Chunk 21131 ---
starting from the min safe front end of the train this On Sight area is the furthest area that 

--- Document Chunk 21132 ---
the train position confidence interval overlaps within the mode profile, the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 21133 ---
on-board equipment shall immediately switch to On Sight mode. 

--- Document Chunk 21134 ---
5.9.2.3 The driver must acknowledge the On Sight mode. A request of acknowledgement shall 

--- Document Chunk 21135 ---
be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 21136 ---
5.9.2.4 If the driver has n ot acknowledged within the driver acknowledgement time (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 21137 ---
Appendix A.3.1) after the change to OS  mode, the service brake command shall be 

--- Document Chunk 21138 ---
triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 21139 ---
5.9.2.5 Note: Once in On Sight mode, the speed supervision is such that the train speed cannot 

--- Document Chunk 21140 ---
exceed the OS mode speed limit. If, when entering the On Sight mode, the train speed 

--- Document Chunk 21141 ---
was higher than the OS mode speed limit (because a higher speed was allowed in Full 

--- Document Chunk 21142 ---
Supervision mode, in Automatic Driving mode , in Limited Supervision mode  or in Staff 

--- Document Chunk 21143 ---
Responsible mode) then a service/emergency brake command could be immediately 

--- Document Chunk 21144 ---
triggered, independently of the acknowledgement of the driver, but because of the On 

--- Document Chunk 21145 ---
Sight supervision (see Figure 4). 

--- Document Chunk 21146 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 21147 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21148 ---
SUBSET-026-5

location 

--- Document Chunk 21158 ---
speed 

--- Document Chunk 21159 ---

--- Document Chunk 21160 ---

--- Document Chunk 21161 ---

--- Document Chunk 21162 ---
in previous mode

--- Document Chunk 21164 ---

--- Document Chunk 21166 ---
SB/EB command  

--- Document Chunk 21167 ---
(even if driver acknowledges 

--- Document Chunk 21168 ---
within 5s)  

--- Document Chunk 21169 ---
train speed 

--- Document Chunk 21170 ---

--- Document Chunk 21171 ---
(conditions see SRS chapter 3, 

--- Document Chunk 21172 ---
Speed & Distance Monitoring) 

--- Document Chunk 21173 ---

Figure 4: Train enters OS area with too high speed 

--- Document Chunk 21175 ---
5.9.2.6 Note: This sharp brake reaction can be avoided in Full Supervision, Automatic Driving or 

--- Document Chunk 21176 ---
Limited Supervision mode by giving with the previous MA an EOA (or a LOA = OS mode 

--- Document Chunk 21177 ---
speed limit) at the location of transition to On Sight mode. In Staff Responsible mode, 

--- Document Chunk 21178 ---
lateral signals (if available) can also order the driver to decrease the train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 21179 ---
5.9.2.7 If the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is already in OS mode when receiving the OS 

--- Document Chunk 21180 ---
mode profile, no further acknowledgement shall be requested from the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 21181 ---
 On Sight is requested for a further location 

--- Document Chunk 21182 ---
5.9.3.1 The beginning of the On Sight area can be a location that the train has not reached yet. 

--- Document Chunk 21183 ---
This occurs when: 

--- Document Chunk 21184 ---
a) In a level 1 area, a balise group gives a Mode Profile with an On Sight area that is 

--- Document Chunk 21185 ---
located at a further location. 

--- Document Chunk 21186 ---
b) In a level 2 area, the RBC gives a Mode Profile with an On Sight area that is located 

--- Document Chunk 21187 ---
at a further location. 

--- Document Chunk 21188 ---
5.9.3.2 A reques t for acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver when the following 

--- Document Chunk 21189 ---
conditions are fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 21190 ---
a)  The distance between the estimated front end of the train and the beginning of On 

--- Document Chunk 21191 ---
Sight area is shorter than a value, contained in the mode profile.   

--- Document Chunk 21192 ---
b) The speed is equal to or lower than the On Sight mode speed limit (national value, or 

--- Document Chunk 21193 ---
value given in the mode profile). 

--- Document Chunk 21194 ---
c) The current mode is not On Sight 

--- Document Chunk 21195 ---
5.9.3.3 The conditions 5.9.3.2 a) and b) define the “rectangle of acknowledgement”. 

--- Document Chunk 21196 ---
5.9.3.4 Once the acknowledgement request is displayed, it shall not be taken back if the train 

--- Document Chunk 21197 ---
leaves the “rectangle of acknowledgement” (for example: because the train accelerates). 

--- Document Chunk 21198 ---
5.9.3.5 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 21199 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

5.9.3.7 If the max safe front end of the train reaches the beginning of the On Sight area according 

--- Document Chunk 21232 ---
to the mode profile and the driver has not yet acknowledged, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 21233 ---
equipment shall switch immediately to OS mode and a request for acknowledgement 

--- Document Chunk 21234 ---
shall be displayed to the driver (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 21235 ---
5.9.3.8 If, in this case, the driver does not acknowledge within the driver acknowledgement time 

--- Document Chunk 21236 ---
(refer to Appendix A.3.1) after the change to OS mode, the service brake command shall 

--- Document Chunk 21237 ---
be triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 21238 ---
 On Sight from Unfitted or SN mode 

--- Document Chunk 21239 ---
5.9.4.1 The mode profile with regards to an OS area is only evaluated in level 1, R, although the 

--- Document Chunk 21240 ---
mode profile may have been received in level 0 (Unfitted mode) or NTC (SN mode). A 

--- Document Chunk 21241 ---
transition to On Sight mode can therefore earliest occur at a transition of level: from level 

--- Document Chunk 21242 ---
0 or NTC to level 1 or 2. 

--- Document Chunk 21243 ---
5.9.4.2 Requirements about the acknowledgement in section 5.9.2 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 21244 ---
 On Sight from Stand By or Post Trip mode 

--- Document Chunk 21245 ---
5.9.5.1 When performing a SoM or a Train Trip procedure and when the current level is 2, the 

--- Document Chunk 21246 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment can receive a mode profile giving an On Sight area 

--- Document Chunk 21247 ---
which the train position confidence interval already overlaps. If starting from the min safe 

--- Document Chunk 21248 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 21249 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21250 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 21251 ---
4.0.0

--- Document Chunk 21253 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 21254 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 21255 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 21256 ---
Page 44/112 

--- Document Chunk 21257 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21258 ---
front end of the train this On Sight area is the furthest area that the train position 

--- Document Chunk 21259 ---
confidence interval overlaps within the mode profile , the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 21260 ---
equipment shall first require an OS acknowledgement from the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 21261 ---
5.9.5.2 When the driver acknowledges, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall perform 

--- Document Chunk 21262 ---
the transition to On Sight mode.” 

--- Document Chunk 21263 ---
 Exit of On Sight mode 

--- Document Chunk 21264 ---
5.9.6.1 General rule 

--- Document Chunk 21265 ---
5.9.6.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall exit the On Sight mode when the min safe 

--- Document Chunk 21266 ---
front end of the train passes the end of the On Sight area. 

--- Document Chunk 21267 ---
5.9.6.2 First case: The On Sight area ends at the EOA/LOA of the current MA 

--- Document Chunk 21268 ---
5.9.6.2.1 This occurs when the end of the On Sight area that is given by the Mode Profile has the 

--- Document Chunk 21269 ---
same location as the EOA/LOA of the related MA. 

--- Document Chunk 21270 ---
5.9.6.2.2 In this case, the train must receive a new Movement Authority to be able to exit the On 

--- Document Chunk 21271 ---
Sight area. 

--- Document Chunk 21272 ---
5.9.6.2.3 Note: In an On Sight area there is no guarantee for the RBC that the track in front of the 

--- Document Chunk 21273 ---
supervised train is free. Therefore, if the next block section is free, the RBC has 

--- Document Chunk 21274 ---
nevertheless to ensure that there is no train/vehicle between the train and the end of the 

--- Document Chunk 21275 ---
On Sight area. This information  

--- Document Chunk 21276 ---
• can be given to the RBC by the signalman or any other trackside means  (outside 

--- Document Chunk 21277 ---
scope of  ERTMS/ETCS), or 

--- Document Chunk 21278 ---
• can be inquired by the RBC by means of the following mechanism: the RBC sends a 

--- Document Chunk 21279 ---
“track ahead free” request which the ERTMS/ ETCS on-board equipment displays to 

--- Document Chunk 21280 ---
the driver. If the driver confirms that the track is free up to the end of the current 

--- Document Chunk 21281 ---
section, the ERTMS/ ETCS on-board equipment will transmit this information to the 

--- Document Chunk 21282 ---
RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 21283 ---
5.9.6.2.4 Note: Receiving the “track ahead free” information, the RBC may be able to transmit an 

--- Document Chunk 21284 ---
MA from the current position of the train, e.g., for Full Supervision (refer to SRS chapter 

--- Document Chunk 21285 ---
4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 21286 ---
5.9.6.3 Second case: The On Sight area ends before the EOA/LOA of the current MA 

--- Document Chunk 21287 ---
5.9.6.3.1 In this case, the current Movement Authority already allows the train to exit the On Sight 

--- Document Chunk 21288 ---
area. 

--- Document Chunk 21289 ---
5.9.6.3.2 When exiting the On Sight area, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment switches either 

--- Document Chunk 21290 ---
to Full Supervision, to Limited Supervision or to Shunting mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, 

--- Document Chunk 21291 ---
transitions between modes).

--- Document Chunk 21362 ---
5.10 Level Transitions 

--- Document Chunk 21363 ---
 General requirements 

--- Document Chunk 21364 ---
5.10.1.1 Every level transition border to an area where operation in level 2 or NTC is supported 

--- Document Chunk 21365 ---
shall be announced to the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment via balise group or via the 

--- Document Chunk 21366 ---
RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 21367 ---
5.10.1.2 A level transition announcement to the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall consist 

--- Document Chunk 21368 ---
of an order to execute the level transition at a further location corresponding to the 

--- Document Chunk 21369 ---
border. 

--- Document Chunk 21370 ---
5.10.1.3 When the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment receives a level transition announcement, 

--- Document Chunk 21371 ---
and if this announcement will result in a change of the on-board level, it shall immediately 

--- Document Chunk 21372 ---
inform the driver about the announced level transition. 

--- Document Chunk 21373 ---
5.10.1.3.1 Note: In a mixed level area the actual le vel of the on -board equipment may remain 

--- Document Chunk 21374 ---
unchanged even though a level transition boundary is passed. 

--- Document Chunk 21375 ---
5.10.1.4 At the level transition border a balise group shall be placed with an immediate level 

--- Document Chunk 21376 ---
transition order or a conditional level transition order. 

--- Document Chunk 21377 ---
5.10.1.4.1 Note: Balise groups are read in all levels and level transition orders and conditional level 

--- Document Chunk 21378 ---
transition orders from balises are accepted independent of the level of operation. Also 

--- Document Chunk 21379 ---
sleeping units read balise groups. 

--- Document Chunk 21380 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21381 ---
Level  

--- Document Chunk 21382 ---
transition  

--- Document Chunk 21383 ---
location 

--- Document Chunk 21384 ---
Level X area Level Y area 

--- Document Chunk 21385 ---
Announcement by 

--- Document Chunk 21386 ---
balise group 

--- Document Chunk 21387 ---
Announcement by RBC 

--- Document Chunk 21388 ---
possible if communication 

--- Document Chunk 21389 ---
session exists 

--- Document Chunk 21390 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21391 ---
Figure 7: Transition from level X area to level Y area 

--- Document Chunk 21392 ---
5.10.1.5 If the message from the border balise group is not received, the level transition shall still 

--- Document Chunk 21393 ---
be executed when the estimated front end passes the location given in the 

--- Document Chunk 21394 ---
announcement. 

--- Document Chunk 21395 ---
5.10.1.6 The on-board equipment shall manage only one level transition order at a time. Therefore 

--- Document Chunk 21396 ---
a new level transition order shall replace a previously received order  that has not yet  

--- Document Chunk 21397 ---
been executed. 

--- Document Chunk 21398 ---
5.10.1.6.1 If a level transition order has not yet been executed but the driver ch anges the level 

--- Document Chunk 21399 ---
manually (see 3.18.4.2.4) this shall delete the level transition order.. 

--- Document Chunk 21400 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 21403 ---

System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 21406 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 21407 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 21408 ---
Page 47/112 

--- Document Chunk 21409 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21410 ---
5.10.1.7 As soon as the announcement of the level transition has been received, some data 

--- Document Chunk 21411 ---
(mainly movement authority and track description data) from the transmission media of 

--- Document Chunk 21412 ---
the new level shall be accepted, but shall not be used until the level transition is effective. 

--- Document Chunk 21413 ---
5.10.1.7.1 Note: for the exhaustive list of accepted/rejected information, please refer to SRS chapter 

--- Document Chunk 21414 ---
4.8. 

--- Document Chunk 21415 ---
5.10.1.7.2 Note: if only track description has been received from the new media without any 

--- Document Chunk 21416 ---
movement authority, this track description still replaces the one previously received from 

--- Document Chunk 21417 ---
the current media when the transition is performed. 

--- Document Chunk 21418 ---
5.10.1.8 When the onboard has performed the level transition, further data (mainly movement 

--- Document Chunk 21419 ---
authority and track description data) received from the transmission media of the leve l 

--- Document Chunk 21420 ---
being left shall be rejected. 

--- Document Chunk 21421 ---
5.10.1.8.1 Note: for the exhaustive list of accepted/rejected information, please refer to SRS chapter 

--- Document Chunk 21422 ---
4.8. 

--- Document Chunk 21423 ---
5.10.1.9 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 21424 ---
 Table of priority of trackside supported levels 

--- Document Chunk 21425 ---
5.10.2.1 Any combination of ERTMS/ETCS levels 0, NTC, 1 and 2 on a given area shall be 

--- Document Chunk 21426 ---
possible. 

--- Document Chunk 21427 ---
5.10.2.2 The level transition announcement and the immediate or conditional level transition order 

--- Document Chunk 21428 ---
at the border shall contain all the supported ERTMS/ETCS levels with a table of priority. 

--- Document Chunk 21429 ---
Even if only one level is permitted this is considered as a table of priority. 

--- Document Chunk 21430 ---
5.10.2.2.1 Note: Level 0 is considered in the same way as the other levels. This means that, for 

--- Document Chunk 21431 ---
example, when an area permits ERTMS/ETCS level 0, an d is fitted with ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 21432 ---
level 1 and 2, the track-side includes levels 0, 1 and 2 in a table of priority of supported 

--- Document Chunk 21433 ---
levels in all level transition orders and conditional level transition orders applying to that 

--- Document Chunk 21434 ---
area. 

--- Document Chunk 21435 ---
5.10.2.3 The table of priority shall list all the supported levels from the highest priority level to the 

--- Document Chunk 21436 ---
lowest one. 

--- Document Chunk 21437 ---
5.10.2.3.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 21438 ---
5.10.2.4 When receiving the information about all ERTMS/ETCS levels that are supported by 

--- Document Chunk 21439 ---
trackside, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall select from the table the level 

--- Document Chunk 21440 ---
with the highest priority, which is available for use by the onboard equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 21441 ---
5.10.2.4.1 The on-board equipment shall consider an ERTMS/ETCS level as “Available for use” 

--- Document Chunk 21442 ---
according to the following conditions: 

--- Document Chunk 21443 ---
a) Level 2:  

--- Document Chunk 21444 ---
• the FRMCS on -board equipment is available, i.e. the ETCS on -board has 

--- Document Chunk 21445 ---
detected that it is in working condition, in case the stored Radio Network type 

--- Document Chunk 21446 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 21447 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21448 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 21449 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 21450 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 21451 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 21452 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 21453 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 21454 ---
Page 48/112 

--- Document Chunk 21455 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21456 ---
is FRMCS or is FRMCS+GSM -R while FRMCS is the only radio system 

--- Document Chunk 21457 ---
installed on-board, OR 

--- Document Chunk 21458 ---
• unless the driver has elected to perform the mission with only one radio system, 

--- Document Chunk 21459 ---
both the FRMCS on-board equipment and at least one GSM-R Mobile Terminal 

--- Document Chunk 21460 ---
are available (i.e. the ETCS on-board has detected that the FRMCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 21461 ---
and at least one GSM-R Mobile Terminal are in working condition), in case the 

--- Document Chunk 21462 ---
stored Radio Network type is FRMCS+GSM-R while both radio systems are 

--- Document Chunk 21463 ---
installed on-board, OR 

--- Document Chunk 21464 ---
• while the driver has elected to perform the mission with only one radio system, 

--- Document Chunk 21465 ---
the concerned radio equipment is available on-board (i.e. the ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 21466 ---
has detected that it is in working condition), in case the stored Radio Network 

--- Document Chunk 21467 ---
type is FRMCS+GSM-R while both radio systems are installed on-board, OR 

--- Document Chunk 21468 ---
• at least one GSM -R Mobile Terminal is available on -board, i.e. the ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 21469 ---
onboard has detected at least one Mobile Terminal in working condition , in 

--- Document Chunk 21470 ---
case the stored Radio Network type is GSM-R or is FRMCS+GSM -R while 

--- Document Chunk 21471 ---
GSM-R is the only radio system installed on-board,  

--- Document Chunk 21472 ---
independently whether the FRMCS on -board equipment and/or the GSM -R 

--- Document Chunk 21473 ---
Mobile Terminals is (are) registered to their respective network or not. 

--- Document Chunk 21474 ---
b) Level NTC: the concerned National System is available on-board (if an STM is used, 

--- Document Chunk 21475 ---
refer to SUBSET-035 for further details). 

--- Document Chunk 21476 ---
c) Level 0 or 1: always. 

--- Document Chunk 21477 ---
 Note regarding a) and b): how the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment checks the 

--- Document Chunk 21478 ---
availability of the FRMCS on-board equipment, of the GSM-R Mobile Terminals or of the 

--- Document Chunk 21479 ---
National System (in case no STM is used) is an implementation issue. 

--- Document Chunk 21480 ---
5.10.2.4.2 Examples: The table of trackside supported levels gives 2, NTC X, 1, NTC Y. If level 1, 

--- Document Chunk 21481 ---
0 and NTC X are “Available for use”, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board will select NTC X level. 

--- Document Chunk 21482 ---
If level 1, 0 and NTC Y are “Available for use”, it will select level 1. If level 2, 1 and 0 are 

--- Document Chunk 21483 ---
“Available for use”, it will select level 2. 

--- Document Chunk 21484 ---
5.10.2.5 When the onboard has selected the level it will switch to, it shall carry out the level 

--- Document Chunk 21485 ---
transition as if it has received a level transition order to this level only i.e. it shall ignore 

--- Document Chunk 21486 ---
the requirements related to transitions to the other levels. 

--- Document Chunk 21487 ---
5.10.2.6 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall inform the driver about the selected level 

--- Document Chunk 21488 ---
transition only. 

--- Document Chunk 21489 ---
5.10.2.7 If none of the ordered level(s) is available for use by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 21490 ---
equipment, it shall nevertheless make the transition, to the ordered level with the lowest 

--- Document Chunk 21491 ---
priority. 

--- Document Chunk 21492 ---
5.10.2.7.1 Justification: The On-board equipment will then indicate the trackside level to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 21493 ---
to allow him to select the correct procedures for degraded situations. 

--- Document Chunk 21494 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 21501 ---
Procedures

Page 49/112 

--- Document Chunk 21503 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21504 ---
5.10.2.8 After level transition information has been evaluated and regardless of whether it results 

--- Document Chunk 21505 ---
in a change of the on-board level, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall store its 

--- Document Chunk 21506 ---
table of priority of trackside supported ERTMS/ETCS levels, for further driver selection 

--- Document Chunk 21507 ---
(see 3.18.4.2.5). 

--- Document Chunk 21508 ---
5.10.2.9 Only one table of priority of trackside supported ERTMS/ETCS levels shall be applicable 

--- Document Chunk 21509 ---
at a time . The table of priority of trackside supported ERTMS/ETCS levels included in 

--- Document Chunk 21510 ---
level transition information shall become applicable: 

--- Document Chunk 21511 ---
a) in case of level transition announcement, when the estimated front end has passed 

--- Document Chunk 21512 ---
the location given in the announcement; 

--- Document Chunk 21513 ---
b) in case of immediate level transition order or conditional level transition order, upon 

--- Document Chunk 21514 ---
evaluation of the order. 

--- Document Chunk 21515 ---
5.10.2.10 A table of priority of trackside supported ERTMS/ETCS levels which is not yet applicable 

--- Document Chunk 21516 ---
shall be deleted if: 

--- Document Chunk 21517 ---
a) new level transition information is received, or 

--- Document Chunk 21518 ---
b) the stored level transition announcement including it is deleted (see sections A.3.4, 

--- Document Chunk 21519 ---
4.10 and clause 5.10.1.6.1). 

--- Document Chunk 21520 ---
5.10.2.10.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 21521 ---
 Specific Additional Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 21522 ---
5.10.3.1 Transition from Level 1 to Level 2 area 

--- Document Chunk 21523 ---
5.10.3.1.1 An order to connect to the RBC shall be given via balise group in rear of the border 

--- Document Chunk 21524 ---
location. 

--- Document Chunk 21525 ---
5.10.3.1.2 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must  possess information 

--- Document Chunk 21526 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 21527 ---
the train either: 

--- Document Chunk 21528 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 21529 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 21530 ---
5.10.3.1.3 When the ERTMS/ETCS communication session is open, Train Data shall be sent to the 

--- Document Chunk 21531 ---
RBC (which acknowledges the data) unless the onboard equipment is in SL or NL mode. 

--- Document Chunk 21532 ---
5.10.3.1.4 If no Level 2 MA and track description has been received when entering the new area, 

--- Document Chunk 21533 ---
the train shall still be supervised according to the level 1 MA previously received. 

--- Document Chunk 21534 ---
5.10.3.1.5 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has switched to the new level, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 21535 ---
report the new on-board level, including a position report. 

--- Document Chunk 21536 ---
5.10.3.1.6 If an order to connect to an RBC has been  received and the train will not enter the 

--- Document Chunk 21537 ---
announced RBC area, an order to terminate the session shall be sent either from balises 

--- Document Chunk 21538 ---
or from the RBC for any route not leading to the RBC area. This is the case both if the 

--- Document Chunk 21539 ---
train turns back and if the train continues in the same direction, but on another route. 

--- Document Chunk 21540 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 21541 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21542 ---
SUBSET-026-5

--- Document Chunk 21549 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21550 ---
5.10.3.2 Transition from Level 0 (Unfitted) to Level 2 area 

--- Document Chunk 21551 ---
5.10.3.2.1 An order to connect to the RBC shall be given via balise group in rear of the border 

--- Document Chunk 21552 ---
location. 

--- Document Chunk 21553 ---
5.10.3.2.2 When the ERTMS/ETCS communication session is open, Train Data shall be sent to the 

--- Document Chunk 21554 ---
RBC (which acknowledges the data) unless the onboard equipment is in SL or NL mode. 

--- Document Chunk 21555 ---
5.10.3.2.3 A level 2 MA and track description information shall be received from the RBC before the 

--- Document Chunk 21556 ---
level transition border. If not, the train will be tripped at passage of the border, i.e. after 

--- Document Chunk 21557 ---
switching to level 2, movement is not allowed without a movement authority (refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 21558 ---
chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 21559 ---
5.10.3.2.4 The driver is responsible for entering the level 2 area at a speed not exceeding the speed 

--- Document Chunk 21560 ---
limits of the unequipped line.  

--- Document Chunk 21561 ---
5.10.3.2.5 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has switched to the new level, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 21562 ---
report the new on-board level, including a position report. 

--- Document Chunk 21563 ---
5.10.3.2.6 If an order to connect to an RBC has been received and the train will not enter the 

--- Document Chunk 21564 ---
announced RBC area, an order to terminate the session shall be sent either from balises 

--- Document Chunk 21565 ---
or from the RBC for any route not leading to the RBC area. This is the case both if the 

--- Document Chunk 21566 ---
train turns back and if the train continues in the same direction, but on another route. 

--- Document Chunk 21567 ---
5.10.3.3 Transition from Level 2 to Level 1 area 

--- Document Chunk 21568 ---
5.10.3.3.1 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must possess information 

--- Document Chunk 21569 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 21570 ---
the train either 

--- Document Chunk 21571 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 21572 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 21573 ---
5.10.3.3.2 If no Level 1 MA and track description has been received when entering the new area, 

--- Document Chunk 21574 ---
the train shall still be supervised according to the level 2 MA  previously received from 

--- Document Chunk 21575 ---
the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 21576 ---
5.10.3.3.3 When the train has passed the level transition border with its min safe rear end, the 

--- Document Chunk 21577 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of the leading engine shall send a position report to 

--- Document Chunk 21578 ---
the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 21579 ---
5.10.3.3.4 After receiving this exit position report,  the RBC can order the train to terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 21580 ---
session (leading and non-leading engines). 

--- Document Chunk 21581 ---
5.10.3.3.5 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has reported that the train has passed 

--- Document Chunk 21582 ---
with its min safe rear end the level transition border and no order to terminate the session 

--- Document Chunk 21583 ---
is received within a fixed waiting time (see Appendix A.3.1) from the time the pos ition 

--- Document Chunk 21584 ---
report was sent, it shall repeatedly send a position report with the fixed waiting time after 

--- Document Chunk 21585 ---
each repetition, until the order to terminate the session is received, or the defined number 

--- Document Chunk 21586 ---
of repetitions (see Appendix A.3.1) has been reached. If no rep ly is received within the 

--- Document Chunk 21587 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 21588 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21589 ---
SUBSET-026-5

4.0.0

Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 21595 ---
Page 51/112 

--- Document Chunk 21596 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21597 ---
fixed waiting time after the last repetition, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 21598 ---
terminate the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 21599 ---
 Note: if, in order to send the session termination order, the RBC relies on a train 

--- Document Chunk 21600 ---
integrity confirmation indicating that the confirmed rear end of the train has passed the 

--- Document Chunk 21601 ---
border, it is assumed that this information is received by the trackside before the on -

--- Document Chunk 21602 ---
board terminates the session when the fixed waiting time after the last repetition elapses. 

--- Document Chunk 21603 ---
5.10.3.4 Transition from Level 0 (Unfitted) to Level 1 area 

--- Document Chunk 21604 ---
5.10.3.4.1 A level 1 MA and track description information shall be received before or at the level 

--- Document Chunk 21605 ---
transition border. If not, when the level transition is performed, the train will be tripped, 

--- Document Chunk 21606 ---
i.e. after switching to level 1, movement is not allowed without a movement authority 

--- Document Chunk 21607 ---
(refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 21608 ---
5.10.3.4.2 The driver is responsible for entering the level 1 area at a speed not exceeding the speed 

--- Document Chunk 21609 ---
limits of the unequipped line.  

--- Document Chunk 21610 ---
5.10.3.5 Transition from Level 1 to Level 0 (Unfitted) area 

--- Document Chunk 21611 ---
5.10.3.5.1 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must possess information 

--- Document Chunk 21612 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 21613 ---
the train either 

--- Document Chunk 21614 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 21615 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 21616 ---
5.10.3.5.2 Note: When entering UN mode, all MA and track description data is deleted (refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 21617 ---
Chapter 4, What happens to stored data when entering a mode) 

--- Document Chunk 21618 ---
5.10.3.6 Transition from Level 2 to Level 0 (Unfitted) area 

--- Document Chunk 21619 ---
5.10.3.6.1 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must possess information 

--- Document Chunk 21620 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 21621 ---
the train either 

--- Document Chunk 21622 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 21623 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 21624 ---
5.10.3.6.2 When the train has passed the level transition border with its min safe rear end, the 

--- Document Chunk 21625 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of the leading engine shall send a position report to 

--- Document Chunk 21626 ---
the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 21627 ---
5.10.3.6.3 After receiving this exit position report, the RBC can order the train to terminate the 

--- Document Chunk 21628 ---
session (leading and non-leading engines).  

--- Document Chunk 21629 ---
5.10.3.6.4 Note: When entering UN mode, all MA and track description data is deleted (refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 21630 ---
Chapter 4, What happens to stored data when entering a mode) 

--- Document Chunk 21631 ---
5.10.3.6.5 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has reported that the train has passed 

--- Document Chunk 21632 ---
with its min safe rear end the level transition border and no order to terminate the session 

--- Document Chunk 21633 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 21642 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21643 ---
is received within a fixed waiting time (see App endix A.3.1) from the time the position 

--- Document Chunk 21644 ---
report was sent, it shall repeatedly send a position report with the fixed waiting time after 

--- Document Chunk 21645 ---
each repetition, until the order to terminate the session is received, or the defined number 

--- Document Chunk 21646 ---
of repetitions (see Appendix A.3.1) has been reached. If no reply is received within the 

--- Document Chunk 21647 ---
fixed waiting time after the last repetition, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 21648 ---
terminate the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 21649 ---
 Note: if, in order to send the session termination order, the RBC relies on a train 

--- Document Chunk 21650 ---
integrity confirmation indicating that the confirmed rear end of the train has passed the 

--- Document Chunk 21651 ---
border, it is assumed that this information is received by the trackside before the on -

--- Document Chunk 21652 ---
board terminates the session when the fixed waiting time after the last repetition elapses. 

--- Document Chunk 21653 ---
5.10.3.7 Transition from Level NTC to Level 2 area 

--- Document Chunk 21654 ---
5.10.3.7.1 An order to connect to the RBC shall be given via balise group in rear of the border 

--- Document Chunk 21655 ---
location. 

--- Document Chunk 21656 ---
5.10.3.7.2 When the ERTMS/ETCS communication session is open, Train Data shall be sent to the 

--- Document Chunk 21657 ---
RBC (which acknowledges the data) unless the onboard equipment is in SL or NL mode. 

--- Document Chunk 21658 ---
5.10.3.7.3 A level 2 MA and track description information shall be received from the RBC before the 

--- Document Chunk 21659 ---
level transition border. If not, the train will be tripped at passage of the border, i. e. after 

--- Document Chunk 21660 ---
switching to level 2, movement is not allowed without a movement authority (refer to SRS 

--- Document Chunk 21661 ---
chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 21662 ---
5.10.3.7.4 The driver is responsible for entering the level 2 area at a speed not exceeding the speed 

--- Document Chunk 21663 ---
limits of the level NTC line.  

--- Document Chunk 21664 ---
5.10.3.7.5 When the level transition location is passed with the estimated front end a position report 

--- Document Chunk 21665 ---
shall be sent to the RBC. In case the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is interfaced to 

--- Document Chunk 21666 ---
the National System through an STM, please refer to SUBSET -035 for the STM state 

--- Document Chunk 21667 ---
transition order. 

--- Document Chunk 21668 ---
5.10.3.7.6 If an order to connect to an RBC has been received and the train will not enter the 

--- Document Chunk 21669 ---
announced RBC area, an order to disconnect shall be sent either from balises or from 

--- Document Chunk 21670 ---
the RBC for any route not leading to the RBC area. This is the case both if the train turns 

--- Document Chunk 21671 ---
back and if the train continues in the same direction, but on another route. 

--- Document Chunk 21672 ---
5.10.3.8 Transition from Level NTC to Level 1 area 

--- Document Chunk 21673 ---
5.10.3.8.1 A level 1 MA and track description information shall be received before or at the level 

--- Document Chunk 21674 ---
transition border. If not, when the level transition is performed, the train will be tripped, 

--- Document Chunk 21675 ---
i.e. after switching to level 1, movement is not allowed without a movement authority 

--- Document Chunk 21676 ---
(refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 21677 ---
5.10.3.8.2 The driver is responsible for entering the level 1 area at a speed not exceeding the speed 

--- Document Chunk 21678 ---
limits of the Level NTC line.  

--- Document Chunk 21679 ---

5.10.3.9 Transition from Level 1 to Level NTC area 

--- Document Chunk 21693 ---
5.10.3.9.1 For the train to be able to enter the new area, the old area must possess information 

--- Document Chunk 21694 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 21695 ---
the train either 

--- Document Chunk 21696 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 21697 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 21698 ---
5.10.3.9.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 21699 ---

--- Document Chunk 21700 ---
through an STM, please refer to SUBSET -035 for the STM state transition orders in 

--- Document Chunk 21701 ---
relation to the level transition announcement and border. 

--- Document Chunk 21702 ---
5.10.3.10 Transition from Level 2 to Level NTC area 

--- Document Chunk 21703 ---

--- Document Chunk 21704 ---
about at least the first section of the new area. The information shall be transmitted to 

--- Document Chunk 21705 ---
the train either 

--- Document Chunk 21706 ---
a) as an MA and track description information into the new area, or 

--- Document Chunk 21707 ---
b) as a target speed at the border location i.e. as an LOA. 

--- Document Chunk 21708 ---
5.10.3.10.2 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 21709 ---
5.10.3.10.3 When the train has passed the level transition border with its min safe rear end, the 

--- Document Chunk 21710 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of the leading engine shall send a position report to 

--- Document Chunk 21711 ---
the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 21712 ---
5.10.3.10.4 After receiving this exit position report, the RBC can order the train to t erminate the 

--- Document Chunk 21713 ---
session (leading and non-leading engines). 

--- Document Chunk 21714 ---
5.10.3.10.5 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is interfaced to the National System 

--- Document Chunk 21715 ---
through an STM, please refer to SUBSET -035 for the STM state transition orders in 

--- Document Chunk 21716 ---
relation to the level transition announcement and border. 

--- Document Chunk 21717 ---
5.10.3.10.6 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has reported that the train has passed 

--- Document Chunk 21718 ---
with its min safe rear end the level transition border and no order to terminate the session 

--- Document Chunk 21719 ---
is received within a fixed waiting time (see Appendix A.3.1) fr om the time the position 

--- Document Chunk 21720 ---
report was sent, it shall repeatedly send a position report with the fixed waiting time after 

--- Document Chunk 21721 ---
each repetition, until the order to terminate the session is received, or the defined number 

--- Document Chunk 21722 ---
of repetitions (see Appendix A.3.1) has been  reached. If no reply is received within the 

--- Document Chunk 21723 ---
fixed waiting time after the last repetition, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 21724 ---
terminate the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 21725 ---

--- Document Chunk 21759 ---
5.10.3.14 Conditional level transition order 

--- Document Chunk 21760 ---
5.10.3.14.1 When the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment accepts a conditional level transition order 

--- Document Chunk 21761 ---
the onboard shall check whether the current level is contained in the priority list of the 

--- Document Chunk 21762 ---
conditional level transition order. 

--- Document Chunk 21763 ---
5.10.3.14.2 If the current level is contained in the priority list of the conditional level transition order, 

--- Document Chunk 21764 ---
the onboard shall not change the level. 

--- Document Chunk 21765 ---
5.10.3.14.3 If the current level is not contained in the priority list of the conditional level transition 

--- Document Chunk 21766 ---
order, the onboard shall evaluate the conditional level transition order in the same way 

--- Document Chunk 21767 ---
as an immediate level transition order (see section 5.10.2). 

--- Document Chunk 21768 ---
5.10.3.14.4 In the same way as for a level transition order, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 21769 ---
shall store the table of ERTMS/ETCS levels supported by trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 21770 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 21779 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21780 ---
5.10.3.14.5 Note: The conditional level transition order allows to check, whether a train operates in 

--- Document Chunk 21781 ---
a permitted level e.g. following a start of mission after a cold movement. The level of a 

--- Document Chunk 21782 ---
train driving in a permitted level will not be changed, regardless of the priority of the 

--- Document Chunk 21783 ---
current level operated by the train.  

--- Document Chunk 21784 ---
5.10.3.15 Transition initiated by driver 

--- Document Chunk 21785 ---
5.10.3.15.1 In addition to th e level transitions ordered by trackside, it is also possible, at standstill, 

--- Document Chunk 21786 ---
for the driver to change the ERTMS/ETCS level (refer to section 3.18.4.2). 

--- Document Chunk 21787 ---
5.10.3.15.2 If the driver changes the level to 2, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall establish 

--- Document Chunk 21788 ---
a communication session with the RBC: 

--- Document Chunk 21789 ---
a) immediately if valid RBC contact information is available and 

--- Document Chunk 21790 ---
• the FRMCS on-board is registered to the FRMCS Radio Network, in case the 

--- Document Chunk 21791 ---
stored Radio Network type is FRMCS or is FRMCS+GSM -R while FRMCS is 

--- Document Chunk 21792 ---
the only radio system installed on-board, OR 

--- Document Chunk 21793 ---
• the FRMCS on-board is registered to the FRMCS Radio Network and at least 

--- Document Chunk 21794 ---
one GSM-R Mobile Terminal is registered to a GSM-R Radio Network, in case 

--- Document Chunk 21795 ---
the stored Radio Network type is FRMCS+GSM -R while both radio systems 

--- Document Chunk 21796 ---
are installed on-board, OR 

--- Document Chunk 21797 ---
• at least one GSM-R Mobile Terminal is registered to a Radio Network, in case 

--- Document Chunk 21798 ---
the stored Radio Network type is GSM-R or is FRMCS+GSM-R while GSM-R 

--- Document Chunk 21799 ---
is the only radio system installed on-board,  

--- Document Chunk 21800 ---
OR 

--- Document Chunk 21801 ---
b) once the driver has selected the R adio data (by the same means as for Start of 

--- Document Chunk 21802 ---
Mission), if the conditions listed in item a) are not fulfilled. 

--- Document Chunk 21803 ---
 Note regarding b): If the level transition leads to TR mode, the request for RBC contact 

--- Document Chunk 21804 ---
information is only displayed once the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in PT mode. 

--- Document Chunk 21805 ---
5.10.3.15.3 If the driver changes the level from 2 to any other, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 21806 ---
shall report the new level to the RBC if a communication session is established. When 

--- Document Chunk 21807 ---
receiving the level change report, the RBC shall order the communication session to be 

--- Document Chunk 21808 ---
terminated. 

--- Document Chunk 21809 ---
5.10.3.15.4 In case the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment has reported having changed from level 

--- Document Chunk 21810 ---
2 to any other and no order to terminate the session is received within a fixed waiting 

--- Document Chunk 21811 ---
time (see Appendix A.3.1) from the time the position report was sent, it shall repeatedly 

--- Document Chunk 21812 ---
send a position report with the fixed waiti ng time after each repetition, until the order to 

--- Document Chunk 21813 ---
terminate the session is received, or the defined number of repetitions (see Appendix 

--- Document Chunk 21814 ---
A.3.1) has been reached. If no reply is received within the fixed waiting time after the last 

--- Document Chunk 21815 ---
repetition, the ERTMS/ETCS  on-board equipment shall terminate the communication 

--- Document Chunk 21816 ---
session. 

--- Document Chunk 21817 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 21827 ---
 Acknowledgement of the level transition ordered by trackside 

--- Document Chunk 21828 ---
5.10.4.1 If defined so for the level transition (see table below), the driver shall be requested to 

--- Document Chunk 21829 ---
acknowledge the transition 

--- Document Chunk 21830 ---
a) when the max s afe front end of the train has passed a trackside defined location in 

--- Document Chunk 21831 ---
rear of the level transition border 

--- Document Chunk 21832 ---
b) upon receipt of the order to switch to the new level immediately 

--- Document Chunk 21833 ---
  Acknowledgement when entering 

--- Document Chunk 21834 ---
  L 0 L 1 L 2 L NTC 

--- Document Chunk 21835 ---
Coming 

--- Document Chunk 21836 ---
from  ... L 0 - No No Yes 

--- Document Chunk 21837 ---
L 1 Yes - No Yes 

--- Document Chunk 21838 ---
L 2 Yes No - Yes 

--- Document Chunk 21839 ---
L NTC Yes No No Yes 

--- Document Chunk 21840 ---
5.10.4.1.1 Exception: An ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment in NL mode shall not require an 

--- Document Chunk 21841 ---
acknowledgement from the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 21842 ---
5.10.4.1.2 Exception 1 to 5.10.4.1.a): in SB mode, the driver shall be requested to acknowledge the 

--- Document Chunk 21843 ---
level transition only when the level changes. 

--- Document Chunk 21844 ---
5.10.4.1.3 Exception 2 to 5.10.4.1.a): If the condition 5.10.4.1 a) is immediately fulfilled upon receipt 

--- Document Chunk 21845 ---
of the order and if this order consists in switching to the same level as the one resulting 

--- Document Chunk 21846 ---
from a previously received but not yet executed order that the driver had already 

--- Document Chunk 21847 ---
acknowledged, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall not request the driver to 

--- Document Chunk 21848 ---
acknowledge this transition again. 

--- Document Chunk 21849 ---
5.10.4.1.4 Exception to 5.10.4.1.b): if the order consists in switching to th e same level as the one 

--- Document Chunk 21850 ---
resulting from a previously received but not yet executed level transition announcement 

--- Document Chunk 21851 ---
that the driver had already acknowledged, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 21852 ---
not request the driver to acknowledge this transition again. 

--- Document Chunk 21853 ---
5.10.4.2 If the driver has not yet acknowledged within the driver acknowledgement time (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 21854 ---
Appendix A.3.1) after the level transition, a service brake command shall be initiated. 

--- Document Chunk 21855 ---
5.10.4.3 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 21856 ---
5.10.4.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 21857 ---

--- Document Chunk 21867 ---
5.11 Procedure Train Trip 

--- Document Chunk 21868 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 21869 ---
5.11.1.1 A train can be tripped for various reasons: refer to SRS chapter 4, mode transition table. 

--- Document Chunk 21870 ---
 Table of requirements for “Train Trip” procedure 

--- Document Chunk 21871 ---
5.11.2.1 The ID numbers in the table are used for the representation of the procedure in form of 

--- Document Chunk 21872 ---
a flowchart in section 5.11.3. 

--- Document Chunk 21873 ---
5.11.2.2 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 21874 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 21875 ---
S010 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in one of the following  

--- Document Chunk 21876 ---
modes: FS, AD, LS, OS, SR, SB, SM, SH, SN or UN 

--- Document Chunk 21877 ---
When an event occurs, which leads to train trip reaction (E015 – refer 

--- Document Chunk 21878 ---
to chapter 4, transitions between modes), the process shall go to 

--- Document Chunk 21879 ---
A025. 

--- Document Chunk 21880 ---
A025 The mode shall change to TR. 

--- Document Chunk 21881 ---
The process shall go to D020. 

--- Document Chunk 21882 ---
D020 If the level is 1, the process shall go to A035. 

--- Document Chunk 21883 ---
If the level is 2, the process shall go to A030. 

--- Document Chunk 21884 ---
If the level is 0/NTC, the process shall go to S050. 

--- Document Chunk 21885 ---
A030 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall report the mode change 

--- Document Chunk 21886 ---
to the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 21887 ---
The process shall go to A035. 

--- Document Chunk 21888 ---
A035 All current MA and track description data (if any), except track 

--- Document Chunk 21889 ---
conditions, shall be deleted and new ones shall not be accepted 

--- Document Chunk 21890 ---
The process shall go to S050. 

--- Document Chunk 21891 ---
S050 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment awaits standstill. While 

--- Document Chunk 21892 ---
braking a border to a level 0 or NTC area may be passed. 

--- Document Chunk 21893 ---
When the train has come to standstill (E055), the process shall go to 

--- Document Chunk 21894 ---
S060. 

--- Document Chunk 21895 ---
S060 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall display the "Request for 

--- Document Chunk 21896 ---
driver acknowledgement to Train Trip" to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 21897 ---
When the driver acknowledges the Train Trip (E065), the process 

--- Document Chunk 21898 ---
shall go to D080. 

--- Document Chunk 21899 ---
D080 If the level is 1 or 2 the process shall go to A105. 

--- Document Chunk 21900 ---
If the level is 0 or NTC, the process shall go to D085 

--- Document Chunk 21901 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 21902 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21903 ---

--- Document Chunk 21910 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21911 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 21912 ---
A105 The mode shall change to PT and the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 21913 ---
equipment revokes the emergency brake command. 

--- Document Chunk 21914 ---
For the supervision provided by the PT mode refer to SRS chapter 4. 

--- Document Chunk 21915 ---
The process shall go to D110. 

--- Document Chunk 21916 ---
D085 If no valid Train Data is stored on-board, the process shall go to A140 

--- Document Chunk 21917 ---
If valid Train Data is stored on-board, the process shall go to D090 

--- Document Chunk 21918 ---
A140 The mode shall change to SH and the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 21919 ---
D090 If the level is 0, the process shall go to A145. 

--- Document Chunk 21920 ---
If the level is NTC, the process shall go to A150. 

--- Document Chunk 21921 ---
A145 The mode shall change to UN and the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 21922 ---
A150 The mode shall change to SN and the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 21923 ---
D110 If the level is 1, the process shall go to S140. 

--- Document Chunk 21924 ---
If the level is 2, the process shall go to A115. 

--- Document Chunk 21925 ---
A115 The mode change to PT shall be reported to the RBC which shall 

--- Document Chunk 21926 ---
acknowledge the mode report (Recognition of exit from TR). 

--- Document Chunk 21927 ---
The process shall go to S120. 

--- Document Chunk 21928 ---
S120 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment waits for the RBC to 

--- Document Chunk 21929 ---
acknowledge the transition to PT. 

--- Document Chunk 21930 ---
When the acknowledgement is received from the RBC (E125), the 

--- Document Chunk 21931 ---
process shall go to D130. 

--- Document Chunk 21932 ---
Note: See 5.11.4 for degraded situation (no response received). 

--- Document Chunk 21933 ---
D130 If there is at least one pending emergency stop, the process shall go 

--- Document Chunk 21934 ---
to S130. 

--- Document Chunk 21935 ---
If there are no pending emergency stops the process shall go to 

--- Document Chunk 21936 ---
S140. 

--- Document Chunk 21937 ---
S130 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment waits for the RBC to revoke 

--- Document Chunk 21938 ---
ALL pending emergency stops. 

--- Document Chunk 21939 ---
When all emergency stops are revoked (E135) the process shall go to 

--- Document Chunk 21940 ---
S140. 

--- Document Chunk 21941 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 21942 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21943 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 21944 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 21945 ---
