--- Document Chunk 21946 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 21947 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 21948 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 21949 ---
Page 59/112 

--- Document Chunk 21950 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21951 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 21952 ---
S140 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the possibility to 

--- Document Chunk 21953 ---
the driver to select "start" (only if train data has been previously 

--- Document Chunk 21954 ---
entered), to select “Supervised Manoeuvre” (only if the level is 2, if 

--- Document Chunk 21955 ---
the train position is valid and is referred to an LRBG, and if the safe 

--- Document Chunk 21956 ---
consist length information is available), or to select SH 

--- Document Chunk 21957 ---
a) If the driver selects "start" and the level is 1 ( E150), the 

--- Document Chunk 21958 ---
process shall go to S160 

--- Document Chunk 21959 ---
b) If the driver selects "start" and the level is 2 ( E155), the 

--- Document Chunk 21960 ---
process shall go to S150 

--- Document Chunk 21961 ---
c) If th e driver selects “Supervised Manoeuvre” (E190), the 

--- Document Chunk 21962 ---
process shall continue in the same way as the procedure 

--- Document Chunk 21963 ---
“Supervised Manoeuvre”. If the SM request is refused by the 

--- Document Chunk 21964 ---
RBC (E200) the process shall return to S140 

--- Document Chunk 21965 ---
d) If the driver selects SH (E145), the process shall continue in 

--- Document Chunk 21966 ---
the same ways as the procedure “Shunting initiated by the 

--- Document Chunk 21967 ---
driver”. If the SH request is refused by the RBC ( E165) the 

--- Document Chunk 21968 ---
process shall return to S140. 

--- Document Chunk 21969 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21970 ---
S150 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall send an MA request to 

--- Document Chunk 21971 ---
the RBC and wait. 

--- Document Chunk 21972 ---
a) If an SR authorisation is received from RBC ( E26), the 

--- Document Chunk 21973 ---
process shall go to S160 

--- Document Chunk 21974 ---
b) If an MA allowing OS/LS/SH is received from RBC ( E175), 

--- Document Chunk 21975 ---
the process shall go to S170 

--- Document Chunk 21976 ---
c) If an MA allowing FS is received from RBC (E170), the mode 

--- Document Chunk 21977 ---
shall change to FS (refer to SRS  chapter 4, transitions 

--- Document Chunk 21978 ---
between modes: transition from PT to FS) and the process 

--- Document Chunk 21979 ---
shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 21980 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 21981 ---
S160 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall request an 

--- Document Chunk 21982 ---
acknowledgement from the driver for running in SR mode. When the 

--- Document Chunk 21983 ---
driver acknowledges (E180), the mode shall change to SR (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 21984 ---
SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: transition from PT to SR) 

--- Document Chunk 21985 ---
and the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 21986 ---
S170 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall request an 

--- Document Chunk 21987 ---
acknowledgement from the driver for running in OS/LS/SH mode. 

--- Document Chunk 21988 ---
When the driver acknowledges (E185), the mode shall change to 

--- Document Chunk 21989 ---
OS/LS/SH (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes: 

--- Document Chunk 21990 ---
transition from PT to OS/LS/SH) and the process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 21991 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 21992 ---

--- Document Chunk 22147 ---
 Degraded Situations 

--- Document Chunk 22148 ---
5.11.4.1 ERTMS/ETCS level 2: no acknowledge for PT mode is received from the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22149 ---
5.11.4.1.1 In case a communication session is established and no reply is received from the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22150 ---
within a fixed waiting time (see appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value Data) after 

--- Document Chunk 22151 ---
reporting the mode change, the report shall be repeated with the fixed waiting time after 

--- Document Chunk 22152 ---
each repetition. 

--- Document Chunk 22153 ---
5.11.4.1.2 After a defined number of repetitions(see appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value Data) 

--- Document Chunk 22154 ---
and if no reply is received within the fixed waiting time from the last sending of the mode 

--- Document Chunk 22155 ---
change report, the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall terminate the communication 

--- Document Chunk 22156 ---
session. 

--- Document Chunk 22157 ---
5.11.4.2 Nominally, accidental loss of an already open session (that can occur at any step) has 

--- Document Chunk 22158 ---
not been taken into account for the design of the flowchart. However, should such a fault 

--- Document Chunk 22159 ---
occur in any step while ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in level 2 and in PT mode, 

--- Document Chunk 22160 ---
the driver shall have the possibility to select "Override" if the conditions defined in 5.8.2.1 

--- Document Chunk 22161 ---
are fulfilled and the process shall go to the procedure "Override". 

--- Document Chunk 22162 ---
5.11.4.3 In case a transition to Level 0 or Level NTC occurs while in PT mode, the process shall 

--- Document Chunk 22163 ---
go to D085. 

--- Document Chunk 22164 ---

--- Document Chunk 22174 ---
5.12 Change of Train Orientation 

--- Document Chunk 22175 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 22176 ---
5.12.1.1 The scope of this procedure is the supervision of a train where the driver controls the 

--- Document Chunk 22177 ---
train from the cab in the front of the train with the direction con troller in FORWARD 

--- Document Chunk 22178 ---
position. 

--- Document Chunk 22179 ---
5.12.1.2 This implies that when the driver has to change the orientation of the train, he has to 

--- Document Chunk 22180 ---
change the driving cab. 

--- Document Chunk 22181 ---
5.12.1.3 The scope of this procedure is NOT shunting movements, during which the driver 

--- Document Chunk 22182 ---
changes the running direction of the  train without leaving the cab, by changing the 

--- Document Chunk 22183 ---
position of the direction controller from FORWARD to REVERSE. 

--- Document Chunk 22184 ---
5.12.1.4 The scope of this procedure is NOT the reverse movement that is allowed in Post Trip 

--- Document Chunk 22185 ---
or in Reversing mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22186 ---
5.12.1.5 The scope of this procedure is NOT Supe rvised Manoeuvre movements, during which 

--- Document Chunk 22187 ---
the train orientation can change according to the last received SM authorisation and the 

--- Document Chunk 22188 ---
driver changes the running direction of the train without leaving the cab, by changing the 

--- Document Chunk 22189 ---
position of the direction controller from FORWARD to REVERSE. 

--- Document Chunk 22190 ---
 The driver uses the same engine (a mission is ongoing) 

--- Document Chunk 22191 ---
5.12.2.1 The situation is the following: The driver closes the desk A and leaves the cab A of the 

--- Document Chunk 22192 ---
leading engine of the train, to go to cab B and open desk B of this same engine. 

--- Document Chunk 22193 ---
5.12.2.2 Desk A and desk B are connected to the same ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 22194 ---
5.12.2.3 When the driver closes the desk A, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment immediately 

--- Document Chunk 22195 ---
goes to Stand-By mode, which is considered as an end of mission (see “End of Mission” 

--- Document Chunk 22196 ---
procedure). 

--- Document Chunk 22197 ---
5.12.2.4 When the driver opens the desk B, the “Start of Mission” procedure is triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 22198 ---
5.12.2.5 When the driver closes a desk and opens the other one of the same engine, the 

--- Document Chunk 22199 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall be able to calculate the new train position data 

--- Document Chunk 22200 ---
(train front position, train orientation), by use of the previous data. 

--- Document Chunk 22201 ---
 The driver leaves the engine to go to another one 

--- Document Chunk 22202 ---
5.12.3.1 The described situation is the following: The train has two engines (engine A and engine 

--- Document Chunk 22203 ---
B). The engine A is the leading engine. The engine B is a slave engine. Each engine has 

--- Document Chunk 22204 ---
its own ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment.  

--- Document Chunk 22205 ---
a) If engine B is remote controlled, its ETCS on -board equipment is in Sleeping mode.  

--- Document Chunk 22206 ---
Note: The mode is entered when on -board equipment detects the presence of the 

--- Document Chunk 22207 ---
"remote control" signal. 

--- Document Chunk 22208 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22209 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22210 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 22211 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 22212 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 22213 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 22214 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 22215 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 22216 ---
Page 64/112 

--- Document Chunk 22217 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22218 ---
b) If the slave engine is not remote controlled (Tandem operation) by the leading engine 

--- Document Chunk 22219 ---
but there is a driver who controls the engine, then the on -board equipment is in Non 

--- Document Chunk 22220 ---
leading mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22221 ---
c) If the engine B is not remote controlled (Tandem Shunting opera tion) by the leading 

--- Document Chunk 22222 ---
engine and there is no driver who controls the engine, then the on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 22223 ---
is in Passive Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22224 ---
5.12.3.2 Assumption: The train configuration does not change. 

--- Document Chunk 22225 ---
a) When changing the train orientation, the leading engine A will become the slave 

--- Document Chunk 22226 ---
engine, and the slave engine B will become the leading engine. 

--- Document Chunk 22227 ---
b) If before the change of train orientation engine B was in SL, afterwards engine A will 

--- Document Chunk 22228 ---
be in SL mode; If before the change of train orientation engine B was in NL, afterwards 

--- Document Chunk 22229 ---
engine A will be in NL mode; If before the change of train orientation engine B was in 

--- Document Chunk 22230 ---
PS, afterwards engine A will be in PS mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22231 ---
5.12.3.3 Case "Engine B was in SL mode" 

--- Document Chunk 22232 ---
5.12.3.3.1 The driver of engine A closes the desk, then the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment of 

--- Document Chunk 22233 ---
engine A switches to Stand-By mode. If the train has a mission, this is a end of mission 

--- Document Chunk 22234 ---
(see “End of Mission” procedure) 

--- Document Chunk 22235 ---
5.12.3.3.2 As soon as the remote control signal disappears, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 22236 ---
of engine B switches to Stand-By mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22237 ---
5.12.3.3.3 Level 2: The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment of engine B opens a communication 

--- Document Chunk 22238 ---
session (if possible) and reports the mode change to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22239 ---
5.12.3.3.4 When the driver opens a desk of engine B he triggers the "Start of Mission" procedure. 

--- Document Chunk 22240 ---
5.12.3.4 Case "Engine B was in NL mode" 

--- Document Chunk 22241 ---
5.12.3.4.1 The driver of engine A selects "Non Leading". The ERTMS/ETCS equipment switches 

--- Document Chunk 22242 ---
to Non Leading mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22243 ---
5.12.3.4.2 Once the non leading input signal is not received any more, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 22244 ---
equipment of engine B will switch to Stand-By mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions 

--- Document Chunk 22245 ---
between modes and chapter 5, “End of Mission” procedure). 

--- Document Chunk 22246 ---
5.12.3.4.3 Because the desk is open, when the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment enters Stand-

--- Document Chunk 22247 ---
By mode, the “Start of Mission” procedure is triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 22248 ---
5.12.3.5 Case "Engine B was in PS mode" 

--- Document Chunk 22249 ---
5.12.3.5.1 The driver of engine A selects "Continue Shunting on desk closure". The ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 22250 ---
equipment switches to Passive Shunting mode once the driver closes the desk of engine 

--- Document Chunk 22251 ---
A. 

--- Document Chunk 22252 ---
5.12.3.5.2 The driver opens a desk in engine B, and ERTMS/ETCS equipment switches to Shunting 

--- Document Chunk 22253 ---
mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22254 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22255 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22256 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 22257 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 22258 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 22259 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 22260 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 22261 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 22262 ---
Page 65/112 

--- Document Chunk 22263 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22264 ---
 The driver uses the same engine (a Shunting movement is ongoing) 

--- Document Chunk 22265 ---
5.12.4.1 The situation is the following: while the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in Shunting 

--- Document Chunk 22266 ---
mode, the driver closes the desk A and leaves the cab A of the Shunting engine, to go 

--- Document Chunk 22267 ---
to cab B and open desk B of this same engine. 

--- Document Chunk 22268 ---
5.12.4.2 Desk A and desk B are connected to the same ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 22269 ---
5.12.4.2.1 Before closing the desk A, the driver enables the function “Continue Shunting on desk 

--- Document Chunk 22270 ---
closure”. When the driver closes the desk A, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 22271 ---
shall immediately go to Passive Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22272 ---
5.12.4.2.2 When the driver opens the desk B, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 22273 ---
immediately switch back to Shunting mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22274 ---
5.12.4.3 When the driver closes a desk and opens the other one of the same engine, the 

--- Document Chunk 22275 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall be able to calculate the new train position data 

--- Document Chunk 22276 ---
(train front position, train orientation), by use of the previous data. 

--- Document Chunk 22277 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22278 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22279 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 22280 ---
4.0.0

--- Document Chunk 22286 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22287 ---
5.13 Train Reversing 

--- Document Chunk 22288 ---
5.13.1.1 This procedure is intended to allow the fast reversal of movement of a train, to run away 

--- Document Chunk 22289 ---
from a danger up to a “safe” location. 

--- Document Chunk 22290 ---
5.13.1.2 The area where initiation of reversing will be possible is announced to the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 22291 ---
on-board equipment by trackside (refer to 3.15.4.2 for details).  

--- Document Chunk 22292 ---
5.13.1.3 While the train front end is at standstill inside the reversing permitted area, the driver 

--- Document Chunk 22293 ---
shall be informed that reversing is possible 

--- Document Chunk 22294 ---
5.13.1.4 If the ERTMS/ETCS onboard  detects the driver’s intention to reverse (e.g. from a 

--- Document Chunk 22295 ---
direction controller in reverse position), the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall ask 

--- Document Chunk 22296 ---
the driver to acknowledge transition to RV mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22297 ---
5.13.1.5 If the driver acknowledges, the on-board equipment shall switch to RV mode 

--- Document Chunk 22298 ---
5.13.1.6 Once in RV mode, it shall be possible for the trackside to send a new permitted distance 

--- Document Chunk 22299 ---
to run and a new maximum speed. 

--- Document Chunk 22300 ---
5.13.1.7 Once in RV mode, it shall also be possible for the trackside to send, together with the 

--- Document Chunk 22301 ---
new permitted distance to run and the maximum speed, a new reference location for the 

--- Document Chunk 22302 ---
new permitted distance to run. 

--- Document Chunk 22303 ---
5.13.1.8 Note: this new reference location is the end of a new reversing area given by trackside 

--- Document Chunk 22304 ---
that the onboard will use only for the purpose of distance referencing. 

--- Document Chunk 22305 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22306 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22307 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22308 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 22309 ---
4.0.0

05/07/2023

Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 22313 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 22314 ---
Page 67/112 

--- Document Chunk 22315 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22316 ---
5.14 Joining / Splitting 

--- Document Chunk 22317 ---
 Definitions 

--- Document Chunk 22318 ---
5.14.1.1 Definition for splitting: The “train to be split” is the train at standstill, waiting for being split. 

--- Document Chunk 22319 ---
The “front train after splitting” refers to the front part of the train before splitting, the “new 

--- Document Chunk 22320 ---
train after splitting”, refers to the other part. 

--- Document Chunk 22321 ---
5.14.1.2 Definitions for joining: The “train to be joined” is the train at standstill, waiting for being 

--- Document Chunk 22322 ---
joined. The “joining train” is the train performing the joining operation. 

--- Document Chunk 22323 ---
 Procedure “Splitting” 

--- Document Chunk 22324 ---
5.14.2.1 Step 1 - The electrical and mechanical links bet ween the two trains must be removed 

--- Document Chunk 22325 ---
(this is a national operational procedure, out of the scope of the SRS). 

--- Document Chunk 22326 ---
5.14.2.1.1 Note: If splitting require s moving the two train parts apart from each other for a small 

--- Document Chunk 22327 ---
distance, this can be done even in SB mode 

--- Document Chunk 22328 ---
5.14.2.2 Step 2a - If the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment which was supervising the train before 

--- Document Chunk 22329 ---
splitting has not performed an end of mission for splitting, the Train Data must be 

--- Document Chunk 22330 ---
modified (e.g. by the driver) such that it fits with the new train composition after splitting. 

--- Document Chunk 22331 ---
For level 2, the new train data is sent to the RBC (see SRS chapter 3 – Data Entry / 

--- Document Chunk 22332 ---
Modification Process) 

--- Document Chunk 22333 ---
5.14.2.3 Step 2b - If an ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of the "new train after splitting" was 

--- Document Chunk 22334 ---
in SL mode before, it will switch to SB mode once the remote control s ignal is not 

--- Document Chunk 22335 ---
received any more (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes).  

--- Document Chunk 22336 ---
For Level 2: The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment opens a communication session (if 

--- Document Chunk 22337 ---
possible) and reports the mode change to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22338 ---
5.14.2.4 Step 2c - If an ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment of the "new train after splitting" was 

--- Document Chunk 22339 ---
in NL mode before, it will switch to SB mode once the non leading input signal is not 

--- Document Chunk 22340 ---
received any more (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes and chapter 5, 

--- Document Chunk 22341 ---
“end of mission” procedure).  

--- Document Chunk 22342 ---
5.14.2.5 The driver can then start a new mission with this “new train after splitting” (refer to the 

--- Document Chunk 22343 ---
“Start of Mission” procedure). In all cases, to start a mission is not the only possibility. 

--- Document Chunk 22344 ---
Shunting movements, or not moving the new train at all, are also possible. 

--- Document Chunk 22345 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22346 ---
 Procedure “Joining” 

--- Document Chunk 22347 ---
5.14.3.1 Step 1 - The “joining train” must approach the “train to be joined”. This can be performed 

--- Document Chunk 22348 ---
in SR, OS, SM or SH mode (depending on the information available, and on the national 

--- Document Chunk 22349 ---
procedure for joining). 

--- Document Chunk 22350 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22351 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22352 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 22353 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 22354 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 22355 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 22356 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 22357 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 22358 ---
Page 68/112 

--- Document Chunk 22359 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22360 ---
5.14.3.2 Step 2 - The electrical and mechanical li nks between the two trains must be closed 

--- Document Chunk 22361 ---
(vehicle dependent, outside the scope of the ETCS). 

--- Document Chunk 22362 ---
5.14.3.3 Step 3a - If a former leading ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment remains leading and 

--- Document Chunk 22363 ---
there was no end of mission, the driver must modify the Train Data such that it fits with 

--- Document Chunk 22364 ---
the new train composition. For level 2, the new train data is sent to the RBC (see SRS 

--- Document Chunk 22365 ---
chapter 3 – Data Entry / Modification Process) 

--- Document Chunk 22366 ---
5.14.3.4 Step 3b - If a former leading ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is to become slave 

--- Document Chunk 22367 ---
equipment in SL mode, when closing the desk, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 22368 ---
will switch to SB mode (see SRS chapter 4, transitions between modes) and the end of 

--- Document Chunk 22369 ---
mission procedure is executed (see “End of Mission” procedure). Transition to SL mode 

--- Document Chunk 22370 ---
is from SB mode. 

--- Document Chunk 22371 ---
5.14.3.5 Step 3c - If a former leading ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is to become slave 

--- Document Chunk 22372 ---
equipment in NL mode, the driver selects NL mode  (see SRS chapter 4, transitions 

--- Document Chunk 22373 ---
between modes).  

--- Document Chunk 22374 ---
5.14.3.6 For further steps after joining refer to procedures “Start of Mission” and “Change of Train 

--- Document Chunk 22375 ---
Orientation”. 

--- Document Chunk 22376 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 22386 ---
5.15 RBC/RBC Handover 

--- Document Chunk 22387 ---
 Principles 

--- Document Chunk 22388 ---
5.15.1.1 Every RBC/RBC handover shall be announced to the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 22389 ---
equipment via a balise group or via the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22390 ---
5.15.1.2 The handover announcement (i.e. RBC transition order) to the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 22391 ---
equipment shall consist of an order to establish a communication session with  the 

--- Document Chunk 22392 ---
Accepting RBC (see 3.5. 2.6.2) and to execute the handover at a further location 

--- Document Chunk 22393 ---
corresponding to the border. 

--- Document Chunk 22394 ---
5.15.1.2.1 In case of RBC/RBC handover including a change of Radio Network type and/or a 

--- Document Chunk 22395 ---
change of GSM -R Radio Network , ERTMS/ETCS trackside is responsible for the 

--- Document Chunk 22396 ---
sequence of Radio Network trans ition order and order to establish a communication 

--- Document Chunk 22397 ---
session with the "Accepting" RBC, according to the Radio Network’s configuration. The 

--- Document Chunk 22398 ---
following Radio Network transitions are possible: 

--- Document Chunk 22399 ---
t1 GSM-R => FRMCS  (for completeness reason, i.e. the on -board only store s the 

--- Document Chunk 22400 ---
Radio Network type and does not order any radio network registration); 

--- Document Chunk 22401 ---
t2 FRMCS => GSM-R; 

--- Document Chunk 22402 ---
t3 GSM-Rx => FRMCS+GSM -Rx (for completeness reason, i.e. the on -board only 

--- Document Chunk 22403 ---
stores the Radio Network type and does not order any radio network registration); 

--- Document Chunk 22404 ---
t4 GSM-Rx => FRMCS+GSM-Ry; 

--- Document Chunk 22405 ---
t5 FRMCS+GSM-Rx => GSM -Rx (for completeness reason, i.e. the on -board only 

--- Document Chunk 22406 ---
stores the Radio Network type and does not order any radio network registration); 

--- Document Chunk 22407 ---
t6 FRMCS+GSM-Rx => GSM-Ry, communication session with “Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22408 ---
through FRMCS; 

--- Document Chunk 22409 ---
t7 FRMCS+GSM-Rx => GSM-Ry, communication session with “Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22410 ---
through GSM-Rx; 

--- Document Chunk 22411 ---
t8 FRMCS => FRMCS+GSM-R; 

--- Document Chunk 22412 ---
t9 FRMCS+GSM-R => FRMCS (for completeness reason, i.e. the on -board only 

--- Document Chunk 22413 ---
stores the Radio Network type and does not order any radio network registration); 

--- Document Chunk 22414 ---
t10 FRMCS+GSM-Rx => FRMCS+GSM -Ry, communication session with “Handing 

--- Document Chunk 22415 ---
Over” RBC through FRMCS; 

--- Document Chunk 22416 ---
t11 FRMCS+GSM-Rx => FRMCS+GSM -Ry, communication session with “Handing 

--- Document Chunk 22417 ---
Over” RBC through GSM-Rx; 

--- Document Chunk 22418 ---
t12 GSM-Rx => GSM-Ry. 

--- Document Chunk 22419 ---
5.15.1.2.2 In the following sections, if both radio communication sessions with “Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22420 ---
and “Accepting” RBC are established with GSM-R, "first" GSM-R Mobile Terminal refers 

--- Document Chunk 22421 ---
to the one used for communication session with “Handing Over” RBC and "second" 

--- Document Chunk 22422 ---
GSM-R Mobile Terminal to the one used for communication s ession with “Accepting” 

--- Document Chunk 22423 ---
RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22424 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22425 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22426 ---

--- Document Chunk 22431 ---

--- Document Chunk 22432 ---
Page 70/112 

--- Document Chunk 22433 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22434 ---
5.15.1.2.3 Note: In the following sections, Radio Networks (FRMCS and/or GSM-R) pertaining to 

--- Document Chunk 22435 ---
the “Handing Over” RBC and “Accepting” RBC areas are supposed to be overlapped. 

--- Document Chunk 22436 ---
5.15.1.3 At the RBC/RBC border a balise group with an order to execute the handover 

--- Document Chunk 22437 ---
immediately shall be placed. 

--- Document Chunk 22438 ---
5.15.1.3.1 Note: Balise groups are read in all levels and orders from balise groups are accepted 

--- Document Chunk 22439 ---
independent of the level of operation. Also sleeping units read balise groups. 

--- Document Chunk 22440 ---
5.15.1.4 If the message from the border balise group is not (yet) received, the handover shall still 

--- Document Chunk 22441 ---
be executed when the train with its max safe front end passes the border location 

--- Document Chunk 22442 ---
according to the announcement information. 

--- Document Chunk 22443 ---
5.15.1.5 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 22444 ---
 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 22445 ---
5.15.2.1 Overview 

--- Document Chunk 22446 ---
5.15.2.1.1 In the normal operation, the main func tional steps needed for running from one RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22447 ---
area to another one are the following: 

--- Document Chunk 22448 ---
a) Pre-announcement of the transition by the “Handing Over” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 22449 ---
b) Depending on the Radio Network transition and the radio system through which the 

--- Document Chunk 22450 ---
“Handing Over” RBC communicat ion session is established, registration to the 

--- Document Chunk 22451 ---
FRMCS network of the FRMCS on -board equipment and/or registration  to the new 

--- Document Chunk 22452 ---
GSM-R Radio Network of second GSM-R Mobile Terminal & Establishment of the 

--- Document Chunk 22453 ---
radio communication session with the “Accepting” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 22454 ---
c) Generation of movement authorities including the border; 

--- Document Chunk 22455 ---
d) Announcement of the RBC transition 

--- Document Chunk 22456 ---
e) Transfer of train supervision to the “Accepting” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 22457 ---
f) Termination of the session with “Handing Over” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22458 ---
g) Only in case of GSM-R Radio Network change and if the radio communication session 

--- Document Chunk 22459 ---
with the “Handing over” RBC was established through GSM -R: Registration to the 

--- Document Chunk 22460 ---
new GSM-R Radio Network of first GSM-R Mobile Terminal 

--- Document Chunk 22461 ---
5.15.2.2 Step by step description  

--- Document Chunk 22462 ---
5.15.2.2.1 Pre-announcement 

--- Document Chunk 22463 ---
 When the “Handing Over” RBC generates a movement authority which reaches the 

--- Document Chunk 22464 ---
border to another RBC area, it initiates the processes associated to the transition. 

--- Document Chunk 22465 ---
 The “Handing Over” RBC informs the “Accepting” RBC about the RBC/RBC handover. 

--- Document Chunk 22466 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 22475 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22476 ---
5.15.2.2.2 Registration to the FRMCS network of the FRMCS on -board equipment and/or to 

--- Document Chunk 22477 ---
the new GSM-R Radio Network of second GSM-R Mobile Terminal & Establishment 

--- Document Chunk 22478 ---
of the radio communication session with “Accepting” RBC  

--- Document Chunk 22479 ---
 A radio communication session with the Acc epting RBC is opened by the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 22480 ---
equipment based on the RBC transition order received from the “Handing Over” RBC or 

--- Document Chunk 22481 ---
from balise group (refer to chapter 3, section "management of radio communication"). 

--- Document Chunk 22482 ---
 In case of RBC/RBC handover including Radio Networ k change, the registration to 

--- Document Chunk 22483 ---
the FRMCS network of the FRMCS on-board equipment (see t1, t3, t4 in 5.15.1.2.1), the 

--- Document Chunk 22484 ---
registration to the new GSM-R radio network of the second GSM-R Mobile Terminal (see 

--- Document Chunk 22485 ---
t2, t4, t6, t7, t8, t10, t11, t12 in 5.15.1.2.1), is completed before the RBC transition order 

--- Document Chunk 22486 ---
is transmitted to the on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 22487 ---
 Depending on whether the communication session with the “Handing Over” RBC is 

--- Document Chunk 22488 ---
established with FRMCS (see t2, t6, t8, t10 in 5.15.1.2.1), the registration to the new 

--- Document Chunk 22489 ---
GSM-R radio network of the first GSM-R Mobile Terminal can also be completed at the 

--- Document Chunk 22490 ---
same time. 

--- Document Chunk 22491 ---
5.15.2.2.3 Generation of MAs including the border 

--- Document Chunk 22492 ---
 The “Handing Over” RBC is responsible for establishing the movement authority 

--- Document Chunk 22493 ---
based on: 

--- Document Chunk 22494 ---
a) Information from the trackside equipment and interlocking of its own area (for the part 

--- Document Chunk 22495 ---
of route related information up to the border), 

--- Document Chunk 22496 ---
b) Information from the “Accepting RBC” for the part of route related information in 

--- Document Chunk 22497 ---
advance of the border. 

--- Document Chunk 22498 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22499 ---
“Handing 

--- Document Chunk 22500 ---
Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22501 ---

--- Document Chunk 22502 ---
RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22503 ---

--- Document Chunk 22504 ---

--- Document Chunk 22505 ---
“Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22506 ---

--- Document Chunk 22507 ---

--- Document Chunk 22511 ---

route information 

--- Document Chunk 22513 ---

--- Document Chunk 22525 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22526 ---
 When it is required to send a movement authority to the train, the “Handing Over” 

--- Document Chunk 22527 ---
RBC will request from the “Accepting” RBC information needed for extending the MA in 

--- Document Chunk 22528 ---
advance of the border. 

--- Document Chunk 22529 ---
5.15.2.2.4 Announcement 

--- Document Chunk 22530 ---
 When the train reaches the border with its max safe front end, the ERTMS/ETCS on-

--- Document Chunk 22531 ---
board equipment sends a position report both to the “Handing Over” RBC and to the 

--- Document Chunk 22532 ---
“Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22533 ---
 The “Handing Over” RBC forwards the announcement information to the “Accepting” 

--- Document Chunk 22534 ---
RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22535 ---
5.15.2.2.4.2.1 Note: The forwarding of the announcement information is executed because the 

--- Document Chunk 22536 ---
“Handing Over” RBC has no knowledge if the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in a 

--- Document Chunk 22537 ---
degraded situation or not i.e. whether it can handle one or two communication sessions. 

--- Document Chunk 22538 ---
5.15.2.2.5 Transfer of train supervision to “Accepting” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22539 ---
 As soon as the on-board has sent to the “Accepting” RBC the position report referred 

--- Document Chunk 22540 ---
to in 5.15.2.2.4.1 , it considers to be supervised by the “Accepting” RBC i.e. it uses 

--- Document Chunk 22541 ---
information received from the “Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22542 ---
 When the “Accepting” RBC receives a position report from the on-board and detects 

--- Document Chunk 22543 ---
that the max safe front end has passed the border, it takes over the responsibility and 

--- Document Chunk 22544 ---
informs the “Handing Over” RBC.  

--- Document Chunk 22545 ---
5.15.2.2.6 Termination of the session with “Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22546 ---
 When the min safe rear end of the train passes the location of the border, the 

--- Document Chunk 22547 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment sends a position report to the “Handing Over” RBC.  

--- Document Chunk 22548 ---
 It is a trackside implementation issue to decide when it is appropriate to  send the 

--- Document Chunk 22549 ---
session termination order to the on-board equipment, e.g. when the ”Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22550 ---
receives a position report and detects that the minimum safe rear end of the train has 

--- Document Chunk 22551 ---
passed the border, or after the RBC has received a train integrity confirmation indicating 

--- Document Chunk 22552 ---
that the confirmed rear end of the train has passed the border. 

--- Document Chunk 22553 ---
5.15.2.2.7 Registration to the new GSM-R Radio Network of first GSM-R Mobile Terminal  

--- Document Chunk 22554 ---
 In case of RBC/RBC handover including a GSM-R Radio Network change and if the 

--- Document Chunk 22555 ---
communication session with the “Handing Over” RBC is established through GSM -R 

--- Document Chunk 22556 ---
(see t4, t7, t11, t12 in 5.15.1.2.1) , the registration to the new GSM-R Radio Network of 

--- Document Chunk 22557 ---
the first GSM-R Mobile Terminal is initiated by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 22558 ---
as soon as the communicati on session with the "Handing Over" RBC has been 

--- Document Chunk 22559 ---
terminated and the safe radio connection has been released. 

--- Document Chunk 22560 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

 Degraded situation: Only one GSM-R communication session can be

5.15.3.1 Overview 

--- Document Chunk 22573 ---
5.15.3.1.1 In case the radio communication session with the “Handing over” RBC was established 

--- Document Chunk 22574 ---
through GSM-R and the RBC transition order does not relate to an RBC interfaced with 

--- Document Chunk 22575 ---
FRMCS only , the main functional steps needed for running from one RBC area to 

--- Document Chunk 22576 ---
another one are the following: 

--- Document Chunk 22577 ---
a) Pre-announcement of the transition by the “Handing Over” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 22578 ---
b) Generation of movement authorities including the border; 

--- Document Chunk 22579 ---
c) Announcement of the RBC transition 

--- Document Chunk 22580 ---
d) Termination of the session with “Handing Over” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 22581 ---
e) Registration to the new GSM-R Radio Network of the GSM-R Mobile Terminal (only 

--- Document Chunk 22582 ---
in case of GSM -R Radio Network ) & Establishment of the radio communication 

--- Document Chunk 22583 ---
session with the “Accepting” RBC; 

--- Document Chunk 22584 ---
f) Transfer of train supervision to the “Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22585 ---
5.15.3.2 Step by step description  

--- Document Chunk 22586 ---
5.15.3.2.1 Pre-announcement 

--- Document Chunk 22587 ---
 When the “Handing over” RBC generates a movement auth ority which reaches the 

--- Document Chunk 22588 ---
border to another RBC area, it initiates the processes associated to the transition. 

--- Document Chunk 22589 ---
 The “Handing Over” RBC informs the “Accepting” RBC about the RBC/RBC transition. 

--- Document Chunk 22590 ---
5.15.3.2.2 Generation of MAs including the border 

--- Document Chunk 22591 ---
 The “Handing Over” RBC is r esponsible for establishing the movement authority 

--- Document Chunk 22592 ---
based on (see Figure 9) 

--- Document Chunk 22593 ---
a) Information from the trackside equipment and interlocking of its own area (for the part 

--- Document Chunk 22594 ---
of route related information up to the border), 

--- Document Chunk 22595 ---
b) Information from the “Accepting RBC” for the part of route related information in 

--- Document Chunk 22596 ---
advance of the border. 

--- Document Chunk 22597 ---
 When it is required to send a movement authority to the train, the "Handing Over" 

--- Document Chunk 22598 ---
RBC will request from the "Accepting RBC" information needed for extending the MA in 

--- Document Chunk 22599 ---
advance of the border. 

--- Document Chunk 22600 ---
5.15.3.2.3 Announcement 

--- Document Chunk 22601 ---
 When the train with its max safe front end reaches the border, the ERTMS/ETCS on-

--- Document Chunk 22602 ---
board equipment sends a position report to the “Handing Over” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22603 ---
 The “Handing Over” RBC forwards the announcement information to the “Accepting” 

--- Document Chunk 22604 ---
RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22605 ---

--- Document Chunk 22615 ---
5.15.3.2.4 Termination of the session with “Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22616 ---
 When the min safe rear end of the train passes the location of the border, the on -

--- Document Chunk 22617 ---
board equipment sends a position report to the “Handing Over” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22618 ---
 It is a trackside implementation issue to decide when it is appropriate to send the 

--- Document Chunk 22619 ---
session termination order to the on-board equipment, e.g. when the “Handing Over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22620 ---
receives a position report and detects that the minimum safe rear end  of the train has 

--- Document Chunk 22621 ---
passed the border, or after the RBC has received a train integrity confirmation indicating 

--- Document Chunk 22622 ---
that the confirmed rear end of the train has passed the border. 

--- Document Chunk 22623 ---
5.15.3.2.5 Registration to the new GSM-R Radio Network of the GSM-R Mobile Terminal (only 

--- Document Chunk 22624 ---
in c ase of GSM -R Radio Network change ) & Establishment of the radio 

--- Document Chunk 22625 ---
communication session with “Accepting” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22626 ---
 When the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment receives the session termination order 

--- Document Chunk 22627 ---
from the “Handing Over” RBC, it terminates the session with the “Handin g over” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22628 ---
and opens a session with the “Accepting” RBC (refer to chapter 3, management of radio 

--- Document Chunk 22629 ---
communication). 

--- Document Chunk 22630 ---
 In case of RBC/RBC handover including a GSM-R Radio Network change towards a 

--- Document Chunk 22631 ---
GSM-R only area or an FRMCS+GSM -R area while the RBC transition order does not 

--- Document Chunk 22632 ---
relate to an RBC interfaced with FRMCS only and if the communication session with the 

--- Document Chunk 22633 ---
“Handing Over” RBC is established through GSM -R (see t4, t7, t11, t12 in 5.15.1.2 .1): 

--- Document Chunk 22634 ---
as soon as the session with the "Handing Over" RBC is terminated, the registration to 

--- Document Chunk 22635 ---
the new GSM-R Radio Network of the GSM-R Mobile Terminal is enforced by the 

--- Document Chunk 22636 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment prior to the opening of a session with the “Accepting” 

--- Document Chunk 22637 ---
RBC (refer to chapter 3, management of radio communication). 

--- Document Chunk 22638 ---
5.15.3.2.6 Transfer of train supervision to “Accepting” RBC 

--- Document Chunk 22639 ---
 When the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment has established a communication 

--- Document Chunk 22640 ---
session with the “Accepting” RBC and sent to the “Accepting” RBC a position rep ort, it 

--- Document Chunk 22641 ---
considers to be supervised by the “Accepting” RBC, i.e. it accepts only information 

--- Document Chunk 22642 ---
received from the “Accepting” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22643 ---
 When the “Accepting” RBC receives a position report from the on-board and detects 

--- Document Chunk 22644 ---
that the max safe front end has passed the bord er, it takes over the responsibility and 

--- Document Chunk 22645 ---
informs the “Handing Over” RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 22646 ---
 Other degraded Situations 

--- Document Chunk 22647 ---
5.15.4.1 Note: If the “Handing Over” RBC is not able to extend the MA into the area of the 

--- Document Chunk 22648 ---
“Accepting RBC”, the driver may select "override", or manually change the level to move 

--- Document Chunk 22649 ---
the train into the area of the “Accepting RBC”. 

--- Document Chunk 22650 ---
5.15.4.2 Note: If the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment cannot open a session with the 

--- Document Chunk 22651 ---
“Accepting RBC”, the train is stopped at the latest when it has reached the EOA given 

--- Document Chunk 22652 ---

--- Document Chunk 22661 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22662 ---
by the “Handing Over” RBC. For passing the EOA the driver may select "override", or 

--- Document Chunk 22663 ---
manually change the level. 

--- Document Chunk 22664 ---
5.15.4.3 If the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment is not able to terminate the session with the 

--- Document Chunk 22665 ---
“Handing Over” RBC: In case a communication session is established and no request to 

--- Document Chunk 22666 ---
terminate the session is received from the “Handing Over” RBC within a fixed wa iting 

--- Document Chunk 22667 ---
time (see appendix to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value Data) after sending the position 

--- Document Chunk 22668 ---
report (see 5.15.2.2.6), the position report is repeated with the fixed waiting time after 

--- Document Chunk 22669 ---
each repetition. After a defined number of repetitions (see appendix to chapter 3, List of 

--- Document Chunk 22670 ---
Fixed Value Data), and if no reply is received within the fixed waiting time from the last 

--- Document Chunk 22671 ---
sending of the position report, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment terminates the 

--- Document Chunk 22672 ---
communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 22673 ---
5.15.4.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 22674 ---
5.16 Procedure passing a non protected Level Crossing 

--- Document Chunk 22675 ---
 General Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 22676 ---
5.16.1.1 In case the LX is not protected, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment (in FS, AD, LS, 

--- Document Chunk 22677 ---
OS or SM mode) first supervises the LX start location as both temporary EOA and SvL, 

--- Document Chunk 22678 ---
with no release speed (see 3.12.5.8). 

--- Document Chunk 22679 ---
5.16.1.2 The supervision of the LX start location as both temporary EOA and SvL shall be 

--- Document Chunk 22680 ---
substituted by the inclusion of the LX speed restriction in the MRSP under  conditions 

--- Document Chunk 22681 ---
depending on whether stopping in rear of the LX start location is required or not. The 

--- Document Chunk 22682 ---
conditions of this substitution are specified in 5.16.2 or 5.16.3. 

--- Document Chunk 22683 ---
5.16.1.3 The start location of the LX speed restriction depends on the substitution conditions, 

--- Document Chunk 22684 ---
which are specified in 5.16.2 or 5.16.3. The end location of the LX speed restriction shall 

--- Document Chunk 22685 ---
be the LX end location. 

--- Document Chunk 22686 ---
5.16.1.4 When approaching a non protected LX, the on -board equipment shall inform the driver 

--- Document Chunk 22687 ---
about the status of the LX, as soon as:  

--- Document Chunk 22688 ---
a) either the temporary EOA or the temporary SvL related to the LX start location 

--- Document Chunk 22689 ---
becomes the Most Relevant Displayed Target (see 3.13.10.4.2), or 

--- Document Chunk 22690 ---
b) the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment substitutes the supervision of the LX start 

--- Document Chunk 22691 ---
location as both temporary EOA and SvL by the inclusion of the LX speed restriction 

--- Document Chunk 22692 ---
in the MRSP. 

--- Document Chunk 22693 ---
5.16.1.5 Unless the information “LX is protected” is received on-board, the indication given to the 

--- Document Chunk 22694 ---
driver shall be displayed as long as the train min safe front end is in rear of the LX end 

--- Document Chunk 22695 ---
location. 

--- Document Chunk 22696 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22697 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22698 ---

--- Document Chunk 22699 ---

--- Document Chunk 22705 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22706 ---
 Stopping in rear of non protected LX is required 

--- Document Chunk 22707 ---
5.16.2.1 Once the train has stopped with its estimated front end inside the st opping area, given 

--- Document Chunk 22708 ---
by trackside, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall no longer supervise  the LX 

--- Document Chunk 22709 ---
start location as both temporary EOA and SvL  and shall immediately include the LX 

--- Document Chunk 22710 ---
speed restriction in the MRSP, starting from the estimated train front end. 

--- Document Chunk 22711 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22712 ---
train front end location 

--- Document Chunk 22713 ---
speed 

--- Document Chunk 22714 ---

--- Document Chunk 22725 ---
 Stopping in rear of non protected LX is not required 

--- Document Chunk 22726 ---
5.16.3.1 In case stopping in rear of the non protected LX is not required, the LX start location shall 

--- Document Chunk 22727 ---
be supervised as both temporary EOA and SvL until the train reaches the location of the 

--- Document Chunk 22728 ---
braking to target  Permitted speed supervision limit calculated for the LX speed  (see 

--- Document Chunk 22729 ---
3.13.9.3.5.11&12 for the calculation of this location). 

--- Document Chunk 22730 ---
5.16.3.2 As soon as the estimated or the max safe front end (depending whether the most 

--- Document Chunk 22731 ---
restrictive SBI supervision limit at LX speed is the SBI1 or the SBI2 , see 3.13.9.3.5.11) 

--- Document Chunk 22732 ---
has reached the location of the Permitted speed supervision limit calculated for the LX 

--- Document Chunk 22733 ---
speed and the train speed is below or eq ual to the LX spe ed, the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 22734 ---
board equipment shall no longer supervise the LX start location as both temporary EOA 

--- Document Chunk 22735 ---
and SvL and shall immediately include the LX speed  restriction in the MRSP , starting 

--- Document Chunk 22736 ---
from the location of the Permitted speed supervision limit calculated for the LX speed.

5.16.3.3 Note: A braking curve to zero, instead of a braking curve to the LX speed at the LX start 

--- Document Chunk 22762 ---
location, will ensure that the train is able to stop before the start location of the level 

--- Document Chunk 22763 ---
crossing, in case this latter is not free for the train to pass. Close to the level crossing it 

--- Document Chunk 22764 ---
is then the responsibility of the driver to proceed or not with LX speed as a maximum. 

--- Document Chunk 22765 ---
5.17 Changing Train Data from sources different from the driver 

--- Document Chunk 22766 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 22767 ---
5.17.1.1 When valid Train Data is stored on-board, input information acquired from ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 22768 ---
external sources different from the driver may affect some of the Train Data, depending 

--- Document Chunk 22769 ---
on the type of train (e.g. tilting input information from tilting external device may affect 

--- Document Chunk 22770 ---
the train category and the loading gauge). 

--- Document Chunk 22771 ---
5.17.1.2 The procedure here below describes the necessary steps performed by the 

--- Document Chunk 22772 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment from the detection of an input information change on 

--- Document Chunk 22773 ---
an external interface, to the effective encountering of the Train Data change by th e 

--- Document Chunk 22774 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 22775 ---
5.17.1.3 This procedure is not applicable for trains running in RV mode: on leaving RV mode, the 

--- Document Chunk 22776 ---
Train Data will always be invalidated or deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 22777 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 22778 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22779 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 22780 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 22781 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 22782 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 22783 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 22784 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 22785 ---
Page 78/112 

--- Document Chunk 22786 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22787 ---
 Table of requirements for “Changing Train Data from sources different 

--- Document Chunk 22788 ---
from the driver” procedure 

--- Document Chunk 22789 ---
5.17.2.1 The ID numbers in the table are used for the representation of the procedure in form of 

--- Document Chunk 22790 ---
a flow chart in section 5.17.3. 

--- Document Chunk 22791 ---
5.17.2.2 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 22792 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 22793 ---
S0 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is in one of the following modes: FS , AD, LS, 

--- Document Chunk 22794 ---
OS, SR, SB, SN, UN, TR, PT and valid Train Data is stored on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 22795 ---
If a change of input information, which affects Train Data, is detected on an 

--- Document Chunk 22796 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board external interface (E0), the process shall go to D0 

--- Document Chunk 22797 ---
D0 According to the specific tr ain implementation, Train Data which is/are affected by the 

--- Document Chunk 22798 ---
change of input information from the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment external 

--- Document Chunk 22799 ---
interface may require validation: 

--- Document Chunk 22800 ---
• If the affected data requires driver validation, the process shall go to D2 

--- Document Chunk 22801 ---
• If the affected data does not require driver validation, the process shall go to D1 

--- Document Chunk 22802 ---
D1 Depending on the type of Train Data which is/are affected by the change of input 

--- Document Chunk 22803 ---
information from the ERTMS/ETCS on -board external interface, the following shall 

--- Document Chunk 22804 ---
apply: 

--- Document Chunk 22805 ---
• If the impacted Train Data regards either train category, or axle load  category, 

--- Document Chunk 22806 ---
or traction system(s) accepted by the engine, or loading gauge, the process shall 

--- Document Chunk 22807 ---
go to D3 

--- Document Chunk 22808 ---
• If the impacted Train Data regards any other t ype of Train Data, the process 

--- Document Chunk 22809 ---
shall go to A1 

--- Document Chunk 22810 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22811 ---
D3 Depending on the mode of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, the following shall 

--- Document Chunk 22812 ---
apply: 

--- Document Chunk 22813 ---
• If mode is FS, AD, LS, or OS, the process shall go to D7 

--- Document Chunk 22814 ---
• If mode is SB or PT, the process shall go to A1 

--- Document Chunk 22815 ---
• If mode is UN, SN, SR, or TR the process shall go to D5 

--- Document Chunk 22816 ---
D5 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall check whether MA and track description, 

--- Document Chunk 22817 ---
received from RBC, are stored on-board, in case a level 2 transition or an RBC transition 

--- Document Chunk 22818 ---
for a further location has been ordered: 

--- Document Chunk 22819 ---
• If MA and track description are stored, the process shall go to D7 

--- Document Chunk 22820 ---
• If MA and track description are not both stored, the process shall go to A1 

--- Document Chunk 22821 ---
D7 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall check whether the train is at standstill: 

--- Document Chunk 22822 ---
• If at standstill, the process shall go to A1 

--- Document Chunk 22823 ---
• If not at standstill, the process shall go to S2 

--- Document Chunk 22824 ---

--- Document Chunk 22830 ---
Chapter 5

Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 22832 ---
Page 79/112 

--- Document Chunk 22833 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 22834 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 22835 ---
A1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall inform the driver that Train Data has been 

--- Document Chunk 22836 ---
changed and the process shall go to A7 

--- Document Chunk 22837 ---
S2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall command the service brake, inform the 

--- Document Chunk 22838 ---
driver about the reason of this brake command and waits for the train to be at standstill; 

--- Document Chunk 22839 ---
when the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment detects that the train is at standstill (E2), 

--- Document Chunk 22840 ---
the process shall go to S3 

--- Document Chunk 22841 ---
S3 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall request the driver to acknowledge the 

--- Document Chunk 22842 ---
brake command; when the driver acknowledges (E3), the process shall go to A5 

--- Document Chunk 22843 ---
A5 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall release the brake command and the 

--- Document Chunk 22844 ---
process shall go to A7 

--- Document Chunk 22845 ---
D2 Depending on the mode of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, the following shall 

--- Document Chunk 22846 ---
apply: 

--- Document Chunk 22847 ---
• If mode is FS, AD, LS, OS, SR, SB, SN or UN the process shall go to D9 

--- Document Chunk 22848 ---
• If mode is TR or PT, the process shall go to S1 

--- Document Chunk 22849 ---
S1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall wait for the end of the Train Trip 

--- Document Chunk 22850 ---
procedure (see section 5.11). When the Train Trip procedure is exited (E1) (i.e. there is 

--- Document Chunk 22851 ---
a mode transition to another mode than TR, PT), the process shall go to D4 

--- Document Chunk 22852 ---
D4 Depending on the mode of the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment, the following shall 

--- Document Chunk 22853 ---
apply: 

--- Document Chunk 22854 ---
• If mode is FS, LS, OS, SR, SN or UN the process shall go to S6 

--- Document Chunk 22855 ---
• If mode is SH, the Train Data are invalidated and the process shall END 

--- Document Chunk 22856 ---
D9 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall check whether the train is at standstill: 

--- Document Chunk 22857 ---
• If at standstill, the process shall go to S6 

--- Document Chunk 22858 ---
• If not at standstill, the process shall go to S4 

--- Document Chunk 22859 ---
S4 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall command the service brake, inform the 

--- Document Chunk 22860 ---
driver about the reason of this brake command and wait for the train to be at standstill; 

--- Document Chunk 22861 ---
when the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment detects that the train is at standstill (E4), 

--- Document Chunk 22862 ---
the process shall go to S5 

--- Document Chunk 22863 ---
S5 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall request the driver to acknowledge the 

--- Document Chunk 22864 ---
brake command; when the driver acknowledges (E5), the process shall go to A6 

--- Document Chunk 22865 ---
A6 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall release the brake command and the 

--- Document Chunk 22866 ---
process shall go to S6 

--- Document Chunk 22867 ---
S6 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall request the driver to re-enter or re-validate 

--- Document Chunk 22868 ---
the Train Data. 

--- Document Chunk 22869 ---
Once Train Data is validated (E6), the process shall go to A7 

--- Document Chunk 22870 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 22881 ---
A7 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall consider the Train Data as being changed 

--- Document Chunk 22882 ---
and shall apply, when relevant, the requirements regarding change of Train Data (refer 

--- Document Chunk 22883 ---
to clauses 3.18.3.4, 3.18.3.7 and 3.18.3.8). 

--- Document Chunk 22884 ---
The process shall END.

5.18 Indication of Track Conditions 

--- Document Chunk 22988 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 22989 ---
5.18.1.1 This set of procedures specifies the sequences of driver indications related to the 

--- Document Chunk 22990 ---
following track-conditions: 

--- Document Chunk 22991 ---
a) powerless section with pantograph to be lowered 

--- Document Chunk 22992 ---
b) powerless section with main power switch to be switched off, 

--- Document Chunk 22993 ---
c) non-stopping area, 

--- Document Chunk 22994 ---
d) radio hole, 

--- Document Chunk 22995 ---
e) air tightness area, 

--- Document Chunk 22996 ---
f) Inhibition of a defined type of brake, 

--- Document Chunk 22997 ---
g) tunnel stopping area, 

--- Document Chunk 22998 ---
h) sound horn, 

--- Document Chunk 22999 ---
i) change of traction system. 

--- Document Chunk 23000 ---
5.18.1.2 Note: For every procedure a figure supports the textual descr iption. The textual 

--- Document Chunk 23001 ---
description of the procedures contains reference to the figures (point B, point F,…). 

--- Document Chunk 23002 ---
 Passing a powerless section with pantograph to be lowered 

--- Document Chunk 23003 ---
5.18.2.1 This procedure is dealing with the announcement and indication to the driver of a 

--- Document Chunk 23004 ---
powerless section with the pantograph to be lowered. 

--- Document Chunk 23005 ---
5.18.2.1.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 23006 ---
5.18.2.2 “Lower pantograph announcement” shall be displayed to the driver when the max safe 

--- Document Chunk 23007 ---
front end of the train reaches a location (point C) in rear of the beginning of the powerless 

--- Document Chunk 23008 ---
section (point D). 

--- Document Chunk 23009 ---
5.18.2.2.1 This location (point C) shall be determined by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 23010 ---
taking into account the time necessary for performing the required actions and the 

--- Document Chunk 23011 ---
current train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 23012 ---
5.18.2.2.2 The displayed “Lower pantograph announcement” informati on shall also indicate if the 

--- Document Chunk 23013 ---
related functionality is executed 

--- Document Chunk 23014 ---
• automatically, or 

--- Document Chunk 23015 ---
• if the driver is requested to act. 

--- Document Chunk 23016 ---
 Note: Whether the operation is automatic or manual is application dependent. 

--- Document Chunk 23017 ---
5.18.2.3 When the max safe front end of the train reaches the start loc ation (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 23018 ---
powerless section: 

--- Document Chunk 23019 ---
• “Lower pantograph announcement” shall no longer be displayed to the driver, 

--- Document Chunk 23020 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 23021 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 23022 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 23023 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 23024 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 23025 ---

--- Document Chunk 23026 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 23027 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 23028 ---
Page 83/112 

--- Document Chunk 23029 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 23030 ---
• “Lowered Pantograph” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 23031 ---
5.18.2.4 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 23032 ---
5.18.2.4.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 23033 ---
5.18.2.5 When the min safe front end of the train reaches the “Powerless section” end location 

--- Document Chunk 23034 ---
point E): 

--- Document Chunk 23035 ---
• “Lowered Pantograph” information shall no longer be displayed to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 23036 ---
• “Raise pantograph” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 23037 ---
5.18.2.5.1 The displayed “Raise pantograph” info rmation shall also indicate if the related 

--- Document Chunk 23038 ---
functionality is executed 

--- Document Chunk 23039 ---
• automatically, or 

--- Document Chunk 23040 ---
• if the driver is requested to act. 

--- Document Chunk 23041 ---
 Note: Whether the operation is automatic or manual is application dependent. 

--- Document Chunk 23042 ---
5.18.2.6 The “Raise pantograph” information shall remain displayed for a fixed time (see Appendix 

--- Document Chunk 23043 ---
A.3.1) after the minimum safe rear end of the train has passed the end of the “Powerless 

--- Document Chunk 23044 ---
section”. 

--- Document Chunk 23045 ---
5.18.2.6.1 Note: The train front end position when this information disappears is shown as point G 

--- Document Chunk 23046 ---
in the Figure 13.

--- Document Chunk 23080 ---
5.18.3.2 “Neutral section announcement” shall be displayed to the driver when the max safe front 

--- Document Chunk 23081 ---
end of the train reaches a loc ation (point C) in rear of the beginning of the powerless 

--- Document Chunk 23082 ---
section. 

--- Document Chunk 23083 ---
5.18.3.2.1 This location (point C) shall be determined by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 23084 ---
taking into account the time necessary for performing the required actions and the 

--- Document Chunk 23085 ---
current train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 23086 ---
5.18.3.2.2 The displayed “Neutral section announcement” information shall also indicate if the 

--- Document Chunk 23087 ---
related functionality is executed 

--- Document Chunk 23088 ---
• automatically, or 

--- Document Chunk 23089 ---
• if the driver is requested to act. 

--- Document Chunk 23090 ---
 Note: Whether the operation is automatic or manual is application dependent. 

--- Document Chunk 23091 ---
5.18.3.3 When the max safe front end of the train reaches the starting location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 23092 ---
powerless section: 

--- Document Chunk 23093 ---
• “Neutral section announcement” shall no longer be displayed to the driver, 

--- Document Chunk 23094 ---
• “Neutral section” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 23095 ---
5.18.3.4 When the min safe front end of the train reaches the “Powerless section” end location 

--- Document Chunk 23096 ---
point E): 

--- Document Chunk 23097 ---
• “Neutral section” information shall no longer be displayed to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 23098 ---
• “End of Neutral section” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 23099 ---
5.18.3.4.1 The displayed “End of Neutral sect ion” information shall also indicate if the related 

--- Document Chunk 23100 ---
functionality is executed 

--- Document Chunk 23101 ---
• Automatically, or 

--- Document Chunk 23102 ---
• if the driver is requested to act.  

--- Document Chunk 23103 ---
 Note: Whether the operation is automatic or manual is application dependent.  

--- Document Chunk 23104 ---
5.18.3.5 The “End of Neutral section” information shall  remain displayed for a fixed time (see 

--- Document Chunk 23105 ---
Appendix A.3.1) after the minimum safe rear end of the train has passed the end of the 

--- Document Chunk 23106 ---
“Powerless section”. 

--- Document Chunk 23107 ---
5.18.3.5.1 Note: The train front end position, when this information disappears is shown as point G 

--- Document Chunk 23108 ---
in the Figure 14. 

--- Document Chunk 23109 ---

--- Document Chunk 23122 ---
 Passing a non stopping area 

--- Document Chunk 23123 ---
5.18.4.1 This procedure is dealing with the announcement and indication to the driver of an area 

--- Document Chunk 23124 ---
where stopping is not permitted. 

--- Document Chunk 23125 ---
5.18.4.2 As long as there are non stopping areas stored on -board, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 23126 ---
equipment shall continuously check the current speed and position of the  train whether 

--- Document Chunk 23127 ---
a full service brake command would stop the train within any of the stored non stopping 

--- Document Chunk 23128 ---
areas. This shall be achieved taking into account for each non stopping area, two virtual 

--- Document Chunk 23129 ---
SBI supervision limits (SBID and SBIG), calculated at the estimated speed from two SBD 

--- Document Chunk 23130 ---
curves of which the f eet are the start location of the non stopping area (point D) and a 

--- Document Chunk 23131 ---
location (point G) at train length distance in advance of the end location of the non 

--- Document Chunk 23132 ---
stopping area: 

--- Document Chunk 23133 ---
a) If the max safe front end is in rear of the first SBI supervision limit (SBID) no information 

--- Document Chunk 23134 ---
related to this non stopping area shall be displayed 

--- Document Chunk 23135 ---
b) If the max safe front end is in advance of the first SBI supervision limit (SBID) and the 

--- Document Chunk 23136 ---
min safe front end in rear of the second SBI supervision limit (SBIG), the non stopping 

--- Document Chunk 23137 ---
area related information shall be displayed to the driver  according to the following 

--- Document Chunk 23138 ---
clauses 5.18.4.3, 5.18.4.4. 

--- Document Chunk 23139 ---
c) If the min safe front end is in advance of the second SBI supervision limit  (SBIG), no 

--- Document Chunk 23140 ---
information related to this non stopping area shall be displayed. 

--- Document Chunk 23141 ---
5.18.4.3 When the max safe front end is in rear of the start location (point D) of the non stopping 

--- Document Chunk 23142 ---
area, the “Non stopping area announcement” shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 23143 ---
5.18.4.4 When the max safe front end is in advance of  the start location (point D) of the non 

--- Document Chunk 23144 ---
stopping area: 

--- Document Chunk 23145 ---
• “Non stopping area announcement”, if any, shall no longer be displayed 

--- Document Chunk 23146 ---
• “Non stopping area” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 23147 ---
running direction 

--- Document Chunk 23148 ---

section»

--- Document Chunk 23221 ---
5.18.6.1 This procedure is dealing with the announcement and indication to the driver of an air 

--- Document Chunk 23222 ---
tightness area. 

--- Document Chunk 23223 ---
5.18.6.2 “Close air conditioning intake announcement” information shall be displayed to the driver 

--- Document Chunk 23224 ---
when the max safe front end of the train reaches a location (point C) in rear of the 

--- Document Chunk 23225 ---
beginning of the “air tightness” area. 

--- Document Chunk 23226 ---
5.18.6.2.1 This location (point C) shall be determined by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 23227 ---
taking into account the time necessary for performing the required actions and the 

--- Document Chunk 23228 ---
current train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 23229 ---
5.18.6.2.2 The displayed “Close air conditioning intake  announcement” information shall also 

--- Document Chunk 23230 ---
indicate if the related functionality is executed 

--- Document Chunk 23231 ---
• automatically, or 

--- Document Chunk 23232 ---
• if the driver is requested to act.  

--- Document Chunk 23233 ---
 Note: Whether the operation is automatic or manual is application dependent. 

--- Document Chunk 23234 ---
5.18.6.3 When the max safe front end of the train reaches the start locat ion (point D) of the air 

--- Document Chunk 23235 ---
tightness area: 

--- Document Chunk 23236 ---
• “Close air conditioning intake  announcement” information shall no longer be 

--- Document Chunk 23237 ---
displayed. 

--- Document Chunk 23238 ---
• “Air conditioning intake closed” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 23239 ---
5.18.6.4 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the end location (point E) of the air 

--- Document Chunk 23240 ---
tightness area: 

--- Document Chunk 23241 ---
• “Air conditioning intake closed” information shall no longer be displayed; 

--- Document Chunk 23242 ---
• “Open air conditioning intake” information shall be displayed to the driver.

--- Document Chunk 23331 ---

--- Document Chunk 23332 ---
5.18.8.1.1 Note: the tunnel stopping areas are designed in such a way that the passengers can step 

--- Document Chunk 23333 ---
out, use a walkway along the track and reach the safe area, taking into account the 

--- Document Chunk 23334 ---
longest admissible train in the tunnel stopped with its front end within the tunnel stopping 

--- Document Chunk 23335 ---
area. 

--- Document Chunk 23336 ---
5.18.8.2 On driver request, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall enable/disable the 

--- Document Chunk 23337 ---
display of the tunnel stopping area related information (initial state: disabled). 

--- Document Chunk 23338 ---

--- Document Chunk 23339 ---
tunnel stopping areas stored on -board, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 23340 ---
continuously check the current speed and position of the train to determine whether the 

--- Document Chunk 23341 ---
running direction

--- Document Chunk 23365 ---
driver can stop the train with the full service brake before reaching the end of the closest 

--- Document Chunk 23366 ---
tunnel stopping area. This shall be achieved taking into account a virtual Permitted 

--- Document Chunk 23367 ---
supervision limit (with no contribution of the GUI curve, if any), calculated at the estimated 

--- Document Chunk 23368 ---
speed from an SBD curve of whi ch the foot is the end location of the tunnel stopping 

--- Document Chunk 23369 ---
area: 

--- Document Chunk 23370 ---
a) If the train front end is in rear of the Permitted supervision limit, the tunnel stopping 

--- Document Chunk 23371 ---
area related information shall be displayed to the driver.  

--- Document Chunk 23372 ---

--- Document Chunk 23373 ---
related to this tunnel stopping area shall be displayed and the next tunnel stopping 

--- Document Chunk 23374 ---
area stored on-board, if any, shall be checked. 

--- Document Chunk 23375 ---

--- Document Chunk 23376 ---
“tunnel stopping area announcement” shall be displayed to the driver. This shall include 

--- Document Chunk 23377 ---
the indication of the remaining distance to the start location of the tunnel stopping area. 

--- Document Chunk 23378 ---

--- Document Chunk 23379 ---
• “Tunnel stopping area announcement” shall no longer be displayed 

--- Document Chunk 23380 ---
• “Tunnel stopping area” information shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 23381 ---

--- Document Chunk 23382 ---
point E is reached, because of the condition 5.18.8.3 b).

--- Document Chunk 23497 ---
5.19 Procedure Limited Supervision 

--- Document Chunk 23498 ---
 General Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 23499 ---
5.19.1.1 The order to switch to Limited Supervision mode shall be given by means of a mode 

--- Document Chunk 23500 ---
profile. 

--- Document Chunk 23501 ---
5.19.1.2 An acknowledgement for running in Limited Supervision mode shall be requested from 

--- Document Chunk 23502 ---
the driver. The conditions of the acknowledgement are specified below. 

--- Document Chunk 23503 ---
 Limited Supervision is requested for current location (from modes 

--- Document Chunk 23504 ---
different from Stand By and Post Trip) 

--- Document Chunk 23505 ---
5.19.2.1 In a level 1 area, the beginning of the Limited Supervision area can be the balise (group) 

--- Document Chunk 23506 ---
that gives the Mode Profile. When the train passes the balise group and receives this 

--- Document Chunk 23507 ---
information, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall immediately switch to Limited 

--- Document Chunk 23508 ---
Supervision mode. 

--- Document Chunk 23509 ---
5.19.2.2 In a level 2 area, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment can receive a mode profile 

--- Document Chunk 23510 ---
giving a Limited Supervision area which the train position confidence interval  already 

--- Document Chunk 23511 ---
overlaps. If starting from the min safe front end of the train this Limited Supervision area 

--- Document Chunk 23512 ---
is the furthest area that the train position confidence interval overlaps within the mode 

--- Document Chunk 23513 ---
profile, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall immediately switch to Limited 

--- Document Chunk 23514 ---
Supervision mode. 

--- Document Chunk 23515 ---
5.19.2.3 The driver must acknowledge the Limited Supe rvision mode. A request of 

--- Document Chunk 23516 ---
acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 23517 ---
5.19.2.4 If the driver has not acknowledged within the driver acknowledgement time (refer to 

--- Document Chunk 23518 ---
Appendix A .3.1) after the change to LS  mode, the service brake command  shall be 

--- Document Chunk 23519 ---
triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 23520 ---
5.19.2.5 Note: Once in Limited Supervision mode, the speed supervision is such that the train 

--- Document Chunk 23521 ---
speed cannot exceed the LS mode speed limit. If, when entering the Limited Supervision 

--- Document Chunk 23522 ---
mode, the train speed was higher than the LS mode speed limit (because a higher speed 

--- Document Chunk 23523 ---
was allowed in Full Supervision mode, in Automatic Driving mode, in On Sight mode or 

--- Document Chunk 23524 ---
in Staff Responsible mode) then a service/emergency brake  command could be 

--- Document Chunk 23525 ---
immediately triggered, independently of the acknowledgement of the driver, but because 

--- Document Chunk 23526 ---
of the LS supervision (see Figure 22). 

--- Document Chunk 23527 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 23528 ---

--- Document Chunk 23549 ---

--- Document Chunk 23552 ---

--- Document Chunk 23553 ---
Speed & Distance Monitoring) 

--- Document Chunk 23554 ---

Figure 22: Train enters LS area with too high speed 

--- Document Chunk 23556 ---
5.19.2.6 Note: This sharp brake reaction can be avoided in Full Supervision, Automatic Driving or 

--- Document Chunk 23557 ---
On Sight mode by giving with the previous MA an EOA (or a LOA = LS mode speed limit) 

--- Document Chunk 23558 ---
at the location of transition to Limited Supervision mode. 

--- Document Chunk 23559 ---
5.19.2.7 If the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment is already in LS mode when receiving the LS 

--- Document Chunk 23560 ---
mode profile, no further acknowledgement shall be requested from the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 23561 ---
 Limited Supervision is requested for a further location 

--- Document Chunk 23562 ---
5.19.3.1 The beginning of the Limited Supervision area can be a location that the train has not 

--- Document Chunk 23563 ---
reached yet. This occurs when: 

--- Document Chunk 23564 ---
a) In a level 1 area, a balise group gives a Mode Profile with an Limited Supervision area 

--- Document Chunk 23565 ---
that is located at a further location. 

--- Document Chunk 23566 ---
b) In a level 2 area, the RBC gives a Mode Profile with an Limited Supervision area that 

--- Document Chunk 23567 ---
is located at a further location. 

--- Document Chunk 23568 ---
5.19.3.2 A request for acknowledgement shall be di splayed to the driver when the following 

--- Document Chunk 23569 ---
conditions are fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 23570 ---
a) The distance between the estimated front end of the train and the beginning of Limited 

--- Document Chunk 23571 ---
Supervision area is shorter than a value, contained in the mode profile.   

--- Document Chunk 23572 ---
b) The speed is equal to or lower than the Limited Supervision mode speed limit (national 

--- Document Chunk 23573 ---
value, or value given in the mode profile). 

--- Document Chunk 23574 ---
c) The current mode is not Limited Supervision 

--- Document Chunk 23575 ---
5.19.3.3 Note: The first 2 conditions define the “rectangle of acknowledgement”. 

--- Document Chunk 23576 ---
5.19.3.4 Once the acknowledgement request is displayed, it shall not be taken back if the train 

--- Document Chunk 23577 ---
leaves the “rectangle of acknowledgement” (for example: because the train accelerates). 

--- Document Chunk 23578 ---
5.19.3.5 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 23579 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 23611 ---
area according the mode profile and the driver has not yet acknowledged, the 

--- Document Chunk 23612 ---

--- Document Chunk 23613 ---
for acknowledgement shall be displayed to the driver (refer to SRS chapter 4, transitions 

--- Document Chunk 23614 ---
between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 23615 ---
5.19.3.8 If, in this case, the driver does not acknowledge within the driver acknowledgement time 

--- Document Chunk 23616 ---
(refer to Appendix A.3.1) after the change to LS mode, the service brake command shall 

--- Document Chunk 23617 ---
be triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 23618 ---
 Limited Supervision from Unfitted or SN mode 

--- Document Chunk 23619 ---
5.19.4.1 The mode profile with regards to an LS area is only evaluated in level 1,2, although the 

--- Document Chunk 23620 ---
mode profile may have been received in level 0 (Unfitted mode) or NTC (SN mode). A 

--- Document Chunk 23621 ---
transition to Limited Supervision mode can therefore earliest occur at a transition of level: 

--- Document Chunk 23622 ---
from level 0 or NTC to level 1 or 2. 

--- Document Chunk 23623 ---
5.19.4.2 Requirements about the acknowledgement in section 5.19.2 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 23624 ---

--- Document Chunk 23625 ---

--- Document Chunk 23626 ---

--- Document Chunk 23627 ---
Supervision area which the train position confidence interval already overlaps. If starting

--- Document Chunk 23643 ---
