--- Document Chunk 23644 ---
 Exit of Limited Supervision mode 

--- Document Chunk 23645 ---
5.19.6.1 General rule 

--- Document Chunk 23646 ---
5.19.6.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall exit the Limited Supervision mode when 

--- Document Chunk 23647 ---
the min safe front end of the train passes the end of the Limited supervision area. 

--- Document Chunk 23648 ---
5.19.6.2 First case: The Limited supervision area ends at the EOA/LOA of the current MA 

--- Document Chunk 23649 ---
5.19.6.2.1 This occurs when the end of the Limited Supervision area that is given by the Mode 

--- Document Chunk 23650 ---
Profile has the same location as the EOA/LOA of the related MA. 

--- Document Chunk 23651 ---
5.19.6.2.2 In this case, the train must receive a new Movement Authority to be able to exit the 

--- Document Chunk 23652 ---
Limited Supervision area. 

--- Document Chunk 23653 ---
5.19.6.3 Second case: The Limited Supervision  area ends before the EOA /LOA of the 

--- Document Chunk 23654 ---
current MA 

--- Document Chunk 23655 ---
5.19.6.3.1 In this case, the current Movement Authority already allows the train to exit the Lim ited 

--- Document Chunk 23656 ---
Supervision area. 

--- Document Chunk 23657 ---
5.19.6.3.2 When exiting the Limited Supervision area, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 23658 ---
switches either to Full Supervision, On Sight or to Shunting mode (refer to SRS chapter 

--- Document Chunk 23659 ---
4, transitions between modes). 

--- Document Chunk 23660 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 23730 ---
5.20 Generation of Track Conditions related information to an 

--- Document Chunk 23731 ---
ERTMS/ETCS external function 

--- Document Chunk 23732 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 23733 ---
5.20.1.1 This set of procedures specifies the information generated by the ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 23734 ---
board equipment to an ERTMS/ETCS external function in relation to the following track-

--- Document Chunk 23735 ---
conditions: 

--- Document Chunk 23736 ---
a) powerless section with pantograph to be lowered, 

--- Document Chunk 23737 ---
b) powerless section with main power switch to be switched off, 

--- Document Chunk 23738 ---
c) passing an “air tightness” area, 

--- Document Chunk 23739 ---
d) inhibition of a defined type of brake, 

--- Document Chunk 23740 ---
e) change of traction system, 

--- Document Chunk 23741 ---
f) change of allowed current consumption, 

--- Document Chunk 23742 ---
g) station platform. 

--- Document Chunk 23743 ---
5.20.1.2 In the following sections, the remaining distance from the concerned train end to the 

--- Document Chunk 23744 ---
concerned track condition location shall be counted positive when the train end is in rear 

--- Document Chunk 23745 ---
of the location and shall be counted negative when the train end is in advance of the 

--- Document Chunk 23746 ---
location. 

--- Document Chunk 23747 ---
 Passing a powerless section with pantograph to be lowered 

--- Document Chunk 23748 ---
5.20.2.1 This procedure is dealing with the generation of the information related to a powerless 

--- Document Chunk 23749 ---
section with the pantograph to be lowered. 

--- Document Chunk 23750 ---
5.20.2.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall start the generation of the information to 

--- Document Chunk 23751 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function when the max safe front end of the train reaches the 

--- Document Chunk 23752 ---
point C in rear of th e start location of the powerless section (see 5.18.2.2.1 for the 

--- Document Chunk 23753 ---
definition of point C). 

--- Document Chunk 23754 ---
5.20.2.3 When the min safe rear end of the train is in rear of the start location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 23755 ---
powerless section, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall provide the follo wing 

--- Document Chunk 23756 ---
information to the ERTMS/ETCS external function: 

--- Document Chunk 23757 ---
• the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train to the start location 

--- Document Chunk 23758 ---
(point D) of the powerless section 

--- Document Chunk 23759 ---
• the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train to the end locati on 

--- Document Chunk 23760 ---
(point E) of the powerless section 

--- Document Chunk 23761 ---
5.20.2.4 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the start location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 23762 ---
powerless section, the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train to 

--- Document Chunk 23763 ---
point D shall no longer be generated. The remaining distance from the min safe front end 

--- Document Chunk 23764 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 23765 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 23766 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 23767 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 23768 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 23769 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 23770 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 23771 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 23772 ---
Page 99/112 

--- Document Chunk 23773 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 23774 ---
of the train to the end location (point E) of the powerless section shall continue to be 

--- Document Chunk 23775 ---
generated. 

--- Document Chunk 23776 ---
5.20.2.5 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the end location (point E) of the 

--- Document Chunk 23777 ---
powerless section, the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train to point 

--- Document Chunk 23778 ---
E shall no longer be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 23779 ---
5.20.2.6 Note: The remaining distance from the train max safe front end to point D and the 

--- Document Chunk 23780 ---
remaining distance from the train min safe front end to point E are generated until the 

--- Document Chunk 23781 ---
min safe rear end passes respectively the point D and the point E to allow the 

--- Document Chunk 23782 ---
ERTMS/ETCS external function to manage each pantograph individually assuming that 

--- Document Chunk 23783 ---
this function knows the distance between each pantograph and the train front end. 

--- Document Chunk 23784 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 23785 ---
Figure 25: Generation of the information to an ERTMS/ETCS external function for a 

--- Document Chunk 23786 ---
supervision of powerless section with pantograph to be lowered 

--- Document Chunk 23787 ---
5.20.2.7 Note: When resuming the initial state or any other reason lead s to the shortening of a 

--- Document Chunk 23788 ---
powerless section with pantograph to be lowered, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board 

--- Document Chunk 23789 ---
equipment considers the new end location (point E) of the powerless section for the 

--- Document Chunk 23790 ---
calculation of the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train to the point 

--- Document Chunk 23791 ---
E. 

--- Document Chunk 23792 ---
5.20.2.8 If resuming the initial state or any other reason leads to the deletion of the powerless 

--- Document Chunk 23793 ---
section, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall stop providing information related 

--- Document Chunk 23794 ---
to this powerless section to the ERTMS/ETCS external function. 

--- Document Chunk 23795 ---
 Passing a powerless section with main power switch to be switched off 

--- Document Chunk 23796 ---

--- Document Chunk 23799 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function when the max safe front end of the train reaches the 

--- Document Chunk 23800 ---
LRBG/ORBG 

--- Document Chunk 23801 ---
running direction

--- Document Chunk 23840 ---
E shall no longer be generated.

--- Document Chunk 23844 ---
ERTMS/ETCS external function to manage the main power switch of each vehicle 

--- Document Chunk 23845 ---
individually assuming that this function knows the distance between each v ehicle and 

--- Document Chunk 23846 ---
the train front end.

 Passing an “air tightness” area 

--- Document Chunk 23883 ---
5.20.4.1 This procedure is dealing with the generation of the information related to an air tightness 

--- Document Chunk 23884 ---
area. 

--- Document Chunk 23885 ---
5.20.4.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall start the generation of the information to 

--- Document Chunk 23886 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function when the max safe front end of the train reaches the 

--- Document Chunk 23887 ---
point C in rear of the start location of the air tightness area (see 5.18.6.2.1 for the 

--- Document Chunk 23888 ---
definition of point C). 

--- Document Chunk 23889 ---
5.20.4.3 When the max safe front end of the train is in rear of the start location (point D) of the air 

--- Document Chunk 23890 ---
tightness area, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall provide the following 

--- Document Chunk 23891 ---
information to the ERTMS/ETCS external function: 

--- Document Chunk 23892 ---
• the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train t o the start location 

--- Document Chunk 23893 ---
(point D) of the air tightness area 

--- Document Chunk 23894 ---
• the remaining distance from the min safe rear end of the train to the end location 

--- Document Chunk 23895 ---
(point E) of the air tightness area 

--- Document Chunk 23896 ---
5.20.4.4 When the max safe front end of the train reaches the start location (point D) of  the air 

--- Document Chunk 23897 ---
tightness area, the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train to point D 

--- Document Chunk 23898 ---
shall no longer be generated. The remaining distance from the min safe rear end of the 

--- Document Chunk 23899 ---
train to the end location (point E) of the air tightness area shall continue to be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 23900 ---
5.20.4.5 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the end location (point E) of the air 

--- Document Chunk 23901 ---
tightness area, the remaining distance from the min safe rear end of the train to point E 

--- Document Chunk 23902 ---
shall no longer be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 23903 ---

--- Document Chunk 23925 ---

--- Document Chunk 23926 ---

--- Document Chunk 23927 ---
and magnetic shoe brake, the procedure is identical except that the generated 

--- Document Chunk 23928 ---
information refers to respectively eddy current brake or magnetic shoe brake. 

--- Document Chunk 23929 ---

--- Document Chunk 23930 ---

--- Document Chunk 23931 ---
point C in re ar of the start location of the regenerative brake inhibition area (see 

--- Document Chunk 23932 ---
5.18.7.3.2 for the definition of point C). 

--- Document Chunk 23933 ---

--- Document Chunk 24019 ---

--- Document Chunk 24020 ---

--- Document Chunk 24023 ---

--- Document Chunk 24024 ---

--- Document Chunk 24025 ---
each pantograph and the train front end.

5.20.7.3 This location (point  C) shall be determined by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 24058 ---
taking into account the time necessary for performing the required actions and the 

--- Document Chunk 24059 ---
current train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 24060 ---
5.20.7.4 When the min safe rear end of the train is in rear of the location of change of allowed 

--- Document Chunk 24061 ---
current consumption (point F), the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall provide the 

--- Document Chunk 24062 ---

--- Document Chunk 24063 ---

--- Document Chunk 24064 ---

--- Document Chunk 24065 ---
• the new allowed current consumption 

--- Document Chunk 24066 ---
5.20.7.5 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the location of change of allowed current 

--- Document Chunk 24067 ---
consumption (point F), the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train to 

--- Document Chunk 24068 ---
point F and the new allowed current consumption shall no longer be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 24069 ---
5.20.7.6 Note: The remaining distance from the train max safe front end to point F is generated 

--- Document Chunk 24070 ---
until the min safe rear end passes the point F to allow the ERTMS/ETCS external 

--- Document Chunk 24071 ---
function, in case the change of all owed current consumption involves several 

--- Document Chunk 24072 ---
pantographs, to manage each pantograph individually assuming that this function knows 

--- Document Chunk 24073 ---
the distance between each pantograph and the train front end.

5.20.8.2 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall start the generation of the information to 

--- Document Chunk 24103 ---
the ERTMS/ETCS external function when the max safe front end of the train reaches a 

--- Document Chunk 24104 ---
location (point C) in rear of the start location of the station platform (point D). 

--- Document Chunk 24105 ---
5.20.8.3 This location (point C) shall be determined by the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 24106 ---
taking into account the time necessary for performing t he required actions and the 

--- Document Chunk 24107 ---
current train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 24108 ---
5.20.8.4 When the min safe rear end of the train is in rear of the start location (point D) of the 

--- Document Chunk 24109 ---
station platform, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall provide the following 

--- Document Chunk 24110 ---
information to the ERTMS/ETCS external function: 

--- Document Chunk 24111 ---
• the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train to the start location 

--- Document Chunk 24112 ---
(point D) of the station platform 

--- Document Chunk 24113 ---
• the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train to the end location 

--- Document Chunk 24114 ---
(point E) of the station platform 

--- Document Chunk 24115 ---
• the nominal height of platform above rail level (refer to TSI infrastructure) 

--- Document Chunk 24116 ---
• the position of the station platform (left side, right side, both sides) in reference to the 

--- Document Chunk 24117 ---
train orientation 

--- Document Chunk 24118 ---
5.20.8.5 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the start location (point D) of the station 

--- Document Chunk 24119 ---
platform, the remaining distance from the max safe front end of the train to point D shall 

--- Document Chunk 24120 ---
no longer be generated. The remaining distance from the min safe front end of the train 

--- Document Chunk 24121 ---
to the end location (point E) of the station platform as well as its nominal height above 

--- Document Chunk 24122 ---
the rail level and its position shall continue to be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 24123 ---
5.20.8.6 When the min safe rear end of the train reaches the end location (point E) of the station 

--- Document Chunk 24124 ---
platform, the remaining distance from the min safe front end of the tr ain to point E, the 

--- Document Chunk 24125 ---
position of the station platform and its nominal height above the rail level shall no longer 

--- Document Chunk 24126 ---
be generated. 

--- Document Chunk 24127 ---
5.20.8.7 Note: The remaining distance from the train max safe front end to point D and the 

--- Document Chunk 24128 ---
remaining distance from the train min safe fron t end to point E are generated until the 

--- Document Chunk 24129 ---
min safe rear end passes respectively the point D and the point E to allow the 

--- Document Chunk 24130 ---
ERTMS/ETCS external function to manage each door individually assuming that this 

--- Document Chunk 24131 ---
function knows the distance between each door and the train front end. 

--- Document Chunk 24132 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 24181 ---
5.21 Procedure Supervised Manoeuvre 

--- Document Chunk 24182 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 24183 ---
5.21.1.1 The procedure describes the selection of Supervised Manoeuvre by the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 24184 ---
 Table of requirements for “Supervised Manoeuvre” procedure 

--- Document Chunk 24185 ---
5.21.2.1 The ID numbers in the table are used for the representation of the procedure in form of 

--- Document Chunk 24186 ---
a flowchart in section 5.21.3. 

--- Document Chunk 24187 ---
5.21.2.2 Procedure 

--- Document Chunk 24188 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 24189 ---
S0 The level is 2, the train position is valid and is referred to an LRBG, the safe consist 

--- Document Chunk 24190 ---
length is available, the train is at standstill, and the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 24191 ---
is in: 

--- Document Chunk 24192 ---
• FS, AD, OS, LS, SR, PT or SB mode, while no RBC transition order is stored 

--- Document Chunk 24193 ---
on-board, OR 

--- Document Chunk 24194 ---
• SM mode 

--- Document Chunk 24195 ---
When the driver selects Supervised Manoeuvre (E015) the process shall go to A045. 

--- Document Chunk 24196 ---
A045 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall send the “Supervised Manoeuvre 

--- Document Chunk 24197 ---
Request” message to the RBC together with a position report and the safe consist length 

--- Document Chunk 24198 ---
information for Supervised Manoeuvre  and, if the mode is different from SM, the 

--- Document Chunk 24199 ---
following default Train Data for Supervised Manoeuvre: 

--- Document Chunk 24200 ---
a) Train category(ies). 

--- Document Chunk 24201 ---
b) Maximum train speed. 

--- Document Chunk 24202 ---
c) Loading gauge. 

--- Document Chunk 24203 ---
d) Axle load category. 

--- Document Chunk 24204 ---
e) Traction system(s) accepted by the engine. 

--- Document Chunk 24205 ---
f) Train fitted with airtight system. 

--- Document Chunk 24206 ---
g) Axle number. 

--- Document Chunk 24207 ---
The content of the position report takes into account the safe consist length information 

--- Document Chunk 24208 ---
(in particular the train front end information is derived from the safe consist length values 

--- Document Chunk 24209 ---
in front of the engine). 

--- Document Chunk 24210 ---
If the mode is different from SB or SM, this first SM request will allow the RBC 

--- Document Chunk 24211 ---
determining the position of the engine and its active cab within the shunting consist. 

--- Document Chunk 24212 ---
The process shall go to S050. 

--- Document Chunk 24213 ---
S050 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment awaits the reply to the SM request. 

--- Document Chunk 24214 ---
If an SM authorisation is received from the RBC (E115), the process shall go to D080. 

--- Document Chunk 24215 ---
If “SM refused” is received from the RBC (E215), the process shall go to A220. 

--- Document Chunk 24216 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 24217 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24218 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 24219 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 24220 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 24221 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 24222 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 24223 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 24224 ---
Page 109/112 

--- Document Chunk 24225 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24226 ---
ID # Requirements 

--- Document Chunk 24227 ---
D080 If the mode is different from SM, the process shall go to A050. Otherwise, it shall go to 

--- Document Chunk 24228 ---
A075. 

--- Document Chunk 24229 ---
A050 The mode shall change to SM. 

--- Document Chunk 24230 ---
The process shall go to A075. 

--- Document Chunk 24231 ---
A075 If the direction of the movement authority is opposite to the current train orientation, the 

--- Document Chunk 24232 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board adjusts its train position information according to the new train 

--- Document Chunk 24233 ---
orientation (see 4.4.21.1.7) and deletes all previously stored location based information 

--- Document Chunk 24234 ---
(see 3.7.3.4 b)). 

--- Document Chunk 24235 ---
The process shall go to A095. 

--- Document Chunk 24236 ---
A095 The train position shall be reported to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 24237 ---
The process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 24238 ---
A220 An indication shall be given to the driver that SM was refused by the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 24239 ---
The process shall END. 

--- Document Chunk 24240 ---
 Flowchart 

--- Document Chunk 24241 ---
5.21.3.1 The ID numbers in the flowchart refer to the ID numbers of the table in section 5.21.2.

--- Document Chunk 24252 ---
S0:

--- Document Chunk 24253 ---
Train is at standstill &

--- Document Chunk 24254 ---
Safe consist length info availaible &

--- Document Chunk 24255 ---
Mode is FS, AD, OS, LS, SR, SB, PT or SM

--- Document Chunk 24256 ---
E015: 

--- Document Chunk 24257 ---
Driver selects Supervised Manoeuvre

--- Document Chunk 24258 ---
A045:

--- Document Chunk 24259 ---

--- Document Chunk 24260 ---

--- Document Chunk 24261 ---

--- Document Chunk 24262 ---

--- Document Chunk 24263 ---
SM refused

--- Document Chunk 24264 ---

--- Document Chunk 24265 ---

--- Document Chunk 24266 ---

--- Document Chunk 24267 ---

--- Document Chunk 24268 ---

--- Document Chunk 24269 ---

--- Document Chunk 24270 ---

--- Document Chunk 24271 ---
0

--- Document Chunk 24272 ---

--- Document Chunk 24273 ---
Mode

--- Document Chunk 24274 ---
FS, AD, OS, LS, SR, 

--- Document Chunk 24275 ---
SB, PT

--- Document Chunk 24276 ---
SM

--- Document Chunk 24277 ---
E115:

--- Document Chunk 24278 ---
SM Authorisation received

--- Document Chunk 24279 ---
A075:

--- Document Chunk 24280 ---
If relevant:

--- Document Chunk 24281 ---
Change train orientation, adjust 

--- Document Chunk 24282 ---
train position information and 

--- Document Chunk 24283 ---
delete all previously stored loc. 

--- Document Chunk 24284 ---
based info 

--- Document Chunk 24285 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24286 ---
Figure 32: Flowchart for “Supervised Manoeuvre” 

--- Document Chunk 24287 ---
 Degraded Situation 

--- Document Chunk 24288 ---
5.21.4.1 In case a communication session is established and no answer to a Supervised 

--- Document Chunk 24289 ---
Manoeuvre request is received from the RBC within a fixed waiting time (see appendix 

--- Document Chunk 24290 ---
to chapter 3, List of Fixed Value Data) after sending the “Request for Supervised 

--- Document Chunk 24291 ---
Manoeuvre” message, the message shall be repeated with the fixed waiting time after 

--- Document Chunk 24292 ---
each repetition. After a defined number of repetitions (see appendix to chapter 3, List of 

--- Document Chunk 24293 ---
Fixed Value Data), and if no reply is received within the fixed waiting time from the time 

--- Document Chunk 24294 ---
of the last sending of “Request for Supervised Manoeuvre”, the ERTMS/ETCS onboard 

--- Document Chunk 24295 ---
equipment shall inform the driver. 

--- Document Chunk 24296 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 24297 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24298 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 24299 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 24300 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 24301 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 24302 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 24303 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 24304 ---
Page 111/112 

--- Document Chunk 24305 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24306 ---
5.22 Procedure Inhibition of balise transmission alarm reaction 

--- Document Chunk 24307 ---
 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 24308 ---
5.22.1.1 As explained in 3.15.7, when the balise reading antenna is over a large metallic object 

--- Document Chunk 24309 ---
that exceeds the Subset-036 limits (something usually called “Big Metal Mass” and in the 

--- Document Chunk 24310 ---
following referred to as “BMM”) an alarm may be generated by the balise transmission 

--- Document Chunk 24311 ---
system, which in turn may trigger an on-board safe reaction. 

--- Document Chunk 24312 ---
5.22.1.2 Such “integrity check alarm of balise transmission” (in the following: “BTM alarm”) tha t 

--- Document Chunk 24313 ---
may be generated when the balise antenna is over a BMM is not distinguishable from 

--- Document Chunk 24314 ---
one that may be generated when the on-board balise reader system is in failure. 

--- Document Chunk 24315 ---
5.22.1.3 Since it is not possible for the on-board to know whether the alarm was generated by a 

--- Document Chunk 24316 ---
failure (and therefore the on-board may be unable to read balises) or by the presence of 

--- Document Chunk 24317 ---
a BMM under the balise antenna, it is possible that a safe reaction is taken by the on -

--- Document Chunk 24318 ---
board (for example switch to SF) when it is in fact still able to read balises. 

--- Document Chunk 24319 ---
5.22.1.4 The track condition “Big Metal Mass” provides a means for trackside to mark areas where 

--- Document Chunk 24320 ---
BMMs are known to exist, and so to avoid that the on -board may take a safe reaction 

--- Document Chunk 24321 ---
when there is no need to (the on-board is able to detect balises but the antenna is over 

--- Document Chunk 24322 ---
a BMM). 

--- Document Chunk 24323 ---
5.22.1.5 However, there may be instances where the train is over a known BMM but the related 

--- Document Chunk 24324 ---
track condition is not available on -board. For example, because the train is awakening 

--- Document Chunk 24325 ---
on a metal covered area or because the driver had to select override and move the train 

--- Document Chunk 24326 ---
over a metal covered area. This can result in deadlocks. 

--- Document Chunk 24327 ---
5.22.1.6 To avoid that, the procedure detailed in this section provides a means for the driver to 

--- Document Chunk 24328 ---
inhibit the potential safe reaction to a BTM alarm. This in turn enables a SoM or a generic 

--- Document Chunk 24329 ---
movement over a BMM in an ETCS equipped area ( level 1 or 2) when no BMM track 

--- Document Chunk 24330 ---
condition is stored on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 24331 ---
5.22.1.7 Note: The driver should use the “Inhibition” procedure only when authorised to do so. 

--- Document Chunk 24332 ---
This authorisation should be covered by operational procedures because to inhibit a safe 

--- Document Chunk 24333 ---
reaction may be detrimental to safety. 

--- Document Chunk 24334 ---
5.22.1.8 In addition, a provision is introduced to allow the procedure to be automatically triggered 

--- Document Chunk 24335 ---
without driver intervention. This provision applies in case the train is in an area covered 

--- Document Chunk 24336 ---
by a BMM track condition stored on board, and the track condition gets reset (for example 

--- Document Chunk 24337 ---
because of a transition to SR mode caused by Override activation). 

--- Document Chunk 24338 ---
 Manual triggering of the procedure 

--- Document Chunk 24339 ---
5.22.2.1 The ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment shall allow the driver to select “Inhibiti on of 

--- Document Chunk 24340 ---
reaction to BTM alarm” only at standstill when the level is 1 or 2 and the current mode is 

--- Document Chunk 24341 ---
Stand-By, Shunting, or Staff Responsible. 

--- Document Chunk 24342 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 24343 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24344 ---
SUBSET-026-5 

--- Document Chunk 24345 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 24346 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 24347 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 24348 ---
Chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 24349 ---
Procedures 

--- Document Chunk 24350 ---
Page 112/112 

--- Document Chunk 24351 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24352 ---
5.22.2.2 As soon as the driver makes the selection, the “Inhibition” procedure shall be triggered. 

--- Document Chunk 24353 ---
 Automatic triggering of the procedure 

--- Document Chunk 24354 ---
5.22.3.1 As soon as a stored BMM track condition is reset, the “ Inhibition” procedure shall be 

--- Document Chunk 24355 ---
automatically triggered provided that at the time of the reset the Eurobalise antenna is in 

--- Document Chunk 24356 ---
an area where that track condition is reset, takin g into account the max and min safe 

--- Document Chunk 24357 ---
antenna positions. 

--- Document Chunk 24358 ---
5.22.3.1.1 Exception: the automatic triggering of the “ Inhibition” procedure shall not apply in case 

--- Document Chunk 24359 ---
the reset is caused by a transition to NP or RV mode. 

--- Document Chunk 24360 ---
 Once the “Inhibition” procedure has been triggered 

--- Document Chunk 24361 ---
5.22.4.1 An indication shall be given to the driver, until the procedure is ended. 

--- Document Chunk 24362 ---
5.22.4.2 Any potential on-board reaction to a “BTM alarm” shall be inhibited. 

--- Document Chunk 24363 ---
 End of “Inhibition” procedure 

--- Document Chunk 24364 ---
5.22.5.1 The “Inhibition” procedure shall end when at least one of the following conditions is 

--- Document Chunk 24365 ---
fulfilled: 

--- Document Chunk 24366 ---
a) The train has run more than the fixed distance defined in A.3.1 after the procedure 

--- Document Chunk 24367 ---
was triggered, OR 

--- Document Chunk 24368 ---
b) The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment switches to a mode different than Standby, 

--- Document Chunk 24369 ---
Shunting or Staff Responsible, OR 

--- Document Chunk 24370 ---
c) The driver ends the procedure, by revoking the inhibition. 

--- Document Chunk 24371 ---
5.22.5.2 Regarding a) above, the distance is the one travelled away from the location when the 

--- Document Chunk 24372 ---
procedure was triggered and it shall be applicable in both directions. 

--- Document Chunk 24373 ---
5.22.5.2.1 Exception: if a BMM track condition which announces a BMM area within the remaining 

--- Document Chunk 24374 ---
distance of the manual or automatic inhibition is received, the distance for ending the 

--- Document Chunk 24375 ---
procedure shall be shortened to the start of the announced BMM area. 

--- Document Chunk 24376 ---
5.22.5.3 Note: the driver may revoke the inhibition following an operational procedure. For 

--- Document Chunk 24377 ---
example, in the case of awakening over a BMM the train has moved past the limit of the 

--- Document Chunk 24378 ---
metallic covered area and so there is no more need to have the inhibition active. 

--- Document Chunk 24379 ---
Revoking the inhibition in turn increases safety, because it allows the on-board to have 

--- Document Chunk 24380 ---
a safe reaction should there be a failure in the balise reader system that was until then 

--- Document Chunk 24381 ---
“masked” by the inhibition set manually or automatically. 

--- Document Chunk 24382 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 24383 ---

--- Document Chunk 24570 ---
6.3 Scope 

--- Document Chunk 24571 ---
6.3.1.1 The chapter defines: 

--- Document Chunk 24572 ---
a) the composition of envelope of legally operated system versions, i.e. all the 

--- Document Chunk 24573 ---
ERTMS/ETCS system versions that trackside shall be allowed to operate. 

--- Document Chunk 24574 ---
b) the allowed envelopes of system versions supported by the on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 24575 ---
6.3.1.2 By default, all the clauses listed in the other SRS chapters are applicable regardless of 

--- Document Chunk 24576 ---
the system version operated (see SUBSET-104 § 6.1.3.2); this chapter includes the 

--- Document Chunk 24577 ---
exceptions to those clauses and the additional clauses, which apply when the system 

--- Document Chunk 24578 ---
version of some trackside constituents and/or the system version operated relates to a 

--- Document Chunk 24579 ---
version number older than the last one introduced. 

--- Document Chunk 24580 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 24581 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24582 ---
SUBSET-026-6 

--- Document Chunk 24583 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 24584 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 24585 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 24586 ---
Chapter 6 : Management of older System Versions 

--- Document Chunk 24587 ---
Page 6/82 

--- Document Chunk 24588 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24589 ---
6.4 Envelopes of system versions 

--- Document Chunk 24590 ---
6.4.1 Trackside - envelope of legally operated system versions 

--- Document Chunk 24591 ---
6.4.1.1 Incompatible versions 

--- Document Chunk 24592 ---
6.4.1.1.1 The system version number X, which a trackside infrastructure is allowed to operate with, 

--- Document Chunk 24593 ---
shall be one of the following: 1, 2 or 3 

--- Document Chunk 24594 ---
6.4.1.2 Compatible versions 

--- Document Chunk 24595 ---
6.4.1.2.1 Within system version number X = 1, the system version number Y that a trackside 

--- Document Chunk 24596 ---
infrastructure is allowed to use shall be any of the following: 0 or 1 

--- Document Chunk 24597 ---
6.4.1.2.2 Within system version number X = 2, the system version number Y that a trackside 

--- Document Chunk 24598 ---
infrastructure is allowed to use shall be any of the following: 0, 1, 2 or 3 

--- Document Chunk 24599 ---
6.4.1.2.3 Within system version number X = 3, the system version number Y that a trackside 

--- Document Chunk 24600 ---
infrastructure is allowed to use shall be any of the following: 0 

--- Document Chunk 24601 ---
6.4.2 On-board – allowed envelopes of supported system versions 

--- Document Chunk 24602 ---
6.4.2.1 The highest system version number supported by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall be 

--- Document Chunk 24603 ---
one of the following: 2.1, 2.2 or 3.0. 

--- Document Chunk 24604 ---
6.4.2.2 In case the highest system version number supported by the ERTMS/ETCS on-board is 

--- Document Chunk 24605 ---
not 3.0, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board is said to support a reduced envelope of system 

--- Document Chunk 24606 ---
versions, which includes all the system versions from 1.0 up to its highest supported one. 

--- Document Chunk 24607 ---
Refer to SUBSET-153 for the applicable exceptions. 

--- Document Chunk 24608 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 24609 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24610 ---
SUBSET-026-6 

--- Document Chunk 24611 ---
4.0.0

05/07/2023

System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 24614 ---

--- Document Chunk 24615 ---
Page 7/82 

--- Document Chunk 24616 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24617 ---
6.5 Trackside requirements in relation to older system versions 

--- Document Chunk 24618 ---
6.5.1 Trackside areas operated with system version number X = 1 

--- Document Chunk 24619 ---
6.5.1.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 24620 ---
6.5.1.1.1 The section is applicable for trackside infrastructures that will be tendered and still 

--- Document Chunk 24621 ---
operated with the system version number X = 1, after the entry into force of this release 

--- Document Chunk 24622 ---
of the SRS. 

--- Document Chunk 24623 ---
6.5.1.1.2 Within a trackside infrastructure operated with the system version number X = 1, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 24624 ---
be allowed to use the following values of M_VERSION: 1.0 and 1.1. 

--- Document Chunk 24625 ---
6.5.1.1.3 Within a trackside area operated with an RBC certified to the system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 24626 ---
= 1, it shall also be allowed to use for balises the following values of M_VERSION: 2.0, 

--- Document Chunk 24627 ---
2.1, 2.2, 2.3 and 3.0. 

--- Document Chunk 24628 ---
6.5.1.1.3.1 Note: this configuration is meaningful in case the trains operating on this RBC area 

--- Document Chunk 24629 ---
support the system version number X = 2 or 3 and the on-board requirements related to 

--- Document Chunk 24630 ---
the trackside information marked with 2.0, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3 or 3.0 are applicable regardless 

--- Document Chunk 24631 ---
of the operated version (i.e. they are applied by the on-board equipment even if this latter 

--- Document Chunk 24632 ---
operates with the system version number X = 1 ordered by RBC). 

--- Document Chunk 24633 ---
6.5.1.2 Exceptions to chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 24634 ---
6.5.1.2.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 24635 ---
6.5.1.2.1.1 Clause 3.4.5.2.3 a) shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 24636 ---
6.5.1.2.1.2 Clause 3.5.2.6.1 b) shall be replaced with “The telephone number of the RBC.” 

--- Document Chunk 24637 ---
6.5.1.2.1.3 Clause 3.5.2.6.2 b) shall be replaced with “The telephone number of the accepting RBC.” 

--- Document Chunk 24638 ---
6.5.1.2.1.4 Clause 3.5.3.7 e) shall be replaced with: “When the trackside receives the session 

--- Document Chunk 24639 ---
established report or the information that no compatible system version is supported by 

--- Document Chunk 24640 ---
the on-board, it shall consider the communication session established.” 

--- Document Chunk 24641 ---
6.5.1.2.1.5 Clause 3.5.4.6 shall be replaced with: “When the trackside receives a session 

--- Document Chunk 24642 ---
established report inside an existing communication session it shall ignore this 

--- Document Chunk 24643 ---
message.” 

--- Document Chunk 24644 ---
6.5.1.2.1.6 Clause 3.5.6.1.1 shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 24645 ---
6.5.1.2.2 Clause 3.7.1.1 b) shall be replaced with: “When needed, limitations related to the 

--- Document Chunk 24646 ---
movement authority, i.e. Mode profile for On Sight or Shunting and signalling related 

--- Document Chunk 24647 ---
speed restriction (see sections 3.12.4 and 3.11.6). Mode profile and Signalling related 

--- Document Chunk 24648 ---
Speed restriction shall always be sent together with the MA to which the information 

--- Document Chunk 24649 ---
belongs” 

--- Document Chunk 24650 ---
6.5.1.2.3 In clause 3.7.1.1 c), the bullet “Optionally Speed restriction to ensure a given permitted 

--- Document Chunk 24651 ---
braking distance (see section 3.11. 11)” shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 24652 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 24653 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 24654 ---
SUBSET-026-6 

--- Document Chunk 24655 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 24656 ---

--- Document Chunk 25751 ---

--- Document Chunk 25752 ---

--- Document Chunk 25753 ---
entered left adjusted into the data field, the leftmost digit is the digit to be dialled first. In case the NID_MN 

--- Document Chunk 25754 ---
is shorter than 6 digits, the remaining space is to be filled with special character “F”. For further information 

--- Document Chunk 25755 ---
about NID_MN refer to Subset-054.

6.5.1.5.36 Note: the packets listed above, which are not allowed for use in balise telegrams/loop 

--- Document Chunk 25813 ---
messages marked with system version number X = 1 or in messages from RBC/RIU 

--- Document Chunk 25814 ---
operating with system version number X = 1, may contain variables that have been 

--- Document Chunk 25815 ---
introduced in the system version number X = 2 or 3. These variables are not mentioned 

--- Document Chunk 25816 ---
in this section, since their use is implicitly forbidden by the fact that the packets using 

--- Document Chunk 25817 ---
them are not allowed. 

--- Document Chunk 25818 ---

--- Document Chunk 25835 ---

--- Document Chunk 25836 ---

--- Document Chunk 25837 ---

--- Document Chunk 25838 ---

--- Document Chunk 25839 ---

--- Document Chunk 25840 ---
balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 25841 ---

--- Document Chunk 25842 ---

--- Document Chunk 25843 ---
duplicate of the balise before or after this one. 

--- Document Chunk 25844 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 25845 ---

--- Document Chunk 25846 ---
of a change of balise group message during passage of the 

--- Document Chunk 25847 ---
balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 25848 ---
8 NID_C 10 Country or region. 

--- Document Chunk 25849 ---

--- Document Chunk 25850 ---

--- Document Chunk 25851 ---

--- Document Chunk 25853 ---
(optional)

6.5.1.7 Additional requirements 

--- Document Chunk 26039 ---
6.5.1.7.1 Any balise telegram, which includes the packet 2, the packet 6, the packet 135, the 

--- Document Chunk 26040 ---
packet 145, the packet 200, the packet 203, the packet 206, the packet 207 or the packet 

--- Document Chunk 26041 ---
239, shall be marked with the system version number 1.1. 

--- Document Chunk 26042 ---
6.5.1.7.2 An RBC that uses the packet 203, the packet 206, the packet 207 or the packet 239 shall 

--- Document Chunk 26043 ---
transmit a system version number equal to 1.1, when negotiating the establishment of 

--- Document Chunk 26044 ---
the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 26045 ---
6.5.1.7.3 Any message transmitted by loop, which includes the packet 206, the packet 207 or the 

--- Document Chunk 26046 ---
packet 239, shall be marked with the system version number 1.1. 

--- Document Chunk 26047 ---
6.5.1.7.4 An RIU that uses the packet 206, the packet 207 or the packet 239 shall transmit a 

--- Document Chunk 26048 ---
system version number equal to 1.1, when negotiating the establishment of the 

--- Document Chunk 26049 ---
communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 26050 ---
6.5.1.7.5 A balise group or RBC message including the packet 203 shall also include the packet 

--- Document Chunk 26051 ---
3 (i.e. in a message, the packet 203 cannot be transmitted without the packet 3). 

--- Document Chunk 26052 ---
6.5.1.7.6 In the packet 70, the use of the value “00” of the variable Q_SUITABILITY shall be 

--- Document Chunk 26053 ---
forbidden. 

--- Document Chunk 26054 ---

Chapter 6 : Management of older System Versions 

--- Document Chunk 26063 ---
Page 38/82 

--- Document Chunk 26064 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 26065 ---
6.5.2.1.1 This section is applicable for trackside infrastructures that will be tendered and still 

--- Document Chunk 26066 ---
operated with the system version number X = 2, after the entry into force of this release 

--- Document Chunk 26067 ---
of the SRS. 

--- Document Chunk 26068 ---
6.5.2.1.1.1 Intentionally deleted. 

--- Document Chunk 26069 ---
6.5.2.1.2 Within a trackside infrastructure operated with the system version number X = 2, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 26070 ---
be allowed to use the following values of M_VERSION: 1.0, 1.1, 2.0, 2.1, 2.2 and 2.3. 

--- Document Chunk 26071 ---
6.5.2.1.3 Within a trackside area operated with an RBC certified to the system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 26072 ---
= 2, it shall also be allowed to use for balises the following value of M_VERSION: 3.0. 

--- Document Chunk 26073 ---
6.5.2.1.3.1 Note: this configuration is meaningful in case the trains operating on this RBC area 

--- Document Chunk 26074 ---
support the system version number X = 3 and the on-board requirements related to the 

--- Document Chunk 26075 ---
trackside information marked with 3.0 are applicable regardless of the operated version 

--- Document Chunk 26076 ---
(i.e. they are applied by the on-board equipment even if this latter operates with the 

--- Document Chunk 26077 ---
system version number X = 2 ordered by RBC). 

--- Document Chunk 26078 ---
6.5.2.2 Exceptions to chapters 3, 4, 5 

--- Document Chunk 26079 ---
6.5.2.2.1 For RBCs certified to the system version number 2.0 and for RBCs certified to the system 

--- Document Chunk 26080 ---
version number 2.1, 2.2 or 2.3 handing over a train fitted with an on-board equipment 

--- Document Chunk 26081 ---
whose highest supported system version number X.Y is only 2.0, the bullet “The system 

--- Document Chunk 26082 ---
versions supported by the on-board equipment” in clause 3.15.1.2.1 b) shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 26083 ---
6.5.2.2.2 For RBCs certified to the system version number 2.0, 2.1 or 2.2, for RIUs certified to a 

--- Document Chunk 26084 ---
system version number lower than 2.3 and for RBCs/RIUs certified to the system version 

--- Document Chunk 26085 ---
number 2.3 in communication with an on-board equipment whose highest supported 

--- Document Chunk 26086 ---
system version number X.Y is only 2.0, 2.1 or 2.2, the clauses 6.5.1.2.1.4 and 6.5.1.2.1.5 

--- Document Chunk 26087 ---
shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 26088 ---
6.5.2.2.3 For RBCs certified to the system version number 2.0, 2.1, 2.2, and for RBCs certified to 

--- Document Chunk 26089 ---
the system version number 2.3 in communication with an on-board equipment whose 

--- Document Chunk 26090 ---
highest supported system version number X.Y is only 2.0, 2.1 or 2.2, the clauses 

--- Document Chunk 26091 ---
6.5.1.4.1 and 6.5.1.4.2 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 26092 ---
6.5.2.2.4 For balise telegrams marked with the system version number 2.0, 2.1, 2.2 and for RBCs 

--- Document Chunk 26093 ---
certified to the system version number 2.0, 2.1 or 2.2, the clauses 6.5.1.2.1.2&3 shall 

--- Document Chunk 26094 ---
apply. 

--- Document Chunk 26095 ---
6.5.2.2.5 For balise telegrams marked with the system version number 2.0, 2.1, 2.2 and for 

--- Document Chunk 26096 ---
RBCs/RIUs certified to the system version number 2.0, 2.1 or 2.2, the clause 6.5.1.2.1.6 

--- Document Chunk 26097 ---
shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 26098 ---

6.5.2.4.1 Any balise telegram, which includes the packet 31, 32 or 245, shall be marked with the 

--- Document Chunk 26761 ---
system version number 2.3. 

--- Document Chunk 26762 ---
6.5.2.4.2 An RBC that uses the packet 31 or 32 shall transmit a system version number equal to 

--- Document Chunk 26763 ---
2.3, when negotiating the establishment of the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 26764 ---
6.5.2.4.3 An RBC/RIU that uses the packet 245 shall transmit a system version number equal to 

--- Document Chunk 26765 ---
2.3, when negotiating the establishment of the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 26766 ---
6.5.2.4.4 Any balise group, RBC or RIU message including the packet 245 with its variable 

--- Document Chunk 26767 ---
Q_NETWORKTYPE = 1 or 2 shall also include the packet 45. 

--- Document Chunk 26768 ---
6.5.2.4.5 Any balise group, RBC or RIU message including the packet 245 with its variable 

--- Document Chunk 26769 ---
Q_NETWORKTYPE = 0 shall not include the packet 45. 

--- Document Chunk 26770 ---
6.5.3 Trackside areas operated with system version number X = 3 

--- Document Chunk 26771 ---
6.5.3.1 General 

--- Document Chunk 26772 ---
6.5.3.1.1 This section is applicable for trackside infrastructures that were operated with the system 

--- Document Chunk 26773 ---
version number X = 1 or 2, before the migration to the system version number X = 3. 

--- Document Chunk 26774 ---
6.5.3.1.2 Within a trackside infrastructure operated with the system version number X = 3, it shall 

--- Document Chunk 26775 ---
be allowed to use the following values of M_VERSION: 1.0, 1.1, 2.0, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3 and 

--- Document Chunk 26776 ---
3.0. 

--- Document Chunk 26777 ---
6.5.3.2 Exceptions to chapters 3, 4, 5 

--- Document Chunk 26778 ---

--- Document Chunk 26779 ---
and 6.5.1.2.1.5 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 26780 ---

--- Document Chunk 26801 ---

--- Document Chunk 26802 ---

--- Document Chunk 26803 ---

--- Document Chunk 26804 ---
= 1 or 2 

--- Document Chunk 26805 ---

--- Document Chunk 26806 ---
= 3, but still transmitting some balise/loop/RIU information related to system version 

--- Document Chunk 26807 ---
number X = 1 or 2 (see section 6.5.3) 

--- Document Chunk 26808 ---

--- Document Chunk 26809 ---
= 3, but on-board equipment has established a communication session with a 

--- Document Chunk 26810 ---
neighbouring RBC certified to system version number X = 1 or 2

6.6.2.3 Exceptions to chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 26872 ---
6.6.2.3.1 Requirement S10 in table 5.4.3.2 shall be replaced with: 

--- Document Chunk 26873 ---
S10 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall offer the possibility to the driver to select 

--- Document Chunk 26874 ---
SH, NL, or to select Train Data Entry. 

--- Document Chunk 26875 ---
 If the driver selects SH (E12), the process shall continue in the same way as the 

--- Document Chunk 26876 ---
procedure “Shunting initiated by the driver”.  

--- Document Chunk 26877 ---
If, in level 2, the RBC rejects the request for Shunting (E13), the process shall go 

--- Document Chunk 26878 ---
back to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 26879 ---
 If the driver selects NL (E10) then the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 26880 ---
immediately switch to Non Leading mode (refer to SRS chapter 4, transition between 

--- Document Chunk 26881 ---
modes: transition [46]). The mission starts in NL mode (if level is 2, the 

--- Document Chunk 26882 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment also reports the change of mode to the RBC). 

--- Document Chunk 26883 ---
 If the driver selects Train Data Entry (E11), the process shall go to S12. 

--- Document Chunk 26884 ---
 Following E10, E12, if the position is still invalid, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board shall 

--- Document Chunk 26885 ---
delete the train position data (new status: “unknown”). 

--- Document Chunk 26886 ---
6.6.2.3.2 Clause 5.4.5.3 k) shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 26887 ---

--- Document Chunk 26888 ---
Step 2 - The end of mission shall be reported to the RBC by means of the message 

--- Document Chunk 26889 ---
“End of Mission”. 

--- Document Chunk 26890 ---
Step 3 -  The RBC shall request to terminate the communication session. 

--- Document Chunk 26891 ---

--- Document Chunk 26910 ---

--- Document Chunk 26911 ---
the driver to select "start" (only if train data has been previously 

--- Document Chunk 26912 ---
entered), or to select SH 

--- Document Chunk 26913 ---

--- Document Chunk 26914 ---
process shall go to S160 

--- Document Chunk 26915 ---

--- Document Chunk 26916 ---
process shall go to S150 

--- Document Chunk 26917 ---
c) If the driver selects SH (E145), the process shall continue in 

--- Document Chunk 26918 ---
the same ways as the procedure “Shunting initiated by the 

--- Document Chunk 26919 ---
driver”. If the SH request is refused by the RBC (E165) the 

--- Document Chunk 26920 ---

--- Document Chunk 26922 ---
6.6.2.4 Exceptions to chapters 7, 8 

--- Document Chunk 26923 ---
6.6.2.4.1 Void 

--- Document Chunk 26924 ---
6.6.3 Handling of air gap data related to system version number X = 1 

--- Document Chunk 26925 ---
6.6.3.1 General 

--- Document Chunk 26926 ---
6.6.3.1.1 For information received from trackside, the message consistency check shall be 

--- Document Chunk 26927 ---
achieved taking into account the exceptions to chapters 7 and 8, as described in sections 

--- Document Chunk 26928 ---
6.5.1.5,  6.5.1.6 and 6.5.1.7. 

--- Document Chunk 26929 ---
6.6.3.1.1.1 Exception: The on-board equipment shall not consider the reception of a packet 76 as a 

--- Document Chunk 26930 ---
message data consistency error (i.e. use of spare value for NID_PACKET) and shall 

--- Document Chunk 26931 ---
ignore its content. 

--- Document Chunk 26932 ---
6.6.3.1.2 For information received from trackside, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 26933 ---
use the translation tables defined here below, in order to use the information as if it had 

--- Document Chunk 26934 ---
been elaborated in compliance with the current chapters 7 and 8. 

--- Document Chunk 26935 ---
6.6.3.2 Packets received from balise, loop, RIU, RBC 

--- Document Chunk 26936 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 26937 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 26938 ---
SUBSET-026-6 

--- Document Chunk 26939 ---

--- Document Chunk 26940 ---

--- Document Chunk 26942 ---
Chapter 6 : Management of older System Versions 

--- Document Chunk 26943 ---
Page 56/82 

--- Document Chunk 26944 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 26945 ---
6.6.3.2.1 In the table below, the translation of information may depend on the on-board operated 

--- Document Chunk 26946 ---
system version at the time the information is received and accepted on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 26947 ---
6.6.3.2.2 When a level transition or an RBC/RBC handover is announced, the information stored 

--- Document Chunk 26948 ---
on-board in the transition buffer shall be translated according to system version operated 

--- Document Chunk 26949 ---
on-board at the time the information is released from the transition buffer (i.e. the system 

--- Document Chunk 26950 ---
version operated by the trackside infrastructure, towards which the train is running). 

--- Document Chunk 26951 ---
6.6.3.2.3 Depending on the packet, the action can be: 

--- Document Chunk 26952 ---
a) data is unchanged, 

--- Document Chunk 26953 ---
b) data is rejected, 

--- Document Chunk 26954 ---
c) data is translated, 

--- Document Chunk 26955 ---
d) not relevant 

--- Document Chunk 26956 ---
R = Rejected T = Translated U = Unchanged NR = Not relevant 

--- Document Chunk 26957 ---

already stored on-board and applicable, shall not be affected by the content of the packet 3 (i.e. if these 

--- Document Chunk 27061 ---
National Values were already applicable and 2nd bullet of clause 3.18.2.5 is not applied, they shall remain 

--- Document Chunk 27062 ---
applicable with their country identifier(s) previously stored).

6.6.3.3 Messages received from RBC/RIU 

--- Document Chunk 27268 ---
6.6.3.3.1 This section applies for the parts of radio messages, excluding the packets themselves, 

--- Document Chunk 27269 ---
which are received from an RBC/RIU certified to the system version number X = 1. 

--- Document Chunk 27270 ---
6.6.3.3.2 Depending on the received message, the action can be: 

--- Document Chunk 27271 ---
a) data is unchanged, 

--- Document Chunk 27272 ---
b) data is rejected 

--- Document Chunk 27273 ---
c) data is translated, 

--- Document Chunk 27274 ---
d) not relevant 

--- Document Chunk 27275 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27276 ---
R = Rejected T = Translated U = Unchanged NR = Not relevant 

--- Document Chunk 27277 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27278 ---

6.6.3.4 Messages transmitted to RBC/RIU 

--- Document Chunk 27316 ---
6.6.3.4.1 This section applies for radio messages/packets, which are transmitted to an RBC or an 

--- Document Chunk 27317 ---
RIU certified to the system version number X = 1. 

--- Document Chunk 27318 ---
6.6.3.4.1.1 Clause 3.5.3.7 d) 1st bullet shall be replaced with: “If one of its supported system versions 

--- Document Chunk 27319 ---
is compatible with the one sent by trackside, it shall send a session established report, 

--- Document Chunk 27320 ---
including its telephone numbers, to the trackside.” 

--- Document Chunk 27321 ---
6.6.3.4.1.2 Clauses 3.5.3.7.4 and 3.5.3.7.4.1 shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27322 ---

6.6.3.4.1.3 Added clause 3.5.3.7.6 shall apply: “Regarding d) 1st bullet: If the ERTMS/ETCS on-

--- Document Chunk 27332 ---
board equipment is in Supervised Manoeuvre mode, it shall terminate the communication 

--- Document Chunk 27333 ---
session immediately after the sending of the session established report.” 

--- Document Chunk 27334 ---
6.6.3.4.1.4 Clause 3.8.2.1.7 shall be replaced with: "Together with the MA request the on-board 

--- Document Chunk 27335 ---
shall inform the RBC if the reason "Track description deletion" is applicable." 

--- Document Chunk 27336 ---
6.6.3.4.1.5 Clause 3.12.3.5.2 shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27337 ---
6.6.3.4.1.6 Clause 3.18.3.10 shall not apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27338 ---
6.6.3.4.2 Clause 3.18.4.5.4 shall be replaced with: “Only if valid Train Data is available: following 

--- Document Chunk 27339 ---
any entry/modification of the train running number when a communication session is 

--- Document Chunk 27340 ---
already established or following the successful establishment of a communication 

--- Document Chunk 27341 ---
session when valid train running number is already available, the ERTMS/ETCS on-

--- Document Chunk 27342 ---
board equipment shall send the Train Data to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 27343 ---
6.6.3.4.3 Clause 3.18.4.5.4.1 shall be replaced with: “Exception: if the train running number has 

--- Document Chunk 27344 ---
been received from the RBC, the Train Data shall not be sent back to the RBC by the 

--- Document Chunk 27345 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment. 

--- Document Chunk 27346 ---
6.6.3.4.3.1 Requirements A33 and A34 in table 5.4.3.2 shall be replaced with: 

--- Document Chunk 27347 ---
A33 The “SoM position report” message, marked as referring to a “valid train position referred 

--- Document Chunk 27348 ---
to an LRBG”, shall be transmitted to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 27349 ---
If already stored on-board, valid Train Data shall be transmitted to the RBC immediately 

--- Document Chunk 27350 ---
after the “SoM position report” message. 

--- Document Chunk 27351 ---
This condition leads to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 27352 ---
A34 If the train position data stored in the on-board equipment is of status “invalid” and refers 

--- Document Chunk 27353 ---
to an LRBG, the “SoM position report” message, marked as referring to an “invalid train 

--- Document Chunk 27354 ---
position referred to an LRBG”, shall be transmitted to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 27355 ---
Otherwise the "SoM position report" message, marked as referring to "no train position 

--- Document Chunk 27356 ---
referred to an LRBG” and with the LRBG identity set to "unknown", shall be transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 27357 ---
to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 27358 ---
In both cases valid Train Data, if already stored on-board, shall be transmitted to the 

--- Document Chunk 27359 ---
RBC immediately after the “SoM position report” message. 

--- Document Chunk 27360 ---
The process shall then go to D33 

--- Document Chunk 27361 ---
6.6.3.4.4 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall elaborate the information to be transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 27362 ---
to the RBC/RIU certified to system version number X = 1, by applying the following 

--- Document Chunk 27363 ---
translation table to the corresponding information intended for an RBC/RIU certified to 

--- Document Chunk 27364 ---
the system version number X.Y = 3.0. 

--- Document Chunk 27365 ---
6.6.3.4.5 Depending on the transmitted message/packet, the action can be: 

--- Document Chunk 27366 ---
a) data is unchanged, 

--- Document Chunk 27367 ---
b) data is deleted (i.e. it is not sent to the receiver) 

--- Document Chunk 27368 ---
c) data is translated, 

--- Document Chunk 27369 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

d) not relevant (i.e. no corresponding requirement to trigger the sending is applicable)

--- Document Chunk 27446 ---

6.6.4 Specific requirements for on-board operating with system version number 

--- Document Chunk 27626 ---
X = 2 

--- Document Chunk 27627 ---
6.6.4.1 Exceptions to chapter 3 

--- Document Chunk 27628 ---
6.6.4.1.1 If the system version number of the supervising RBC is 2.0, 2.1 or 2.2, clause 6.6.2.1.2 

--- Document Chunk 27629 ---
shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27630 ---
6.6.4.1.2 Clause 6.6.2.1.3 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27631 ---
6.6.4.1.3 Clause 6.6.2.1.4 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27632 ---
6.6.4.2 Exceptions to chapter 4 

--- Document Chunk 27633 ---
6.6.4.2.1 If the system version number of the supervising RBC is 2.0, 2.1 or 2.2, clause 6.6.2.2.3 

--- Document Chunk 27634 ---
shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27635 ---
6.6.4.2.2 For text messages received in balise telegrams marked with a system version number 

--- Document Chunk 27636 ---
lower than 2.2 or received from RBCs certified to the system version number 2.0 or 2.1, 

--- Document Chunk 27637 ---
the clauses 6.6.2.2.4, 6.6.2.2.5 and 6.6.2.2.6 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27638 ---
6.6.4.3 Exceptions to chapter 5 

--- Document Chunk 27639 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

6.6.4.3.1 If the system version number of the supervising RBC is 2.0, 2.1 or 2.2, clauses 6.6.2.3.1, 

--- Document Chunk 27649 ---
2, 6 &7 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27650 ---
6.6.4.3.2 If the on-board is in communication with an RBC whose system version number is 2.0, 

--- Document Chunk 27651 ---
2.1 or 2.2, clauses 6.6.2.3.3, 6.6.2.3.4 & 6.6.2.3.5 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27652 ---
6.6.4.4 Exceptions to chapters 7, 8 

--- Document Chunk 27653 ---
6.6.4.4.1 Void 

--- Document Chunk 27654 ---
6.6.5 Handling of air gap data related to system version number X = 2 

--- Document Chunk 27655 ---
6.6.5.1 General 

--- Document Chunk 27656 ---
6.6.5.1.1 For information received from trackside, the message consistency check shall be 

--- Document Chunk 27657 ---
achieved taking into account the exceptions to chapters 7 and 8, as described in section 

--- Document Chunk 27658 ---
6.5.2.3. 

--- Document Chunk 27659 ---
6.6.5.1.2 For information received from trackside, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall 

--- Document Chunk 27660 ---
apply the requirements here below, in order to use the information as if it had been 

--- Document Chunk 27661 ---
elaborated in compliance with the current chapters 7 and 8. 

--- Document Chunk 27662 ---
6.6.5.2 Packets received from balise, loop, RIU, RBC 

--- Document Chunk 27663 ---
6.6.5.2.1 Upon receipt of a packet 41 or 46, the translation [21] referred to in 6.6.3.2.3 shall apply 

--- Document Chunk 27664 ---
by analogy. 

--- Document Chunk 27665 ---
6.6.5.2.2 Upon receipt of a packet 70, the translation [18] referred to in 6.6.3.2.3 shall apply by 

--- Document Chunk 27666 ---
analogy. 

--- Document Chunk 27667 ---
6.6.5.2.3 Upon receipt of a packet 72, the variable NID_PACKET shall be set to 73 and the 

--- Document Chunk 27668 ---
translation [22] referred to in 6.6.3.2.3 shall apply by analogy. 

--- Document Chunk 27669 ---
6.6.5.2.4 Upon receipt of a packet 76, the variable NID_PACKET shall be set to 74 and the 

--- Document Chunk 27670 ---
translation [22] referred to in 6.6.3.2.3 shall apply by analogy. 

--- Document Chunk 27671 ---
6.6.5.2.5 Upon receipt of a packet 245 with its variable Q_NETWORKTYPE = 0, the variable 

--- Document Chunk 27672 ---
NID_PACKET shall be set to 45. 

--- Document Chunk 27673 ---
6.6.5.2.6 Upon receipt of a packet 245 with its variable Q_NETWORKTYPE = 1 or 2, this latter 

--- Document Chunk 27674 ---
shall be incorporated in the packet 45 received in the same message (i.e. packet 45 as 

--- Document Chunk 27675 ---
specified in 6.5.2.3.13.1), in order to form a single packet 45 as specified in 7.4.2.11.1. 

--- Document Chunk 27676 ---
6.6.5.2.7 Upon receipt of a packet 45 without packet 245 in the same message, the on-board shall 

--- Document Chunk 27677 ---
form the packet 45 as specified in 7.4.2.11.1 with its variable Q_NETWORKTYPE set to 

--- Document Chunk 27678 ---
2. 

--- Document Chunk 27679 ---
6.6.5.3 Messages transmitted to RBC/RIU X.Y = 2.0 

--- Document Chunk 27680 ---
6.6.5.3.1 This section applies for radio messages/packets, which are transmitted to an RBC or an 

--- Document Chunk 27681 ---
RIU certified to the system version number X.Y = 2.0. 

--- Document Chunk 27682 ---

6.6.5.3.2 The clause 6.6.3.4.1.1 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27692 ---
6.6.5.3.3 Clause 6.6.3.4.1.2 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27693 ---
6.6.5.3.4 Clause 6.6.3.4.1.3&6 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27694 ---
6.6.5.3.5 Clause 6.6.3.4.3.1 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27695 ---
6.6.5.3.6 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall elaborate the information to be transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 27696 ---
to the RBC/RIU certified to system version number X = 2.0, by applying the following 

--- Document Chunk 27697 ---
translation table to the corresponding information intended for an RBC/RIU certified to 

--- Document Chunk 27698 ---
the system version number X.Y = 3.0. 

--- Document Chunk 27699 ---
6.6.5.3.7 Depending on the transmitted message/packet, the action can be: 

--- Document Chunk 27700 ---
a) data is unchanged, 

--- Document Chunk 27701 ---
b) data is deleted (i.e. it is not sent to the receiver) 

--- Document Chunk 27702 ---
c) data is translated, 

--- Document Chunk 27703 ---
d) not relevant (i.e. no corresponding requirement to trigger the sending is applicable)

--- Document Chunk 27779 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27780 ---
Description This packet is an extension of the “standard position report“ packet 0. It is used in 

--- Document Chunk 27781 ---
case of single balise groups if the orientation of the LRBG is unknown but the on-

--- Document Chunk 27782 ---
board equipment is able to report a second balise group (the one detected before) 

--- Document Chunk 27783 ---
to give a direction reference for the directional information in the position report. 

--- Document Chunk 27784 ---
Transmitted to RBC, RIU 

--- Document Chunk 27785 ---
Content Variable Length Comment 

--- Document Chunk 27786 ---

6.6.5.4 Messages transmitted to RBC/RIU X.Y = 2.1 

--- Document Chunk 27844 ---
6.6.5.4.1 This section applies for radio messages/packets, which are transmitted to an RBC or an 

--- Document Chunk 27845 ---
RIU certified to the system version number X.Y = 2.1. 

--- Document Chunk 27846 ---
6.6.5.4.2 Clause 6.6.3.4.1.2 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27847 ---
6.6.5.4.3 Clause 6.6.3.4.1.3&6 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27848 ---
6.6.5.4.4 Clause 6.6.3.4.3.1 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27849 ---
6.6.5.4.5 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall elaborate the information to be transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 27850 ---
to the RBC/RIU certified to system version number X = 2.1, by applying the following 

--- Document Chunk 27851 ---
translation table to the corresponding information intended for an RBC/RIU certified to 

--- Document Chunk 27852 ---
the system version number X.Y =3.0. 

--- Document Chunk 27853 ---
6.6.5.4.6 Depending on the transmitted message/packet, the action can be: 

--- Document Chunk 27854 ---
a) data is unchanged, 

--- Document Chunk 27855 ---
b) data is deleted (i.e. it is not sent to the receiver) 

--- Document Chunk 27856 ---
c) data is translated, 

--- Document Chunk 27857 ---
d) not relevant (i.e. no corresponding requirement to trigger the sending is applicable) 

--- Document Chunk 27858 ---

6.6.5.5 Messages transmitted to RBC/RIU X.Y = 2.2 

--- Document Chunk 27905 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 27906 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27907 ---
SUBSET-026-6 

--- Document Chunk 27908 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 27909 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 27910 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 27911 ---
Chapter 6 : Management of older System Versions 

--- Document Chunk 27912 ---
Page 77/82 

--- Document Chunk 27913 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27914 ---
6.6.5.5.1 This section applies for radio messages/packets, which are transmitted to an RBC or an 

--- Document Chunk 27915 ---
RIU certified to the system version number X.Y = 2.2. 

--- Document Chunk 27916 ---
6.6.5.5.2 Clause 6.6.3.4.1.2 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27917 ---
6.6.5.5.3 Clause 6.6.3.4.1.3&6 shall apply. 

--- Document Chunk 27918 ---
6.6.5.5.4 Requirements A33&A34 in table 5.4.3.2 shall be replaced with: 

--- Document Chunk 27919 ---
A33 The “SoM position report” message, marked as referring to a “valid train position referred 

--- Document Chunk 27920 ---
to an LRBG”, shall be transmitted to the RBC, together with valid Train Data and/or valid 

--- Document Chunk 27921 ---
Train running number, if already stored on-board. 

--- Document Chunk 27922 ---
This condition leads to S10. 

--- Document Chunk 27923 ---
A34 If the train position data stored in the on-board equipment is of status “invalid” and refers 

--- Document Chunk 27924 ---
to an LRBG, the “SoM position report” message, marked as referring to an “invalid train 

--- Document Chunk 27925 ---
position referred to an LRBG”, shall be transmitted to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 27926 ---
Otherwise the "SoM position report" message, marked as referring to "no train position 

--- Document Chunk 27927 ---
referred to an LRBG” and with the LRBG identity set to "unknown", shall be transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 27928 ---
to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 27929 ---
In both cases valid Train Data and/or valid Train running number, if already stored on-

--- Document Chunk 27930 ---
board, shall be included in the “SoM position report” message. 

--- Document Chunk 27931 ---
The process shall then go to D33 

--- Document Chunk 27932 ---
6.6.5.5.5 The ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall elaborate the information to be transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 27933 ---
to the RBC/RIU certified to system version number X = 2.2, by applying the following 

--- Document Chunk 27934 ---
translation table to the corresponding information intended for an RBC/RIU certified to 

--- Document Chunk 27935 ---
the system version number X.Y = 3.0. 

--- Document Chunk 27936 ---
6.6.5.5.6 Depending on the transmitted message/packet, the action can be: 

--- Document Chunk 27937 ---
a) data is unchanged, 

--- Document Chunk 27938 ---
b) data is deleted (i.e. it is not sent to the receiver) 

--- Document Chunk 27939 ---
c) data is translated, 

--- Document Chunk 27940 ---
d) not relevant (i.e. no corresponding requirement to trigger the sending is applicable) 

--- Document Chunk 27941 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 27942 ---
D = Deleted T = Translated U = Unchanged NR = Not relevant

--- Document Chunk 28061 ---

--- Document Chunk 28141 ---
  NID_NTC 8  

--- Document Chunk 28142 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 28143 ---
Description This packet is an extension of the “standard position report “ packet 0. It is used 

--- Document Chunk 28144 ---
in case of single balise groups if the orientation of the LRBG is unknown but the 

--- Document Chunk 28145 ---
on-board equipment is able to report a second balise group (the one detected 

--- Document Chunk 28146 ---
before) to give a direction reference for the directional information in the position 

--- Document Chunk 28147 ---
report. 

--- Document Chunk 28148 ---
Transmitted to RBC, RIU 

--- Document Chunk 28149 ---

--- Document Chunk 28150 ---

--- Document Chunk 28512 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 28513 ---
7.3 Components of ERTMS/ETCS Language 

--- Document Chunk 28514 ---
7.3.1 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 28515 ---
7.3.1.1 The ERTMS/ETCS language is used in transmitting information over the radio, balise 

--- Document Chunk 28516 ---
and loop airgaps. 

--- Document Chunk 28517 ---
7.3.1.2 The ERTMS/ETCS language is based on variables, packets, messages and telegrams 

--- Document Chunk 28518 ---
(variables and packets are described in this section, while telegrams and messages are 

--- Document Chunk 28519 ---
described in chapter 8). 

--- Document Chunk 28520 ---
7.3.1.3 Note: A number of variables contain values which have to be assigned. Some of these 

--- Document Chunk 28521 ---
values have to be unique to ensure that the system functions properly. A centralised 

--- Document Chunk 28522 ---
handling of this assignment is therefore required (nationally or internationally, depending 

--- Document Chunk 28523 ---
on the variable). The variables concerned have been marked. The values included in this 

--- Document Chunk 28524 ---
document for these variables are therefore not to be used without prior verification of 

--- Document Chunk 28525 ---
their validity. See SUBSET-054 for further details. 

--- Document Chunk 28526 ---
7.3.2 Definition of Variables 

--- Document Chunk 28527 ---
7.3.2.1 Variables are used to encode single data values. Variables cannot be split in minor units. 

--- Document Chunk 28528 ---
The whole variable has one type (meaning). 

--- Document Chunk 28529 ---
7.3.2.2 Variables may have special values which are related to the basic meaning of the variable. 

--- Document Chunk 28530 ---
7.3.2.3 Special values have always the highest values in a variable (e.g. 32767 = “unknown”). 

--- Document Chunk 28531 ---
7.3.2.4 Spare values are located between the normal and special values in the variable range 

--- Document Chunk 28532 ---
7.3.2.5 Names of variables are unique. A variable is used in context with the meaning as 

--- Document Chunk 28533 ---
described i n the variable definition. Variables with different meanings have different 

--- Document Chunk 28534 ---
names. 

--- Document Chunk 28535 ---
7.3.2.6 All variable definitions are independent of the transport media over which they are used, 

--- Document Chunk 28536 ---
if used in more than one media. 

--- Document Chunk 28537 ---
7.3.2.7 Signed values shall be encoded as 2’s complement. 

--- Document Chunk 28538 ---
7.3.2.8 One bit variables (Boolean) always use 0 for false and 1 for true. 

--- Document Chunk 28539 ---
7.3.2.9 Offsets for numerical values are avoided (0 is used for 0, 1 for 1, etc.) except where 

--- Document Chunk 28540 ---
justified. 

--- Document Chunk 28541 ---
7.3.2.10 When transmitting over the different transmission media, the most significant bit shall be 

--- Document Chunk 28542 ---
transmitted first. 

--- Document Chunk 28543 ---
7.3.2.11 All Variables have one of the following prefixes: 

--- Document Chunk 28544 ---
A_ Acceleration 

--- Document Chunk 28545 ---
D_ distance 

--- Document Chunk 28546 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 28547 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 28548 ---
SUBSET-026-7 

--- Document Chunk 28549 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 28550 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 28551 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 28552 ---
Chapter 7 

--- Document Chunk 28553 ---
ERTMS/ETCS language 

--- Document Chunk 28554 ---
Page 8/91 

--- Document Chunk 28555 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 28556 ---
G_ Gradient 

--- Document Chunk 28557 ---
L_ length 

--- Document Chunk 28558 ---
M_ Miscellaneous 

--- Document Chunk 28559 ---
N_ Number 

--- Document Chunk 28560 ---
NC_ class number 

--- Document Chunk 28561 ---
NID_ identity number 

--- Document Chunk 28562 ---
Q_ Qualifier 

--- Document Chunk 28563 ---
T_ time/date 

--- Document Chunk 28564 ---
V_ Speed 

--- Document Chunk 28565 ---
X_ Text 

--- Document Chunk 28566 ---
7.3.3 Definition of Packets 

--- Document Chunk 28567 ---
7.3.3.1 Packets are multiple variables grouped into a single unit, with a defined internal structure. 

--- Document Chunk 28568 ---
7.3.3.2 This structure consists of a packet header with: 

--- Document Chunk 28569 ---
• Track to Train: a unique packet number, the length of the packet in bits, the 

--- Document Chunk 28570 ---
orientation information, optionally the scale for distance/length information and an 

--- Document Chunk 28571 ---
information section containing a defined set of variables. The packet structure is as 

--- Document Chunk 28572 ---
follows: 

--- Document Chunk 28573 ---
Number NID_PACKET Packet identifier 

--- Document Chunk 28574 ---
Direction Q_DIR Specifies the validity direction of 

--- Document Chunk 28575 ---
transmitted data 

--- Document Chunk 28576 ---
Length L_PACKET  Number of bits in the packet 

--- Document Chunk 28577 ---
Scale Q_SCALE Specifies which scale is used for 

--- Document Chunk 28578 ---
distance/length information 

--- Document Chunk 28579 ---
within the packet. 

--- Document Chunk 28580 ---
There is no Q_SCALE variable 

--- Document Chunk 28581 ---
in packets which do not contain 

--- Document Chunk 28582 ---
distance information. 

--- Document Chunk 28583 ---
Information ...... Well defined set(s) of variables. 

--- Document Chunk 28584 ---
• Train to Track: a unique packet number, the length of the packet in bits, optionally 

--- Document Chunk 28585 ---
the distance scale and an information section containing a defined set of variables. 

--- Document Chunk 28586 ---
The packet structure is as follows: 

--- Document Chunk 28587 ---
Number NID_PACKET Packet identifier 

--- Document Chunk 28588 ---
Length L_PACKET  Number of bits in the packet 

--- Document Chunk 28589 ---
Scale Q_SCALE Specifies which scale is used for 

--- Document Chunk 28590 ---
distance/length information 

--- Document Chunk 28591 ---
within the packet. 

--- Document Chunk 28592 ---
There is no Q_SCALE variable 

--- Document Chunk 28593 ---
in packets which do not contain 

--- Document Chunk 28594 ---
distance information. 

--- Document Chunk 28595 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 28596 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 28597 ---
SUBSET-026-7 

--- Document Chunk 28598 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 28599 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 28600 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 28601 ---
Chapter 7 

--- Document Chunk 28602 ---
ERTMS/ETCS language 

--- Document Chunk 28603 ---
Page 9/91 

--- Document Chunk 28604 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 28605 ---
Information ...... Well defined set(s) of variables. 

--- Document Chunk 28606 ---
7.3.3.3 The packet definition does not change when transmitted over different transmission 

--- Document Chunk 28607 ---
media. 

--- Document Chunk 28608 ---
7.3.3.4 All packet identifiers not listed in 7.4.1.1 shall be considered as invalid values (i.e. like 

--- Document Chunk 28609 ---
spare values)  when received by the on -board equipment . E xception: reception of 

--- Document Chunk 28610 ---
information only differing by Y with regards to the highest system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 28611 ---
supported by on-board (refer to section 3.17.3.11). 

--- Document Chunk 28612 ---
7.3.3.4.1 Note: Depending on the system version number with which the message/telegram was 

--- Document Chunk 28613 ---
transmitted relevant exception from chapter 6 may apply regarding 7.4.1.1. 

--- Document Chunk 28614 ---
7.3.3.5 Exception: Packet 0 “Virtual Balise Cover marker” and Packet 255: “End of Telegram” 

--- Document Chunk 28615 ---
do not follow the above defined structure. 

--- Document Chunk 28616 ---
7.3.3.6 N_ITER specifies the number of iterations of a variable or group of variables which follow. 

--- Document Chunk 28617 ---
7.3.3.7 If N_ITER is 0 then no variables follow. 

--- Document Chunk 28618 ---
7.3.3.8 Two or more nested levels of iterations can exist. 

--- Document Chunk 28619 ---
7.3.3.9 If, depending on the value of a previous qualifier variable in the packet, a vari able is 

--- Document Chunk 28620 ---
optional, it is written indented in the packet definition 

--- Document Chunk 28621 ---
7.3.3.10 Row “Transmitted by” in the description of a packet specifies which ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 28622 ---
trackside device (balise, loop, RIU, RBC) can transmit this packet. “Any” means that the 

--- Document Chunk 28623 ---
packet can be transmitted by a balise, a loop, an RBC and a RIU. 

--- Document Chunk 28624 ---
7.3.3.10.1 Row “Transmitted to” in the description of a packet specifies to which ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 28625 ---
trackside device the packet can be transmitted. 

--- Document Chunk 28626 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 28627 ---

7.4.2.39 Packet Number 255: End of Information 

--- Document Chunk 29969 ---
Description This packet consists only of NID_PACKET containing 8 bit 1s 

--- Document Chunk 29970 ---
It acts as a finish flag; the receiver will stop reading the remaining part of the 

--- Document Chunk 29971 ---
message/telegram when receiving eight bits set to one in the NID_PACKET 

--- Document Chunk 29972 ---
field. 

--- Document Chunk 29973 ---
Transmitted by Balise, Loop 

--- Document Chunk 29974 ---
Content Variable Length Comment 

--- Document Chunk 29975 ---
 NID_PACKET 8  = 255 (1111 1111) 

--- Document Chunk 29976 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP
