7.5 Definitions of Variables 

--- Document Chunk 30204 ---
7.5.0.1 A_NVMAXREDADH1 

--- Document Chunk 30205 ---
Name Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions (1) 

--- Document Chunk 30206 ---
Description Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions applicable for trains: 

--- Document Chunk 30207 ---
• With brake position “Passenger train in P”, and 

--- Document Chunk 30208 ---
• with special/additional brakes independent from wheel/rail adhesion. 

--- Document Chunk 30209 ---
This variable is part of the National Values 

--- Document Chunk 30210 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 30211 ---
6 bits 0 m/s2 3 m/s2 0.05 m/s2 

--- Document Chunk 30212 ---
Special/Reserved Values 61 No maximum deceleration, display target information in CSM 

--- Document Chunk 30213 ---
 62 No maximum deceleration, display time to Indication in CSM 

--- Document Chunk 30214 ---
 63 No maximum deceleration, no additional display 

--- Document Chunk 30215 ---
7.5.0.2 A_NVMAXREDADH2 

--- Document Chunk 30216 ---
Name Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions (2) 

--- Document Chunk 30217 ---
Description Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions applicable for trains: 

--- Document Chunk 30218 ---
• with brake position “Passenger train in P”, and 

--- Document Chunk 30219 ---
• without special/additional brakes independent from wheel/rail adhesion. 

--- Document Chunk 30220 ---
This variable is part of the National Values 

--- Document Chunk 30221 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 30222 ---
6 bits 0 m/s2 3 m/s2 0.05 m/s2 

--- Document Chunk 30223 ---
Special/Reserved Values 61 No maximum deceleration, display target information in CSM 

--- Document Chunk 30224 ---
 62 No maximum deceleration, display time to Indication in CSM 

--- Document Chunk 30225 ---
 63 No maximum deceleration, no additional display 

--- Document Chunk 30226 ---
7.5.0.3 A_NVMAXREDADH3 

--- Document Chunk 30227 ---
Name Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions (3) 

--- Document Chunk 30228 ---
Description Maximum deceleration under reduced adhesion conditions applicable for trains: 

--- Document Chunk 30229 ---
• with brake position “Freight train in P”, or 

--- Document Chunk 30230 ---
• with brake position “Freight train in G”. 

--- Document Chunk 30231 ---
This variable is part of the National Values 

--- Document Chunk 30232 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 30233 ---
6 bits 0 m/s2 3 m/s2 0.05 m/s2 

--- Document Chunk 30234 ---
Special/Reserved Values 61 No maximum deceleration, display target information in CSM 

--- Document Chunk 30235 ---
 62 No maximum deceleration, display time to Indication in CSM 

--- Document Chunk 30236 ---
 63 No maximum deceleration, no additional display 

--- Document Chunk 30237 ---

7.5.1.1 D_ADHESION 

--- Document Chunk 30262 ---
Name Distance to start of area with reduced adhesion factor  

--- Document Chunk 30263 ---
Description  

--- Document Chunk 30264 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 30265 ---

7.5.1.56 L_TRAIN 

--- Document Chunk 30761 ---
Name Train length 

--- Document Chunk 30762 ---
Description This is the length of the train acquired as Train Data. 

--- Document Chunk 30763 ---
When the safe consist length is captured as part of valid Train Data,  L_TRAIN is equal to 

--- Document Chunk 30764 ---
L_CONSISTREARENGINEMAX, considering that valid Train Data can only be captured and sent to the 

--- Document Chunk 30765 ---
RBC with the leading engine/cab located at the very front of the train. 

--- Document Chunk 30766 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 30767 ---
12 bits 0 m 4095 m  1 m 

--- Document Chunk 30768 ---
7.5.1.57 L_TRAININT 

--- Document Chunk 30769 ---
Name Confirmed Train length 

--- Document Chunk 30770 ---
Description Information sent to the RBC allowing the trackside to retrieve what was the position of the min safe rear 

--- Document Chunk 30771 ---
end of the train at the time the train was last known to be integer. It is counted from the estimated position 

--- Document Chunk 30772 ---
of the train front reported to the RBC. 

--- Document Chunk 30773 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 30774 ---
15 bits 0 m 32767 m 1 m 

--- Document Chunk 30775 ---

7.5.1.62 M_AXLELOADCAT 

--- Document Chunk 30814 ---
Name Axle load category 

--- Document Chunk 30815 ---
Description The values allocated below correspond to  the axle load categories and it is used by the on -board 

--- Document Chunk 30816 ---
equipment to compare its axle load category with the axle load category sent by trackside. 

--- Document Chunk 30817 ---
For the underlying meaning of the axle load categories listed below (with the exception of HS17) refer to 

--- Document Chunk 30818 ---
INF TSI. 

--- Document Chunk 30819 ---
The category HS17 (axle load <= 17t) corresponds to a static load per axle only, as specified in the former 

--- Document Chunk 30820 ---
HS RST TSI clause 4.2.3.2. The introduction of this artefact is necessary to ensure backward compatibility, 

--- Document Chunk 30821 ---
without any negative performance impact, in case ASPs are used on lines operated with system version X 

--- Document Chunk 30822 ---
= 1. 

--- Document Chunk 30823 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 30824 ---
7 bits    

--- Document Chunk 30825 ---
Special/Reserved Values 0 A 

--- Document Chunk 30826 ---
 1 HS17 

--- Document Chunk 30827 ---
 2 B1 

--- Document Chunk 30828 ---
 3 B2 

--- Document Chunk 30829 ---
 4 C2 

--- Document Chunk 30830 ---
 5 C3 

--- Document Chunk 30831 ---
 6 C4 

--- Document Chunk 30832 ---
 7 D2 

--- Document Chunk 30833 ---
 8 D3 

--- Document Chunk 30834 ---
 9 D4 

--- Document Chunk 30835 ---
 10 D4XL 

--- Document Chunk 30836 ---
 11 E4 

--- Document Chunk 30837 ---

the balise group). 

--- Document Chunk 30864 ---

--- Document Chunk 30865 ---
of the balise group).

7.5.1.71 M_MCOUNT 

--- Document Chunk 31016 ---
Name Message counter 

--- Document Chunk 31017 ---
Description The purpose of this counter is to make it possible for the ERTMS/ETCS on-board to detect which balise 

--- Document Chunk 31018 ---
group message the telegram belongs to. 

--- Document Chunk 31019 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 31020 ---
8 bits 0 253 Numbers 

--- Document Chunk 31021 ---
Special/Reserved Values 254 The telegram never fits any message of the group  

--- Document Chunk 31022 ---
 255 The telegram fits with all telegrams of the same balise group 

--- Document Chunk 31023 ---

7.5.1.75.1 M_NVEBCL 

--- Document Chunk 31114 ---
Name Confidence level for emergency brake safe deceleration on dry rails 

--- Document Chunk 31115 ---
Description This variable is part of the National Values. 

--- Document Chunk 31116 ---
Based on the required confidence level, the on -board equipment selects its corresponding rolling stock 

--- Document Chunk 31117 ---
correction factor Kdry_rst(V). 

--- Document Chunk 31118 ---
The confidence level on emergency brake safe deceleration represents the probability of the following 

--- Document Chunk 31119 ---
individual event: the rolling stock emergency brake subsystem of the train does ensure a deceleration at 

--- Document Chunk 31120 ---
least equal to A_brake_emergency(V) * Kdry_rst(V), when the emergency bra ke is commanded on dry 

--- Document Chunk 31121 ---
rails. 

--- Document Chunk 31122 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 31123 ---
4 bits    

--- Document Chunk 31124 ---
Special/Reserved Values 0 Confidence level = 50 % 

--- Document Chunk 31125 ---
 1 Confidence level = 90 % 

--- Document Chunk 31126 ---
 2 Confidence level = 99 % 

--- Document Chunk 31127 ---
 3 Confidence level = 99.9 % 

--- Document Chunk 31128 ---
 4 Confidence level = 99.99% 

--- Document Chunk 31129 ---
 5 Confidence level = 99.999 % 

--- Document Chunk 31130 ---
 6 Confidence level = 99.9999 % 

--- Document Chunk 31131 ---
 7 Confidence level = 99.99999 % 

--- Document Chunk 31132 ---
 8 Confidence level = 99.999999 % 

--- Document Chunk 31133 ---
 9 Confidence level = 99.9999999 % 

--- Document Chunk 31134 ---
 10-15 Spare 

--- Document Chunk 31135 ---

7.5.1.79 M_VERSION 

--- Document Chunk 31240 ---
Name Version of ETCS system 

--- Document Chunk 31241 ---
Description This gives the version of the ETCS system 

--- Document Chunk 31242 ---
Each part indicates the first and second number of the version respectively. 

--- Document Chunk 31243 ---
- The first number distinguishes not compatible versions. (The three MSB’s) 

--- Document Chunk 31244 ---
- The second number indicates compatibility within a version X. (The four LSB’s) 

--- Document Chunk 31245 ---

--- Document Chunk 31332 ---
Name Cant Deficiency Train Category 

--- Document Chunk 31333 ---

--- Document Chunk 31334 ---

--- Document Chunk 31335 ---
static speed profile, thanks to NC_CDDIFF, the train can select the “Cant Deficiency” SSP best suiting its 

--- Document Chunk 31336 ---
NC_CDTRAIN. 

--- Document Chunk 31337 ---

7.5.1.83 NC_DIFF 

--- Document Chunk 31363 ---
Name Other specific SSP category 

--- Document Chunk 31364 ---
Description It is the “other specific” SSP category for which a different value for the static line speed exists. 

--- Document Chunk 31365 ---
Used together with V_DIFF to permit trains belonging to the corresponding “other international” train 

--- Document Chunk 31366 ---
category to go faster or lower than the “international basic static speed” given by V_STATIC.  

--- Document Chunk 31367 ---
Value 0 of NC_DIFF corresponds to the LSB of NC_TRAIN, value 14 of NC_DIFF to MSB (15-bit variable) 

--- Document Chunk 31368 ---
of NC_TRAIN. 

--- Document Chunk 31369 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 31370 ---
4 bits 0 15 Numbers 

--- Document Chunk 31371 ---
Special/Reserved Values 0 Specific SSP applicable to Freight train braked in “P” position 

--- Document Chunk 31372 ---
 1 Specific SSP applicable to Freight train braked in “G” position 

--- Document Chunk 31373 ---
 2 Specific SSP applicable to Passenger train 

--- Document Chunk 31374 ---
 3-15 Spare

7.5.1.84 NC_TRAIN 

--- Document Chunk 31376 ---
Name Other International Train Category.  

--- Document Chunk 31377 ---
Description Other train category (different from Cant Deficiency) to which the train belongs. 

--- Document Chunk 31378 ---
Thanks to NC_TRAIN, the train knows the “Other specific” SSP category it must consider. 

--- Document Chunk 31379 ---
By receiving a list of static speed profile, thanks to NC_DIFF, the train can select the SSP it must obey. 

--- Document Chunk 31380 ---
Each bit represents one category. 

--- Document Chunk 31381 ---
A train can belong to various categories.  

--- Document Chunk 31382 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 31383 ---
15 bits   Bitset 

--- Document Chunk 31384 ---
Special/Reserved Values 000 0000 0000 0000 Train does not belong to any of the “Other International” Train Category

--- Document Chunk 31387 ---

--- Document Chunk 31453 ---
(NID_BG). 

--- Document Chunk 31454 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

7.5.1.91.1 NID_MN (Values to be assigned according to 7.3.1.3) 

--- Document Chunk 31479 ---
Name Identity of GSM-R Radio Network  

--- Document Chunk 31480 ---
Description The NID_MN identifies the GSM-R network the GSM-R Mobile Terminal has to register with. The NID_MN 

--- Document Chunk 31481 ---
consists of up to 6 digits which are entered left adjusted into the data field, the leftmost digit is the digit to 

--- Document Chunk 31482 ---
be dialled first. In case the NID_MN is shorter than 6 digits, the remaining space is to be filled with special 

--- Document Chunk 31483 ---
character “F”. For further information about NID_MN refer to Subset-54. 

--- Document Chunk 31484 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 31485 ---
24 bits 0 999999   Binary Coded Decimal 

--- Document Chunk 31486 ---
Special/Reserved Values For each digit ; 

--- Document Chunk 31487 ---
 Values A – E Not Used 

--- Document Chunk 31488 ---
 F Use value F for digit to indicate no digit (if number shorter than 6 digits) 

--- Document Chunk 31489 ---
7.5.1.92 NID_OPERATIONAL 

--- Document Chunk 31490 ---
Name Train Running Number 

--- Document Chunk 31491 ---
Description This is the operational train running number. The NID_OPERATIONAL consists of up to 8 digits which are 

--- Document Chunk 31492 ---
entered left adjusted into the data field, the leftmost digit is the digit to be entered first. In case the 

--- Document Chunk 31493 ---
NID_OPERATIONAL is shorter than 8 digits, the remaining space is to be filled with special character “F”. 

--- Document Chunk 31494 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 31495 ---
32 bits 0 9999 9999 Binary Coded Decimal 

--- Document Chunk 31496 ---
Special/Reserved Values For each digit ;  

--- Document Chunk 31497 ---
 Values A – E Spare 

--- Document Chunk 31498 ---
 F Use value F for digit to indicate no digit (if number shorter than 8 digits) 

--- Document Chunk 31499 ---
 FFFF FFFF Spare 

--- Document Chunk 31500 ---

7.5.1.95 NID_RADIO (Values to be assigned according to 7.3.1.3) 

--- Document Chunk 31525 ---
Name Radio subscriber number. 

--- Document Chunk 31526 ---
Description Quoted as a 16 digit decimal number.  

--- Document Chunk 31527 ---
The number is to be entered “left adjusted” starting with the first digit to be dialled. Padding by the special 

--- Document Chunk 31528 ---
value F shall be added after the least significant digit of the number.  

--- Document Chunk 31529 ---
 For further information about NID_RADIO  refer to SUBSET-054. 

--- Document Chunk 31530 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 31531 ---
64 bits 0 9999 9999 9999 9999 Binary Coded Decimal 

--- Document Chunk 31532 ---
Special/Reserved Values For each digit ; 

--- Document Chunk 31533 ---
 Values A – E Not Used 

--- Document Chunk 31534 ---
 F Use value F for digit to indicate no digit (if number shorter than 16 digits) 

--- Document Chunk 31535 ---
 FFFF FFFF FFFF FFFF Use the short number stored onboard 

--- Document Chunk 31536 ---

7.5.1.121 Q_NEWCOUNTRY 

--- Document Chunk 31889 ---
Name New Country Qualifier 

--- Document Chunk 31890 ---
Description Qualifier to indicate whether the next balise group is in the same country / railway administration as the 

--- Document Chunk 31891 ---
one before inside the packet or not. 

--- Document Chunk 31892 ---
For the first balise group in the packet, if Q_NEWCOUNTRY = 0, it is the same country / railway 

--- Document Chunk 31893 ---
administration as the one of the LRBG within the radio message, the one of balise group within the balise 

--- Document Chunk 31894 ---
telegram giving the packet, or the one of the loop within the loop message giving the packet. 

--- Document Chunk 31895 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 31896 ---
1 bit    

--- Document Chunk 31897 ---
Special/Reserved Values 0 Same country / railway administration, no NID_C follows 

--- Document Chunk 31898 ---
 1 Not the same country / railway administration, NID_C follows 

--- Document Chunk 31899 ---

7.5.1.150 T_OL 

--- Document Chunk 32273 ---
Name Overlap validity time 

--- Document Chunk 32274 ---
Description The time span the train can expect the overlap to be available, measured from the moment the train 

--- Document Chunk 32275 ---
reaches the location defined by D_STARTOL. 

--- Document Chunk 32276 ---
Length of variable Minimum Value Maximum Value Resolution/formula 

--- Document Chunk 32277 ---
10 bits 0 s 1022 s 1 s 

--- Document Chunk 32278 ---
Special/Reserved Values 1023  

--- Document Chunk 32279 ---

--- Document Chunk 32282 ---

--- Document Chunk 32283 ---

--- Document Chunk 32284 ---

--- Document Chunk 32917 ---
8.3 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 32918 ---
8.3.1 Scope and Purpose 

--- Document Chunk 32919 ---
8.3.1.1 This chapter defines the format and content of  messages necessary for ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 32920 ---
functions. 

--- Document Chunk 32921 ---
8.3.1.2 Concerning the transmission media, this chapter does not cover considerations such as 

--- Document Chunk 32922 ---
medium-specific use constraints (e .g. distance between track -circuit and balise…), as 

--- Document Chunk 32923 ---
well as functions (e.g. detection of balise reference, time and location stamp, identifying 

--- Document Chunk 32924 ---
type of receiving balise, Key Management, Releasing/maintaining a radio connection…) 

--- Document Chunk 32925 ---
and performance of the transmission media. 

--- Document Chunk 32926 ---
8.3.2 Definitions 

--- Document Chunk 32927 ---
8.3.2.1 Transmission media considered hereafter are standard ERTMS/ETC S transmission 

--- Document Chunk 32928 ---
media used for ETCS (Eurobalise, Euroradio and Euroloop). 

--- Document Chunk 32929 ---
8.3.2.2 A message includes user data (application level) and protocol data (depending on the 

--- Document Chunk 32930 ---
transmission medium). 

--- Document Chunk 32931 ---
8.3.2.3 A Eurobalise message is the information sent by a balise group (i.e. the message is 

--- Document Chunk 32932 ---
composed of one or several telegrams, sorted by balise number in the group (telegram 

--- Document Chunk 32933 ---
from balise number 1 first), each telegram is transmitted by a Eurobalise). A Eurobalise 

--- Document Chunk 32934 ---
telegram contains one header and an identified and coherent set of Packets. 

--- Document Chunk 32935 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 32936 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 32937 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 32938 ---
SUBSET-026-8 

--- Document Chunk 32939 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 32940 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 32941 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 32942 ---
Chapter 8 

--- Document Chunk 32943 ---
Messages 

--- Document Chunk 32944 ---

--- Document Chunk 32945 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 32946 ---
  

--- Document Chunk 32947 ---
Reverse direction   Nominal direction 

--- Document Chunk 32948 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 32949 ---
Location Reference 

--- Document Chunk 32950 ---
Composition of message when passing the balise group in 

--- Document Chunk 32951 ---
nominal direction: 

--- Document Chunk 32952 ---
1st 2nd 3rd 

--- Document Chunk 32953 ---
1st 2nd 3rd 

--- Document Chunk 32954 ---
1st 2nd 3rd 

--- Document Chunk 32955 ---
Balise telegrams read: 

--- Document Chunk 32956 ---
Balise message composed: 

--- Document Chunk 32957 ---
3rd 2nd 1st 

--- Document Chunk 32958 ---
1st 2nd 3rd 

--- Document Chunk 32959 ---
Balise telegrams read: 

--- Document Chunk 32960 ---
Balise message composed: 

--- Document Chunk 32961 ---
Composition of message when passing the balise group in 

--- Document Chunk 32962 ---
reverse direction: 

--- Document Chunk 32963 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 32964 ---
Figure 1: Composition of a balise group message 

--- Document Chunk 32965 ---
8.3.2.4 A Euroradio message contains one header and an identified and coherent set of 

--- Document Chunk 32966 ---
variables (if needed) and Packets. 

--- Document Chunk 32967 ---
8.3.2.5 A Euroloop message contains one header and an identified and coherent set of Packets. 

--- Document Chunk 32968 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP

--- Document Chunk 32978 ---
8.4 Rules 

--- Document Chunk 32979 ---
8.4.1 Common Rules 

--- Document Chunk 32980 ---
8.4.1.1 A message (Euroradio/Euroloop) or telegram (Eurobalise) is composed of 

--- Document Chunk 32981 ---
1. One Header, 

--- Document Chunk 32982 ---
2. When needed, a predefined set of variables (only for Radio), 

--- Document Chunk 32983 ---
3. When needed, a predefined set of Packets (only for Radio), 

--- Document Chunk 32984 ---
4. Optional Packets as needed by application. 

--- Document Chunk 32985 ---
8.4.1.2 The transmission order shall respect the order of data elements listed in the message 

--- Document Chunk 32986 ---
format (from top to bottom). 

--- Document Chunk 32987 ---
8.4.1.3 The behaviour of the receiver shall not depend on the sequence of the Packets given by 

--- Document Chunk 32988 ---
the message. 

--- Document Chunk 32989 ---
8.4.1.3.1 Exception for Infill information: The locations given in the packets following packet 136 

--- Document Chunk 32990 ---
(Infill Location Reference) shall be referred to the balise group indicated in such packet. 

--- Document Chunk 32991 ---
8.4.1.3.2 Note: orientations are in any case always refe rred to the directionality of balise group 

--- Document Chunk 32992 ---
(balise transmission), directionality of loop (Euroloop transmission) or directionality of 

--- Document Chunk 32993 ---
LRBG (radio transmission). 

--- Document Chunk 32994 ---
8.4.1.4 A track-to-train message shall contain at most one instance of the same packet type for 

--- Document Chunk 32995 ---
the same direction. 

--- Document Chunk 32996 ---
8.4.1.4.1 Exception 1: A message can contain several packets 44 (Data used by applications 

--- Document Chunk 32997 ---
outside the ERTMS/ETCS system). 

--- Document Chunk 32998 ---
8.4.1.4.2 Exception 2: A message can contain several packets 65 (Temporary Speed Restriction). 

--- Document Chunk 32999 ---
In case of  revocable TSRs, the identities of the corresponding temporary speed 

--- Document Chunk 33000 ---
restrictions (variable NID_TSR) transmitted in the same message shall be different. 

--- Document Chunk 33001 ---
8.4.1.4.3 Exception 3: A message can contain several packets 66 (TSR Revocation). The 

--- Document Chunk 33002 ---
identities of the corresponding temporary speed restrictions ( variable NID_TSR) 

--- Document Chunk 33003 ---
transmitted in the same message shall be different. 

--- Document Chunk 33004 ---
8.4.1.4.4 Exception 4: A message transmitted by a balise group can contain one packet 136 per 

--- Document Chunk 33005 ---
balise telegram per direction. Each packet 136 indicates which part of that telegram is to 

--- Document Chunk 33006 ---
be considered as part of the infill information. Multiple packets 136 in balises of a balise 

--- Document Chunk 33007 ---
group shall have identical content per direction. 

--- Document Chunk 33008 ---
8.4.1.4.5 Exception 5: A message can contain several packets 88 (Level Crossing information). 

--- Document Chunk 33009 ---
The identities of the corresponding Level Crossings (variable NID_LX) transmitted in the 

--- Document Chunk 33010 ---
same message shall be different. 

--- Document Chunk 33011 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 33012 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33013 ---
SUBSET-026-8 

--- Document Chunk 33014 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 33015 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 33016 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 33017 ---
Chapter 8 

--- Document Chunk 33018 ---
Messages 

--- Document Chunk 33019 ---
Page 11/36 

--- Document Chunk 33020 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33021 ---
8.4.1.4.6 Exception 6: A message transmitted by a balise group can contain several packets 254 

--- Document Chunk 33022 ---
(default balise, loop or RIU information). 

--- Document Chunk 33023 ---
8.4.1.4.7 Exception 7: A message transmitted by a balise group can contain several packets 145 

--- Document Chunk 33024 ---
(Inhibition of balise group message consistency reaction). 

--- Document Chunk 33025 ---
8.4.1.4.8 Exception 8: A message transmitted by a balise group can contain several packets 0 

--- Document Chunk 33026 ---
(Virtual Balise Cover marker). 

--- Document Chunk 33027 ---
8.4.1.4.9 Exception 9: A message transmitted by a balise group can contain several packets 6 

--- Document Chunk 33028 ---
(Virtual Balise Cover order). The identities (pairs of variables NID_VBCMK and NID_C) 

--- Document Chunk 33029 ---
of the corresponding VBC transmitted in the same message shall be different. 

--- Document Chunk 33030 ---
8.4.1.5 A train-to-track message shall contain at most one instance of the same packet type. 

--- Document Chunk 33031 ---
8.4.1.5.1 Exception: A message can contain several packets 44 (Data used by applications 

--- Document Chunk 33032 ---
outside the ERTMS/ETCS system). 

--- Document Chunk 33033 ---
8.4.1.6 Note: For the purposes of clause 8.4.1.4, when the same packet is transmitted by 

--- Document Chunk 33034 ---
duplicated balises, this is considered to be only a single instance of the packet within the 

--- Document Chunk 33035 ---
message. Justification: The on -board equipment will only use one of these duplicat ed 

--- Document Chunk 33036 ---
telegrams (and therefore only one set of duplicated packets) to compose the balise group 

--- Document Chunk 33037 ---
message (see 3.16.2.4.8.2). 

--- Document Chunk 33038 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 33039 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33040 ---
SUBSET-026-8 

--- Document Chunk 33041 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 33042 ---
05/07/2023

System Requirements Specification

Messages

--- Document Chunk 33047 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33048 ---
8.4.2 Rules for Eurobalise telegrams 

--- Document Chunk 33049 ---
8.4.2.1 The format of the telegram to be transmitted by each balise is as follows:  

--- Document Chunk 33050 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33051 ---
General Format of Balise Telegram 

--- Document Chunk 33052 ---
Field No. VARIABLE Length ( bits) Remarks 

--- Document Chunk 33053 ---
1 Q_UPDOWN 1 Defines the direction of the information:  

--- Document Chunk 33054 ---
Down-link telegram (train to track) (0)  

--- Document Chunk 33055 ---
Up-link telegram (track to train) (1) 

--- Document Chunk 33056 ---
2 M_VERSION 7 Version of the ERTMS/ETCS system. 

--- Document Chunk 33057 ---
3 Q_MEDIA 1 Defines the type of media: Balise (0) 

--- Document Chunk 33058 ---
4  N_PIG 3 Position in the group. Defines the position of the balise in the 

--- Document Chunk 33059 ---
balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 33060 ---
5 N_TOTAL 3 Total number of balises in the balise group 

--- Document Chunk 33061 ---
6 M_DUP 2 Used to indicate whether the information of the balise is a 

--- Document Chunk 33062 ---
duplicate of the balise before or after this one. 

--- Document Chunk 33063 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33064 ---
7 M_MCOUNT 8 Message counter (M_MCOUNT) - 8 bits. To enable detection 

--- Document Chunk 33065 ---
of a change of balise group message during passage of the 

--- Document Chunk 33066 ---
balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 33067 ---
8 NID_C 10 Country or region. 

--- Document Chunk 33068 ---
9 NID_BG 14 Identity of the balise group. 

--- Document Chunk 33069 ---
10 Q_LINK 1 Marks the balise group as linked (Q_LINK = 1) or unlinked 

--- Document Chunk 33070 ---
(Q_LINK = 0) 

--- Document Chunk 33071 ---
 Packet 0 

--- Document Chunk 33072 ---
(optional) 

--- Document Chunk 33073 ---
14 Virtual Balise Cover marker 

--- Document Chunk 33074 ---
 Information Variable This information is composed according to the rules applicable 

--- Document Chunk 33075 ---
for packets. 

--- Document Chunk 33076 ---
 Packet 255 8 Finishing flag of the telegram 

--- Document Chunk 33077 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33078 ---
Number of bits in balise header: 50 

--- Document Chunk 33079 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33080 ---
8.4.2.2 The user information transmitted by a balise shall contain complete packets, i.e. splitting 

--- Document Chunk 33081 ---
a packet between two balises is forbidden. 

--- Document Chunk 33082 ---
8.4.2.3 When used, the packet 0 shall be transmitted as the first packet of the telegram (i.e. it is 

--- Document Chunk 33083 ---
appended to the header). 

--- Document Chunk 33084 ---
8.4.2.4 Note: If there is an active VBC stored on -board and in order to find a VBC marker, the 

--- Document Chunk 33085 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment needs first to check M_VERSION: 

--- Document Chunk 33086 ---
• If M_VERSION = 0.Y, the telegram will be ignored; 

--- Document Chunk 33087 ---
• If M_VERSION = 1.0, there will be no VBC marker; 

--- Document Chunk 33088 ---
• If M_VERSION = 1.1, the on-board must look for a packet 200 (see chapter 6); 

--- Document Chunk 33089 ---
• In all other cases (including when M_VERSION is higher than the highest sy stem 

--- Document Chunk 33090 ---
version supported by the on-board), the on-board must look for a packet 0. 

--- Document Chunk 33091 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 33092 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33093 ---
SUBSET-026-8 

--- Document Chunk 33094 ---
4.0.0 

--- Document Chunk 33095 ---
05/07/2023 

--- Document Chunk 33096 ---
System Requirements Specification 

--- Document Chunk 33097 ---
Chapter 8 

--- Document Chunk 33098 ---
Messages 

--- Document Chunk 33099 ---
Page 13/36 

--- Document Chunk 33100 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33101 ---
If a packet 0 or 200 is found, the ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment must also check 

--- Document Chunk 33102 ---
whether NID_C matches the VBC marker included in the packet 0 or 200. This implies 

--- Document Chunk 33103 ---
that in all future system versions the size and location of M_VERSION and NID_C inside 

--- Document Chunk 33104 ---
the header, the overall size of the header and the position/content of the packet 0 

--- Document Chunk 33105 ---
appended to it, will remain invariant. 

--- Document Chunk 33106 ---

--- Document Chunk 33112 ---
Down-link message (train to track) (0)  

--- Document Chunk 33113 ---
Up-link message (track to train) (1)

--- Document Chunk 33116 ---

--- Document Chunk 33117 ---

8.4.4 Rules for Euroradio messages 

--- Document Chunk 33138 ---
8.4.4.1 The message identifier is unique (variable NID_MESSAGE). 

--- Document Chunk 33139 ---
8.4.4.1.1 All message identifiers not listed in 8.5.3 shall be considered as invalid values (i.e. like 

--- Document Chunk 33140 ---
spare values)  when received by the on -board equipment . Exception: reception of 

--- Document Chunk 33141 ---
information only differing by Y with regards to the highest system version number X 

--- Document Chunk 33142 ---
supported by on-board (refer to section 3.17.3.11 b)). 

--- Document Chunk 33143 ---
8.4.4.1.1.1 Note: Depending on the system version number with which the message was transmitted 

--- Document Chunk 33144 ---
relevant exception from chapter 6 may apply regarding 8.5.3. 

--- Document Chunk 33145 ---
8.4.4.2 Each message shall indicate its own length through the use of the variable L_MESSAGE. 

--- Document Chunk 33146 ---
8.4.4.2.1 The receiver shall check whether the computed length of the message is equal to the 

--- Document Chunk 33147 ---
length given by L_MESSAGE. 

--- Document Chunk 33148 ---
8.4.4.3 The messages shall be composed of predefined variables and packets. 

--- Document Chunk 33149 ---
8.4.4.4 For some messages, it shall be possibl e to add optional packets at the end of the 

--- Document Chunk 33150 ---
message. 

--- Document Chunk 33151 ---
8.4.4.4.1 The track to train messages possibly including optional packets are listed hereafter: 

--- Document Chunk 33152 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 33153 ---

--- Document Chunk 33154 ---

--- Document Chunk 33155 ---
Movement Authority 3 21, 27, 49, 80, plus common optional packets 

--- Document Chunk 33156 ---
SM Authorisation 4 3, 5, 31, 39, 40, 44, 45, 51, 58, 64, 65, 66, 67, 

--- Document Chunk 33157 ---
68, 69, 71, 73, 74, 79, 88, 131, 140 

--- Document Chunk 33158 ---
Request To Shorten MA 9 49, 80 

--- Document Chunk 33159 ---
General Message 24 From RBC: 21, 27, plus common optional 

--- Document Chunk 33160 ---
packets 

--- Document Chunk 33161 ---
From RIU: 44, 45, 143, 180, 254 

--- Document Chunk 33162 ---

--- Document Chunk 33163 ---

--- Document Chunk 33187 ---

--- Document Chunk 33188 ---

--- Document Chunk 33190 ---

--- Document Chunk 33191 ---

--- Document Chunk 33192 ---

--- Document Chunk 33193 ---
5.4.3.2 A33&A34), 

--- Document Chunk 33194 ---

--- Document Chunk 33195 ---

--- Document Chunk 33196 ---

--- Document Chunk 33197 ---
a) Packet 9 (Level 2 transition information, see clauses 3.8.2.7.1&2) 

--- Document Chunk 33198 ---

--- Document Chunk 33199 ---
include the following packet: 

--- Document Chunk 33200 ---
a) Packet 12 (Default Train Data for Supervised Manoeuvre) 

--- Document Chunk 33201 ---
8.4.4.5 If needed to obtain an integer number of bytes, padding shall be added at the end of the 

--- Document Chunk 33202 ---
message. 

--- Document Chunk 33203 ---

--- Document Chunk 34299 ---
9.3 Introduction 

--- Document Chunk 34300 ---
9.3.1 Scope and Purpose 

--- Document Chunk 34301 ---
9.3.1.1 Chapter 9 lists a classification into categories of all the clauses in the chapters 1 to 8 of 

--- Document Chunk 34302 ---
the SRS. 

--- Document Chunk 34303 ---
9.3.1.2 The purpose of this chapter is to ease the assessment of the compliance of an 

--- Document Chunk 34304 ---
ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment with the SRS. 

--- Document Chunk 34305 ---
9.3.1.3 To that effect , this chapter comprehensively identifies which clauses contain 

--- Document Chunk 34306 ---
requirements allocated to the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment and conversely which 

--- Document Chunk 34307 ---
ones do not, either because they contain requirements allocated to the ERTMS/ETCS 

--- Document Chunk 34308 ---
trackside only or because they are of another type. 

--- Document Chunk 34309 ---
9.3.2 Definitions 

--- Document Chunk 34310 ---
9.3.2.1 The following categories are used to classify each SRS clause: 

--- Document Chunk 34311 ---
a) ERTMS/ETCS on-board requirement: a clause containing requirement(s) that must 

--- Document Chunk 34312 ---
be fulfilled by a SRS compliant ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 34313 ---
b) ERTMS/ETCS trackside requirement: a clause containing requirement(s) that must 

--- Document Chunk 34314 ---
be fulfilled by a SRS compliant ERTMS/ETCS trackside, in case the corresponding 

--- Document Chunk 34315 ---
function is implemented 

--- Document Chunk 34316 ---
c) Definition: a c lause that is a necessary prerequisite to the correct interpretation of 

--- Document Chunk 34317 ---
requirement(s) or without which requirement(s) cannot be unambiguously interpreted 

--- Document Chunk 34318 ---
d) Informative: a clause that helps the reader to better understand the context or the 

--- Document Chunk 34319 ---
justification of requirement(s) 

--- Document Chunk 34320 ---
e) Others: a clause that does not belong to any of the above categories 

--- Document Chunk 34321 ---
9.3.2.2 Throughout the SRS, the requirements are identified as sentences using the keyword 

--- Document Chunk 34322 ---
“shall”. However: 

--- Document Chunk 34323 ---
a) In section 9.4, tables are identified as a single entity through a reference based on 

--- Document Chunk 34324 ---
the accompanying clause number. They can be classified as ERTMS/ETCS on-board 

--- Document Chunk 34325 ---
and/or trackside requirements even if they do not include the keyword “shall”. 

--- Document Chunk 34326 ---
b) Elements of the ERTMS/ETCS language (radio messages, packets and variables, 

--- Document Chunk 34327 ---
see chapters 7 and 8) are also described with tables. The numbered titles (i.e. the 

--- Document Chunk 34328 ---
name of the element preceded by a clause number) together with their associated 

--- Document Chunk 34329 ---
table are considered as single entities and are classified as both ERTMS/ETCS on -

--- Document Chunk 34330 ---
board and trackside requirements, even if they do not include the keyword “shall” 

--- Document Chunk 34331 ---
either. 

--- Document Chunk 34332 ---
9.3.2.3 Amongst the categories listed in 9.3.2.1 only the two first ones can be combined, in case 

--- Document Chunk 34333 ---
a requirement equally applies to both ERTMS/ETCS on -board equipment and 

--- Document Chunk 34334 ---
ERTMS/ETCS trackside or in case two unambiguously distinguishable on -board and 

--- Document Chunk 34335 ---
trackside requirements are kept together in the concerned clause for readability reasons. 

--- Document Chunk 34336 ---
ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP 

--- Document Chunk 34337 ---

--- Document Chunk 42305 ---
Classification of clauses 

--- Document Chunk 42306 ---
Page 133/148 

--- Document Chunk 42307 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 42308 ---
 

--- Document Chunk 42309 ---
{1} The replacing clause does not inherit the classification "ETCS on-board requirement" of the replaced clause because the replacement clause 

--- Document Chunk 42310 ---
(being part of section 6.5) is applicable to the trackside only. 

--- Document Chunk 42311 ---
{2} The replacing clause does not inherit the classification "ETCS trackside requirement" of the replaced clause because the replacement clause 

--- Document Chunk 42312 ---
(being part of section 6.6) is applicable to the on-board only. 

--- Document Chunk 42313 ---
